title: Crime and Catharsis at Givenchy and Stella McCartney
description: PARIS  Fashion woke up Monday to the news that Kim Kardashian West had been the victim of armed robbers at her temporary residence in Paris. It made for an unsettling beginning to the last days of shows. Ms. Kardashian West had, after all, been something of a constant presence here until that point. On Sunday alone she popped into Balenciaga in the morning, kibitzed with Courtney Love at Givenchy in the evening (the designer Riccardo Tisci made the wedding dress for her marriage to Kanye West) and then attended a dinner hosted by Surface magazine in honor of Azzedine Alaa, held in the designers kitchen. We have all been complicit in advertising those facts.

title: Still Waiting to Hear From Yahoo
description: Q. I have a Yahoo account. I have changed the password and taken other recommended security steps but I have yet to hear from Yahoo. Does the company have any obligation to inform its users of the breach? Shouldnt Yahoo have been the first to send out information instead of letting us find out about the hacking from the news?

title: Brand to Know: A Line of Pieces Woven From Unusual Materials
description: What Im really interested in is actually being defiant, says Amy Revier, a Texan artist who has made north London her home for the last five years. She is sitting by a rack of the muted clothes that she weaves by hand, at the London concept store Hostem  and yet, she doesnt see herself as a fashion designer at all.

title: Turkey Detains Brother of Fethullah Gulen, Cleric Accused of Plotting Coup
description: ISTANBUL  Turkey has detained a brother of Fethullah Gulen, the Pennsylvania-based cleric whom the government accused of organizing a  coup attempt in July and who is now the source of a diplomatic confrontation with the United States.

title: A Genuine Bordeaux Caviar to Pair With Champagne
description: Farmed caviar has been produced in the Bordeaux region of France for decades. One brand, Sturia, has finally made its way to the United States. Sturia offers several grades of baeri, the Siberian sturgeon caviar, delineated by age. The youngest is the mildest tasting; the flavors become stronger and earthier as the eggs mature. The company is also selling genuine osetra, a somewhat nuttier and paler variety, with a very good texture: 30 grams (about an ounce), from $100 for the Primeur (young) baeri to $162 for genuine osetra at Le District, Brookfield Place, 225 Liberty Street (West Street), 212-981-8588, ledistrict.com, sturia.com.

title: As Navy Heads to Haiti, Hurricane Matthew Threatens U.S. Coast
description: In its 11 a.m. update, the National Weather Service said confidence [is] increasing that Matthew will significantly affect the southeast coast of the United States:

title: Haiti Braces for Catastrophe as Hurricane Matthew Makes Landfall
description: Haiti braced for a possible catastrophe on Tuesday as Hurricane Matthew, a dangerous Category 4 storm, made landfall, delivering winds of up to 145 miles an hour and rainfall that could exceed three feet in some areas.

title: A Banquet of Chinese Experience
description: An exhibition at the Museum of Chinese in America examines the immigrant and second-generation Chinese and Asian experience through food. More than 30 home cooks and professional chefs, including Ken Hom, Anita Lo, Susanna Foo, Danny Bowien and Michael Tong are profiled. Their experiences and interpretations of regional cuisines are presented through video installations, and objects illustrating the chefs stories are displayed on an oversize dinner table: Sour, Sweet, Bitter, Spicy: Stories of Chinese Food and Identity in America, Oct. 6 to March 26, 2017, Museum of Chinese in America, 215 Centre Street (Grand Street), 855-955-6622, mocanyc.org.

title: Daily Report: Googles Slow Response to Amazons Echo is a Warning
description: Google, for all its financial success and world-beating technology, has a problem: It often lags or is never even a player in markets it could have dominated.

title: The Prisoners Paradox
description: This weeks challenge was suggested by Greg Ross, creator and curator of the Futility Closet, the online miscellany of compendious amusements. The puzzle is from the first of his two eponymous book-form compilations of closet tidbits, which I happened to pull off the bookshelf recently and completely derail an evening. Lets try

title: A Brooklyn Caterer Expands
description: If youre not hungry when you enter the new shop for Cobblestone Catering, which just moved to a larger location after 10 years, a glance at the alluring, colorful display of prepared foods will be enough to whet the appetite. How to decide among a toss of golden spaghetti squash, a verdant broccoli salad, roasted cauliflower, fried chicken, tangy Moroccan carrots, apple pastries and fruit-filled crostatas? The shop and its catering division, on the second floor of the building, are owned by Linsey Snyder Wachalter and her husband, the chef Jeremy Wachalter: Cobblestone Catering and Fine Foods, 220 Atlantic Avenue (Court Street), Boerum Hill, Brooklyn, 718-222-1661, cobblestonecatering.com.

title: Steven Alans Goals: Subtlety and Quality
description: In the 22 years since he opened his first store, the designer and retailer Steven Alan has built a brand that serves as a bridge between the stalwarts (Ralph Lauren, Calvin Klein) and the upstarts (Hood by Air, Public School). His line of casual, elevated pieces is sold in 32 namesake locations worldwide, with two scheduled to open in South Korea next year, and no two look alike. We try to make each store into a neighborhood experience, he said.

title: An Italian-Style Aperitif With a California Twist
description: The initial attack in this garnet-hued aperitif from St. George Spirits, an artisanal producer in California, is deceptively sweet. Then gradually, the complex layers of flavor unfold, ending with a bitter swagger. There are hints of citrus  Seville oranges are what the company uses  as well as herbaceous notes. Its an American take on typical Italian aperitifs like Campari: Bruto Americano, $29.99, Astor Wines and Spirits, 212-674-7500, astorwines.com.

title: Thai Sausages From Olympia Provisions and Pok Pok
description: To give that tailgate platter or an autumn stir-fry a twist, consider searing these sai ua sausages. Olympia Provisions in Portland, Ore., makes the Thai links in collaboration with Andy Ricker of the Pok Pok restaurants there and in New York. Along with fish sauce, lemongrass, garlic and shallots, these sausages are infused with galangal, chiles and lime leaf. Asian napa cabbage slaw would be great to serve alongside: Olympia Provisions Sai Ua Sausage, $10 for three 4-ounce sausages, olympiaprovisions.com.

title: Nobel Awarded to Japanese Biologist
description: Fellow Japanese reacted enthusiastically after Dr. Yoshinori Ohsumi was awarded the Nobel Prize for Physiology or Medicine on Monday for his pioneering work on how cells recycle their content.

title: A Cold-Brew Coffee to Drink Year Round
description: Cold-brew coffee was big this summer, and as fall begins the popularity of coffee made this way, best suited for serving iced, shows no signs of slacking off. This smooth, strong, full-bodied cold brew is bottled without preservatives or sweeteners by Zingermans Coffee Company, a division of the diverse food emporium in Ann Arbor, Mich. A special process gives it a years shelf-life unrefrigerated (before opening). Well-made cold brew has minimal acidity. This one fits the profile: Zingermans Cold Brew Coffee, $3.99 for a 10-ounce bottle; a case of 16, $56, zingermanscoffee.com.

title: Why Colombias Peace Deal With the FARC Failed
description: Colombians defied opinion polls on Sunday by voting against a peace agreement to end 52 years of war with the countrys largest rebel group, the FARC.

title: Times Insider Photo Challenge: Caption This!
description: Times Insider shares insights into how we work at The New York Times. Occasionally we have some fun.

title: Shimon Peres: The Peacemaker Who Wasnt
description: RAMALLAH, West Bank  Now that the funeral of Shimon Peres, the former Israeli president and prime minister, is over and the effusive praise of world leaders has subsided, its time for a critical look at his legacy. While many remember him as a courageous and tireless advocate for peace, Palestinians recall a different man  one who was very good at talking peace but not so good at walking the walk.

title: Herms: Spring 2017
description: Designs by Nadge Vanhee-Cybulski for spring 2017.

title: Elena Ferrantes My Brilliant Friend Goes From Page to Stage
description: LONDON  A day after a New York Review of Books article about the possible real identity of the best-selling author known as Elena Ferrante, the Rose Theater Kingston  here announced Monday that it would present the first stage adaptation of the four novels that have made Ms. Ferrante an international literary name.

title: Nutanix I.P.O. Creates Opening for Others
description: Nutanix, the cloud data-storage firm that made its market debut last week, has jammed open the window for initial public offerings.

title: How to Get the Stunning Red Lips From Giambattista Valli
description: The spring/summer 2017 makeup look at Giambattista Valli was a departure from the designers usual aesthetic in two distinct ways. First, models faces were matte (Normally at Giambattista theres always a little bit of shine somewhere, said the makeup artist Val Garland). Second, they were devoid of color  with one exception: a tomato-red lip. I dont think weve had a red lip in years, she noted, after finishing Gigi Hadids makeup.

title: Och-Ziff May Face Consequences Beyond Fine in Bribery Case
description: Defendants often point to the collateral consequences of a prosecution and civil enforcement action when arguing that they should not be punished too severely. The settlement by the hedge fund Och-Ziff Capital Management and its founder, Daniel S. Och, for paying bribes to obtain natural resource deals in Africa tests how much they will endure beyond the settlements fines and disgorged profits.

title: Fashion Week Photo Diary: Balenciaga, Cline and Givenchy
description: Scenes from the spring/summer 2017 collections which were presented in Paris on Sunday.

title: A Roller Coaster Remedy for Kidney Stones?
description: There are visceral reactions most of us expect during a roller coaster ride: a drop in the gut, a leap of the heart, a tingle in the fingertips.

title: Shawn Mendes Is a Familiar Face at No. 1
description: A year and a half ago, a fresh face topped the Billboard album chart: Shawn Mendes, a 16-year-old Canadian, who had drawn a big online following with six-second cover videos before being signed to a major label, Island Records.

title: In Upstate Congressional Race, a Classic Boxers Match That Is Virtually Tied
description: NEW PALTZ, N.Y.  The two candidates, current and former, stood with arms around each other, an American flag behind them, an adoring crowd before them.

title: State Attorney General Orders Trump Foundation to Cease Raising Money in New York
description: The office of the New York attorney general, Eric T. Schneiderman, has issued a notice of violation to Donald J. Trumps foundation, ordering it to immediately stop soliciting charitable donations in the state.

title: Letter to Trump Foundation From New York Attorney Generals Office
description: The office of Eric Schneiderman, New York's attorney general, has issued a notice of violation to the Donald J. Trump Foundation, ordering it to immediately stop soliciting donations in New York. It said that the office's charities bureau had determined that the charity had been fund-raising in New York this year when it was not registered to do so under state law.

title: Green the World and Grow the Economy?
description: To the Editor:

title: What You Should Watch: Empire and Pitch
description: Welcome to Watching, The New York Timess what-to-watch guide. We comb through releases big and small to email readers twice a week with our timely recommendations. You can browse previous guides here, and to receive recommendations straight to your inbox, sign up here. Stay tuned for our coming website.

title: Predawn Twitter Storm: Donald Trumps Destructive Habit
description: To the Editor:

title: A Brief History of the Single-Elimination Wild-Card Game
description: When Major League Baseball introduced the wild-card game in 2012, it was a new phenomenon. For the first time, there would be regularly scheduled single-elimination games in the postseason.

title: The Veep Head Writer David Mandel Builds a Private Museum
description: When David Mandel, the showrunner of HBOs Veep, accepted the Emmy for best comedy series last month, he gave a shout-out to the old neighborhood: This is for chubby Jews from the Upper West Side. Wherever you are, thank you.

title: A Lieutenant in Eradicating Smallpox Remembers the General
description: When I worked at what is now the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention in Atlanta in 1964, my boss, Dr. Donald A. Henderson, sent me to West Africa to help with an immunization program aimed at eradicating measles in eight countries.

title: In Greek Warriors Grave, Rings of Power (and a Mirror and Combs)
description: A trove of beautifully engraved gold rings and gemstones, found in the untouched grave of an ancient Greek warrior last year, were possessions from his culture, not loot from the nearby island of Crete, archaeologists now believe.

title: Next From David Byrne: Neuroscience in an Art Gallery
description: MENLO PARK, Calif.  Instead of just reading about the latest mind-bending experiments in neuroscience, David Byrne said he prefers, when possible, to participate in them. And hes hoping others feel the same.

title: This Store Still Needs a Name
description: Benjamin Albucker is, by his own description, an exacting, opinionated, slightly neurotic aesthete. He has a refined eye and a drive to sharpen it further.

title: The Trump Campaigns Questionable Tax Return Justification
description: Did Donald J. Trump have a fiduciary duty to keep the amount he personally owes in taxes to a minimum?

title: Copper Doorknobs as Germ Assassins
description: Q. How good are copper doorknobs at protecting patients from germs in hospitals?

title: Kim Kardashian Is Tied and Robbed of Millions in Jewels, French Police Say
description: PARIS  Just after midnight on Monday, Kim Kardashian West left an intimate Fashion Week reception and dinner in the Marais section of Paris, at which truffled scrambled eggs, white fish and copious amounts of Champagne were served.

title: Sonia Rykiel: Spring 2017
description: The labels spring 2017 collection.

title: How I Created My Very First Garden From Scratch
description: MILL VALLEY, Calif.  Remind me again why we bought this house? my husband asked. He was standing on the front porch a few days after we finally moved into our cottage here, after the three-year odyssey of buying it, renting it out while an architect drew plans for an addition and, finally, living like nomads with various friends as the promised four months of construction stretched into six.

title: Tension With Russia Rises as U.S. Halts Syria Negotiations
description: WASHINGTON  The United States on Monday suspended talks with Russia over the protracted conflict in Syria, accusing the Kremlin of joining with the Syrian Air Force in carrying out a brutal bombing campaign against the besieged city of Aleppo.

title: Chicken Potpie
description: Chicken potpie gets a much-needed makeover, and the results are astounding.

title: Chicken Potpie for the Modern Cook
description: I never like to argue with the bible of American cookery, Joy of Cooking. Much of its advice is timeless, like the best way to skin an eel and how to make fritters from day lilies.

title: Marine Recruit Training
description: To the Editor:

title: The F.B.I. Crime Report
description: To the Editor:

title: So Youd Rather Be Alone? Its O.K. Really.
description: To the Editor:

title: Kevin Harts Fashion Sense Is No Joke
description: Kevin Hart is one of the most successful comedians on earth, but his sense of style is no joke. With a new stand-up concert movie, What Now? out Oct. 14 and a debut album from Motown Records as his hip-hop alter ego Chocolate Droppa expected later in the fall, Mr. Hart, 37, will have plenty of opportunities to showcase his largely monochromatic look. He took a moment to discuss his five fashion favorites and the styling tip he picked up from David Beckham.

title: The Uproar Over Donald Trumps Taxes
description: To the Editor:

title: Cantor Fitzgerald Gambling Affiliate Settles Investigation
description: A business financed by Cantor Fitzgerald that became one of the biggest sports book runners in the country has agreed to pay about $22.5 million to settle allegations of illegal gambling and money laundering, authorities announced on Monday.

title: Review: An Unsatisfying Opera (or Is It a Lecture?)
description: Op-eds dont make good operas. That much was clear from Fridays performance of The Hunger at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, a fully staged work by the composer Donnacha Dennehy about the Irish famine of 1845-52, in which at least one million people died and another million were driven to emigrate. The subject could make a compelling background to a drama peopled with flesh-and-blood characters. But The Hunger is more of a lecture than an opera: Dramatically static and musically amorphous, the work is interspersed with filmed interviews in which academics invoke the evils of capitalism and colonialism.

title: Voices From Abortion Bill Protests
description: A proposal to ban abortions in Poland, even in cases of rape and when a womans life is in danger, sparked so-called Black Monday rallies in several European cities.

title: Taliban Launch Coordinated Attack on Kunduz
description: The Taliban began an assault on Kunduz, Afghanistan, on Monday and residents continued to worry about the poor security in their city.

title: People and Technology
description: WEAPONS OF MATH DESTRUCTIONHow Big Data Increases Inequality and Threatens DemocracyBy Cathy ONeil259 pp. Crown, $26.

title: Review: In No Tomorrow, a Romantic Rejoinder to All the Naysayers
description: Last year CW scored one of the big successes of the television season with the nervy-cute musical comedy Crazy Ex-Girlfriend. This year its offering another hourlong comedy about a young woman going to extremes to find whats missing in her life, No Tomorrow.

title: 10 Movies to Put on Your List This Month
description: An accountant, a girl on a train and Tom Cruise come to theaters this month.

title: In Las Vegas, Rising Murders Strain a Police Force Used to Solving Them
description: LAS VEGAS  In the seven months since Heriberto Diaz Marcial was shot and killed walking home from his job as a casino porter on the Vegas Strip, church volunteers have knocked on hundreds of doors in his neighborhood and handed out fliers seeking information. The police released blurry security footage of a gray sedan tied to his three killers. His wife, Maria Diaz, has gone on television to plead for help.

title: Readers Guide to This Falls Big Book Awards
description: Its that time of year when the literary world hands out its biggest prizes. Next weeks announcement of the Nobel Prize in Literature will be followed by the awarding of the Man Booker Prize later in October and the National Book Awards in November. Heres a guide to the finalists for the honors  and the chatter about who might win the Nobel.

title: The Problem With Googles Star Trek Computer
description: Google is hoping to develop its Assistant, a Siri-like technology to be included on the companys new smartphones and other products, into something like the computer on Star Trek. For those who arent Trek fans, that would mean the Assistant could understand and execute complex spoken commands (though tasks like opening a subspace channel would have to wait for other technologies to catch up).

title: Dabbling in Provocation at the Fall for Dance Festival
description: The wow moment in most Fall for Dance Festival programs comes in a propulsive unison finale or a virtuosic solo. But last Wednesday at City Center, the wow was more of a whoa as Wendy Whelan, the esteemed ballerina, sauntered across the stage wearing only a white button-down shirt with black nylons, garters and high heels. She stopped, stared and stubbed out a cigarette on her tongue.

title: Alexander McQueen: Spring 2017
description: Sarah Burtons designs for next spring.

title: It Was Once a Required Item. Now the Hat Is Just for Fun.
description: Prada and Dior Homme put sailor caps and beanies on the runway, and the options dont end there.

title: Two Brothers, Both August Wilson Stalwarts, Play the Same Role on Opposite Coasts
description: The work of August Wilson has for years sustained Brandon and Jason Dirden, actor brothers who have found themselves turning again and again to his plays for meaning and inspiration.

title: Roman Artifacts Found in Okinawa Castle
description: Archaeologists have found ancient Roman coins buried in the ruins of a 12th-century castle in Okinawa, and no one knows how they got there.

title: Review: In This Ring Cycle, Gods Dwell in an Old Theater
description: CHICAGO  David Pountney is hardly the first director to assert that his production of Wagners epic Ring cycle will focus on telling the story, rather than telling audiences what it means. Yet is it possible to tell any story without interpreting it, even inadvertently?

title: Hillary Clinton, Seizing on Tax Returns, Says Donald Trump Embodies Rigged System
description: TOLEDO, Ohio  Hillary Clinton seized on revelations that Donald J. Trump could have avoided paying income taxes for up to 18 years to unleash a new torrent of criticism of her opponent, saying he pretended to help working Americans even as he personified the same rigged system he claims he will change.

title: Protesters in Poland Rally Against Proposal for Total Abortion Ban
description: WARSAW  Despite pouring rain and a chill in the air, Anna Pietruszka-Drozdz, together with as many as 24,000 other Polish women and men, skipped work on Monday and instead came to Castle Square in Warsaw, dressed in black, to protest a sweeping new anti-abortion bill.

title: Louise Bourgeois, in Her 90s
description: A new exhibition features intimate etchings made between 2006 and the artists death in 2010 at age 98  along with portraits made of her during the same period.

title: In the English Countryside, Intimate Works by  and of  Louise Bourgeois
description: Somerset, in the west of England, is old farming country: a gently rolling, leafy landscape dotted with livestock. Here, in a suite of renovated agricultural buildings, Hauser & Wirth has its two-year-old out-of-town gallery, coupled with a working farm and a bustling art-lined restaurant serving local produce. With a salt-walled meat locker on public display and a loamy, autumnal smell floating in from surrounding pastures, the space has an earthy sensibility that might have appealed to Louise Bourgeois. The French-born, New York-based artist was noted for her forthright treatment of issues of the body and the mind; and in a series of little-known etchings now on view at the gallery-cum-country estate, she fuses the human body with botanical elements.

title: A Milestone for Carbon Dioxide in the Atmosphere
description: Climate science reached an unhappy milestone last week. And then things went a little crazy.

title: Review: Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea, With a Message on the Environment
description: Theatergoers, theres no need to pack scuba gear or even a snorkel mask to plunge into the ocean deep. In Craig Francis and Rick Millers Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea, a frisky adaptation of the Jules Verne sci-fi saga at the New Victory Theater, a few actors, a few more props and some extremely nifty projections send the audience right to the seafloor. Hey, look out for that squid!

title: Maria Grazia Chiuri and the History of Women at Dior
description: Gabrielle Coco Chanel never did things by halves. When asked her opinion on Christian Diors New Look  the shorthand for the wasp-waisted, full-skirted silhouette Dior introduced to furor, acclaim and near universal adoption in his debut collection of 1947  she snapped: Look how ridiculous these women are, wearing clothes by a man who doesnt know women, never had one, and dreams of being one.

title: Review: Rogue Heroes, the Birth of Britains Elite Special Forces
description: Ben Macintyres suspenseful new book, Rogue Heroes, about the founding of Britains S.A.S. during World War II, reads like a mashup of The Dirty Dozen and The Great Escape, with a sprinkling of Oceans 11 thrown in for good measure. Like earlier Macintyre books set during that war (Double Cross: The True Story of the D-Day Spies and Operation Mincemeat: How a Dead Man and a Bizarre Plan Fooled the Nazis and Assured an Allied Victory), this volume features an ensemble of eccentrics, mavericks and malcontents. And, in this case, one visionary, David Stirling, who invented an elite commando unit that would become the prototype for a new kind of modern warfare, and the model for special forces around the world, including the Navy SEALs and the Armys Delta Force.

title: Review: Movable Roots Jam Brings a Philadelphia Festival to New York
description: For a certain stripe of older fan, the Roots are exceptionalists who embody all of hip-hops potential as an extension of the soul music tradition, and who keep hip-hop viable as live performance. For a newer generation of fans, who come to them via their gig on Jimmy Fallons late-night show, they are Americas house band, polymaths who collaborate with stars on quirky viral videos and offer up musical cheers, jeers or arched eyebrows as the circumstance dictates.

title: Donald Trump, Aleppo, FARC: Your Monday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: 7 Broadway Musicals Coming Your Way
description: A look at some Broadway musicals, including a few Tony Award winners, going on tour this fall.

title: Women Shun the Maternity Smock, and Stores Race to Catch Up
description: It has been more than 25 years since Demi Moore bared her pregnant belly on the cover of Vanity Fair, but retailers are finally catching up to the fact that pregnant women do not always want to hide under a muumuu.

title: Scrutiny of Commercial Real Estate Loans Chills Small Lenders
description: Financing commercial property has been local banks bread-and-butter business for years, but a postcrisis push for loan growth prompted regulatory warnings about lax lending standards, and small banks are now shying away from the market.

title: Judges Push Brevity in Briefs, and Get a Torrent of Arguments
description: The Constitution of the United States clocks in at 4,543 words. Yet a number of lawyers contend that 14,000 words are barely enough to lay out their legal arguments.

title: OBannon Ruling Stands, but N.C.A.A.s Status Quo May Yet Collapse
description: The chances that the United States Supreme Court would ever agree to hear the OBannon case were always low.

title: Protest Started by Colin Kaepernick Spreads to High School Students
description: AURORA, Colo.  Vicqari Horton dropped a knee to the grass. The varsity choir piped out The Star-Spangled Banner. And in the bleachers at a sun-soaked football stadium here on Saturday, parents clenched their teeth in anger or raised their fists in support.

title: As Maria Sharapovas Case Winds Down, Reduced Penalty Is a Possibility
description: Maria Sharapova, the Russian tennis star, received a two-year suspension from international competition for a doping violation this year. Sharapova has appealed that decision, calling it unfairly harsh. On Tuesday, her final penalty will be made public. Here is what you need to know.

title: Four From BuzzFeed Politics Defect to CNN
description: Andrew Kaczynski, the BuzzFeed reporter whose scoop about Donald J. Trumps early support for the invasion of Iraq surfaced in the presidential debate last week, is leaving to join CNN, just a month before the election.

title: Resurrecting Colombias Peace Deal
description: By narrowly rejecting an agreement between the government of Colombia and the nations largest guerrilla group, Colombian voters have thrown a four-year-long peace process into turmoil.

title: With a Single Baseball, Seeking to Connect All 312 Hall of Famers
description: The wooden sign for Section 39 flapped in the wind and rain as Ralph Carhart walked past it and headed for a grassy expanse in Calvary Cemetery in Queens where, decades ago, poor parishioners were given charity burials in unmarked graves.

title: Jason Rezaian, Washington Post Reporter, Sues Iran Over Imprisonment
description: Jason Rezaian, The Washington Posts former bureau chief in Tehran whose 544-day imprisonment in Iran during the nuclear negotiations aggravated tense relations with the United States, filed a federal lawsuit Monday against the Iranian government, accusing it of hostage-taking, torture and terrorism.

title: The City Is Plastic
description: Dear Diary:

title: Deep Scars and Complacency Defeated Colombias Peace Deal
description: MEDELLN, Colombia  Laura Solano, a 25-year-old graphic design student, is the kind of young urbanite who Colombian leaders had hoped would support a peace deal with the countrys largest rebel group.

title: Study-Abroad Programs Address a Risk: Road Fatalities
description: Early on a morning in June, Shannon Marie Nuth, just shy of her 25th birthday, was returning to Antigua after spending the weekend near Lake Atitln, Guatemala. The bus she was riding in went out of control, flipped several times and crashed.

title: Data on Road Deaths by Country
description: Road fatalities are the leading cause of death for teens and young adults, according to the World Health Organization.

title: Is Leftist Era Fading in Latin America? Ask Colombia and Brazil
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  It was not a banner day for Latin Americas leftists.

title: With Tim Kaine and Mike Pence, Faith Is Back in the Mix
description: WASHINGTON  The descent of the 2016 presidential campaign last week into the realm of sex tapes and marital infidelity was remarkable enough in its own right, but it also offered a reminder of what has been largely absent from the race: a debate about issues of public morality that for decades have been at the heart of the countrys political divide.

title: Tips for Avoiding Traffic Accidents Abroad
description: Terrorism, infectious disease, crime and plane accidents are typical worries when students travel abroad. But road crashes are the biggest threat by far.

title: Elena Ferrante and the Power of Appropriation
description: On Sunday, readers awoke to the news that one of the worlds outstanding literary mysteries may have finally been solved. In an article published on the website of The New York Review of Books, and simultaneously in French, German and Italian publications, the journalist Claudio Gatti wrote that Elena Ferrante  the pen name for an Italian novelist whose true identity was a closely guarded secret  is actually a Rome-based translator named Anita Raja. Using financial records, Mr. Gatti makes a seemingly irrefutable case that Ms. Raja is the author of the books that made the name Elena Ferrante famous around the world, including her four Neapolitan novels.

title: Frances Hope for 2018 Ryder Cup: If We Host It, They Will Come
description: CHASKA, Minn.  The 41st Ryder Cup was remarkable in scope and in outcome, with the American team ending a three-match losing streak against Europe on Sunday in front of large and occasionally over-the-top home crowds at Hazeltine National Golf Club here.

title: How a Simple Tax Rule Let Donald Trump Turn a $916 Million Loss Into a Plus
description: It is among the least controversial parts of the federal tax code, almost as old as the income tax itself: A business, big or small, can escape taxation if it lost money in a previous year, a rule that helps businesses weather tough economic times, and hopefully thrive again.

title: Donald Trumps Business Decisions in 80s Nearly Led Him to Ruin
description: Abraham Wallach thought he had scored a major career break when Donald J. Trump hired him in 1990 for a senior executive role. Based on Mr. Trumps boasting and gaudy lifestyle, Mr. Wallach imagined he would soon be leading impressive construction projects around the globe.

title: Terry Collins, Author of Mets Playoff Run, Acts as an Open Book
description: In the revelry of the Mets playoff celebration on Saturday, one moment resonated. A group of players, led by Jerry Blevins, Jose Reyes and James Loney, formed a circle around Mets Manager Terry Collins and jumped up and down, hooting and hollering as they sprayed him with Champagne and beer.

title: Mr. Trumps Government Bailout
description: For more than a year, Donald Trump has said his genius as a businessman makes him uniquely qualified to fix the countrys problems. We can dispense with that fiction now that we know that he claimed a $916 million loss on his 1995 tax returns. Such a mammoth loss amounts to an epic failure, not runaway success.

title: Who Is Elena Ferrante? Supporters Say NOYB
description: The readers of Elena Ferrante are devoted  and fiercely protective  of that anonymous Italian author. That much was clear from the swift and unforgiving backlash after an investigative journalist used financial documents to suggest in an article  published on Sunday that Anita Raja, an Italian translator, was behind Ms. Ferrantes books.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: We see police do us wrong. We see our teachers give up on us and expect us to fail. Weve always seen this. Once we saw somebody else stand up against it, we just fell in line.

title: Gloria Naylor, Whose Honored Novel Was Set in a Housing Project, Dies at 66
description: Gloria Naylor, whose debut novel, The Women of Brewster Place, won a National Book Award and was adapted into an acclaimed mini-series that starred and was produced by Oprah Winfrey, died on Wednesday near her home in Christiansted, V.I. She was 66.

title: For Dust You Are
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  Todays crossword by Sam Buchbinder reminded me of school lunches where, instead of eating what ones parents had packed, everyone would dump their food in the middle of the table and we would all pick and choose from the pile what we wanted to eat. That way, if you were not so much a bologna sandwich kind of person but someone else at the table was, you could easily get out of eating your sandwich while someone else enjoyed it. And you could joyfully dine on the Ho-Hos that someone else contributed.

title: Gordon Davidson, Artistic Director of Mark Taper Forum, Dies at 83
description: Gordon Davidson, who as artistic director of the Mark Taper Forum for nearly 40 years helped establish Los Angeles as a West Coast capital of regional theater and challenged audiences with socially conscious plays, died on Sunday in Los Angeles. He was 83.

title: When It Comes to Tax Avoidance, Donald Trumps Just a Small Fry
description: Not paying taxes makes me smart, Donald J. Trump said last week. His surrogates called him a genius for his recently revealed tax avoidance strategies.

title: Odell Beckham Jr.? Steamed. The Giants Defense? Rolled.
description: MINNEAPOLIS  Four games into Ben McAdoos tenure as head coach, the Giants face a number of troubling problems, all of which contributed to a 24-10 loss to the Minnesota Vikings on Monday night.

title: Corrections: October 4, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Paris Fashion Week, Day 8: No One Goes Bigger Than Chanel
description: The end is near, and the number of key shows thinning, but Tuesday kicks off with one of Pariss biggest bangs. Heres what to look for:

title: Whats on TV Tuesday: No Tomorrow and the Vice-Presidential Debate
description: In No Tomorrow, some Jane the Virgin team members put their twist on another South American import  this one about the end of the world. Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trumps running mates debate the issues. And Dheepan, Jacques Audiards tale of survival, is almost prophetic in its portrayal of the European refugee crisis.

title: October Baseball: Our Writers Make Their Picks (and a Few Jokes)
description: Baseballs postseason begins Tuesday night and could extend into November. Six New York Times sportswriters offer their predictions (and wisecracks), and most of them are not picking the Chicago Cubs.

title: Trump as Role Model? Kelly Ayotte Says She Misspoke
description: Senator Kelly Ayotte of New Hampshire wanted to be clear late Monday: There are no role models in this years presidential race.

title: Word + Quiz: astringent
description: astringent \-strin-jnt\ adjective or noun

title: What Lies Behind French Conservatives Love of Putin?
description: PARIS  It is not too hard to explain the love affair between the Kremlin and the National Front, the far-right party in France. They share positions on a wide range of issues  national sovereignty (for), the European Union (against), Russias annexation of Crimea (for) and an American role in Europe (against).

title: Love and Loss: Responding to the Orlando Massacre
description: Four months after a gunman killed 49 people at a gay nightclub in Florida, an exhibit highlights the global outpouring of love and support.

title: The King of False Equivalence
description: So, now were supposed to feel sorry for Paul Ryan?

title: Trump, Taxes and Citizenship
description: You can be a taxpayer or you can be a citizen. If youre a taxpayer your role in the country is defined by your economic and legal status. Your primary identity is individual. Youre perfectly within your rights to do everything you legally can to look after your self-interest.

title: Third-Party Voters Know What They Want
description: On Tuesday night, two men who want to be vice president will face off in a debate. If Bill Weld had his way, hed be up on that stage, too.

title: Speak Up, Mr. Vice Presidential Candidate. We Can Barely Hear You.
description: Gail Collins: Arthur, we are on the cusp of another great moment in the campaign  vice-presidential debate! Tim Kaine takes on Mike Pence! Never has there been such an encounter since Sylvester Stallone took on Mr. T in Rocky III.

title: In Rural Bangladesh, Solar Power Dents Poverty
description: KAKHIN BIMILE, Bangladesh  Kismat Ali is a 33-year-old mason living in Kakhin Bimile, a village a few hours drive from Dhaka, Bangladeshs crowded capital. He lives in a large brick home on a dirt road with his wife, son, parents and five brothers. This semirural area is off the main electrical grid, so residents rely on kerosene lamps and electricity from wires strung across the village to a noisy privately owned diesel generator. It runs about five hours each night.

title: Why Its So Hard to See Politicians Financial Data
description: You dont learn much from tax returns, Donald J. Trump said last week in the first presidential debate. That line may become as famous a gaffe as Gerald Fords claiming in a 1976 debate that Eastern Europe wasnt under Soviet domination.

title: Senator Kaine and Gov. Pence: Face-Off in Farmville!
description: Its safe to say Tuesdays vice-presidential debate wont rival the Hillary Clinton-Donald Trump rumble for great television moments. It features two middle-aged, white, Midwest-raised politicians who call themselves boring (Tim Kaine) and B-list (Mike Pence). And running mates play an even smaller role than usual in 2016, given the outsized personalities at the top of the tickets. But if these two men are willing to seriously engage the issues (and the rest of us are willing to stay awake), they could provide useful insights into their sharply contrasting plans for the future.

title: Not One New York Police Officer Has a Body Camera
description: The New York Police Department once seemed poised to be an early adopter of body cameras. A federal judge thought the technology could curb unwarranted stops and searches of black and Hispanic men. So in 2013, after finding the departments stop-and-frisk practices unconstitutional, the judge ordered that a pilot program be established in at least five precincts.

title: Easing the Pain of Automation
Love and Loss: Responding to the Orlando Massacre
description: ngel Franco had been staking out a medical facility in Orlando, Fla., photographing grieving families who had just identified relatives slain in one of the nations largest mass shootings, when he found himself thinking: What am I doing here?

title: Creepy Clowns
Afghan Forces Push Taliban Out of Kunduz Center, Officials Say
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Afghan officials said on Tuesday that their commando forces had reclaimed the main city square in Kunduz from the Taliban and were making gains elsewhere in the vital provincial capital, where the insurgents overran central neighborhoods on Monday.

title: LVMH to Take 80% Stake in German Luggage Brand Rimowa
description: LONDON  LVMH Mot Hennessy Louis Vuitton, the largest luxury conglomerate in the world, said on Tuesday that it had agreed to buy a controlling stake in the German luggage brand Rimowa for 640 million euros, or about $719 million.

title: Why Are Politicians So Obsessed With Manufacturing?
description: When Donald J. Trump landed in Pittsburgh a few weeks ago, the city was buzzing about Ubers deployment of the worlds first fleet of driverless taxicabs. Political leaders were thrilled that Silicon Valley was hiring highly paid workers and investing hundreds of millions of dollars in western Pennsylvania. Local taxi drivers were understandably less excited that robots were coming for their jobs.

title: Winston Churchills Great Escape
description: HERO OF THE EMPIREThe Boer War, a Daring Escape and the Making of Winston ChurchillBy Candice MillardIllustrated. 381 pp. Doubleday. $30.

title: Aasif Mandvi Knows How to Make America Great Again
description: In August, you characterized Donald Trumps anti-Muslim rhetoric as a gift to terrorists  specifically, you said its like Christmas for ISIS. Would you care to extend that metaphor? Donald Trump is essentially tapping into the most fearful, racist, xenophobic, fear-based mind-set in this country, but hes also justifying that in other parts of the world. Whether its ISIS or its Trump  what theyre basically saying is: Theres a reason you should be afraid, theres a reason you should feel disenfranchised, theres a reason that you should feel angry, and its because of those people, over there.

title: We Are a Big Family: Dealers Unite Against Thefts of Rare Books
description: In Nantucket-red trousers and loafers, the customer looked the part of an upscale antiquarian book collector as he browsed 16th-century Italian texts on display in a chandelier-decked showroom inside a landmark brownstone on the Upper East Side of Manhattan. But it was a conspicuous outfit for a thief  moments after the man entered on that day last spring, cameras caught him stuffing two texts worth a total of more than $20,000, according to a bookseller, into an elegant case.

title: In Juan Gabriel Vsquezs Novel, a Political Cartoonist Answers to the Past
description: REPUTATIONSBy Juan Gabriel VsquezTanslated by Anne McLean190 pp. Riverhead Books. $25.

title: How Republican Politicians Learned to Love Working Mothers
description: A generation ago, when Republican politicians held stay-at-home motherhood as the ideal, they often treated women who broke the traditional mold as slightly radioactive. So the speech that Donald Trump gave on Sept. 13, if nothing else, stands as a marker of how much the partys campaign rhetoric has changed.

title: A Debate Stage in Virginia, With Racial Scar Tissue as the Backdrop
description: FARMVILLE, Va.  When Tim Kaine joyously proclaimed that Old Virginny is dead the day after Barack Obama was elected president in 2008, he was on to something. Virginia, the birthplace of American slavery and the state that provided the intellectual foundation more than 300 years later for massive resistance to integration, had just voted for a black man to go to the White House. But Virginias support for Mr. Obama that year was not an aberration.

title: Lee Child: No. 1 in America
description: Objectively I was one of the luckiest humans ever born. In 1954, Britain was a stable postwar liberal democracy, at peace, with a cradle-to-grave welfare system that worked efficiently, with all dread diseases conquered, with full employment for our parents, with free and excellent education from the age of 5 for just as long as we merited it.

title: Vice-Presidential Debate: What You Missed
description: Right Now: Heres how we analyzed in real time the only vice-presidential debate between Senator Tim Kaine of Virginia and Gov. Mike Pence of Indiana. Plus, check out our fact checks and our email exchanges with Walter F. Mondale, the 42nd vice president of the United States.

title: A Mets Fans Daughter Catches the Bug
description: I talk about baseball every day. I talk about it in the spring and summer. I talk about it in the fall and the winter, during the season of relentless trade and free-agent gossip, and then into early spring, when I count down the days until pitchers and catchers report south to round themselves into shape for the coming season. Then, as in the eternal ritual of the reading of the Five Books of Moses, I start all over again.

title: How Well Do You Know Tim Kaine and Mike Pence?
description: Polls show that roughly a third of voters have no opinion or have never heard of each vice-presidential nominee. We spent weeks with them on the trail so you did not have to.

title: Why Referendums Arent as Democratic as They Seem
description: The voters of the world have had quite a year: They rejected Colombias peace deal; split Britain from the European Union; endorsed a Thai Constitution that curtails democracy; and, in Hungary, backed the governments plan to restrict refugees, but without the necessary turnout for a valid result.

title: Civil Conversation Challenge for Teenagers | Issue 2: Guns
description: As part of our Civil Conversation Challenge, we have opened student forums on some of the biggest issues dividing Americans this campaign season.

title: Vice-Presidential Debate, Haiti, M.L.B. Playoffs: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Morning Agenda: Small-Fry Tax Avoidance, an Outdoor Merger, a Chill on Small Lenders
description: Donald J. Trump may call himself a genius for his tax avoidance strategies, but in comparison, corporate America is being run by absolute virtuosos, Andrew Ross Sorkin writes.

title: Toxins Linger in Homes Long After Smokers Quit
description: Houses where smokers have lived remain polluted with tobacco smoke for at least six months after the smoker has quit and may continue to pose a threat to nonsmokers who live there, a new study found.

title: 11 Essential Drinks at 11 Great Cocktail Bars
description: Getting a great cocktail at a great bar is a wonderful experience. But getting a cocktail of noted repute, at the bar where it originated or from the bartender who created it, contributes a certain extra level of special. There arent that many places where you can pull off this trick, but the modern cocktail revival has added to the number of such destination bars. For the intrepid boozehound with some frequent flier miles to burn, heres a list of a few to hit.

title: How to Have a Luxury Vacation for Less
description: Who doesnt like the idea of a luxury vacation? Ponying up the money for an upscale getaway, on the other hand, isnt nearly as appealing as going on one. Fortunately, says Joel Widzer, an expert on saving money on travel and the author of the book The Penny Pinchers Guide to Luxury Travel, there are ways to cut the cost of a fancy trip. Here, he shares tips for a lavish getaway on a limited budget.

title: Better Polling for Clinton, but Trump Is Keeping Core Support
description: Donald J. Trump had a difficult week after the first presidential debate, and, as you might expect, his polling was not great.

title: When Rebecca Hall First Got This Script, She Hid It
description: To anyone who has qualms about seeing the new movie Christine, based on the Florida news anchor Christine Chubbuck, who shot and killed herself on a live broadcast in 1974, Rebecca Hall gets it.

title: Art Deco Los Angeles
description: Californias broad landscape suggests endless possibility, a chance to realize your dreams. You can backpack in the Klamath National Forest within Siskiyou County. You can find a slice of Denmark in the Santa Ynez Valley. Or you can immerse yourself in the glittery landscape of the Hollywood hills, the place that has applied a practicality to its dreams by making an industry of them.

title: New York Today: An Ode to Opera
description: Updated, 10:05 a.m.

title: 3 Who Studied Unusual States of Matter Win Nobel Prize in Physics
description: Three physicists born in Britain but now working in the United States were awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics on Tuesday for research into the bizarre properties of matter in extreme states, including superconductors, superfluids and thin magnetic films.

title: Chappatte on Colombias Failed Peace Deal
description: A narrow defeat plunges a nation back into uncertainty.

title: 1916: Britain to Raise New War Credit
description: LONDON  According to the Daily News and Leader, the new war credit which will be asked for in Parliament next week will probably amount to 250,000,000. An Order in Council, dated yesterday [Oct. 3], gives the Army Council, the Admiralty and the Chancellor of the Exchequer full power to regulate or prohibit the purchase, the production and the sale of all foods and food products, forage and merchandise of every kind as well as to requisition them.

title: Celebrating Alber Elbaz
description: The ex-artistic director of Lanvin was appointed an officer of the Lgion dHonneur. It was an elevation of his rank; he had been made a chevalier in 2007.

title: Alber Elbaz Receives a French Honor and a Crowds Cheers
description: PARIS  I cannot believe what a fabulous front row is here, Alber Elbaz, the former artistic director of Lanvin, said on Monday as he drew some of the biggest names in the industry to a gilded room in the Palais Royal. Here I am, inviting you to a show with no dresses. It was difficult, but dont you find it original?

title: Liberal Economists Think Big Companies Are Too Powerful. Hillary Clinton Agrees.
description: Antitrust law will probably never be the subject of breathless campaign coverage, at least not in this election year of a beauty queen and a leaked tax return. But it is one of the more powerful ways a president can shape the playing field of the United States economy.

title: Subpoenas and Gag Orders Show Government Overreach, Tech Companies Argue
description: SAN FRANCISCO  It has been six months since the Justice Department backed off on demands that Apple help the F.B.I. break the security of a locked iPhone.

title: Australians Arrested in Malaysia After Stripping to Briefs at Grand Prix
description: HONG KONG  It began as a day at the races in Malaysia. But for a group of Australians who stripped down to briefs that featured Malaysias flag  including an aide to a cabinet minister, according to news reports  it ended in arrest.

title: Julian Assange, WikiLeaks Founder, Promises Raft of Revelations
description: BERLIN  Julian Assange, the founder of WikiLeaks, promised on Tuesday to release significant material over the next 10 weeks about arms, Google, mass surveillance, oil, the United States election and war.

title: Chinese Tourists Take to the Road in Record Numbers for Golden Week
description: BEIJING  If there is ever a time when one truly understands what it feels like to live alongside 1.4 billion people in the worlds most populous nation, it is the annual Golden Week holiday in China.

title: Weekly News Quiz | Sept. 27-Oct. 3, 2016
description: Have you been following the news? Take our quiz to see what you know and to learn more.

description: Karl Lagerfelds collection for spring 2016.

title: Will Mike Pence Tell the Truth?
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive more briefings and a guide to the section daily in your inbox.

title: Next Renewable Energy: Burning Forests, if Senators Get Their Way
description: President Obamas Clean Power Plan  the central plank in his strategy to combat climate change  is in danger.

title: California Today: Requiring the Use of Condoms in Adult Films
description: Good morning.

title: In Video, Sacramento Police Appear to Try to Hit Man With Their Car Before Hes Fatally Shot
description: The Sacramento County district attorney is investigating the fatal police shooting of a homeless black man who was hit 14 times in an encounter that was captured on dashboard cameras, leading to calls by his family for a federal investigation and for murder charges to be filed against the two officers.

title: John Kerry Criticizes Russia, Saying It Turned a Blind Eye on Syria
description: BRUSSELS  Secretary of State John Kerry criticized Russia on Tuesday for pointedly ignoring the Syrian governments use of chlorine gas and barrel bombs against its own citizens, and he left little hope for an early resumption of talks with Russia about a cease-fire.

title: In Case You Missed It: September's Top Real Estate Stories
description: Catch up on the most popular stories of the month.

description: ComiXology, a digital distributor of comic books, will be expanding its library with exclusive comics.

title: Questions for: Whats Clogging Jakartas Waterways? You Name It
description: Article: Whats Clogging Jakartas Waterways? You Name It

title: I.M.F. Warns of Anti-Trade Sentiment Amid Weak Global Growth
description: WASHINGTON  The International Monetary Fund has warned that sluggish economic growth throughout the world could bolster an anti-trade backlash that has become a feature of politics in both the United States and Europe.

title: With Court Ruling, Maria Sharapova Can Return to Tennis in 2017
description: Maria Sharapova, the Russian tennis star, won a partial victory in the worlds top sports court on Tuesday after appealing her two-year suspension for a doping violation.

title: Nailing Down Trumps Taxes
description: As a whistle-blower, Merrell Williams Jr.s character and motives were hardly pure.

title: Paris Fashion Show Photos: Chanel, Alexander McQueen and More
description: Plus looks from the Herms and Sonia Rykiel spring 2017 shows.

title: Getting Lost in the Matrix With Chanel and Herms
description: PARIS  On the penultimate day of fashion month, Anne Hidalgo, the mayor of Paris, fresh from defending her city during LAffaire Kardashian, held a small breakfast in the gilded rooms of the Htel de Ville with assorted media figures and the titans of the Fdration Franaise de la Couture, French fashions governing body, to celebrate the industry.

title: As Bugs Come for Its Mulberry Trees, a City Wraps Itself in Flypaper
description: TEHRAN  It is usually around midday, when the late-summer sun is scorching the Iranian capital, that they appear: thousands of minuscule whiteflies, seemingly everywhere, but particularly thick on the leaves of Tehrans signature tree, the mulberry.

title: A British Architect Finds Her Solo Voice
description: LONDON  Amanda Levetes architecture studio is lodged in an old transport depot on a street neighboring Pentonville Prison here. One is tempted to step in through sliding glass windows, but an overlaid pattern of Ben-Day dots spells out This Is Not a Door and directs visitors instead to a portal lacquered in neon orange, set centrally on a graphite gray wall. Theatrical but not grandiose, with an edge of humor, its a cannily judged introduction to the work of Ms. Levete and her practice, AL_A.

title: Photos: Chanel, Spring 2017
description: Guests included Roger Federer, Frances Bean Cobain and her mother, Courtney Love, and more.

title: After Just 6 Months, Justin OShea Is Out at Brioni
description: PARIS  Brionis brief experiment with radical reinvention has ended. Justin OShea, the former buying director and rebel in a pinstripe suit who was hired with great fanfare by Brioni in March to become its creative director  despite having no design experience  has left the Italian mens wear brand after just six months, the company confirmed on Tuesday.

title: Sociology, According to Putin
description: Long before the Russian state declared the Levada Center, Russias only reputable independent polling organization, to be a foreign agent in September, its director, Lev D. Gudkov, knew this was going to happen.

title: Poll Finds Deep Split on Climate Change. Party Allegiance Is a Big Factor.
description: Americans are deeply divided on the causes, cures and urgency of climate change, and party identification is one of the strongest predictors of individual views, according to a poll released Tuesday by the Pew Research Center.

title: The Trump Dialogues, From a Parody Universe
description: The comedy writer Owen Ellickson sent hundreds of tweets this summer as he pushed the boundaries of the years definitive comic genre: political parody, in miniature.

title: Emporio Armani Comes to Paris
description: PARIS  The letters ran the length of the building, spotlit against the night sky, a supersize billboard: Emporio Armani. The maestro of Milan wanted to announce himself, and he had. You had to stop for a second and think: Where am I?

title: Pope Francis Makes Surprise Visit to Earthquake-Hit Towns in Italy
description: ROME  When Amatrice and several other small Italian towns were ravaged by an earthquake six weeks ago, Pope Francis made a promise to the residents there.

title: Face in the Crowd: Usher at Chanel
description: Deep inside the Chanel Data Center, amid the LED lights, blinking panels and flashing cameras of the paparazzi that thronged the Grand Palais after the houses spring 2017 show on Tuesday morning, stood the singer Usher.

title: 1941: Britains Plans to Beat Hitler
description: LONDON  Viscount Halifax, British Ambassador to the United States, said today [Oct. 4] that he regarded ultimate invasion of the Continent as essential to the defeat of Germany. He stressed, however, that the time was not yet ripe, giving his opinion that Hitler probably asked nothing better than to see a small British expeditionary force landed on the Continent now, which could again be crushed by overwhelming German forces.

title: A.C.C. May Add a Ninth Conference Game, for Money and for Fairness
description: As the athletic directors of the Atlantic Coast Conference meet this week, one subject on the table, according to numerous reports, is whether to add a game to its eight-game conference schedule in football.

title: Dashboard Video of Sacramento Police Chase
description: Police officers appear to be trying to hit a homeless black man with their patrol car before fatally shooting him 14 times in July.

title: Thats Amaro: One Mans Love Affair With Bitter Liqueurs
description: Brad Thomas Parsons doesnt seem like a bitter guy. Garrulous and friendly, hes a well-liked regular at several restaurants and bars in his Brooklyn neighborhood, Carroll Gardens.

title: Copper Sinks and Faucets May Stem Hospital Infections
description: Installing copper equipment in hospital rooms may be a good way to reduce infections, a new study reports.

title: Rodrigo Duterte, Philippines Leader, Says Obama Can Go to Hell
description: MANILA  President Rodrigo Duterte of the Philippines complained on Tuesday that Washington was refusing to sell weapons to his government and said that President Obama can go to hell.

description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times. In this podcast, the food writers Julia Moskin and Kim Severson and Times Insiders Gray Ladles chat about food for fall.

title: One of the Smartest Money Strategies Is Asking When You Dont Know
description: Remember that kid in your high-school geometry class who raised his hand and asked the question everyone knew the answer to? Remember how the class laughed and thought he was so dumb?

title: Architects and Designers Pick Their Favorite New Kitchen and Bath Products
description: Every year, American home-furnishing stores sell more than $40 billion of merchandise, with products chased on and off the floor by changing fashions and technology. Tracking the abundance is more than any set of eyes can manage. So we asked 30 interior designers and architects to recommend their favorite recent products in a variety of categories. The choices add up to a look book of some of the most imaginative designs out there.

title: Hurricane Matthew Pummels Haiti and Moves Toward U.S.
description: Hurricane Matthew assaulted Haitis southern coast with deadly fury on Tuesday, destroying homes and crops, sweeping away livestock and cutting off transportation as a large part of the Caribbean was pummeled by the storms 145-mile-per-hour winds and torrential rain.

description: Every year, American home-furnishing stores sell more than $40 billion of merchandise, with products chased on and off the floor by changing fashions and technology. title: Hurricane Matthew Hits Haiti
description: Haiti took precautions as the Category 4 storm made landfall on Tuesday. The storm is expected to cause damaging winds, flash floods and landslides.

title: Daily Report: Another Round in the Privacy vs. Security Debate, This Time With the Signal App
description: Earlier this year, Apple resisted the demands of federal authorities to help open a locked iPhone. In Brazil, Facebooks WhatsApp declined to provide law enforcement there with information from its messaging service to help criminal investigations.

title: How U.S. Immigration Judges Battle Their Own Prejudice
description: SAN FRANCISCO  One of the immigrants appearing before Judge Dana Marks in a crowded court here was a boat worker from the former Soviet Union who stared in silence as a prosecutor asked about his criminal history. Another was a mother who started praying after testifying that she had fled Honduras because her husband beat her. She sought divine rather than judicial intervention.

title: Ex-Ally of Christie Links Cuomo to Cover-Up of Lane Closings
description: NEWARK  The man who has admitted orchestrating the mysterious lane closings at the George Washington Bridge in 2013 testified on Tuesday that he was told that Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey and Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York had agreed to falsely explain the closings as part of a traffic study to try to put an end to a growing scandal surrounding them.

title: A List of Previous Disasters in Haiti, a Land All Too Familiar With Hardship
description: Haiti, the poorest country in the Western Hemisphere, has been battered by natural disasters over the last decade. Its location in the Caribbean and on the Gonve microplate make it highly vulnerable to tropical storms and earthquakes.

description: David J. Thouless, F. Duncan M. Haldane and J. Michael Kosterlitz won the Nobel Prize in Physics for their work in topology, a branch of mathematics that describes properties that change only in increments.

But the bill seems certain to face considerable opposition from hard-liners in the judiciary.

description: NORTH BETHESDA, Md.  Congested and derided, the Rockville Pike thoroughfare, which connects Bethesda and Rockville, troubled local residents, officials and developers for years.

title: For Canadians, Thanksgiving Is a Quieter Affair in October
description: Most of the year, Canadians living in the United States look, talk and act so much like their neighbors that their nationality draws no attention at all. Autumn is a season of danger, though, when the mask of assimilation can be ripped off, forcing some Americans to face the unnerving, if fleeting, realization that Canada is an entirely different country.

description: Tom Brady is back and says he is ready to play against the Cleveland Browns on Sunday.

description: Brooklyns knack for attracting creative professionals is no secret, and soon, designers will have even more reason to flock there.
