description: Two decades after its inception, the award is one of the countrys most prestigious. Here, a guide to its winners.

title: Objects From New Yorks Buried Past Find a New Home in Midtown
description: From a cone-shaped mold used in sugar refining to an oversize oyster, a 7,000-year-old spear tip to a 19th-century Transferware teapot and a bone from a passenger pigeon, which was once the most abundant bird in North America but was declared extinct in 1914, New York City has cataloged and digitized a vast archive of its buried past.

title: Flint Hit With Bacterial Illness as Residents Shun City Water
description: Residents of Flint, Mich., affected by the contaminated-water crisis have added a new complication to their lives: an outbreak of shigellosis, a bacterial illness that is easily transmitted when people do not wash their hands.

title: The Magic of Crepe Cake
description: As the French and Japanese can attest, the crepe makes a brilliant snack on the run. You can nibble on the crispy edges of a hot crepe oozing with chocolate hazelnut spread or billowy whipped cream, folded into a paper cone that keeps the whole thing neatly contained while you walk the dog and pick up the dry cleaning.

title: How Shari Redstone Turned the Tide
description: Shari Redstone is well on her way to declaring victory in the battle over the future of the $40 billion media empire controlled by her father, Sumner M. Redstone.

title: Improvised Bomb Kills U.S. Service Member in Afghanistan
description: WASHINGTON  A member of the American military was killed in Nangarhar Province in Afghanistan on Tuesday while on a mission against Islamic State fighters, the Pentagon said.

title: Teaching Your Child Emotional Agility
description: Its hard to see a child unhappy. Whether a child is crying over the death of a pet or the popping of a balloon, our instinct is to make it better, fast.

title: Princes Paisley Park Museum Opening Snared by Zoning Vote
description: The planned opening of a museum in Princes former studio complex outside Minneapolis has been complicated by a municipal zoning vote, just days before the facility was set to open its doors to the public.

title: Review: Daughter and Father, Talking Across Time in CWs Frequency
description: The intriguing CW series Frequency starts out looking as if it were going to be a bittersweet, nostalgia-tinged time-travel drama in the Stephen King-Twilight Zone lineage, and that probably would have made for a comfortably satisfying show, the kind you can half-watch while doing something else. In the last third of the premiere, though, things take a joltingly different, more complicated path. Sorry, couch potatoes, but it looks as if you might have to keep both eyes on the screen for this one, which begins on Wednesday night.

title: David Burke Opens an Upscale Tavern on the Upper East Side
description: TAVERN 62 BY DAVID BURKE This represents something of a comeback for David Burke, a celebrated chef who dropped out of sight for several months while he dealt with business issues, even though his name was still on a number of restaurants. He has teamed up with ESquared Hospitality, and is opening this upscale tavern in the Upper East Side townhouse that housed his restaurant Fishtail, which closed last winter. In its new incarnation, the ground floor is the bar, where an afternoon menu will focus on toasts with various toppings. The second floor has a spacious dining room, a smaller room and a greenhouse garden room that will open later. Mr. Burkes signature use of slabs of Himalayan pink salt is everywhere, in the food and even to cover some walls. His menu can be counted on for inventive touches; there are scallops with corned beef cheeks, lamb carbonara and Peking pork shank. The executive chef is Ed Cotton. (Opens Saturday): 135 East 62nd Street, 212-988-9021, tavern62.com.

title: Ken Thompson, Brooklyn District Attorney, Says He Has Cancer and Will Take Leave
description: Ken Thompson, the Brooklyn district attorney, said on Tuesday that he had recently learned he has cancer and would take a sick leave.

title: A Look at Clintons Marriage Woes Raises a Question: Really?
description: Late last Saturday evening, The New York Times delivered an eye-popping scoop to its readers  tax documents of Donald Trumps that showed he may not have paid taxes for 18 years thanks to a nearly $1 billion loss suffered by his business.

title: With Devils Seeking More Offense, Taylor Hall Settles In
description: NEWARK  To get to and from Yankee Stadium to watch a baseball game last week, the new Devils forwards Taylor Hall and Vern Fiddler had to catch PATH trains to and from Hoboken, where Hall now lives.

title: A Bee Gees Survivor: Barry Gibb Reflects in a Solo Album
description: All I think about is yesterday, sings Barry Gibb at the start of his first solo album in 32 years, in a staccato familiar from his decades in the Bee Gees. I need you here in the now.

title: Hedge Fund Targets Companies Weakness: The Gender Gap
description: The chief executive at a plastics company was playing golf. A lot of golf.

title: Goldman Sachs Deal Maker John Vaske to Retire
description: A senior deal maker at Goldman Sachs, John Vaske, will retire from the investment bank after 28 years, the company announced on Tuesday.

title: Facebook Marketplace Goes Wrong: Sex, Guns and Baby Hedgehogs
description: On Monday morning, Facebook introduced Marketplace, a new section on its mobile app that allowed its users to buy and sell things with their friends and strangers.

title: Supreme Court Case to Test Prosecution of Insider Trading
description: The Securities and Exchange Commissions 40-year campaign against insider trading faces another big test on Wednesday when the Supreme Court is scheduled to hear oral arguments in an obscure case that challenges the enforcement of what the petitioner correctly describes as a judge-made law. Congress, as it turns out, has never defined the crime of insider trading, leaving it to the courts and the regulators to draw the line between what is legal and what isnt.

title: Los Angeles Police Release Video of Fatal Shooting; Say Man Had Gun
description: After two days of protests and speculation surrounding a police shooting that killed an 18-year-old black man this weekend, the Los Angeles Police Department on Tuesday released video surveillance footage Tuesday it said proved that the man, Carnell Snell Jr., had been carrying a handgun.

title: Faces in the Crowd: Sichun Ma and Bai Baihe
description: PARIS  Fashion weeks may be rooted in change, but some things stay the same  namely, the clustering of beautiful young actresses at Chanel, one of the blockbuster shows of the season.

title: Talking Broadway With Hamilton Star Lin-Manuel Miranda
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into news, features and opinion at The New York Times.

title: Canadian Philosopher Wins $1 Million Prize
description: The Canadian philosopher Charles Taylor has been named the winner of the first Berggruen Prize, which is to be awarded annually for a thinker whose ideas are of broad significance for shaping human self-understanding and the advancement of humanity.

title: Bill and Hillary Clintons Private Life in the Public Glare
description: To the Editor:

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: $12.25 MILLION

title: German Prosecutors Side With Satire, Not Turkish President
description: BERLIN  In the end, German prosecutors decided that a satirical poem was just that, an act of hyperbole in the name of art  not a criminal attempt to insult a foreign leader, President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey.

title: How Do You Say Email in Yiddish?
description: In a thousand-year-old language like Yiddish, with many of its words rooted in the ancient Bible, how would you say email? Or transgender? Or designated driver? Or binge watch?

title: Wallpaper Thats More Like a Painting
description: Cosmos from Sarkos is a wallpaper of uncommon beauty, with a hazy wash of watery blue or smoky charcoal blasted by a spray of gold-leaf points resembling stars in the night sky. There is no pattern repeat  the shimmering dots seem to cluster or spread out at random  and the texture is similar to a painting.

title: IBM Is Buying Consulting Firm for Its Washington Connections
description: What do you do if you are IBM, supposedly one of the most reliable of blue-chip companies, and you want to acquire another company that is, shall we say, a little more ethically and morally challenged? You convince everyone that the new acquisition will allow IBM to advance the practical applications of the supercomputer named Watson, its mysterious and envelope-pushing entry into the exploding world of artificial intelligence.

title: Union Boss (and Former Miss America) Hits the Road in Fun Home
description: Kate Shindle is compiling quite the rsum. Once she was Miss America. Now shes a labor leader, the president of Actors Equity. And this week she began playing the nations most famous lesbian cartoonist, Alison Bechdel, in the touring production of the Tony-winning Fun Home.

title: The Rise of the Bromosexual Friendship
description: A recent ad for the Bravo TV show Shahs of Sunset finds two of its male stars lazing on lounge chairs at the beach. Amid a scene of scantily clad sun worshipers, the best friends Reza Farahan and Mike Shouhed gaze at different objects of desire: Mr. Farahan at musclebound guys, Mr. Shouhed at voluptuous women.

title: A Confrontation With Charlotte Police
description: Two videos released by police and two by bystanders offer multiple perspectives on the shooting of Keith Lamont Scott, 43. They show how police surrounded Mr. Scott's car and the fast-moving events that led to his death. Here are the four videos synchronized.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: Review: Homeland: Iraq Year Zero Chronicles a War-Torn Family
description: Saddam Husseins regime in Iraq was despotic, oppressive, criminal and worse. Yet something that Westerners can recognize as ordinary life took place in certain sectors of Iraq during his rule. The Iraq-born filmmaker Abbas Fahdel, who has long resided in France, chronicles his own extended familys everyday life in Iraq in 2002 in the first half of his two-part film, Homeland: Iraq Year Zero, opening on Thursday. Shooting on video in his brothers home near Baghdad, he shows his niece and nephews watching television one morning; a piece of state propaganda referring to Hussein as Beloved Leader soon gives way to a Looney Tune cartoon featuring Foghorn Leghorn.

title: In a Range of Tastes, Books to Inspire Redecorating
description: As temperatures drop and Canada geese catch thermals, ones thoughts turn to redecorating for the indoor months ahead. This falls crop of home design books offers the usual inspiration and escapism.

title: George Barris, Photographer Who Captured the Last Images of Marilyn Monroe, Dies at 94
description: George Barris, who took the last professional photographs of Marilyn Monroe, just weeks before her death in 1962, died on Friday at his home in Thousand Oaks, Calif. He was 94.

title: Then and Now: Hollywood Remakes as Election-Year Players
description: Entertainments golden rule: Whatever worked once may work yet again. Most movie remakes are produced to make money. A few have an agenda.

title: A French Dancers Hip-Hop Moves Are Tested in New York
description: Anne Nguyen is a French b-girl and choreographer. In her home country, shes gained a reputation for rethinking the conventions of hip-hop dance and how the form might best be transferred from street to stage. Shes hardly the first choreographer to address these issues, but over the past two weeks, the Crossing the Line Festival offered New Yorkers their first chance to see what new ideas Ms. Nguyen might have  both on the street and on the stage.

title: Review: Nell Zinks Nicotine Is Hard to Put Down, Despite Its Unruly Plot
description: Nell Zinks surname, which seems to combine the words zing and sink, happens to be a nice distillation of her prose style. Shes a deadpan comedian, her sentences funny yet plump with existential dread. Her novels give you that zinking feeling.

title: New for Fall: Preppy Sweaters Gone Haywire, Custom Italian Loafers and More
description: Items from Gant, Raf Simons, Calvin Klein and others offer updates to your uniform this season.

title: We Know What Lipstick Youll Wear This Fall
description: Whats new for fall? For one thing, the colors are intense, subversive even. When it comes to lips, thats not exactly a surprise, for goth glam was the breakout look on the fall runways (see the black lips at Dior and Marc Jacobs or the matte merlot at Marni and Rodarte).

title: Tim Kaine, Mike Pence, Donald Trump: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: A Head-Shot Truck Comes to New York
description: On a recent afternoon in Hells Kitchen, a pink and orange Chevrolet Stepvan, pulled up to the curb. It looked suspiciously like a food truck peddling Miami-fusion tacos, but the only thing cooking inside was a generator, pumping power into a 12-foot photo studio in the back.

title: A Computer Guy of Interest to the F.B.I. Walks Into a Bar, in Siberia
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times. In this piece, The Timess Moscow correspondent, Andrew E. Kramer, follows a long trail of digital sleuthing into U.S. election-related cyber attacks to a 26-year-old snowboarder in an isolated Siberian town near Mongolia.

title: Fannie and Freddie Investors Win Round in Suit Against U.S.
description: The United States government improperly withheld documents from investors who were suing the government over its decision in 2012 to seize all of the profits of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, the mortgage finance giants, a federal judge has ruled.

title: Gomez Addams, Donald Trump and the Art of Failing
description: One of the towering characters of 1960s television comedy, Gomez Addams, the pencil-mustachioed patriarch of the Addams Family, had a certain genius for business.

title: Trinh Thi Ngo, Broadcaster Called Hanoi Hannah in Vietnam War, Dies
description: Trinh Thi Ngo, a soft-spoken radio announcer known as Hanoi Hannah who entertained American forces during the Vietnam War while trying to persuade them that the conflict was immoral, died on Friday in Ho Chi Minh City. She was believed to be 85.

title: Once Damaged Goods, Mets Josh Smoker Returns to the Top Shelf
description: This was three years ago, before Josh Smoker made his long-shot major league debut with the Mets this season, before he became a possibility for the teams bullpen in Wednesday nights wild-card game.

title: Google Introduces the Pixel, Its Own Smartphone
description: SAN FRANCISCO  For all the bells and whistles of Googles new smartphone, the biggest point of emphasis is tucked away in small type on the back of the device: Phone by Google.

title: After Another Giants Loss, the Talk Is All About Odell Beckham Jr.
description: For the second consecutive week, after a second straight Giants defeat, the emotional outbursts of wide receiver Odell Beckham Jr. dominated the conversation about what the Giants must do to get back on a winning track.

title: Xi Jinping May Delay Picking Chinas Next Leader, Stoking Speculation
description: BEIJING  The Chinese president, Xi Jinping, appears prepared to defy the Communist Partys established script for transferring power and delay the designation of his successor until after a party congress next year, unsettling the party elite and stirring speculation that he wants to prolong his tenure.

title: Post-Romance Cognac
description: Dear Diary:

title: Former A.I.G. Chief Denies He Knew of Payback Terms in Reinsurance Deal
description: Maurice R. Greenberg, a former chief executive of the insurance giant American International Group, said on Tuesday that he was not aware of certain repayment terms in a reinsurance deal that lies at the center of his civil accounting fraud trial.

title: Donald Trump Would Have Trouble Winning a Suit Over The Timess Tax Article
description: WASHINGTON  More than 20 years ago, a surreptitious recording of a cellphone conversation arrived at a Pennsylvania radio station. A federal law made it illegal to broadcast such recordings, but the radio station aired it anyway.

title: Colombia and Rebels Want Peace, but How Has Never Been Less Clear.
description: MEDELLN, Colombia  What comes next has never been so unclear.

title: Obama Hails Enforcement on Trade Deals to Win Support for T.P.P.
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration has used a flurry of tough-sounding trade enforcement announcements in recent weeks to counter complaints from the left and right that free trade is not fair trade  and to assist President Obama in the struggle to win approval of his trade pact with 11 Pacific Rim nations.

title: As Baseball Playoffs Begin, an Issue That Has Not Left the Park
description: TORONTO  The postseason began here on Tuesday with two fitting representatives of baseball in 2016. The Baltimore Orioles led the majors in home runs. The Toronto Blue Jays ranked second in homers among playoff teams. Each team had six players with 20 or more homers.

title: Sharapovas Case Shows How Unforced Errors Hurt Cleanup Efforts
description: With her doping suspension reduced  to 15 months, from two years, Maria Sharapova and her legal team sounded triumphant on Tuesday.

title: Syndergaard Is Mets Logical Choice to Face Giants and Bumgarner
description: The Mets season-opening rotation had Noah Syndergaard slotted in between Matt Harvey and Jacob deGrom. Steven Matz, and eventually, Zack Wheeler would be the two other starters, making for what many figured to be the most imposing group of pitchers in baseball.

title: An Evolving Episcopal Church Invites Back a Controversial Sculpture
description: Edwina Sandys had seen this before: the 250-pound bronze statue of a bare-breasted woman on a translucent acrylic cross being installed in the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Who said that the battle of ideas would be easy? Lets keep dreaming.

title: Donald Trump as Role Model? G.O.P. Senator Absolutely Has Second Thoughts
description: WASHINGTON  When you are a United States senator running for re-election who has to apologize for saying your nominee for president is a role model for children, things may be going subpar for you.

title: Kaine and Pences Debate: Analysis
description: We analyzed the only vice-presidential debate between Tim Kaine and Mike Pence in real time.

title: U.S. Election Cycle Offers Kremlin a Window of Opportunity in Syria
description: WASHINGTON  Russia is using the waning days of the Obama administration to strengthen President Bashar al-Assads hold on power, expand the territory he controls in Syria and constrain the options of the next American president in responding to the civil war, according to a number of American officials and Russian analysts.

title: Fact Checks of the Vice-Presidential Debate
description: Reporters for The New York Times fact-checked the statements made by Senator Tim Kaine and Gov. Mike Pence during Tuesdays vice-presidential debate.

title: President Duterte, the Wild Card in U.S.-Filipino Relations
description: Hardly a day goes by that President Rodrigo Duterte fails to come up with some new way to poison the relationship between the Philippines and the United States.

title: Messaging With Mondale: Real-Time Reactions From an Ex-Vice President
description: Joining us live during tonights debate was Walter F. Mondale, the 42nd vice president of the United States: Mr. Mondale chatted with us via emails sent from his home in Minneapolis, sharing his thoughts. (Check out how we covered the debate in real time:  analysis, highlights and fact checks.)

title: The Vice Presidential Debate
description: Tonight saw a proxy war between Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton, fought by Mike Pence and Tim Kaine. Heres my take on the debate, not as a formal article but simply fact-checking and commentary in the form of play-by-play tweets as the battle unfolds.

title: Classic Root Beer
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  For the longest time while solving Michael Deweys Wednesday crossword, I thought we were supposed to be cooing the word AW, as in Isnt that cute?

title: Joshua Wong, Hong Kong Democracy Leader, Is Detained at Bangkok Airport
description: HONG KONG  Joshua Wong, who was a prominent leader of the 2014 pro-democracy rallies in Hong Kong, was detained at the international airport in Bangkok early Wednesday while trying to enter Thailand, he said after being put on a plane and flown back home.

title: Joseph Verner Reed Jr., 78, Dies; Envoy Became White House Chief of Protocol
description: Joseph Verner Reed Jr., who was under secretary for four secretaries general of the United Nations and, as chief of protocol under President George Bush, presided over one of the more colorful diplomatic gaffes in recent history, died on Thursday in Greenwich, Conn. He was 78.

title: Jack Kirrane, Captain of U.S. Gold Medal Hockey Team in 1960, Dies at 86
description: Jack Kirrane, who was the youngest player on the United States Olympic mens hockey team in 1948 and, 12 years later, the teams oldest member and captain when it captured Americas first gold medal in that sport, died on Sept. 26 in Quincy, Mass. He was 86.

title: Video May Contradict Ex-ISIS Members Claim on Rejecting Violence
description: A previously unreleased video clip brought to light in a news report on Tuesday raised questions about the claim by a former Islamic State member that he had refused to kill while with the group in Syria.

title: Pence and Kaine in Vice-Presidential Debate
description: Gov. Mike Pence of Indiana and Senator Tim Kaine of Virginia scrambled to defend the policies of their running mates in their only debate at Longwood University in Farmville, Va. The Times reporter Michael D. Shear weighs in on their defensive maneuvers.

title: Tim Kaine and Mike Pence Clash Sharply Over Their Running Mates
description: FARMVILLE, Va.  Senator Tim Kaine and Gov. Mike Pence repeatedly threw each other on the defensive over their running mates policies and character at the vice-presidential debate on Tuesday night, with Mr. Pence making little effort to directly rebut the near-constant attacks on Donald J. Trumps fitness for the presidency.

title: Mike Pences Galling Amnesia
description: Back when Mike Pence hosted a talk radio show in the 1990s, he described himself as Rush Limbaugh on decaf.

title: Edwin Encarnacions Homer Lifts Blue Jays Past Orioles in A.L. Wild-Card Game
description: TORONTO  The ball left the bat with a thunderclap, one that reverberated all through a nation. Edwin Encarnacion won the American League wild-card game for the Toronto Blue Jays on Tuesday with one mighty swing.

title: Potential Jurors Face Questions in Derrick Rose Rape Suit
description: Derrick Roses rape trial got underway in a Los Angeles courtroom Tuesday, and he was halfway across the country saying he planned to win the lawsuit.

title: A French Underground Railroad, Moving African Migrants
description: BREIL-SUR-ROYA, France  On a recent sunny Sunday, about a dozen young men, women and children sat around a wooden table belonging to Cdric Herrou, a 37-year-old farmer, laughing about who would cook that night. It could have been any family-like gathering in the pastoral setting high in the French Alps, just above the border with Italy. But it was not.

title: Hanoi Hannah Radio Broadcast
description: Trinh Thi Ngo, who broadcast in English, was a propaganda weapon for North Vietnam as it battled the United States.

title: Prepaid Debit Cards Users Will Get New Federal Protections
description: Prepaid debit cards are a financial lifeline for many people, but a risky one. They lack many of the basic consumer protections that credit cards and bank debit cards are required to offer. That will change next year, with a raft of new federal rules intended to clamp down on a product that has been growing rapidly despite concerns about high fees, poor disclosures and weak protections for customers when something goes wrong.

title: Mike Pences Defense Strategy: Dodge and Deflect Donald Trumps Words
description: Mike Pence defended Donald J. Trump by scarcely defending him at all.

title: Mike Pences Fantasy Running Mate
description: Weve seen presidential candidates in the past try to defend an unlikely choice of running mate. But weve never before seen a vice-presidential candidate try to defend a bizarre choice of nominee.

title: Corrections: October 5, 2016
description: BUSINESS DAY

title: Whats on TV Wednesday: Frequency and Designated Survivor
description: A detective tinkers with the course of history when she starts communicating with her father  who is 20 years in the past  in Frequency. Kiefer Sutherland continues to settle into his new gig as commander in chief in Designated Survivor. And Breakfast at Tiffanys lands on Netflix.

title: Paris Fashion Week, Day 9: At the Finish Line
description: This is it. Its the last day of Paris Fashion Week, and the last day of fashion month, at least as its generally understood in shorthand (New York, London, Milan and Paris, though there are many, many others). For those who have done the full circuit, dragging multiple suitcases across Europe and the United States, its the end of an exhaustive tour. Heres what theyll see on the final day.

title: Transcript of the 2016 Debate Between the Running Mates
description: Following is a transcript of the vice-presidential debate on Tuesday, as transcribed by the Federal News Service.

title: Who Won the Debate? Commentators Give Edge to Mike Pence
description: Senator Tim Kaine of Virginia on Tuesday repeatedly provoked Gov. Mike Pence of Indiana with criticism of his running mate, Donald J. Trump, trying to make him answer for some of Mr. Trumps more provocative comments and contentious proposals as the men faced off in the sole vice-presidential debate.

title: Word + Quiz: alias
description: alias \-l-s, l-ys\ noun and adverb

title: Fact Check: The Vice-Presidential Debate
description: Senator Tim Kaine and Gov. Mike Pence defended the policies of their running mates in the only vice-presidential debate of the election season. They debated the Iran nuclear deal, Donald J. Trumps tax plan and President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia.

title: Debate Takeaways: Tim Kaine Presses Mike Pence on Russia, but Not Gay Rights
description: The debate on Tuesday between Senator Tim Kaine of Virginia and Gov. Mike Pence of Indiana was sloppy, contentious and unlikely to reshape the course of presidential history. What was supposed to be the nice-guy tte--tte was instead a snippy, tit-for-tat exchange in the key of conventional politics. Here are some of our top takeaways from the evening:

title: A Man Killed Five Amish Girls. Now, His Brother Is Photographing Their Community.
description: Almost 10 years after his brother killed five Amish schoolgirls, Zachary Tyler Roberts returned to Pennsylvania to explore how families and communities forgive and move forward.

title: Sompo of Japan Buying Endurance, a Specialty Insurer
description: TOKYO  Another Japanese insurer has made a multibillion-dollar overseas deal to protect itself from the financial pitfalls of an aging domestic population.

title: As China Strikes Deals, U.S. Considers Expanding Foreign Reviews
description: BEIJING  An American government auditing agency will look at whether the United States should broaden its reviews of foreign investments and purchases in important areas of the economy.

title: The Countdown Clock on Brexit
description: The British prime ministers announcement on Sunday that Britain will begin formal negotiations on withdrawing from the European Union by the end of March effectively started a countdown that must end in the spring of 2019. The prompt plunge of the British currency to a 31-year low against the dollar provided a far louder response than the misguided cheers of her fellow Conservative Party members.

title: Lets Get Putins Attention
description: You may have missed this story, so I am repeating it as a public service:

title: How to Build a Democratic Majority That Lasts
description: The demographic revolution of the past 50 years has transformed the United States from a predominantly white country into a truly multiracial nation. People of color have grown to 38 percent of the population today from 12 percent in 1966, and that metamorphosis paved the path to electing the first African-American president.

title: A Trumpism of the Left
description: Donald Trumps post-debate ranting about Alicia Machado, the former Miss Universe elevated by Hillary Clinton as proof of Trumps misogyny, has been similar to his other meltdowns but distinctive in one particular way: Its the first time in this election that Trump has clashed with someone who actually resembles him.

title: The Movement to End Racist Voting Laws
description: This year, state laws will bar nearly six million Americans with criminal convictions from voting in the presidential election. About 4.4 million of those are people who are not in prison but are still denied the right to vote.

title: Can Colombia Overcome Fear to Achieve Peace?
description: Cartagena de Indias, Colombia  The president of Colombia, Juan Manuel Santos, reacted to his defeat in Sundays peace deal plebiscite by calling on all sides, and especially former President lvaro Uribe, to open a dialogue that eventually would lead back to the negotiating table.

title: A Disabled Life Is a Life Worth Living
description: In midsummer, I learned of the death of Laurie Hoirup, a prominent 60-year-old disability rights advocate in California. Laurie drowned in the Sacramento River after a July 4 celebration. She was well-loved and accomplished. Shed served as a chief deputy director of the State Council on Developmental Disabilities for five years and wrote books about living with a disability.

title: Little Safety in Honduras
description: To the Editor:

title: Ethics Panel Investigating de Blasios Nonprofit Is Said to Issue Broad Subpoena
description: A state ethics panel investigating Mayor Bill de Blasios political nonprofit organization has served a sweeping subpoena on City Hall seeking communications among the mayor, his aides, the nonprofit, its donors and consulting firms that worked for it, people with knowledge of the matter said.

title: After Buck Showalters Plan Fizzled, Questions: How? Why? Huh?
description: TORONTO  The moderator said there was time for one more question. The microphone was near me, so I asked for it. I had already asked Buck Showalter three questions, at the start of his postgame news conference late Tuesday night, without really getting an answer. I told him I was sorry to harp on it, and Showalter stopped me.

title: Glass Cliff, Not Just Ceiling, Often Impedes Women Rising in Politics
description: LONDON  When Theresa May became the prime minister of Britain in July, she appeared to be confirming a trend rather than establishing one. Northern Ireland is led by a woman. Scotlands first minister is a woman, and so are the main two Scottish opposition leaders. Even the populist U.K. Independence Party recently elected its first female leader, though her tenure was short.

title: Healing and Forgiveness After the Murder of Five Amish Girls
description: The post has been updated so the photographer could respond to reader questions regarding the Amish communitys aversion to being photographed.

title: Myanmar Repeals 1950 Law Long Used to Silence Dissidents
description: CHIANG MAI, Thailand  Myanmar has abolished a decades-old law that was used by past military regimes to jail thousands of dissidents, the latest move in the Southeast Asian countrys transition to democracy.

title: A Trip to Mars
description: Elon Musk is the billionaire founder of the SpaceX rocket company. For years, he has been talking about going to Mars. Now, he says has a plan for spacecraft that would take 100 passengers to the planet.

title: Why Did the Obamas Fail to Take On Corporate Agriculture?
description: Activists hoped President Obama would fight for stronger regulation. Eight years later, theyre still waiting.

title: The Dizzying Grandeur of 21st-Century Agriculture
description: From cranberry bogs to cattle feedlots, George Steinmetz captures the grand and disturbing nature of our expansive food system.

title: The Quest to Make a True Blue M&M
description: In an effort to remove artificial colors from their products, the Mars company is tinkering with the chemistry of some of Americas most beloved candies.

title: The Bitch in the House Has a Sequel: The Bitch Is Back
description: THE BITCH IS BACKOlder, Wiser, and (Getting) HappierEdited by Cathi Hanauer332 pp. William Morrow/HarperCollins Publishers. $26.99.

title: Can You Be Black and Republican?
description: BLACK REPUBLICANS AND THE TRANSFORMATION OF THE GOPBy Joshua D. FarringtonIllustrated. 311 pp. University of Pennsylvania Press. $45.

title: Is It Possible to Make a More Healthful Frozen Pizza?
description: And even if you could, would anyone want to eat it?

title: Little Birds That Carry Away Troubles
description: Family conflict? Financial stress? Heartache? Legal trouble? Health issues? Birds called pithis, sold on the streets of Senegal, are believed to carry away sins when set free.

title: In Senegal, Absolution Comes With a Wing and a Prayer
description: Forgiveness for sins often comes at a cost. But in Senegal, making your transgressions fly away can run you as little as 8 cents.

title: The Fight Over Transparency in the Meat Industry
description: Undercover watchdogs have touched off a battle for true openness in the factory farm system  and everyone is losing.

title: Living In East Harlem
description: Change is visible in East Harlem, where relatively low housing prices and a drop in crime have attracted new residents.

title: East Harlem: Bodegas, Botanicas and New Buildings
description: Like the Metro-North Railroad trains clack-clacking across the brownstone trestle on Park Avenue in East Harlem, the neighborhood seemed to be a place on the move on a recent afternoon.

title: How to be Mindful at a Stoplight
description: If we can learn how to appreciate stopping, a whole new world of driving opens up to us.  Michele McDonald, guiding teacher for Vipassana Hawaii and creator of the audio guide Awake at the Wheel: Mindful Driving.

title: Morning Agenda: Fights Over Fannie and Freddie, Gender Gaps, Trade Warnings
description: In the latest round of a long-running battle between the United States government and investors in Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, the investors have won.

title: Mike Pence, Tim Kaine, Toronto Blue Jays: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: A Single Concussion May Have Lasting Impact
description: A single concussion experienced by a child or teenager may have lasting repercussions on mental health and intellectual and physical functioning throughout adulthood, and multiple head injuries increase the risks of later problems, according to one of the largest, most elaborate studies to date of the impacts of head trauma on the young.

title: Why a South African Desert Blooms Into an Annual Flower Show
description: Its happened. Summer is over  in the top half of the world. But while the fiery colors of fall are beginning their descent upon the green leaves of Americas East Coast, a rainbow of spring flowers is blooming into a short-lived, colorful carpet for a South African desert. Superblooms can bring impressive palettes to deserts across the world, but few erupt as consistently or on schedule as the flower show in South Africas Namaqualand.

title: The Real Message in Ang Lees Latest? Its Just Good to Look At
description: In the action movies that Ang Lee grew up watching in Taiwan, it was perfectly commonplace and yet still thrilling to see rivals take to the air and fly at each other as they faced off in combat.

title: Trekking to the Toronto Suburbs for Excellent, Cheap Chinese Food
description: I was trudging through calf-high grass in an industrial zone just a couple of miles north of Torontos city limits. Having crossed through a car dealership, I sprinted across a highway and traversed a seemingly endless mall parking lot. There were now large swaths along the road where the sidewalk completely disappeared; construction was constant, and new buildings appeared to be popping up everywhere. I made a mental note to drive next time.

title: MailChimp and the Un-Silicon Valley Way to Make It as a Start-Up
description: ATLANTA  The typical start-up fairy tale goes something like this: You begin with young entrepreneurs from Stanford or Harvard who have come up with some novel idea for disrupting restaurants or dog walking or whatever else.

title: Beyond Kitsch in Skopje
description: From my hotel rooms balcony, Skopje, the capital of Macedonia, lay before me like a curiosity shop at the crossroads of antiquity and absurdity. Its shelves were crammed with symbols of long-gone epochs, genuine collectibles and dubious tchotchkes. An Eiffel Tower topped one building. A Statue of Liberty adorned a hotel. Beyond them, authentic monuments like the crenelated Kale Fortress, with sixth-century foundations, the minimalist Museum of Contemporary Art and the domed St. Clement of Ohrid Church crowded the vista.

title: New York Today: A Moment for the Mets
description: Good morning on this perfect fall Wednesday.

title: 3 Makers of Worlds Smallest Machines Awarded Nobel Prize in Chemistry
description: Three pioneers in the development of nanomachines, made of moving molecules, were awarded the Nobel Prize in Chemistry on Wednesday.

title: Paintings That Bear the Scars of War
description: LIGE, BELGIUM  A looted Matisse portrait of a woman in a blue dress with white frills is displayed not far from a black swastika and a life-size photo of Adolf Hitler in uniform, striding away from a hazy Eiffel Tower.

title: Questions for: Tim Kaine and Mike Pence Clash Sharply Over Their Running Mates
description: Article: Tim Kaine and Mike Pence Clash Sharply Over Their Running Mates

title: Italys Open Literary Secret
description: MILAN  We didnt have to wait for the latest revelations: Quite a few Italians already suspected that the pseudonymous author Elena Ferrante was indeed Anita Raja, a translator at Edizioni E/O, Ms. Ferrantes publisher. Rumors had already been swirling when, in February 2015, a gossip website called Dagospia (quite trashy, but usually well informed) wrote, Theres not a cat or dog that doesnt know that Ferrantes real name is Raja.

title: Louis Vuitton: Spring 2017
description: Spring 2017 looks by Nicolas Ghesquire.

title: When You Hear the Margin of Error Is Plus or Minus 3 Percent, Think 7 Instead
description: As anyone who follows election polling can tell you, when you survey 1,000 people, the margin of error is plus or minus three percentage points. This roughly means that 95 percent of the time, the survey estimate should be within three percentage points of the true answer.

title: Europe Makes Deal to Send Afghans Home, Where War Awaits Them
description: BRUSSELS  The European Union and Afghanistan announced a deal on Wednesday that would send tens of thousands of Afghan migrants who had reached Europe back home to an increasingly hazardous war zone.

title: Bangladesh Siege Recalled in Militants Words, and From Beyond the Grave
description: NEW DELHI  An Islamic State publication offered a detailed account of the bloody July 1 siege of a restaurant in Dhaka, the capital of Bangladesh, including the use of religious tests to distinguish Muslims from non-Muslims, who would then be killed.

title: Judge Substance, Not Style
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive more briefings and a guide to the section daily in your inbox.

description: As part of our Civil Conversation Challenge, we have opened student forums on some of the biggest issues dividing Americans this campaign season.

title: California Today: The Steep Costs of Fighting Wildfires
description: Good morning.

title: What the Chef Rick Bayless Cant Travel Without
description: When Rick Bayless, the chef, cookbook author and television star, hits the road, its most often to Mexico, the country whose cuisine has been the inspiration for his recipes and clutch of Chicago restaurants. His latest establishment, Frontera Cocina, opened in Disney Springs in Orlando, Fla., in June.

title: Syria Draws a Rare Source of Accord in Debate Between Kaine and Pence
description: WASHINGTON  With the humanitarian and refugee crisis in Syria spiraling to new depths, the Democratic and Republican vice-presidential candidates, in their debate on Tuesday, called for a more forceful American response to the civil war than President Obama has undertaken.

title: Moncler Gamme Rouge: Spring 2017
description: The labels spring 2017 collection.

title: 1966: TV Effects on Children
description: LOS ANGELES  The lethargic behaviour of children who watch television many hours every day could be due partly to radiation beams from the picture tube, an experimenter said here today [Oct. 5]. A Florida nature photographer, Dr. John N. Ott, who has spent 15 years studying the sometimes weird effects of visible and invisible light on plants and animals, reported on his experiments at the 100th meeting of the Society of Motion Picture and Television Engineers. In one experiment, Dr. Ott placed three-month-old rats directly in front of a color television set. Within ten days, he said, rats protected only by black paper showed abnormal activity, and by 30 days, were extremely lethargic.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Oct. 6, 1966

title: Could Officers Have Avoided Shooting Keith Scott? Experts Weigh In
description: A spate of killings by the police has put a renewed focus on de-escalation tactics developed to prevent some confrontations and keep others from ratcheting up to lethal force. A growing number of law enforcement agencies have endorsed the concept, but commitment to it varies widely by department, and even by officer.

title: White Schools vs. Black Hair in Post-Apartheid South Africa
description: JOHANNESBURG  I was too young  barely old enough to have had a full head of hair for two years  to remember the African National Congresss 1994 election campaign poster depicting a smiling, grandfatherly Nelson Mandela, surrounded by a group of children of all races. This picture of Tata Madiba, South Africans term of endearment for Mr. Mandela, was appropriate for the Rainbow Nation he was hoping to preside over. The mastermind behind the election effort was the Clinton presidential campaign consultant Stan Greenberg, who advised the A.N.C. to abandon its image as a liberation movement and adopt a new role as change agents.

title: What You Get for  $1,000,000
description: A log house in North Carolina, an old farmhouse in Virginia and a water view in Washington

title: $1 Million Homes in North Carolina, Virginia and Washington State
description: LAKE TOXAWAY, N.C.

title: Vice-Presidential Debate: How Do You Fact-Check a Headshake?
description: On Tuesday night, the vice-presidential nominees, Senator Tim Kaine and Gov. Mike Pence, held their only debate of the 2016 campaign, moderated by Elaine Quijano of CBS. Our chief television critic, James Poniewozik, and our media columnist, Jim Rutenberg, caught up with each other on Wednesday morning to discuss how the bottom-of-the-ticket debate played onscreen.

title: Art by Salvatore Scarpitta, From Vivid Paintings to Fast Cars
description: The American painter and sculptor Salvatore Scarpitta has always seemed like the lost man in the lineup of durably famous artists  Robert Rauschenberg, Jasper Johns, Cy Twombly, Frank Stella  championed by the legendary dealer Leo Castelli. Scarpitta, who was raised in Los Angeles and died in 2007, never quite took off as a postwar pioneer. But then again, he never pursued anything resembling a standard art career: He was an unconventional painter who became an untrained car manufacturer. Opening Oct. 14 at the Luxembourg & Dayan gallery, Salvatore Scarpitta 1956-1964 will trace his evolution, from his traumatized-looking paintings made with bandages and bulges to a turn in his sculpture toward the mid-1960s in which his automotive fascinations began to spawn racecars, a few of which actually worked (and were actually raced). (Through Dec. 23; 212-452-4646, luxembourgdayan.com.)

title: A Manor House Near a Forest Outside Warsaw
description: The house, just outside Kampinos National Park, is on the market for 8 million zlotys ($2,088,773).

title: House Hunting in ... Poland
description: A  MANOR HOUSE NEAR A FOREST IN A SUBURB OF WARSAW

title: A Museum About Rights, and a Legacy of Uncomfortable Canadian Truths
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba  The Canadian Museum for Human Rights offers many opportunities for contemplation. A glass display case holds the bloodstained salwar kameez worn by Malala Yousafzai, the activist for girls education in Pakistan, during an assassination attempt by the Taliban. Video testimonials from survivors of the genocides in Rwanda, Ukraine and Bosnia aim to teach tolerance.

title: Sarah Jessica Parker Returns to HBO With Divorce
description: Twelve years after the women of Sex and the City swilled their last cosmos, Sarah Jessica Parker is returning to HBO with a new series  one that might suggest her alter egos long-awaited I love you didnt work out quite as planned. But dont expect Carrie Bradshaw in the burbs. In Divorce, debuting at 10 p.m. on Sunday, Oct. 9, Ms. Parker plays Frances, an arty type turned corporate recruiter navigating marital purgatory in Westchester County with her husband, Robert (Thomas Haden Church), a flailing real-estate developer, and their two children. But when a friends 50th-birthday party turns amusingly violent, lifes niggling disappointments explode into vivid relief, and some serious navel-gazing ensues. The shows title pretty much sums it up as Frances and Robert deal with each others infidelities  hers physical, his emotional  and the flatlining of their union, and conclude that theyre better off apart. If only they could make a clean break. The discourse, achingly knowing and bracingly comical, will ring familiar to fans of Amazons Catastrophe and its gloriously sniping Sharon Horgan, this seriess creator.

title: Danish Dance Theater at the Joyce, With a Sci-Fi Look
description: Tim Rushtons Black Diamond begins with an explosion, filling the stage with silver confetti and the members of Danish Dance Theater  some masked and resembling science-fiction aliens, others wrapped in (and seeking to extricate themselves from) enveloping fabric. As the two-act piece proceeds, audiences may wonder if that big bang is one of apocalyptic destruction. Maybe. But maybe not. The human spirit may ultimately triumph, as dancers aspire toward a shining ball of light: the light of truth, perhaps?

title: St. Paul Chamber Orchestra Comes to New York
description: To inaugurate the St. Paul (Minn.) Chamber Orchestras new concert hall in 2015, the composer George Tsontakis wrote a piece titled Coraggio  courage in Italian. That quality was much in demand while the classical music scene in the Twin Cities weathered fiscal storms and labor strife. Now happily sailing in smoother waters, this excellent ensemble makes an overdue visit to New York at the 92nd Street Y.

title: Tidal Has Another Starry Charity Show Planned in Brooklyn
description: A music streaming service owned by Jay Z was never going to have a problem wrangling star power. Since its Avengers-like introductory news conference  Madonna! Jack White! Kanye! Daft Punk!  Tidal has staked its reputation on access to A-list acts, a muscle it is flexing again for its second annual charity concert on Saturday, Oct. 15, at Barclays Center. (Proceeds from ticket sales benefit education nonprofits.) Returning from last years event, which raised $1.5 million, are Beyonc, Nicki Minaj and T.I.; Alicia Keys and Lauryn Hill are also to perform. A more eclectic bunch of Tidal allies  the Latin pop singer Prince Royce, the singsong rapper Lil Yachty, the political indie-pop project Blood Orange  also fit under this big tent of artist activism, and may have more to prove. (tidal.com/us/1015.)

title: Who Is Buying What at Paris Fashion Week?
description: PARIS  For a sector that pretends to welcome change, fashion can be steadfastly resistant to it. So the collective appearance of four new designers at four big-name luxury houses in Paris this season  Anthony Vaccarello at Yves Saint Laurent, Bouchra Jarrar at Lanvin, Maria Grazia Chiuri at Christian Dior and Pierpaolo Piccioli, solo for the first time, at Valentino  had the potential to trigger a sizable creative and commercial ripple effect, especially among the front-row coterie of buyers from the worlds best-known luxury department stores, boutiques and e-commerce sites.

title: Its Rachel Weiszs Turn in Plenty at the Public Theater
description: When the drama Plenty was first produced in New York at The Public Theater in 1982, its British playwright David Hare had been active for over a decade but was known, if at all, in America as a plucky newcomer. The year before, Mel Gussow of The New York Times described him as part of a wave of young, politically righteous dramatists, and since then, Mr. Hare has grown into the role of liberal dramas minence grise. Plenty, a time-jumping drama, remains not only one of his finest and most popular plays but also one of the great modern vehicles for ambitious actresses. The four-time Tony nominee Kate Nelligan originated the role (an English secret agent, who worked for the French resistance, adjusting to a tepid postwar life), which has now been played by Meryl Streep and Cate Blanchett. Part of the fun of the new revival, once again at the Public, will be to see how Rachel Weisz follows in their footsteps. David Leveaux directs. (publictheater.org, 212-967-7555.)

title: Lord of the Flies and More From Peter Brook at BAMcinmatek
description: The revered theater director Peter Brook has made only a handful of films, but they include one cinematic classic: Lord of the Flies, his 1963 adaptation of William Goldings apocalyptic fable of British schoolboys on a desert island, and of how quickly a civilized veneer can crack into barbarism. Its the highlight of BAMcinmateks nine-day retrospective Peter Brook: Behind the Camera, starting Monday, Oct. 10.

title: The Best of European Street Style
description: Some of the best street style seen during Fashion Weeks in London, Milan and Paris.

title: The Situation With Street Style
description: How many light years ago was it that we first saw clusters of fashion week photographers kneeling to photograph somebodys shoe? That time now seems distant and quaint.

title: Samsung in Cross Hairs of American Hedge Fund
description: Last year, a big American hedge fund took aim at plans to revamp a part of Samsung, the South Korean giant that dominates many of its home countrys industries.

title: Half of Chinese Favorable Toward U.S., but Many See a Threat, a Survey Finds
description: BEIJING  With tensions between the United States and China on the rise over issues such as the South China Sea and cyberespionage, one might think the citizens of the two nations have an increasingly hostile view of the other.

description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during spring/summer 2017 fashion week in Paris.

description: Looks from the Louis Vuitton, Moncler Gamme Rouge and Miu Miu spring 2017 shows.

title: Renovating Fashions House
description: PARIS  The Paris shows began in a building site  Yves Saint Laurents new headquarters on the Rue de Bellechasse  and they ended in one too: Louis Vuittons new maison on the Place Vendme, due to open next July. At the moment it is five floors of raw concrete with floor-to-ceiling windows looking onto the square. Bernard Arnault, the chief executive of LVMH Mot Hennessy Louis Vuitton, was busy taking photos of the view with his iPhone.

title: That Mexican Thing Takes On Life After the Debate
description: In the grand digital tradition of American political debates, the audience tends to seize upon singular phrases or gestures that, at least for a few hours, seem to define the evenings discussion.

title: Theresa May, British Premier, Urges Conservatives to Claim New Center Ground
description: BIRMINGHAM, England  Prime Minister Theresa May of Britain capped the Conservative Partys convention on Wednesday by breaking with the domestic agenda of her predecessor, courting working-class voters and promising to use the power of government to rein in abuses by big business.

title: Transformative Juilliard President Will Step Down After Three Decades
description: One of the most influential offstage figures in the New York arts world is stepping down. Joseph W. Polisi, who transformed the Juilliard School during three decades as its president, announced on Wednesday that he plans to leave the post in June 2018.

title: Inside Fabrizio Vitis Doll Collection
description: The shoe designer opens up his Paris home  complete with a room to house his more than 600 dolls.

title: In Paris, the Shoe Designer Who Collects Dolls
description: Fabrizio Viti, the 50-year-old Italian who has designed Louis Vuittons womens shoes for a dozen years, shares his home with approximately 600 women. They are all dolls. You have your own little model, he says, toying with an original 1960s Barbie in the room devoted to housing his collection. And the agency doesnt call her back!

title: 1941: Freedom of Worship
description: Religious freedom as defined in the Soviet constitution and as practiced in Russia is in sharp contrast to the traditional right of free Americans, Dean Luther A. Weigle, of the Yale University Divinity School, said in a statement yesterday [Oct. 4]. The Soviet constitution does not guarantee the same freedom for religion that it guarantees for anti-religion. This means, then, that the right of propaganda is recognized for the forces that oppose religion but not for religion itself, which is robbed even of its proper means of defence.  New York Herald Tribune, Oct. 6, 1941

title: Miu Miu: Spring 2017
description: The labels spring 2017 collection.

title: 6 Recipes for Midweek
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: After Bucharest, a Ballet Power Couple Move On
description: The world of ballet is not without its moments of high drama, even beyond the stage lights. (The acid attack against the Bolshois artistic director Sergei Filin is just the most extreme example.) Often, its a case of jostling for power behind the scenes; sometimes nationalism, too, gets in the way. Both seem to be factors in recent events at the Bucharest National Opera ballet, where Alina Cojocaru and Johan Kobborg were unceremoniously pushed out in a messy and protracted brawl with the management of the opera.

title: Madison Bumgarner: Postseason King
description: While there is understandable excitement among Mets fans for their trip to the 2016 postseason, few of them can be excited about the Giants pitcher they have to face in their do-or-die game on Wednesday night: Madison Bumgarner.

title: Deutsche Bank Singled Out in I.M.F. Stability Warning
description: WASHINGTON  The International Monetary Fund did not bring up Deutsche Banks name when it warned in its financial stability report that cash-poor banks in Europe with outdated business models posed a threat to the financial system.

title: When Should the People's Voice Be Trusted?
Ask the Eye: Hurricane Matthew
description: John Schwartz, a New York Times reporter who covers climate change and the environment, is answering reader questions about the storm.

title: After Mike Pences Debate Showing, Donald Trump Takes Credit
description: Donald J. Trump hailed Mike Pences steady debate performance as a credit to his own judgment on Wednesday in a renewed attempt to allay voters concerns about his temperament and readiness for the presidency.

title: Vladimir Kagans Final Show
description: The furniture designer Vladimir Kagan never ran out of creative fuel, and he was still at work on new projects when he died in April at 88. Now, Carpenters Workshop Gallery is presenting three of his final designs at its Manhattan gallery. Named Annecy, after one of the designers granddaughters, the collection includes a wall-mounted console, a sofa and a coffee table that were produced by the gallerys workshop in France. We wanted him to express himself without the constraints of manufacturing cost, said Julien Lombrail, a founder of Carpenters Workshop Gallery. Theyre functional sculptures.

title: Different Dancing Sweets, and Richard Strauss, for Ratmanskys New Ballet
description: In recent years the choreographer Alexei Ratmansky has often delved into the past to create historically informed stagings of classical ballets.

title: Patriots Day Eases Into Promotion With Solemn Tone
description: LOS ANGELES  Trailers for high-profile movies usually arrive with as much noise as studio marketers can manufacture.

title: N.S.A. Contractor Arrested in Possible New Theft of Secrets
description: WASHINGTON  The F.B.I. secretly arrested a former National Security Agency contractor in August and, according to law enforcement officials, is investigating whether he stole and disclosed highly classified computer code developed by the agency to hack into the networks of foreign governments.

title: Security Council Backs Antnio Guterres to Be Next U.N. Secretary General
description: UNITED NATIONS  The United Nations Security Council reached a surprisingly swift consensus Wednesday on its choice for the next secretary general of the United Nations: Antnio Guterres, a former prime minister of Portugal.

title: After You Strengthen Your Passwords, Heres How to Store Them
description: THE recent revelation that the account information of at least 500 million Yahoo users was stolen in 2014 was a big reminder that we all need to be smarter about our digital security. That includes our smartphones, which are increasingly the repositories for all sorts of information about our digital lives.

title: As Hurricane Matthew Nears U.S., Residents Get Warning: Prepare
description: Hurricane Matthew, a deadly storm with maximum sustained winds of more than 110 miles per hour, was forecast to start inflicting significant rain and wind damage in southern Florida beginning late Thursday, and in Georgia by late Friday, with the storm expected to strengthen to Category 4 from Category 3 as it approaches Florida. Coverage continues here >>

title: Pences That Mexican Thing Comment
description: During Tuesdays vice-presidential debate, Gov. Mike Pence told Senator Tim Kaine, Youve whipped out that Mexican thing again, referring to the Republican campaigns stance on immigration, causing uproar on social media.

title: What Is a Personal Benefit From Insider Trading? Justices Hear Arguments
description: WASHINGTON  Supreme Court justices offered hope to both prosecutors and traders on Wednesday during arguments in the first insider trading case to come before the nations high court in two decades.

title: The Tie? Leave Home Without It
description: Like much of Wall Street, executives at American Express have adopted a more relaxed dress code.

title: Panti Bliss, Irelands Queen of Drag, Expands Her Kingdom
description: Ireland became the first country in the world to legalize same-sex marriage by popular vote in 2015, thanks in part to the advocacy of a drag queen called Panti Bliss.

title: Daily Report: Google Would Like You to Meet Its Gadgets
description: We present to you Google, the Silicon Valley gadget company.

title: 15 Years Ago: The Times Establishes a Bureau in Kabul
description: In the aftermath of the American-led invasion of Afghanistan, I was sent to manage telecommunications and logistics for The Times  and I recorded what I saw with a small digital camera.

title: For Transgender Youths in New York, It Would Be a Health Care Milestone
description: ALBANY  The New York State Health Department has signaled that it intends to allow transgender youths to receive Medicaid coverage for hormones that forestall puberty, wiping away prohibitions that have been criticized by lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender groups.

title: Fashion Week Photo Diary: Chanel and Kenzo
description: Scenes from the spring/summer 2017 collections that were presented in Paris on Tuesday.

title: Fashion That Doesnt Let You Use Your Hands
description: Hands are out for spring/summer 2017. In fact, theyre not out, which is really my point. Theyre out of fashion, which means designers have largely concealed them inside a sleeve, the hem hanging anywhere between the third knuckle and several inches below the fingertips.

title: The Neighborhood Bookstores Unlikely Ally? The Internet
description: TRAVERSE CITY, Mich.  When Peter Makin opened Brilliant Books five years ago, he quickly realized his business wouldnt survive in this remote locale if his only customers were local buyers.

title: How to Get Kenzos All-Red Disco Beauty Look
description: For Kenzos spring/summer 2017 show, the designers Carol Lim and Humberto Leon channeled the illustrator Antonio Lopezs muses  Pat Cleveland, Grace Jones, Donna Jordan and Jerry Hall  in Studio 54. And the all-red makeup look followed suit, pulling inspiration from the 70s or 80s and making it modern, said the makeup artist Lynsey Alexander. Its definitely not retro.

title: Maria Sharapova Claims Victory and Goes on the Offensive
description: With her doping suspension reduced by an appeals court, Maria Sharapova will be allowed to return to professional tennis in time for next years French Open. The top officials for the sports global governing body are unlikely to be there cheering for her.

title: Whats the Longest Humans Can Live? 115 Years, New Study Says
description: On Aug. 4, 1997, Jeanne Calment passed away in a nursing home in France. The Reaper comes for us all, of course, but he was in no hurry for Mrs. Calment. She died at age 122, setting a record for human longevity.

title: How to Get That Elevated Tracksuit Look
description: The sporty tracksuit look is peaking in a high-style way. (Read: This is not an athleisure trend.) Heres how to wear it.

title: Christine, a Pop Star Who Sings With Her Muscles
description: For Hlose Letissier, Christine is a disguise, a truth serum, a state of mind. The French pop singer-songwriter behind Christine and the Queens, Ms. Letissier created her alter ego as a way, as she recently explained, to feel good in my own skin.

title: Doing Good at Bloomingdales: Donald Robertson Signs Sweatshirts to Aid Breast Cancer Research.
description: On Saturday, kick off Breast Cancer Awareness Month with a Pure Yoga class ($10) at Bloomingdales 59th Street at 8:30 a.m., before the store opens. Then at noon, the illustrator Donald Robertson will be signing sweatshirts he designed for the stores October Pink campaign ($40), with $15 from each sale benefiting the Breast Cancer Research Foundation.  That same day, head to the #GiltLife House, the flash-sale sites pop-up experience, from 10 a.m. to 6 p.m., to enjoy culinary demonstrations by the James Beard Award-winning chef Chris Fischer and check out fall fashions, like a Marc Jacobs mini suede cross-body ($456), that are available to shop during October. At 4 Centre Market Place. Tickets ($5 for Gilt members) are available at gilt.com. On Sunday, from 11 a.m. to 2 p.m., Kit and Ace, will host a shopping event to celebrate the debut of Love Stories TV, an online platform for wedding videos. The sites founder, Rachel Jo Silver, will be on hand to help brides-to-be pick honeymoon travel pieces like an easy silk shirtdress ($248). At 255 Elizabeth Street.  Throughout October, Loeffler Randall is inviting customers to shop the showroom at its new SoHo headquarters, where youll find pretty fall bits like a flap bucket bag ($350) and silver tassel oxfords ($395). At 588 Broadway, Suite 1203. To book an appointment, visit www.LoefflerRandall.com.

title: Randi Malkin Steinbergers No Circus Photos
description: The photographers new book features the vivid tents that mark Los Angeles homes being gassed for termite infestations.

title: A Bizarre, Colorful California Rite of Passage, in Photos
description: In the 1960s, Ed Ruscha, the poet laureate of the weird contours of Los Angeles, began taking pictures of the citys gas stations, apartment complexes and parking lots  the mostly banal things one would encounter while going for a drive  and compiling them into inexpensively produced booklets. He eventually formed not only a taxonomy of Southern Californias architectural vernacular  but its languorous temperament, too, and the ways of living people (who rarely figured in the pictures) choose for themselves.

title: Federal Warning on Possible Florida Strike by Hurricane Matthew
description: Rick Knabb, director of the National Hurricane Center, warns Floridians that Hurricane Matthew could hit as a Category 4 storm late Thursday.

title: Sarah Jessica Parker, Molly Shannon and Jerry Seinfeld at HBOs Premiere of Divorce
description: The erstwhile Carrie Bradshaw celebrates her new show: a dark comedy about middle-age suburbanites and their crumbling marriage.

title: On Epic Spawning Migration, Eels May Travel at Their Own Pace
description: Every year, when the autumn chill sets in, eels start to transform. Their skins thicken, donning a coat of mucus and changing from a muddied yellow to a gunmetal silver. Their stomachs shrivel and turn white. Their eyes expand, so they can see better in the dark. On moonless, stormy nights, when the rivers flow fast, they travel downstream until they reach the sea. Then, they disappear.

title: How Much Is It Worth to Hold Your Newborn? $40, Apparently
description: After holding his newborn son for the first time at a Utah hospital last month, a man found a strange charge on his bill: $39.35.

title: Lavish, Vintage-Inspired Emeralds
description: Captivating gems that give the green light.

title: Sarah Jessica Parker and Ta-Nehisi Coates, on New Literary Paths
description: Having conquered their respective fields, the actress Sarah Jessica Parker and the journalist Ta-Nehisi Coates are heading into the literary unknown.

title: Homeopathic Teething Gels May Pose Risks
description: Parents should throw away any homeopathic teething tablets and gels they may be using, since they may pose a risk to infants and children, the Food and Drug Administration is warning.

title: Ava DuVernay on Modern Slavery in America
description: Ava DuVernays new documentary, 13th, opened the New York Film Festival last week with a thunderclap, relating the damning story of how, in the age of mass incarceration, prisons have largely become plantations, disproportionately warehousing and exploiting African-American men. The title of the film, which reaches theaters and Netflix on Friday, refers to the 13th Amendment to the Constitution abolishing slavery except as punishment for a crime, a crucial loophole that, in Ms. DuVernays forceful telling, has been used for political gain and profit.

title: F.B.I. Criminal Complaint Against Harold Martin, N.S.A. Contractor
description: The F.B.I. secretly arrested Harold T. Martin III, an N.S.A. contractor, and is investigating whether he stole and disclosed highly classified information.

description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times.

title: An Alarming 10% Rise in Traffic Deaths in the First Half of 2016
description: Traffic deaths in the United States rose 10.4 percent in the first half of this year compared with the same period in 2015, maintaining a steady climb.

title: And the Winner Is ? Using Statistics to Predict the 2016 Presidential Election
description: Overview

title: Blue Origin, Jeff Bezos Rocket Company, Passes an In-Flight Escape Test
description: Blue Origin, the rocket company started by Jeffrey P. Bezos, the billionaire chief executive of Amazon, successfully separated a crew capsule from a rocket after it had lifted off on Wednesday, an important step toward Blue Origins goal of carrying tourists into space.

title: The Editorialists Have Spoken; Will Voters Listen?
description: The Atlantic magazine has made only two presidential endorsements in its 159-year history: one for Abraham Lincoln in 1860 and one for Lyndon B. Johnson in 1964.

title: Gilbert Cruz: How The Times Covers Television
description: Welcome to Times Insider Events  live programming for Times Insiders and their guests.

title: To Enhance Scoring, N.H.L. Looks to Shrink the Goalie
description: BUFFALO  At 6 feet 5 inches and 235 pounds, Buffalo Sabres goaltender Robin Lehner is big even by N.H.L. standards, able to block much of the net by using his bulk.

title: Hashtags, Polls and Putin: Aftermath of the Vice-Presidential Debate
description: The vice-presidential debate may be in the books, but the post-debate spin goes on.

title: Rocket Test: A Step Toward Space Tourism
description: Blue Origin, a rocket company owned by Amazons Jeff Bezos, successfully launched and landed a capsule and booster, putting the company closer to its goal of carrying tourists into space.

title: A Call for Difficult Conversations, Not Censorship
description: To the Editor:

title: Elliotts Demands on Samsung Might Have Staying Power
description: The hedge fund Elliott Managements attack on Samsung Electronics of South Korea may have staying power. Elliott wants the Samsung to restructure, pay a $27 billion special dividend, pledge to return at least 75 percent of free cash flow to investors and agree to appoint some independent directors.

title: Yahoo Said to Have Aided U.S. Email Surveillance by Adapting Spam Filter
description: A system intended to scan emails for child pornography and spam helped Yahoo satisfy a secret court order requiring it to search for messages containing a computer signature tied to the communications of a state-sponsored terrorist organization, several people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

title: Review: In The Girl on the Train, a Boozy Emily Blunt Never Winks
description: The Girl on the Train is a preposterous movie but not an unenjoyable one. If that sounds like faint praise, well, it is and it isnt. Theres always something to be said for an entertainment that sustains its nuttiness all the way to its twisty finish. This one may not make much sense, but  like a demented old film noir or a Shonda Rhimes show at its crazed best  Girl doesnt falter in its absurdity or commitment to its own seriousness. It never winks. You may laugh (as the audience I saw it with did, on and off), but theres genuine pleasure in that mirth.

title: In Visceral Ads for Hillary Clinton, Donald Trump Does All the Talking
description: The ads are stark: Adolescent girls assessing themselves before a mirror or a cellphone camera, stroking their hair, straightening their clothes and seeking personal reassurance about their appearance. The strained self-assessment is then met with a jarring interruption.

title: Kate Middletons Tour of Canada: A Designer Scorecard
description: The masses have long been intrigued by royals fashion choices, and the royals, in turn, have used their sartorial presentation to establish and manage their reputations in the public eye. In a letter to one of her sons, Queen Victoria, whom a historian once called the first media monarch, wrote that what you wear gives the one outward sign from which people in general can and often do judge upon the inward state of mind and feeling of a person; for this they all see, while the other they cannot.

title: The Modern Love Podcast: Dash Mihok Reads A Path to Fatherhood, With (Shared) Morning Sickness
description: In this episode of Modern Love: The Podcast, the actor Dash Mihok (Ray Donovan, I Am Legend) reads the essay A Path to Fatherhood, With (Shared) Morning Sickness, about a man whose wife conceives just before he begins chemotherapy for metastatic cancer.

title: From Ralph Nader: Dont Blame Third Parties
description: To the Editor:

title: How Did the Running Mates Do?
description: To the Editor:

title: Threes a Trend: The Return of the Power Suit
description: Suits with big shoulders, a staple of the 80s career womans wardrobe, made a comeback this season. The trend first came on strong at the Jil Sander show in Milan, where Rodolfo Paglialunga added extra-large shoulder pads to almost every look. Over in Paris, Clines classic three-button suit, in a neutral taupe, was tailored for the perfect oversize fit. And Balenciaga  where Demna Gvasalia played with boxy silhouettes last season, too  showed an army of oversize shoulders, too, as in this pinstriped skirt suit paired with a bright pink shirt.

title: The Surprising Defeat of Colombias Peace Plan
description: To the Editor:

title: Review: LItaliana in Algeri, a Comedy With Coloratura and Pasta
description: There came a point during Tuesdays performance of Rossinis LItaliana in Algeri at the Metropolitan Opera when I vowed I would stop laughing at the sophomoric spectacle in front of me.

title: Southwest Flight Evacuated After Samsung Phone Catches Fire, Airline Says
description: A Southwest Airlines flight scheduled to leave Louisville, Ky., on Wednesday morning was evacuated on the runway after a passengers Samsung cellphone caught fire, passengers and the airline said.

title: Recognizing Boarding Schools Psychic Toll in China
description: BEIJING  The emotional disintegration of a 17-month-old boy named John as he sought and failed to find comfort from caregivers in a British boarding nursery, captured in a 1969 documentary film, deeply distressed the Chinese women at a seminar last week on early childhood separation.

title: Debate Segment on Race and Policing Leaves Activists Underwhelmed
description: For 10 minutes at their debate on Tuesday, the Republican and Democratic vice-presidential nominees argued about race and policing, offering their opinions on what might improve the relationship between police officers and members of minority groups across the country.

title: Developer That Cracked the Code on Modular Building Exits the Business
description: Five years after announcing that it had cracked the code on modular building technology and would open a factory in Brooklyn to construct modules, the developer Forest City Ratner is getting out of the prefab construction business.

title: Want to Help Pay for a Childs College? Grab a Gift Card
description: Parents are often reluctant to solicit gifts for their childrens college funds, even though they might prefer a gift of cash to another stuffed animal. But friends and relatives will soon have an option to contribute to a 529 saving account without being asked.

title: An Artists Eye to the Sky, Transformed at MoMA PS1
description: The three-year renovation of James Turrells beloved skyspace at MoMA PS1 might have tried even the patience of the Quakers who inspired it.

title: Review: When Reading Tana Frenchs Ingenious New Novel, Assume Nothing
description: Tana French, the superb Irish novelist who happens to write avidly about crime, used to link her books by having a minor character in one become the beleaguered protagonist of the next. Since the books all involved the Dublin Murder Squad, the beleaguered part came easily. But in her sixth novel, The Trespasser, she breaks that pattern to reunite the same pair of detectives who waded through The Secret Place, her fifth. That one took place at a swanky private school, a grating milieu where the girls teen language (Um, duh?) wasnt easy for the detectives, Antoinette Conway and Stephen Moran, to take.

title: Review: Revolution Radio Finds Green Day Still Unsatisfied
description: The state of the world is just too much for Green Day on Revolution Radio. Violence, war, death and lies loom everywhere; a glimmer of love or truth, or simply a respite, is the most the band can hope for, and its far from enough. But the tumult and desperation ignite the music on Revolution Radio. Its the groups first batch of new songs since Uno! Dos! Tr!, the three-disc surfeit of more straightforward tunes released in 2012. Those songs were built around snappy catchphrases and brisk, punky riffs. Green Days new ones arent so easily summed up, but they can roar through their contradictions.

title: Justices Seem Ready to Find Bias in Trial of Black Man on Texas Death Row
description: WASHINGTON  In a decidedly lopsided argument in a death penalty case at the Supreme Court on Wednesday, the only dispute among the justices was whether they should rule narrowly or broadly in favor of Duane Buck, a Texas death row inmate whose trial was marred by testimony that black men are more dangerous than others.

title: Review: Maria Hassabis Staged Might Have a Better Title as Runway
description: Its no coincidence that Plastic, one of Maria Hassabis most successful ventures in her mission to place bodies in extreme states of slowness, occurred not in a theater but at the Museum of Modern Art last winter. Somehow, by placing her dancers in a landscape of stationary art and normal people moving at a normal pace, her work gained greater intensity.

title: Can Women Be Trusted on Abortion? Two Men Weigh In
description: Well, that was painful. What with the cross talk, interruptions, insults, sneers and overly rehearsed zingers, the vice-presidential debate on Tuesday surely bewildered more voters than it enlightened. There was one area, though, in which both Senator Tim Kaine and Gov. Mike Pence were crystal-clear and decidedly different: abortion rights.

title: Stepping Over the Dead on a Migrant Boat
description: It began with blips on a radar screen, 12 miles off the Libyan coast. As the rescuers approached, they found overloaded wooden vessels and rafts that evoked scenes of the slave trade.

title: New York Film Festival: Determined Women and Uncertainty in the World
description: As you watch television news reports of the European migrant crisis, your eyes may glaze over at the sight of so much suffering packaged into brief segments on a small screen. But Gianfranco Rosis documentary Fire at Sea, a high point of the 2016 New York Film Festival, makes it real, life-size and viscerally unnerving.

title: Questions and Answers on Hurricane Matthew
description: John Schwartz, a New York Times reporter who covers climate change and the environment, is answering reader questions about the storm.
