John rode out his first hurricane, Carla, in his hometown, Galveston, Tex., at the age of 4. He has covered the aftermath of Katrina, as well as other storms for The Times.

title: Richard J. Schwartz, Who Expanded Jonathan Logans Dress Empire, Dies at 77
description: Richard J. Schwartz, who at 25 took over the dressmaker Jonathan Logan from his father and built it into an even more successful enterprise, died on Monday in Upper Nyack, N.Y. He was 77.

title: United States Criticizes Israel Over West Bank Settlement Plan
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration on Wednesday castigated the Israeli government for approving plans to create a new Jewish settlement on the West Bank, three weeks after it signed a lucrative military aid package with the United States and just as President Obama was traveling to Jerusalem for the funeral of Shimon Peres.

title: Mike Pence, N.S.A., Nobel Prize: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Vice-Presidential Debate Generates Fireworks, but Not Ratings
description: No Trump, no bump.

title: Allen Roses, Who Upset Common Wisdom on Cause of Alzheimers, Dies at 73
description: Allen Roses, a maverick researcher whose team of scientists identified two genes that put healthy people over 65 at higher risk for Alzheimers disease, died on Friday in New York. He was 73.

title: How Mom and Dad Met, With Ninjas
description: On a sunny Southern California day in the spring of 2015, a full house showed up to attend not a play, but a reading of a play: Vietgone by Qui Nguyen. It was the last day of the Pacific Playwrights Festival, hosted by the local South Coast Repertory theater. Vietgone was the final presentation, a two-and-a-half-hour piece about a complicated event: the Vietnam War.

title: Donald Trumps Slip in Polls Has G.O.P. Worried About Congress
description: Donald J. Trumps support has plunged across the swing-state map over the last 10 days, wiping out his political recovery from September and threatening to undo weeks of Republican gains in the battle for control of Congress.

title: Wild-Card Lineup Is Set for the Mets. Now Comes the Game.
description: The Mets tried to balance health and their opponent when they finalized their 25-man roster and starting lineup for Wednesdays National League wild-card game against the San Francisco Giants.

title: Marshall Islands Cant Sue the Worlds Nuclear Powers, U.N. Court Rules
description: PARIS  The United Nations highest court on Wednesday rejected a bid by the Marshall Islands to sue the worlds nuclear powers, saying the court did not have jurisdiction because there was no evidence of a legal dispute that it could adjudicate.

title: N.J. Transit Changes Rules for Trains Arriving at Hoboken Station
description: In the wake of the fatal train crash in Hoboken last week, New Jersey Transit ordered on Wednesday that a second crew member must stand watch as the engineer pulls a train into that busy terminal.

title: Were All a Little Biased, Even if We Dont Know It
description: One of the newest chew toys in the presidential campaign is implicit bias, a term Mike Pence repeatedly took exception to in the vice-presidential debate on Tuesday.

title: Sometimes It Pays to Sit
description: Dear Diary:

title: Phyllis Creore, Canteen Girl on Wartime Radio, Dies at 100
description: Sometimes Tokyo Rose was the best thing on the radio  if you were an American serviceman overseas during World War II. You put up with her demoralizing pro-Japanese propaganda to hear the popular music. But sometimes things were infinitely better. For 15 minutes on Fridays on the shortwave, there was Canteen Girl.

title: Rod Temperton, Who Wrote Thriller for Michael Jackson and Boogie Nights, Dies
description: Rod Temperton, who wrote the 1970s disco classic Boogie Nights and went on to compose some of Michael Jacksons biggest hits, including Rock With You and Thriller, died last week. His family gave his age as 66, though many sources indicate he was 68.

title: Gary Johnson Equates Syria Deaths Caused by Assad and West
description: Gary Johnson, the Libertarian Party presidential nominee, drew a parallel on Wednesday between the Syrian governments targeting of noncombatants in that nations civil war and the accidental bombing of civilians by United States-backed forces.

title: Ex-Ally of Christie Hews to Story as Bridge Case Testimony Ends
description: NEWARK  David Wildstein is a serial prankster and a manipulative liar. He once stole a United States senators jacket to make him squirm during a debate. He boasted, falsely, of suppressing votes by sending black and Democratic voters on a bus trip to Atlantic City.

title: Call Centers in India Posed as I.R.S. to Cheat U.S. Taxpayers, Authorities Say
description: NEW DELHI  The call centers outside Mumbai looked like many others that have sprung up across India in recent decades. But investigators say the hundreds of people who worked at the nine centers had an unusual assignment: posing as Internal Revenue Service officers and demanding money from American taxpayers.

title: Bigger Museum Will Give Lady Libertys Crowds More to Do Than Snap Selfies
description: It is time for a backyard construction project on an island with a resident population of one and a transient population of 4.3 million.

title: New York State to Eliminate Cash Option for Paying Tolls
description: For motorists in New York, the only things that may rival death and taxes as certainties are traffic and tolls  the latter of which, for the better part of the last 80 years, have been collected by hand.

title: Israel Halts Yacht Trying to Break Its Blockade of Gaza Strip
description: JERUSALEM  Their chances of reaching the shores of Gaza were never high: Thirteen women on a yacht hoping to breach the years-old sea blockade of the Hamas-run Palestinian coastal territory enforced by the Israeli Navy.

title: With Youth in Place, the Yankees Look Ahead
description: On the day the Mets made a second straight playoff appearance, Yankees General Manager Brian Cashman voiced optimism about the future of a franchise that has appeared in one postseason game in four years.

title: Dusty Baker Is Tied to His Opponents, but Backing Down From None of Them
description: WASHINGTON  Dusty Baker had an out-of-town baseball friend in his office at Nationals Park last week. It happens a lot around here.

title: Oil Glut? Here Comes Some More!
description: HOUSTON  Global oil markets are flooded with cheap crude, and concerns about climate change are growing louder. The last thing the world seems to be craving is the discovery of new large oil and natural gas fields.

title: A New Voice for a Complicated World
description: By any measure, Antnio Guterres of Portugal is an excellent choice to replace Ban Ki-moon of South Korea as the next United Nations secretary general. He has experience, energy and diplomatic finesse, all of which hell need to lead the United Nations as it confronts regional wars, rising tensions between Russia and the West, Chinas aggressive posture in Asia and the refugee crisis in the Middle East and Europe.

title: Sarah Jessica Parker, Molly Shannon and Jerry Seinfeld at HBOs Premiere of Divorce
description: There was Sarah Jessica Parker (Sex and the City) huddling with Matthew Broderick (Election), as guests tucked into plates of pumpkin agnolotti by Mario Batali (Babbo) and bantered about the latest Clinton White House run.

title: A Sad Case Suspect, Scared Pale as Police Swarmed His House in N.S.A. Case
description: GLEN BURNIE, Md.  Until the day the F.B.I. showed up, Harold T. Martin III seemed to be a familiar type in the sprawling Maryland suburbs where the employees and contractors of Americas largest intelligence agency make their home.

title: Knicks Derrick Rose Expected in Court as Civil Trial in Rape Case Begins
description: LOS ANGELES  Derrick Rose is expected to belatedly join a federal civil trial Thursday, two days after his first exhibition game as a Knick, that will assess whether he and two friends raped his former girlfriend.

title: Both Sides of a Fashion Eccentric
description: JON CARAMANICA When we found out that Rick Owens was opening a new store, it seemed like the opportunity for a Critical Shopper first: tag-team shopping.

title: A.I.G. Ex-Chief Maintains He Knew of Nothing Improper in Sham Deal
description: A lawyer for New York State finished questioning Maurice R. Greenberg, the former chief executive of the insurance giant American International Group, without cracking his insistence that he did not know of anything improper in the transactions at the heart of his civil accounting fraud trial.

title: What I Saw at Paris Fashion Week
description: On the final, frantic leg of a tour that begins in New York and caravans through London and Milan before arriving in Paris, here is what stood out.

title: Twitters Fate: Marc Benioff of Salesforce Addresses Acquisition Talk
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Marc Benioff, the founder and chief executive of Salesforce.com, showed up onstage on Wednesday afternoon at his biggest customer event of the year to talk up his business technology companys products and strategy.

title: Kava Gorna Photographs the Denim-Clad Bottoms of It Girls
description: Age 37

title: Hurricane Matthew: Photos of the Destruction in Haiti
description: Hurricane Matthew killed at least 25 people on its destructive path through Hispaniola, the Caribbean island that Haiti shares with the Dominican Republic, according to Reuters, but the authorities are just beginning efforts to assess the full scale of the damage.

title: Neither Large Nor Small
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  We discuss todays puzzle below, but first I want to point out the fact that, as a column and a community, we lack an anthem. Your mileage may vary, but I think its an important point; all nations have one, and while those who solve The New York Times Crossword are not exactly a nation, we are a community. And to me, that means we should have a song.

title: Review: The Roads to Home Offers Gossip and Insanity Most Genteel
description: For the women in Horton Footes The Roads to Home, which opened on Wednesday night at the Cherry Lane Theater, talking is close kin to breathing, and almost as essential to their survival. The three female characters in this plaintive, meandering trilogy of short plays are all displaced persons of a sort, uprooted from the Texas or Louisiana towns where they grew up and where they still live in their thoughts.

title: Empire Season 3, Episode 3: Carry On, My Wayward Son
description: Shes the character formerly known as Boo-Boo Kitty and currently (reluctantly) referred to as Mrs. Lucious Lyon, but whatever you call her, Anika uttered two of the best lines of the night in this weeks Empire. Feuding with Lucious over what is effectively her house arrest in his mansion, Anika warns the Lyon king not to mess with her anymore. When you push me, she says, I push back harder.

title: Why the Word Fianc Is Falling Out of Fashion
description: The day after my wedding, I turned to my partner of many years and, for the first time, called him husband. I was thrilled.

title: Theranos to Close Labs and Lay Off 340 Workers
description: Theranos, the embattled blood-testing company, announced on Wednesday that it would close its laboratory operations, shutter its wellness centers and lay off about 340 employees, around 40 percent of its work force.

title: A List of Missed Chances, but Few Answers, in Fatal Abuse Case
description: The array of city officials seated with Mayor Bill de Blasio in the Blue Room of City Hall on Wednesday reflected the pinball nature of a boys short life of abuse, observed by police officers, school staff members and investigators at the Administration for Childrens Services.

title: Racial Bias Claim Looms Over Bronx School as Administrators Exit
description: So far, the turmoil at a public school in the Bronx has cost two principals and a district superintendent their jobs, has sparked a lawsuit and has a local assemblyman defending himself against claims that he is trying to keep minority children out of the school. And its not over yet.

title: A New Bronze Age for Wristwatches
description: In an effort to stay au courant in the 21st century, watchmakers have been turning more and more to high-tech materials that seem borrowed from NASA: carbon fiber (the IWC Ingenieur Carbon Performance Ceramic), ultralight polymer (the Breitling Avenger Hurricane), ceramic (the Bell & Ross BR 03-92 Heritage Ceramic), even synthetic sapphire (the Hublot Big Bang Unico Sapphire).

title: Designated Survivor Season 1, Episode 3: The Two Shows
description: When you get promoted, everything moves faster. You deal with new responsibilities and unfamiliar systems. Youre forced to make harder decisions on a shorter timetable.

title: Madison Bumgarner and One Big Blast Leave the Mets Blanked and Blue
description: Baseball can be so cruel. The Mets injected hope into New York with a spirited sprint to the playoffs, posting the best record in baseball during a six-week stretch and overcoming injuries that could have crippled their season. The Mets then escaped trouble so many times in Wednesdays win-or-go-home National League wild-card game against the San Francisco Giants that they appeared capable of conquering the October legend Madison Bumgarner.

title: Building a Good Anthropocene From the Bottom Up
description: Over the last few years, Ive gotten to know a determined cast of characters in academia aiming to identify paths toa good Anthropocene  Anthropocenebeing the closest thing there is to common shorthand for this span of human-dominated planetary history unfolding around us.

title: Corrections: October 6, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: The Giants Rely on a Familiar Formula, and a Great Equalizer
description: These are the San Francisco Giants. This is what they do. You were expecting something else?

title: As Drug Deaths Soar, a Silver Lining for Transplant Patients
description: BOSTON  The surge in deaths from drug overdoses has become an unexpected lifeline for people waiting for organ transplants, turning tragedy for some into salvation for others.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: If youre facing death and someone is throwing you a potential life preserver, the less interested you are in who made the life preserver and where it came from.

title: Why 10% of Florida Adults Cant Vote: How Felony Convictions Affect Access to the Ballot
description: A new report estimates that millions of Americans will be barred from voting in November because of felony convictions.

title: Whats on TV Thursday: Roman Polanskis The Ghost Writer and Gustavo Dudamel
description: How do you get to Carnegie Hall? Thursday night, by reclining on the couch as Gustavo Dudamel conducts the season opener. Roman Polanski unveils the sinister side of British politics in The Ghost Writer. And watch a slithery Alan Rickman as a garden-loving Louis XIV in A Little Chaos.

title: Conor Gillaspies Winning Homer Culminated a Journey of Soul-Searching
description: Last fall, around this time of the season, Conor Gillaspie returned home to Wichita, Kan., after his eighth, and arguably his most trying, professional baseball season.

title: Opposing a Pipeline Near Sacred Sioux Sites
description: As the Standing Rock Sioux oppose a pipeline near their water and sacred lands, a camp has sprung up, complete with a school, a medical center and a radio station.

title: 2 Years After Mexican Students Vanished
description: The State Department quietly notified Congress last month that it had decided, after considerable deliberation, to certify that Mexico had made enough progress in upholding human rights to justify receiving its full security aid package of about $155 million.

title: The Supreme Court Revisits Insider Trading
description: Illegal insider trading goes on every day, and it is often difficult to detect and prosecute. But it is a fraud that harms public confidence in securities markets and unfairly disadvantages investors who are not privy to the confidential information. On Wednesday, the Supreme Court revisited this complex but important area of law for the first time in two decades.

title: I Am Very Afraid I Will Die Tonight
description: Our excuse for failing to respond to mass atrocities used to be that we didnt fully appreciate the horrors until it was too late. If only we had known, became one refrain, along with, Never again!

title: Global Trade War, Trump Edition
description: Lets take Donald Trumps trade policies at face value.

title: Dont Intervene in Syria
description: The cease-fire in Syria that the United States and Russia tortuously negotiated has, like the one before it, fallen apart.

title: Whos Sorry Now? The Country
description: I dont know about you, but Im totally exhausted by the publics obsession with the vice-presidential debate. Everywhere I go, people are babbling about Mike Pence and Tim Kaine! Who knew it would be so electric? The world cant stop talking about Veep Vitriol.

title: Word + Quiz: interpolate
description: interpolate \in-tr-p-lt\ verb

title: Opposing a Pipeline Near Sacred Sioux Sites
description: CANNONBALL, N.D.  The fake image of the Protest on the Pipeline  shared more than 350,000 times on Facebook within 24 hours  got it all wrong.

title: Questions for: The Neighborhood Bookstores Unlikely Ally? The Internet
description: Article: The Neighborhood Bookstores Unlikely Ally? The Internet

title: Election Engagement
Is It O.K. to Find Sexual Satisfaction Outside Your Marriage?
description: I am married and have three children with my husband. For the most part, our lives are happy. My husband and I have a good relationship and are active in our childrens lives. However, I am utterly unsatisfied sexually. I need a bit more than occasional vanilla sex to feel content in that area (nothing too crazy, mind you). When my husband and I first started dating some years ago, I gently brought this matter up to him a handful of times during the course of regular conversation. His answers to me seemed to imply that he was the type who took some time to warm up to new ideas. With this in mind, I moved forward with him, believing that eventually our sex life would become more adventurous. It hasnt. It has been seven years since we became a committed couple, and if anything, our sex has become more boring and certainly less frequent.

title: Letter of Recommendation: The Life of Marshall Hodgson
description: Viewed in the least charitable terms, academia is a small fraternity of ambitious backbiters engaged in the production of work so dense that only other members of the order can hope to understand it. But some scholars arrive on the scene bearing such a combination of intellect, urgency and charisma that their achievements resonate long after the Festschrift is printed and the memorial lecture empties out.

title: Judge John Hodgman Rules on Learning the Bagpipes
description: Liz writes: My fianc is interested in learning the bagpipes. He claims that you can make good money playing weddings, funerals and St. Patricks Days. He plays no other instruments, does not read music and has failed at taking up other pursuits. Should he be allowed to do this?

title: The Lower East Side, Minus Three Roommates
description: Five bedrooms, five roommates: That was the setup for Garrett Aries and Olivia Jung, both 25 and friends from the University of Michigan, class of 2013.

title: 36 Hours in Mumbai, India
description: Glamour hub, culinary capital, coastal metropolis: The teeming city of Mumbai has enough sights, glitter and art for everyone.

title: Review: In Nate Parkers The Birth of a Nation, Must-See and Wont-See Collide
description: Can going to a movie be a moral obligation? A political gesture? There are occasions when various interested parties  filmmakers, publicists and perhaps especially critics  would like you to think so. Buying a ticket can become a test of seriousness, of personal commitment to a position or a cause. Jerry Seinfelds sitcom mom would not rest until her son had fulfilled the duty to watch Schindlers List. (Oh, you have to go. You have to!) To make other plans would have been a filial, tribal and ethical betrayal, a lapse only a few steps removed from outright Holocaust denial.

title: Fantasy Football: Players to Start in Week 5
description: The Sablich brothers have provided award-winning fantasy football advice for The New York Times since 2010. See their weekly player rankings, and visit 5thDownFantasy.com for more fantasy analysis. You can also ask them questions through their Twitter account, @5thdownfantasy.

title: Trumps Deals: Hype and Reality
description: Donald J. Trump is a prolific, if controversial, businessman. Here, we examine some of his ventures to find out how they fared. (Pictured: Mr. Trump showing off his home furnishings collection in 2007.)

title: Donald Trumps Ventures Began With a Lot of Hype. Heres How They Turned Out.
description: When Donald J. Trump unveiled his new online travel booking venture, GoTrump.com, he said in a promotional video in 2006 that customers would love everything I put on this site. Theres nobody better, he added. Theres nobody even close!

title: Fight Big Soda
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive more briefings and a guide to the section daily in your inbox.

title: New York Burial Plots Will Now Allow Four-Legged Companions
description: Whenever it is that Shakeema Hutcherson, a dog walker in New York City, dies, she plans to be buried with her family  and that includes her angelic Yorkshire terrier-Chihuahua mix, Tinka, and her frequently demonic cat, Sweetie. Now, when Ms. Hutchersons time comes, Tinka and Sweetie will be allowed to rest in peace in her familys plot: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo recently signed a law allowing cemeteries for people to inter pets alongside their owners.

title: Annie Leibovitzs Work on Women Is Never Done
description: On a recent morning at her photography studio in Chelsea, Annie Leibovitz was affectionately discussing with her longtime friend Gloria Steinem a photo shoot they did together.

title: N.S.A., Migrant Crisis, San Francisco Giants: Your Thursday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Morning Agenda: Theranos Closes Labs, Twitter Chatter, Taking on Samsung
description: Not long ago, Theranos and its founder, Elizabeth Holmes, were stars of Silicon Valley.

title: Now Available on Airbnb: Frank Lloyd Wright
description: There are dozens of Frank Lloyd Wright houses across the country that fans of the architect can visit. There are a handful that can be rented.  There is only one where you can sleep overnight for $148, which includes a personal guided tour by the 90-year-old owner and breakfast in a Wright-designed great room.

title: Pro-Trump Group to Release Ads as Part of Major Swing State Effort
description: A political group connected to a prominent family of donors will begin airing ads criticizing Hillary Clinton and praising Donald J. Trump as the 2016 election enters its final weeks.

title: Fright Festivals and Other Chilling Reasons to Travel
description: Trick or treat? How about a trip instead?

title: New York Today: A City of Superheroes
description: Updated, 8:02 a.m.

title: Our Journey to the Blacksonian
description: The Smithsonians brand-new, long-gestating National Museum of African American History and Culture opened two weekends ago to enormous lines, a swell of starry, prominent Americans and a poignant speech by the president. We both visited in the first weeks and were overwhelmed by the magnitude of the space itself and the story that the museum  the Blacksonian, if you will (and, boy, will we!)  tells about the founding and development of this country.

title: Quiz: How Much Do You Know About Nobel Peace Prize Winners?
description: Test your knowledge from the last decade.

title: 1941: Nazis Drive Toward Moscow
description: LONDON  The German invaders of Russia have again shifted the direction of their main attack and now are hurling great forces of men and tanks supported by bombing planes into an all-out offensive toward Moscow, authoritative quarters at London said today [Oct. 6]. The Russians were said to be resisting strongly, but little official news was available here regarding the trend of the fighting.

title: Poland Steps Back From Stricter Anti-Abortion Law
description: WARSAW  After growing protests from Polish women and an embarrassing debate in the European Parliament, Polands governing party retreated Thursday from a proposed law that would have made virtually all abortions illegal.

title: Ikram Goldman Steps Up to the Mic at Paris Fashion Week
description: PARIS  There are many ways the front row tries to unwind at the end of Paris Fashion Week (massages, minibreaks and so on), but making a public singing debut with a 13-member orchestra in front of a 1,750-strong audience is not usually one of them.

title: How a Food Subsidy Program Pushed Junk Food Off the Table
description: Can people make healthier food choices without spending more money?

title: West Bank Settlers Prepare for Clash, With Israeli Government
description: AMONA OUTPOST, West Bank  Thousands of Israeli police officers stormed this hilltop settler outpost in the occupied West Bank to raze nine illegally built homes. Settlers and their supporters hurled cinder blocks at the officers, who charged on horseback and beat protesters with batons. The homes were torn down, but 300 people were injured and the emotional scars ran deep. Some later called it a pogrom.

title: Malaysian Court Frees Australians Who Stripped to Briefs at Grand Prix
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Nine Australians who were arrested in Malaysia last weekend after stripping down to briefs emblazoned with the Malaysian flag at a Formula One race were freed by a judge on Thursday after they apologized.

title: A Letter to the Doctors and Nurses Who Cared for My Wife
description: After his 34-year-old wife suffered a devastating asthma attack and later died, the Boston writer Peter DeMarco wrote the following letter to the intensive care unit staff of CHA Cambridge Hospital who cared for her and helped him cope.

title: H. W. Brands: By the Book
description: The historian and author, most recently, of The General vs. the President has a thing for Gore Vidal as an essayist, but his historical novels set my teeth on edge.

title: Your Surgeon Is Probably a Republican, Your Psychiatrist Probably a Democrat
description: We know that Americans are increasingly sorting themselves by political affiliation into  friendships, even into neighborhoods. Something similar seems to be happening with doctors and their various specialties.

title: More Asian-Americans Are Identifying as Democrats, Survey Finds
description: More than twice as many Asian-Americans now identify as Democrats than as Republicans, and they hold strongly unfavorable views of Donald J. Trump, a new national survey found, emphasizing the Republican Partys continued struggle to appeal to minority groups.

title: A Mets Season of Illogical Success Finally Comes to an End
description: The silence in Queens was tomblike. All night long, Citi Field had been caught between delirium and high anxiety. By the ninth and final inning, 44,747 fans had bounced and screamed and pleaded, and were now urging Jeurys Familia, their exuberant giant of a Mets closer, to extend their season another few days.

title: Protest Against Fox Correspondent Accused of Racism for Chinatown Interviews
description: Elected officials and activists staged a protest outside the Manhattan headquarters of Fox News on Thursday over a segment in which a correspondent conducted a series of mocking interviews of Asian-Americans in New York Citys Chinatown that critics said trafficked in stereotypes and veered into racism.

title: Myanmar Gives Tourist Who Pulled Plug on Buddhist Chants 3 Months in Prison
description: MANDALAY, Myanmar  A Dutch tourist who unplugged an amplifier that was broadcasting Buddhist chants, which he said disrupted his sleep, was sentenced to three months of hard labor in prison by a court here on Thursday.

title: The White House Rule: No Tax Returns, No Job
description: As ethics counsel to the current president and his predecessor, we scrutinized their tax returns before they were released every year. We also worked with our colleagues to review many tax returns of presidential nominees for cabinet and other positions. Based on the few pages of Donald J. Trumps 1995 tax returns that have become public, we have come to the conclusion that no one in his position would have been nominated, much less confirmed by the Senate, during either of the administrations we served. The same is true of any modern administration of a president from either party.

title: Images From Voyage of Time, Explained
description: Terrence Malicks latest film takes a trip back through history. Way, way back.

title: California Today: Silicon Valley, Housing Villain, Tries to Make Amends
description: Good morning.

title: How to Get People to Evacuate? Try Fear
description: (This story was written in 2016 and updated on Sept. 8, 2017.)

title: How Do You Pronounce Antnio Guterres?
description: Antnio Guterres of Portugal is the clear favorite to become the next secretary general of the United Nations. His surname is already tripping up those who dont speak Portuguese.

title: Biting the E.U. That Feeds Him
description: He has built, at great expense, a narrow-gauge railway between two villages that figured in his childhood and where his family now owns homes. Soccer-obsessed, he also built a large sports stadium near his weekend house. He manipulates news coverage in many ways, including letting cronies snatch control of national media outlets that fell on bad times. When he created a government program to encourage land acquisition to assist farmers, one conspicuous beneficiary was his wife.

title: UKIP Lawmakers Clash at E.U. Parliament. One Ends Up on the Floor.
description: LONDON  Britains populist, right-wing United Kingdom Independence Party might have thought its week could get no worse after its leader, Diane James, quit on Tuesday just 18 days after her election.

title: Amid Hills of Wine and Truffles, a Mission to Give Fungus Room to Breathe
description: BAROLO, Italy  Few places in Italy, and perhaps the world, have been so gifted with exquisite natural abundance as Barolo and its surrounding region.

title: Hurricane Matthew Approaches Florida; Governor Urges 1.5 Million to Flee
description: Read Fridays Storm Watch for the latest updates on Hurricane Matthew.

title: Think Like a Doctor: A Terrible Stomachache
description: The Challenge: Can you figure out what is wrong with a 43-year-old woman who suddenly develops abdominal pain so powerful that it wakes her up from sleep?

title: Deutsche Bank to Cut an Additional 1,000 Jobs in Germany
description: LONDON  Deutsche Bank said on Thursday that it would eliminate 1,000 full-time positions in Germany as part of job cuts the embattled lender first announced last year.

title: 1966: Nuclear Weapons and Vietnam
description: WASHINGTON  President Johnson avoided direct comment today [Oct. 6] on potential use of nuclear weapons in Vietnam but said U.S. policy there is to provide the maximum deterrence with a minimum involvement. The statement came during a White House press conference when the president was asked for comment on a statement made on Monday by former President Dwight D. Eisenhower.

title: Civil Conversation Challenge for Teenagers | Issue 4: Race, Gender and Identity
description: As part of our Civil Conversation Challenge, we have opened student forums on some of the biggest issues dividing Americans this campaign season.

title: National Book Awards Finalists Include Colson Whitehead and Viet Thanh Nguyen
description: Colson Whitehead, Jacqueline Woodson, Rita Dove and Viet Thanh Nguyen are among the finalists for the 2016 National Book Awards.

title: Valentin de Boulogne, Bright Star in Caravaggios Orbit
description: A canon is not a static list of dead white men. Its an assertion of who from the past can speak to the present, and its shape is always up for negotiation. Valentin de Boulogne: Beyond Caravaggio, a big Baroque blast of a show at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, is the first exhibition anywhere devoted to a French painter whose theatrically lit tableaus of musicians, cardsharps and saints now stand in slight obscurity. It is also, quite explicitly, an application for canon membership, a full-throated bid to place Valentin (1591-1632) alongside Jusepe de Ribera and Georges de La Tour as a pioneer of the early 17th century.

title: Mike Pence Disavows Donald Trumps Earlier Proposal Barring Muslims
description: The Trump campaign appeared to disavow one of its most provocative policy proposals on Thursday, as Gov. Mike Pence of Indiana said explicitly that Donald J. Trump no longer wanted to impose a temporary ban on Muslim immigration to the United States.

title: Review: All That Man Is, and a Lot He Is Not, in David Szalays View
description: David Szalay writes with voluptuous authority. He possesses voice rather than merely style, and you climb into his new novel, All That Man Is, as if into an understated luxury car. The book has a large, hammerlike engine, yet it is content to purr. Theres a sense of enormous power held in reserve.

title: Megyn Kelly and Sean Hannity Indulge in Testy Public Clash
description: Donald J. Trumps rise has created deep rifts at some of the countrys most powerful political institutions. The latest casualty: Fox News.

title: With Senate Control at Stake, Koch Groups Start Endorsing by Name
description: WASHINGTON  The vast and cash-rich Koch political network is intensifying efforts behind preferred Republican candidates in the few crucial races that could decide Senate control.

title: Bowing to a New Life, in Tokyo
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights from The New York Times. In this piece, Motoko Rich, who moved her family from Brooklyn to Japan in August after becoming The Timess Tokyo bureau chief, shares what its been like, for all of them, to adapt.

title: Deutsche Bank as Next Lehman Brothers: Far-Fetched but Not Unthinkable
description: All it took was the threat of a $14 billion fine against Deutsche Bank for the word contagion to rear its ugly head.

title: The Chinese Club
description: Cuisine of the Chinese diaspora in Williamsburg, Brooklyn.

title: The Chinese Club Cuts a Culinary Path Through India
description: The sign above the Chinese Clubs scarlet storefront in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, says Est. 1914, although its doors opened only in March. More than a century and 7,500 miles separate it from its ancestor, the Chinese Club of Darjeeling, in the Himalayan foothills of eastern India.

title: Video Review: VW Dresses Up the Alltrack for the Hard Road
description: Adding ground clearance, all-wheel drive and rugged Ranger Rick cladding to a station wagon is a well-known path for automotive profit.

title: Range Is All the Rage in Paris, as Electric Cars Steal the Show
description: PARIS  For perhaps the first time at a major international auto salon, the stars of the Paris Motor Show are electric cars.

title: Should Every Young Athlete Get a Trophy?
Cardinals Carson Palmer Wont Play Thursday Against 49ers
description: The Arizona Cardinals will have to play Thursday nights N.F.L. game without quarterback Carson Palmer, who sustained a concussion last week. Palmer was a Most Valuable Player Award candidate last year, throwing for 35 touchdowns and leading the league in yards per pass.

title: Move Around an iMac by Touch
description: Q. Do the trackpad shortcuts on a MacBook work the same way on an iMac if you buy an external trackpad to use instead of the included mouse?

title: Kennedy Center Taps Broadway Producer to Lead Theater Programming
description: The Broadway producer Jeffrey Finn has been named to oversee theater programming at the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts in Washington.

title: Worlds Oldest Man, After Century Wait, Celebrates Bar Mitzvah at Last
description: Yisrael Kristal, like many a bar mitzvah boy before him, celebrated the event last weekend, reading the Torah and enjoying the company of his family, who danced, sang and threw candies.

title: Daily Report: The Feds Cant Resist Silicon Valleys Data
description: A gentle reminder: The Justice Department backing off demands that Apple help it break the security of an iPhone six months ago does not mean law enforcement isnt still very interested in the information gathered and protected by tech companies.

title: Motorcycle Bomb Near Istanbul Police Station Wounds at Least 10
description: ANKARA, Turkey  A motorcycle bomb exploded near a police station in Istanbul on Thursday, wounding at least 10 people, Turkish officials said.

title: How the Berenstain Bears Found Salvation
description: My 4-year-old son is obsessed with the Berenstain Bears. When bedtime rolls around, I no longer ask him what book he wants to read, but which Berenstain Bears book he would like. And who could blame him? Stan and Jan Berenstains 50-year-old series, with its family of bears living in a big tree house down a sunny dirt road deep in Bear Country, covers the waterfront of possible toddler experiences: everything from Trouble at School to Too Much Birthday to Messy Room to Go to the Doctor. And for that reason, the books are easily deployed by scheming parents like myself to inoculate against potentially unsettling changes that might frighten a 4-year-old. When my wife and I were set to take a child-free overseas trip, we read and reread Week at Grandmas with my son as preparation; when summer rolled around, we pulled out Go to Camp.

title: Micki Pellerano Reads Jenny Hvals Tarot
description: The singer-songwriter visited the artist and occultist at his home in Greenpoint, Brooklyn, for a very personal consultation.

title: A Brooklyn Artist Reads a Norwegian Singers Tarot
description: On Blood Bitch, Jenny Hvals beguiling new album, the avant-garde musician sings about menstruation and vampires, blood and politics. A spiritual successor to Kate Bush, Arthur Russell and Bjrk, Hval uses her breathy voice, programmed beats and Arp Odyssey synthesizer to invoke a pop cosmogony of feminism, humor, sensuality and noise. It really is a subconscious album, she says. I think that Im probably a little too good with the intellectual side of things after Ive finished an album. I make it all up. The music on Blood Bitch is an elemental experience; one can imagine moon cycles guiding rhythms, or the tides inspiring its looping melodies. Which is why its a surprise that, until very recently, Hval knew almost nothing about astrology.

title: U.N. Syria Envoy Offers to Escort Rebel Fighters From Aleppo
description: GENEVA  The top United Nations diplomat for the Syria conflict proposed a new truce on Thursday, in hopes of averting what he called the destruction of rebel-held eastern Aleppo by Russian and Syrian forces. He offered to personally escort the jihadist fighters in the area to safety if the bombing is halted.

title: Threes a Trend: White Dresses, With Roomy Sleeves
description: Continuing whats emerged as a theme in Milan and Paris  unexpected plays on volume  several designers have put a spin on the classic white dress by adding exaggerated rounded sleeves. Back in Milan, Salvatore Ferragamo showed a stark white design with sleeves that were ruched to add dimension. The young designer Jacquemus, whose obscure silhouettes put him on the map, sent out a short white shirtdress with eye-catching round sleeves on the first day of Paris Fashion Week. And a few days ago, Stella McCartneys version of the roomy sleeve trend came with a poplin below-the-knee dress.

title: Floridas Vulnerability Tested as Hurricane Matthew Hugs Coast
description: A lot has changed in Florida since Oct. 22, 2005, when Hurricane Wilma roared west to east across the peninsula at Category 3 strength, making it the last major hurricane (storms in that category and stronger) to come ashore in the United States. On coasts there and elsewhere in hurricane danger zones, populations and development have grown and spread tremendously in a long storm lull.

title: David Beckham Makes His Presence Felt at Kent & Curwen
description: LONDON  David Beckham strode into the Kent & Curwen showroom here, just one block from the mens wear mecca of Jermyn Street. He smiled amiably at the small gathering of fashion reporters; posed for a picture with Suzy Menkes, the Vogue International editor, who would soon post on  Instagram, and briefly rubbed his close-cropped beard before announcing that he wanted to make one thing perfectly clear.

title: Tips for Landing a Career at Your Fathers Software Company
description: Finding a career thats right for you at your fathers software company is one of the more difficult tasks you will encounter as you enter your 30s. But it can be exciting, too! If you set realistic goals and put your mind to it, theres no reason you wont find gainful employment at the company your father runs.

title: A Mother Criticizes Vince Staples, and the Rapper Defends Her
description: Musicians do not usually respond with patience when listeners refer to their music as filth.

title: At Paris Fashion Week, a Season of Big Changes
description: The focus of the spring/summer 2017 Paris Fashion Week was undoubtedly, relentlessly, on the new. New labels, new designers at houses, lots of new clothes, a few new ideas. You may wind up asking: Whats new? The last five years have been characterized by that situation. Newness is nothing new.

title: Video Visits in Jail
description: To the Editor:

title: A Rare Move for Bob Dylan: Old Vic Play Is Set to His Music
description: LONDON  A new play by Conor McPherson, Girl From the North Country, set to songs by Bob Dylan, headlines the second half of the 2016-17 season at the Old Vic, the theater announced Thursday.

title: Mars Cashes Out Warren Buffett to Take Control of Wrigley
description: Mars Inc. has finally taken full control of Wrigley, formally putting M&Ms and Altoids mints in the same division  and cashing out its partner, Warren E. Buffett, in the process.

title: 20 Under $20
description: Twenty exciting value wines to drink right now.

title: 20 Wines for Under $20: The Fall Edition
description: I hear it all the time: Where should I look for the best wine values?

title: New York Archdiocese Offers Compensation Program for Sexual Abuse Victims
description: The Archdiocese of New York has established an independent program that will allow victims of sexual abuse by members of the clergy to apply for compensation from the church, even for abuse claims that are decades old, church leaders said on Thursday.

title: Backstage and Now the Boss: The Only Girl in the Building
description: Jennifer Diaz first stepped onto the stage of the Metropolitan Opera House at 11, as an extra in I Pagliacci and La Bohme. For the next three years, it became her second home, as she regularly visited her father, who is still the Mets night crew manager after more than three decades.

title: In Fight for Aleppo, Tangled Alliances in Syria Add to Chaos
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The Syrian civil war, and the intense new ground battle in the divided city of Aleppo, is often seen as a contest between a chaotic array of rebel groups and the Russian-backed government of President Bashar al-Assad. But the reality is that Mr. Assads side is increasingly just as fragmented as its opponents, a panoply of forces aligned partly along sectarian lines but with often-competing approaches and interests.

title: Wells Fargo Scandal Blunts a Weapon in Banks Regulatory Fight
description: Wells Fargo has deprived banks of a Washington standard-bearer. Big lenders hoped to piggyback on their rivals lack of Wall Street taint to resist proposals to curb pay and ban merchant banking. But the fake-accounts scandal weakens Wells Fargos ability to lead the charge.

title: Donald Trump Takes Advantage of a Republican Party Pitted Against Itself
description: Four years ago, Mitt Romney, the Republican presidential nominee, won the first fall debate with a smoothly delivered promise of cooperation. While President Obama had rebuffed Republicans, Mr. Romney would work on a collaborative basis with Democrats.

title: Tim Coppens Likes Grooming Products With Soul
description: I dont believe in the miracle of product, the Belgian fashion designer Tim Coppens said. When it comes to grooming, he takes a pragmatic approach.

title: The Best of Michael Pollan for The New York Times
description: In the introduction to his essay on the Obama administrations failure to take on corporate agriculture in this weeks Food Issue, Michael Pollan writes about an open letter to the president that he published in the magazine eight years ago. Pollan has been writing for The Times much longer, starting with his articles in the magazine about lawns and gardens in the 1980s. Since then he has primarily examined all the complicated ways we obtain the food we eat.

title: Over 190 Countries Adopt Plan to Offset Air Travel Emissions
description: Governments from more than 190 countries on Thursday adopted a measure that for the first time will reduce the climate impact of international jet travel.

title: An Affair to Forget
description: My husbands co-worker is going to be the best man at a wedding. But he has shared with several colleagues his concern over taking part in the ceremony: The groom-to-be told him that he cheated on his fiance with a woman with whom all three of them work. (The couple has had trouble with fidelity before; they broke up briefly but reunited.) The best man encouraged the groom to be honest with his fiance, telling him it could be an issue later. But the groom resisted. We all feel strongly that the co-worker should not act as best man. What would you recommend?

title: A Potters Appealing Artistry, Broadcast on Social Media
description: Eric Landon, the co-founder of Tortus, a pottery studio in Copenhagen, has won serious accolades, including the 2015 Danish Design Award for Craftsman of the Year, for his work: simple, organic shapes glazed in appealingly muted pastels. And, in an age of fetishistic obsession with objects that are handcrafted, the 40-year-old Milwaukee native has harnessed the power of social media to do better than simply make the claim: Hell show you exactly how its done, in mesmerizing Instagram videos that have earned him nearly 600,000 followers. Think Ghost without Demi Moore or the Righteous Brothers soundtrack.

title: Fashion Week Photo Diary: Louis Vuitton, Moncler Gamme Rouge and Miu Miu
description: Scenes from the spring/summer 2017 collections that were presented in Paris on Wednesday.

title: Antnio Guterres Pledges to Help Vulnerable as Secretary General
description: The Security Council on Thursday formally recommended Antnio Guterres, a former prime minister of Portugal, to be the next Secretary General of the United Nations.

title: Good, Bad and Mad: Andrew Rosenthal on the News
description: The Opinion columnist Andrew Rosenthal on the vice-presidential debate, efforts to legalize marijuana and other news. Susan Lehman is host

title: Facebook Live: A Day in the Life at Lincoln Center
description: For four decades Live From Lincoln Center has been a television standby. On Friday the arts complex will try something new: Think of it as Facebook Live From Lincoln Center.

title: Los Angeless Ideal Future
description: To the Editor:

title: 5 Shows for Under 5 Hamiltons
description: Updated | Believe us  not every show in New York costs as much as a ticket to Hamilton. Here are five that will cost you just a few Hamiltons of your own, with our expert guidance on what to expect if you go:

title: Good, Bad and Mad: Andrew Rosenthal on the News
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times. In this podcast, Andrew Rosenthal, a Times Op-Ed columnist, talks about the news  the good, the bad and that which makes him mad.

title: Bias in Immigration Judges
description: To the Editor:

title: CUNYs Fee Waiver
description: To the Editor:

title: Barred From Baseball (in Taiwan)
description: NANTOU CITY, Taiwan  The former first baseman for the Brother Elephants, Taiwans equivalent of the Yankees, now spends most of his days and nights deep in a local stadium, in a spartan room with all the charm of an old warship.

title: Hurricane Matthew Makes Old Problems Worse for Haitians
description: The first reports to arrive were of vast flooding and destruction, rivers of brown water pulsing through streets and homes shorn of tin roofs. Eventually, the talk turned to livestock lost, a veritable fortune for those living in the poorest country in the Western Hemisphere.

title: Tim Kaine Criticizes Gary Johnson Over Syria Remarks
description: PHILADELPHIA  Tim Kaine forcefully criticized Gary Johnson, the Libertarian Partys presidential nominee, on Thursday after Mr. Johnson equated the targeting of noncombatants by the Syrian government with the accidental bombing of civilians by United States-backed forces.

title: Hurricane Matthew Pushes Toward Florida
description: People along the East Coast from Florida to South Carolina prepared for the storm to make landfall.

title: Obama Administration Is Quietly Delaying Thousands of Deportation Cases
description: The Obama administration is delaying deportation proceedings for recent immigrants in cities across the United States, allowing more than 56,000 of those who fled Central America since 2014 to remain in the country legally for several more years.

title: The Supreme Court Plays Goldilocks on Insider Trading
description: Sometimes the Supreme Court is a bit like Goldilocks, looking for a ruling that will be like a perfect bowl of porridge  not too hot, not too cold, but just right.

title: Anatomy of a Scene | Miss Peregrines
description: Tim Burton narrates a sequence from Miss Peregrines Home for Peculiar Children.

title: A Few Medics Hold the Line in Kunduz, Their Hospital Also a Casualty
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  When the Talibans attack on central parts of Kunduz began before dawn on Monday, the doctors and nurses at the northern Afghan citys only government hospital knew they were going to be needed.

title: One Model, 36 Beauty Looks
description: The Russian model Odette Pavlovas season of hair and makeup, in pictures.

title: Tim Burton Narrates a Scene From Miss Peregrines Home
description: Tim Burtons fantasy adventure Miss Peregrines Home for Peculiar Children includes a number of eye-popping sequences. But the toughest one for the director to shoot takes place under the sea.

title: In a Montana Bear Attack, Lessons on Hope, Survival and First Aid
description: A 50-year-old man was attacked by a bear in the wilderness of southwest Montana. Alone and injured, he walked  then drove  for miles to save himself.

title: What Its Like to Be Trapped by a Category 5 Hurricane
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  When you are born in Miami, your hurricane experiences tend to start early. Mine began in utero  my mother was pregnant with me when Hurricane Cleo touched down in Miami. Two weeks before my arrival, Hurricane Isbell set its sight on the Everglades. And just as I neared my first birthday, she hurriedly pushed my baby carriage down the street with my brother and sister to seek shelter at my godfathers house. Hurricane Betsy, a doozy, was headed to Miami (It landed in Key Largo).

title: For New Yorks Police, Talk Down, Not Take Down
description: To the Editor:

title: Theyll Perform and Talk to Remember Those Killed by AIDS
description: One day in the middle of the 1980s, John Bernd took a taxi to St. Marks Church in the East Village, where he did a solo show for Danspace Project. Then he took a taxi back to where he had come from: New York University Hospital, a few blocks away. A friend had to sneak him out for his performance. Mr. Bernd had been sick with AIDS since 1981, before the syndrome had a name.

title: Simon Halsey, Preaching to, and for, the Choir
description: Since the dawn of the jet age, the globe-trotting maestro has been a familiar feature of the classical music scene  conducting all over the world and often holding positions with orchestras in several nations at once. But jet-setting chorus masters? They are altogether rarer.

title: Taller Than the Trees
description: Japanese men havent traditionally been caregivers. But for Masami Hayata, its a crucial part of raising his family.

title: Taller Than the Trees
description: Japan is a hyper-aging society. People are living longer, and the birthrate is extremely low. For a culture steeped in oya-koko, or filial piety, fewer children has led to a crisis in caregiving. Elder care has traditionally fallen to family members and specifically to daughters and daughters-in-law. With more women working, an unprecedented number of men are breaking with tradition to take hands-on caregiving responsibilities for their families. They often do so in the prime of their careers and many are unable to reconcile their devotion to family with Japans intensely competitive workplace culture.

title: The Next Generation of French Winemakers
description: Wine may have always been a cornerstone of French culture and gastronomy, but today, the industry is experiencing a marked wave of change, driven largely by up-and-coming producers. Josh Adler, owner of the four-year-old Paris Wine Company, a Paris-based wine exporter with a special focus on young producers, says its truly the golden age of winemaking in France. You see people taking over family domaines or starting their own, despite the inherent challenges. On top of that, theyre focused on organic farming and all natural wines.

title: Want to Know the Crucial Areas for Clinton? Follow Michelle Obama
description: Four taps of the microphone were all Michelle Obama needed to take down Donald J. Trump.

title: The Gallery of Everything
description: The inaugural exhibition at the outsider-art aficionado James Bretts newest venture, the Gallery of Everything, comes with an assist from Jarvis Cocker.

title: A Britpop Star, a Curator and a Former Barbershop
description: The friendship between the musician Jarvis Cocker and the curator James Brett first flowered some six years ago in a onetime recording studio in Primrose Hill, London. It was here that Brett, a certified Pulp fan, first displayed the dizzying assortment of self-taught art that drew more than 35,000 visitors to the Museum of Everything, following its opening in 2009. Among the wondrous works on display was a screening of the little-known 90s television documentary Journeys Into the Outside, in which Cocker had tracked down some of the marginalized creators of so-called outsider art. Ever curious, Cocker came along to the museum: Id heard that they were putting together an exhibition at the studio where I used to record, he recalls by phone from France. I liked the way Brett mixed everything together. He seemed to have found a good way to show that type of art that kept the spirit alive. It doesnt work if its too reverential. The museum had an entertaining aspect to it, not too serious or formal. It was an occasion to go there.

title: Where to Go Next: The Most Underrated City in Germany
description: Consider Cologne, rich with aesthetic delights: from one of the best concert halls in Europe to galleries, major museums and brewhouse taverns.

title: Practical Tips for Surviving a Hurricane, Learned the Hard Way
description: Four years after Hurricane Sandy, my condominium development at the Jersey Shore is finally fully back. Many of the residents around us in Ortley Beach  a Toms River beach town that was described as New Jerseys ground zero in the hurricane  are still struggling through recovery, and some have abandoned their efforts and property.

title: Brutalism Is Back
description: IN THE RANK OF UNFLATTERING monikers for an artistic style, Brutalism has got to score near the top. Like the much kinder-sounding Fauvism or Impressionism, it was a term of abuse for the work of architects whose buildings confronted their users  brutalized them  with hulking, piled-up slabs of raw, unfinished concrete. These same architects, centered on the British couple Alison and Peter Smithson, enthusiastically took up Brutalism as the name for their movement with a kind of pride, as if to say: Thats right, we are brutal. We do want to shove your face in cement. For a world still climbing gingerly out of the ruins of World War II, in need of plain dealing and powerful messages, this brand of architectural honesty was refreshing.

title: Man Charged With Stealing Rare Books Worth $20,000 From Manhattan Dealer
description: A man has been arrested and charged with stealing two valuable books last spring from a rare-book dealer on the Upper East Side of Manhattan, the police said.

title: In Balanchines Serenade, Rituals and Gestures of Autonomy
description: At the start of George Balanchines Serenade, the curtain rises on an extraordinary image: a tableau of 17 stationary women, dressed in blue calf-length dresses. The orchestra has already begun to play the slow descending scales of Tchaikovskys Serenade for Strings, but for a long while these women dont move.

title: Dealing With Mas Dementia, and That Trip Out West
description: I dont mean to be a downer, but have you readers of a certain age noticed how many conversations weve all been having about making an early exit?

title: Early Book Praising Hitler May Have Been Written by Hitler
description: In the early fall of 1923, when Adolf Hitler was still mostly known for his frenzied speeches at Munich beer halls, a slim biography was published that lauded him as the savior of the German nation and even compared him to Jesus.

title: Minnesota Mall Attackers Killing by Police Was Justified, Prosecutors Say
description: Dahir Adan, the man accused of stabbing 10 people at a Minnesota mall last month, slashed an electronics store employee and later advanced toward an off-duty police officer even after sustaining gunshot wounds, security footage released on Thursday showed.

title: New York City Sells Landlords Debts, but Buildings Fall Into Limbo, Critics Say
description: The apartment building on St. Johns Place in the Crown Heights neighborhood of Brooklyn is a mess. Repeated flooding has curdled the paint and caused mold to bloom on the walls. The temperature inside is freezing in the winter and sweltering in the summer. New York Citys housing agency has sued the owner of the eight-unit apartment building nine times to try to force repairs. And the landlord owes $20,000 in fines and more than $235,000 in unpaid interest and water, sewer and other bills.

title: Review: In Being 17, 2 Boys Teeter Between Animosity and Attraction
description: To fight or to fall in love: That is the choice two antagonistic high school classmates face in Being 17, a touching drama about raging hormones, bullying and sexual awakening  and the strongest film in many years by the post-New Wave French director Andr Tchin.

title: This Weeks Movies: Oct. 7, 2016
description: The New York Times film critics review The Birth of a Nation, Being 17 and The Girl on the Train.

title: Review: Insecure, or How to Negotiate Love and Commitment
description: The writer and actress Issa Rae has said that she was happy that the experience of making her new series for HBO, Insecure, was regular. This seems to mean something like keeping things everyday, staying within herself, not being defined by her work and not letting her work be defined solely by its blackness.

title: Pakistan Toughens Laws on Rape and Honor Killings of Women
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  The Pakistani Parliament on Thursday passed laws to increase sentences for rapists and those who commit so-called honor killings of women, and closed a loophole that allowed many of the killers to go free, after hours of heated opposition from Islamist lawmakers.

title: In Divorce, Sarah Jessica Parker Wants to Ditch Mr. Medium
description: In 1998, playing the relationship columnist Carrie Bradshaw in Sex and the City, Sarah Jessica Parker helped usher in HBOs golden age and define a Manhattan gilded age. So its unavoidable to wonder if her new HBO series, Divorce, is Sex and the City 18 years later.

title: Review: Growing Up Fast in London Town Amid Punk and Thatcherism
description: Its the late 1970s in London Town, where 14-year-old Shay (Daniel Huttlestone), a fragile-looking kid in neatly pressed bell-bottoms, is about to be catapulted into adulthood. Punk and Thatcherism are at loggerheads and the far-right group known as the National Front is peddling white supremacy on street corners. But for Shay, the most pressing problem is his falling-apart family.

title: Train Was Traveling at Twice the Speed Limit Just Before Hoboken Crash
description: A New Jersey Transit train that crashed in Hoboken last week accelerated to about 21 miles per hour just before it smashed into the terminal, killing a woman and injuring more than 100 other people, federal investigators said on Thursday.

title: Review: The Golden Girls, Back Again as Wisecracking Puppets
description: It has been almost 25 years since The Golden Girls ended, but its four wisecracking housemates reconvene in That Golden Girls Show! A Puppet Parody, a harmless homage that respects the beloved television series but also underscores its limitations.

title: Leaked Videos Pull Back Curtain on Mormon Leadership
description: In this era of leaks and hacks, secrets have been stolen from organizations as varied as the Democratic Party, the Vatican, Sony Pictures and Yahoo. Now comes Mormon Leaks, a breach of the inner sanctum of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints that has provided a rare glimpse into the workings of the churchs leadership and its cozy relationship with Mormons in politics.

title: Snap Sketch: The Faces of Paris Fashion Week
description: The illustrator Damien Florbert Cuypers draws the models, designers, buyers, bloggers  and looks  at the spring/summer 2017 collections.

title: The Cubs Confront the Curse: Is This the Year?
description: CHICAGO  There is no curse; thats crazy talk, the chairman of the Chicago Cubs, Tom Ricketts, said the other day in his office.

title: Review: The Late Bloomer, About a Sex Therapist Who Missed Puberty
description: How old is too old to be subsisting on a steady diet of sex jokes, sex talk and sex fantasies? Your answer to that question will determine whether you find anything funny in The Late Bloomer, a comedy directed by Kevin Pollak. If this were a frat-house movie, then sure, youd expect the preoccupation with crotches. Here, though, the title character, Pete (Johnny Simmons), is 30, and so are his various friends.

title: The Eight Best Shoes of Paris Fashion Week
description: Highlights from the runways.

title: Desert Trip Festival Woos Classic Rock Fans (Emphasis on Classic)
description: Its not often a mother tries to persuade her teenage son to attend a music festival with her. But Desert Trip is not your average festival.

title: The Seven Best Bags of Paris Fashion Week
description: Highlights from the runways.

title: The Eight Best Jewels of Paris Fashion Week
description: Highlights from the runways.

title: Strausss Elektra Sure Seems to Resemble Another Work
description: In June, the plagiarism trial about one of the most recognizable guitar solos in rock history ended in a not guilty verdict when a jury found there was no evidence that Led Zeppelin had knowingly lifted the opening to its Stairway to Heaven from an earlier song by the band Spirit.

title: Review: Contortions en Route to Resurrection in Shen Weis Neither
description: Morton Feldman and Samuel Beckett claimed not to like opera, but they made one anyway, collaborating on Neither for the Rome Opera in 1977. The work, for orchestra and a lone soprano, with an 87-word libretto by Beckett, has been called an anti-opera, or an hourlong art song, as The Village Voice put it after its first New York performance.

title: Bill Cosbys Lawyers Say Prosecutions Delay Violated His Rights
description: Lawyers for Bill Cosby filed a motion on Thursday in a renewed effort to have criminal sexual assault charges against him dismissed. They argued that the delay of more than 10 years in bringing charges against him, among other issues, meant that prosecutors in Pennsylvania were denying him the right to a fair trial.

title: Player Who Sold Pills to Derek Boogaard Is Sentenced to Probation
description: Jordan Hart, a former minor league hockey player who sold thousands of dollars of illegally obtained prescription painkillers to the N.H.L. star Derek Boogaard in the months and weeks before Boogaard died of an overdose in 2011, was sentenced on Thursday to one year of probation and 100 hours of community service.

title: Debates Past, and Debates Future
description: To the Editor:

title: Squirrel Stole My Underpants, and Therein Hangs a Tale
description: Titles count.

title: The Joy of Reading Between Agnes Martins Lines
description: To be honest, I wonder what a lot of people see in abstract painting. I love it, the idea of it and the experience of it, because its been in my life for decades. But what if you dont have that information? How do you approach an art empty of figures and evident narratives? How do you find out what, if anything, is in it for you? What do you do to make it your own?

title: Doomocracy Puts the Politics of Fear on Display in Brooklyn
description: The artist Pedro Reyes is a biting social critic whose pieces often hold out hope  in the face of overwhelming evidence to the contrary  that things will get better.

title: Collectors Still Savor Shirley Temple Black Memorabilia
description: Shirley Temple Black, the plucky child star turned diplomat, remains an indelible pop culture figure, and her costumes and other possessions are in demand. While parts of her estate are being dispersed, new owners of her possessions are unearthing the objects histories.

title: Review: The Great Gilly Hopkins, a Childs Story Elevated by Grown-Ups
description: The title character is a child, but two adult actors, Kathy Bates and Glenn Close, really give The Great Gilly Hopkins its considerable heart. This movie, though uneven, is affecting because of these two reliable stars.

title: Syria, N.S.A., Michelle Obama: Your Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: What to See in New York Art Galleries This Week
description: James Fuentes 55 Delancey Street Through Oct. 23

title: Review: In Theo Who Lived, a Journalist Tells of His Capture by Al Qaeda
description: In the imaginative and affecting documentary Theo Who Lived, the writer and journalist Theo Padnos walks the viewer through his nearly two years of captivity in the hands of Al Qaeda. A self-described dumb American, Mr. Padnos, who went by the name Peter Theo Curtis at the time, crossed the border into Syria from Turkey in October 2012, looking for a story. He was kidnapped almost immediately.

title: At Frieze Art Fairs, No Frenzy but a Sense of Steady Activity
description: LONDON  The art dealer Robert Mnuchin was testing his theory of parallels between the painter Willem de Kooning and the sculptor John Chamberlain by juxtaposing their work in his booth at Frieze Masters, the major art fair that opened here this week.

title: Reimagining the Divine Art of Asia at the Philadelphia Museum of Art
description: PHILADELPHIA  The Philadelphia Museum of Arts renowned collection of South Asian art had a problem: Despite a dazzling array of artifacts that thrilled scholars and absorbed curators, it made no sense to the general public.

title: Review: 37, a Fictional Retelling of the Kitty Genovese Story
description: There is a conceit to Puk Grastens drama 37 that must be addressed up front. The film assumes that the oft-repeated circumstances surrounding the rape and murder of Kitty Genovese in Kew Gardens, Queens, in March 1964 are true  that 37 witnesses (actually, 38) did nothing to intervene. But the facts are otherwise, as The Witness, an effective documentary released in June that follows Ms. Genoveses brother Bill as he investigates the crime, proved. The popular belief that neighbors ignored her cries, a notion, based on police claims, reported in a New York Times article at the time (and since reconsidered by the paper), was an exaggeration. Alas, a closing intertitle quotes the piece.

title: Review: In Henry Jagloms Ovation, the Action Is Backstage
description: Henry Jagloms movies are like artisanal cupcakes: The shape is sometimes weird, the flavors unpredictable, and the frosting occasionally overdone. Always reliable, though, are the baseline ingredients, and his 20th feature, Ovation, doesnt disappoint. Dependably genuine, and suffused with Mr. Jagloms increasingly mellow intelligence, this lighthearted backstage drama will feel to his fans like a gathering of familiars.

title: Review: In Mirzya, Echoes of Romeo and Juliet, Lushly Shot
description: Mirzya is one gorgeously shot movie, and the filmmakers slow down some scenes to make sure you know it. They neednt have bothered. Most everything in this easy-to-like story is hard to miss.

title: 8 New Books We Recommend This Week
description: The latest round of books we like are meaty, weighty, often serious  and very, very good. This week, in an exciting new addition to the list, were incorporating favorites from our daily book critics, Michiko Kakutani, Dwight Garner and Jennifer Senior, all of whom bring their enthusiasms to bear on what theyve read recently, and all of whom have piqued my interest in what theyve been reading.

title: After Congressional Grilling, Wells Fargo Is Berated in Newspaper Ads
description: Former bank tellers and angry customers. Democrats and Republicans in Congress. State treasurers in California and Illinois. Even Hillary Clinton. They have all lambasted Wells Fargo in recent weeks over the phony accounts scandal.

title: Review: In Newtown, Understated Eloquence but No Peace
description: Newtown is as hard a documentary to watch as youre likely to encounter. It needed to be; anything less would have been too dismissive of one of the most traumatic American tragedies in recent memory.

title: 5 Years Later, Jon Corzine May Avoid Trial With $5 Million Settlement
description: WASHINGTON  Nearly five years after Jon S. Corzine presided over the collapse of the brokerage firm MF Global and became a target of federal investigations, his legal ordeal might be drawing to a close.

title: Review: In Blue Jay, Returning to Romantic Roads Not Taken
description: Blue Jay, Alex Lehmanns amiable black-and-white film about ex-lovers who meet by chance two decades after breaking up, has the inestimable benefit of Sarah Paulsons emotional electricity zapping through it. When Ms. Paulsons character, Amanda, runs into her former high school boyfriend, Jim (Mark Duplass, who wrote the screenplay), at a supermarket in Crestline, Calif., there is a moment of shocked recognition. Crestline is a faded resort town 80 miles east of Los Angeles, in the San Bernardino Mountains. It sets the tone of a movie drenched in nostalgia and regret for what might have been.

title: Review: Voyage of Time, the Cosmology of Terrence Malick (the Short Version)
description: Im hip about time, Peter Fondas character said in Easy Rider. But nobody, alive or dead, real or imagined, is quite as hip on the subject as Terrence Malick, one of modern cinemas great masters of distended and compacted chronology. His recent work  a flurry of productivity after an extended silence  has embedded his fascination with the cosmic and ephemeral dimensions of time in individual stories. The consciousness of his characters has been a screen on which inquiries about the nature of the universe and the place of human beings have been projected.

title: Racist Objects: A Painful Past Still Present
description: Help us shape a new interactive project that examines everyday racism through everyday objects from mammy saltshakers to Ghettopoly.

title: Archaeological Victims of ISIS Rise Again, as Replicas in Rome
description: ROME  A statue of a human-headed winged bull from the Northwest Palace in Nimrud, Iraq, that was bulldozed by the Islamic State last year to great outcry has been faithfully recreated using modern technology and put on exhibit at the Colosseum in Rome to spur discussion of the possible reconstruction of war-torn archaeological sites.

title: De Blasio Snubs New York Post Reporter and Calls Paper a Right-Wing Rag
description: For weeks, Mayor Bill de Blasio has barely disguised his disgust for the coverage of his administration in The New York Post. He has referred to the newspaper as propaganda and suggested recently during his weekly radio call-in show that right-thinking New Yorkers would do well to ignore what he called The Posts fabricated front-page stories.

title: Review: An Undetonated Missile and Evil Spirits Lurk in Under the Shadow
description: The creaking and shrieking inside a haunted-house movie often turn on evil spirits, restless ghosts or sometimes just human madness. It takes time before the creepy noises are fully revealed in the quietly nerve-pricking horror flick Under the Shadow, though theres already plenty to worry about before the first real boo erupts. Bad juju is one thing, but in Tehran in 1988  the final year of the eight-year Iran-Iraq war  danger comes from every direction: the prying nosy neighbors, the patrolling morality police, the hurtling enemy missiles.

title: One of the New York Film Festivals Best Movies Isnt at the Main Event
description: In my dream New York Film Festival, some of the wonderments in Projections  the section dedicated to avant-garde and experimental material  would be programmed alongside the titles in the main slate. Its laudable that the festival continues to show noncommercial fare like you find in Projections (starting Friday), yet segregating these titles from the main event continues to marginalize works that merit a larger audience. And, as it happens, one of the best films in this years festival is in Projections: Robert Beaverss From the Notebook of , a 48-minute masterpiece.

title: Health Care: Decoded
description: Informed by research, Austin Frakt and Aaron Carroll explore and explain the changing landscape of health care.

title: Theater Listings for Oct. 7-13
description: A critical guide to productions in New York City, including shows in previews.

title: Hurricane Matthew: How The Times Prepares for a Coming Storm
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights from The New York Times. Marc Lacey, the national editor, and Peter Applebome, a deputy national editor in charge of the South, have covered dozens of natural disasters between them, going back decades. They are overseeing coverage of Hurricane Matthew, deploying correspondents up and down the coast. Here they discuss the challenges inherent in covering hurricanes.

title: Comedy Listings for Oct. 7-13
description: A selected guide to stand-up, improv and comedy shows in New York City.

title: Movie Listings for Oct. 7-13
description: Read reviews of new releases and search our full database of thousands of films at nytimes.com/reviews/movies.

title: Classical Music Listings for Oct. 7-13
description: A critical guide to performances of classical music in the New York City area.

title: A.I.G. Ex-Chief Ends Testimony in Fraud Case Unbowed
description: The six-day courtroom confrontation between Maurice R. Greenberg and lawyers for New York State accusing him of orchestrating sham transactions as chief executive of American International Group 16 years ago ended Thursday without any knockout blows.

title: A Memorable 11th Birthday With a Touch of the Macabre
description: Dear Diary:

title: Women in Royal Canadian Mounted Police Get an Apology for Years of Harassment
description: OTTAWA  The head of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police struggled to keep his composure as he publicly apologized Thursday to hundreds of women who were bullied, sexually harassed or discriminated against as officers or employees of the force.

title: Pop & Rock Listings for Oct. 7-13
description: A selected guide to concerts in the New York City area.

title: Dance Listings for Oct. 7-13
description: A selected guide to dance performances in New York City.

title: Asian-American Fighters Return to Ancestral Homelands, and Find Fans Waiting
description: SINGAPORE  Brandon Vera was recently pinned in a corner by an excited mob at a shopping mall in the Philippines, and briefly thought that he might have to fight his way out. But instead of brandishing weapons, the crowd was armed with pens and cellphones, hoping to get autographs and selfies with Vera, one of Asias most popular mixed martial arts fighters.

title: At Booz Allen, a Vast U.S. Spy Operation, Run for Private Profit
description: WASHINGTON  In the six weeks since federal agents raided a suburban Maryland home and arrested Harold T. Martin III on suspicion of stealing classified information from the National Security Agency, another organization has quietly prepared to face the fallout: Booz Allen Hamilton, Mr. Martins employer.

title: A Raw Deal for Chickens, as Jews Atone for Sins
description: A hen squirmed in Joel Lubins hands, but he held on and raised it over the head of his wife at noon on Thursday, as they stood on a sidewalk in the Williamsburg section of Brooklyn.

title: Army General Used Government Credit Card at Strip Clubs, Pentagon Says
description: WASHINGTON  An Army general who was previously the senior military assistant to Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter used his government credit card at strip clubs in Rome and Seoul and had inappropriate interactions with women, according to a Pentagon investigation released Thursday.

title: First Round in Clash of Unlikely Rivals Goes to the Blue Jays
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.  The Texas Rangers and the Toronto Blue Jays play in different divisions and different nations. They have made no significant trades with each other. A few stars have passed through both places  Al Oliver, Jose Canseco  but not many. The Blue Jays were the guests for Nolan Ryans last no-hitter, but there was no shame in that; he had thrown six before.

title: Ramzan Kadyrov, Chechen Strongman, Criticized Over Televised Child Fights
description: Ramzan A. Kadyrov, the leader of the Russian republic of Chechnya, has long sought to project himself as a muscle-bound brawler. He scares critics, wears camouflage and orders women to stay home. Now Mr. Kadyrov is publicly indoctrinating his three young sons in how to show off his model of Chechen manhood.

title: Museum & Gallery Listings for Oct. 7-13
description: A critical guide to exhibitions and installations in the New York area.

title: Witness Says Christie Aide Asked Her to Delete Email About Lane Closings
