description: NEWARK  As the scandal over the lane closings at the George Washington Bridge mushroomed in December 2013, Bridget Anne Kelly called a co-worker one evening in a panic.

title: Former Badger Gives Team Fresh Start, While He Finishes His Degree
description: MADISON, Wis.  Zigzagging through campus on the 15-minute walk to his 8 a.m. class in Nancy Nicholas Hall, a black backpack slung over one shoulder and sporting a red University of Wisconsin warm-up jacket, Tony Granato looks like an average college student.

title: Jazz Listings for Oct. 7-13
description: A selected guide to jazz performances in New York City.

title: Millions Flee or Brace as Hurricane Matthew Barrels Toward Florida
description: TITUSVILLE, Fla.  As Hurricane Matthew barreled toward Central Florida, the most powerful storm to hit the region in decades, millions of people fled inland or barricaded themselves inside their homes on Thursday to escape what could be dangerous flooding, widespread blackouts and 140-mile-per-hour wind capable of turning debris into deadly missiles.

title: C.E.O. of Backpage.com, Known for Escort Ads, Is Charged with Pimping a Minor
description: The chief executive of a website known for the sexually oriented escort advertisements it hosts was arrested on Thursday and charged with conspiracy and pimping a minor after the authorities raided the companys Dallas headquarters, according to court records.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: No. 1 item? Oh my God, generators.

title: Around Town for Oct. 7-13
description: A listing of discussions, film screenings, cultural activities and walking tours in New York City.

title: N.S.A. Suspect Is a Hoarder. But a Leaker? Investigators Arent Sure.
description: WASHINGTON  On a half-dozen occasions in the last three years, top-secret information has leaked from the National Security Agency and appeared on the web. Government analysts concluded with alarm that the documents, including intercepted communications from Europe and Japan and the computer code for the N.S.A.s hacking tools, had not come from the huge collection taken by Edward J. Snowden.

title: At the Boiling Point With Israel
description: If the aim of the Israeli government is to prevent a peace deal with the Palestinians, now or in the future, its close to realizing that goal. Last week, it approved the construction of a new Jewish settlement in the West Bank, another step in the steady march under Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to build on land needed to create a Palestinian state.

title: Spare Times for Children Listings for Oct. 7-13
description: A select guide to cultural events for children, teenagers and families.

title: The Mets Big Off-Season Question: Whither Yoenis Cespedes?
description: The Mets improbable season ended so abruptly late Wednesday night that it took a while for the feeling of shock to subside and for the players to finally reflect on what they had accomplished in even reaching the National League wild-card game. And ultimately, they did so.

title: Map of Hurricane Matthews Path
description: Live map of the storm's forecasted path.

title: Bing Thom, Daring Architect With a Sense of Place, Dies at 75
description: Bing Thom, a Hong Kong-born Canadian architect whose swooping, playful design for the Arena Stage companys Mead Center for American Theater enlivened Washingtons dreary southwestern waterfront and drew critical acclaim, died on Tuesday in Hong Kong. He was 75.

title: Bertrand M. Bell, Who Strove to Reduce Medical Trainees Grueling Shifts, Dies at 86
description: Dr. Bertrand M. Bell, who was instrumental in reducing the grueling shifts worked by interns and residents being trained in American hospitals, died on Tuesday at his home in Manhattan. He was 86.

title: The New-Look Knicks Seek an Identity
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  Most of the Knicks returned to work on Thursday to review some recent missteps and then take part in a post-practice yoga session.

title: Auto Shop Owners Forced Out of Willets Point Struggle to Rebuild in the Bronx
description: Mario Chasi stood in the middle of one of the 45 corrugated steel stalls that line the former warehouse in the Hunts Point section of the Bronx where he hopes to re-establish his body shop.

title: Mets or Giants? In Wrigleyville Bar, It Didnt Matter
description: CHICAGO  When Friday afternoon rolls around, barricades will go up on the streets around Wrigley Field, garbage cans will be removed from the sidewalks, the police will be out in force and many bars will begin serving drinks only in plastic cups  no cans, bottles or glasses.

title: Some Advice for a Balding Announcer: Let It Go, Joe
description: The Fox Sports announcer Joe Buck lost his voice five years ago and blamed it on a virus that had attacked a nerve in his left vocal cord. He told this story to me and others. It was quite believable. But it was a lie. He didnt really have a virus.

title: Communication Problems
description: FRIDAY PUZZLE  It always surprises me how serious some people are about their crossword puzzles, because from construction through solving, the whole kit and kaboodle is essentially about play. We play with words, we play with grids; in fact, Robyn Weintraub has done just that. In order to keep herself motivated to build puzzles, she changed things up a bit, and that sort of creativity and willingness to experiment is to be encouraged.

title: Review: Holiday Inn: Its Beginning to Look a Lot Like a Recycled Movie
description: The Christmas season seems to start earlier every year, it is often noted  or lamented. Will we soon be hearing sleigh bells in spring? This year, the Roundabout Theater Company has obliged all whose hearts are already pining for candy canes and mistletoe by presenting Holiday Inn, a perky but bland stage adaptation of the 1942 movie that is fondly remembered for Bing Crosbys crooning White Christmas, which has been a seasonal favorite ever since.

title: When Donald Trump Went to Washington and Got Himself a Tax Break
description: Speaking in a flurry of words, without notes, Donald J. Trump painted the matter in apocalyptic terms. Unless Congress did as he urged, he said, the United States would face catastrophe. We are not different right now than the Soviet Union, Mr. Trump said. They have no incentive, and we have no incentive.

title: Derrick Roses Accuser Testifies During an Emotional Day in Court
description: LOS ANGELES  The woman who has accused Derrick Rose and two of his friends of rape spent several hours on the witness stand Thursday, appearing soft-spoken and jittery as she gave her first testimony in the civil trial.

title: Blue Jays Pummel Cole Hamels, the Rangers Big-Game Ace
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.  Among the millions watching Madison Bumgarners virtuoso performance this week was at least one man who could relate: Cole Hamels, the ace left-hander for the Texas Rangers.

title: Corrections: October 7, 2016
description: NEW YORK

title: Review: Middle School, Where the Principal Is Mean and the Pranks Messy
description: The latest entry in the revenge-on-the-educator genre  extending at least as far back as Matilda  is the slick, harmless Middle School: The Worst Years of My Life, from CBS Films and adapted from the novel out of the James Patterson book factory. Directed by Steve Carr (Paul Blart: Mall Cop), the movie borrows a trick or two from the Disney XD series Kirby Buckets, with a dollop of A Beautiful Mind for dramatic heft.

title: CIT Group Plans to Sell Its Aircraft Leasing Unit for $10 Billion
description: The CIT Group, a commercial lender, agreed on Thursday to sell its aircraft leasing business to a Chinese-owned competitor for about $10 billion, signifying a big step by CIT to slim itself down in the face of pressure from investors.

title: Red Sox Muster Threat After Rick Porcello Stumbles, but Indians Hold On
description: CLEVELAND  In the days leading up to the Cleveland Indians playoff opener, Manager Terry Francona sidled up to some of his relievers, one by one, for brief conversations. Francona knew that they had routines, that they stretched their arms and loosened their shoulders before warming up, and he did not want them to be surprised when they were needed.

title: Hurricane Matthew Avoids Direct Hit on Florida, Continues North
description: Hurricane Matthew churned north along the coast of Florida on Friday, staying far enough offshore to spare the state a direct hit, but still caused flooding, wind damage and power failures. By Friday evening, it was a Category 2 storm, with sustained winds of up to 110 miles per hour, and government officials and forecasters shifted their focus to the threat of more serious damage on Saturday as the storm approaches Savannah and Charleston.

title: Europe May Finally End Its Painful Embrace of Austerity
description: LONDON  As Europe has grappled with the trauma of a devastating financial and economic crisis, policy makers have consistently relied on one approach to managing the damage  budget austerity.

title: Whats on TV Friday: Ava DuVernays 13th and Lewis Black in Black to the Future
description: In 13th, Ava DuVernay addresses what she sees as a different form of slavery in the United States: the mass incarceration of African-American men. And PBS ponders the state of the American dream.

title: Word + Quiz: angular
description: angular \a-gy-lr\ adjective

title: The Week in Pictures: Oct. 7, 2016
description: Photos from The New York Times and photographers from around the world.

title: The Week in Pictures: Oct. 7, 2016
description: Photos from The New York Times and photographers from around the world.

title: The G.O.P. Ticket; Fox News in Chinatown
description: Donald Trumps biggest selling point when he entered this campaign was that hes not a professional politician but a crack deal maker who can fix whats broken in Washington. So who are Republicans relying on to salvage his candidacy as poll numbers drop? The professional politician Mike Pence.

title: Reefer Republic
description: PORTLAND, Ore.  The budtenders of the Rose City are relentlessly helpful with tips pairing a marijuana strain that is equal parts fruity and musky with a stimulating Sichuan dish. As Oregon, the place where empires once clashed over the global trade of beaver furs, glides into a second year of legalized recreational pot, the state is determined to show the world that a certain kind of drug prohibition belongs in historys Dumpster.

title: Intimacy for the Avoidant
description: Over the past generation there seems to have been a decline in the number of high-quality friendships.

title: Canadas Trudeau Steps Up on Climate Change
description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau of Canada promised to make climate change a priority when he campaigned for office last year. This week he made progress on that promise with a plan to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by putting a price on carbon. This marks a big turning point for his country, whose previous government resisted aggressive steps on climate change because it wanted to protect the oil industry.

title: What About the Planet?
description: Our two major political parties are at odds on many issues, but nowhere is the gap bigger or more consequential than on climate.

title: Politicians Place a Bet on a Stadium, and Vegas Pays for It
description: LAS VEGAS  The fight to get professional football to Nevada is actually a story of inside baseball.

title: A Mother Is Shot Dead on a Playground, and a Sea of Witnesses Goes Silent
description: To the right of where the hooded gunman paused and lifted his revolver, Jessica Whites three young children were twirling down a pockmarked metal slide.

title: The Pounds Flash Crash
description: A look at the British pounds sharp plunge on Friday.

title: Pound Drops Sharply in Asian Trading Amid Brexit Fears
description: LONDON  The British pound plunged suddenly in the early hours of trading in Asia on Friday before just as quickly making back most of its losses, puzzling currency trading experts but underscoring investor skittishness over Britains prospects as it moves to break away from the European Union.

title: Third Piece of Debris Confirmed to Be From Missing Malaysian Jet
description: SYDNEY, Australia  The Australian government said on Friday that a piece of debris that washed up on the Indian Ocean island of Mauritius in May was from Malaysia Airlines Flight 370.

title: I.P.O. Values Innogy Unit of German Utility RWE Around $22 Billion
description: LONDON  Innogy, the renewable energy unit of the German utility company RWE, debuted on the stock market on Friday after it was valued at 20 billion euros, or about $22 billion, the largest initial public offering in Germany since 2000.

title: Pool of Sprinkles
description: All we will tell you about this photo is that the ground is covered in ice cream sprinkles.

title: Inspired by a Book Long Buried in the Garden
description: I left my home in Damascus for a life in Europe decades ago, long before the migrant waves of today. At the time, I was an active member of the political left in a country run by the military and the secret police, so I had no real future in Syria. But my main motive for going to Paris in my 20s was to study at the cole des Beaux-Arts and become an artist.

title: You Say Anguria, I Say Cocomero: Italys Many Dialects
description: Say youre shopping at a farmers market in Rome, and youd like to pick up some nice, ripe watermelon. The signs at some stands call it anguria; others say cocomero or melone dacqua.

title: How to Bluff at Cards
description: Build lies on logical narratives. You cant be telling a murder mystery that all of a sudden ends as a comedy, says Chris Moneymaker, who as an amateur bluffed his way to the $2.5 million first-place prize at the World Series of Poker Main Event in 2003 with what one ESPN commentator called the bluff of the century. In poker, a bluff is a bet or raise that gives the false impression of a stronger hand. Bet erratically  in ways that are inconsistent with your pattern of play in previous hands or that dont make sense given the cards on the table  and your story becomes irrational, which will pique opponents curiosity and prompt them to call you out.

title: Letterman Has No Love for Damaged Trump

He took a centrist approach to NBCs Late Night (which he starred in from 1982 to 1993) and at CBSs Late Show (where he was the M.C. from 1993 until his retirement in 2015), holding wide-ranging conversations with President Bill Clinton or Senator John McCain on a given evening, then bringing the satirical hammer down on them the following night.

Thats not even my opinion; it says so right on the box: A party game for horrible people. The website elaborates: Unlike most of the party games youve played before, Cards Against Humanity is as despicable and awkward as you and your friends.

title: 1966: Russia Expels Chinese

It did so in retaliation against the recent ouster of Soviet students from China. The Soviet government expressed regret that China had unilaterally broken a ten-year cultural exchange agreement. It told the Chinese embassy it would consider resuming the student exchanges as soon as the Chinese side displays a readiness to do so. Communist China last month suspended for a year training of all foreign students in China.

title: The Story Behind This Weeks Best Sellers
description: Tyrant in the Machine: Cathy ONeil had been working as a quant at a hedge fund for about a year when the global economy collapsed. In her introduction to Weapons of Math Destruction, No. 5 on the monthly education list and longlisted for the National Book Award, ONeil  who holds a Ph.D. in mathematics from Harvard  recounts how the 2008 crash made her realize the enormous havoc that could be wreaked by mathematicians wielding magic formulas. The crisis showed that computer technology could combine with mathematics to multiply the chaos and misfortune, yet years later we continue to be enthralled by algorithms. We use them in teacher evaluations, hiring decisions, even sentencing rulings in the criminal justice system. We rely on Big Data more than ever before.

title: Redefining the Lower East Side

With a champagne hue to its facade, the building, 242 Broome, is just one piece of Essex Crossing, a $1 billion redevelopment project that will redefine the character of an area that lay fallow for nearly 50 years.

title: In Exile With Don Quixote
description: Of the myriad times since adolescence that I have returned to the story of Don Quixote de la Mancha, there is one I choose to remember  that I cannot help but remember  as we commemorate the 400th anniversary of the death of Miguel de Cervantes. That reading, in October 1973, took place among a distraught group of captive men and women who, like me, had sought asylum in the Argentine Embassy in Santiago, Chile, after the coup that overthrew the democratic government of Salvador Allende.

You can browse previous guides here, and to receive recommendations straight to your inbox, sign up here. Stay tuned for our coming website.

title: After Hurricane Matthew, Devastation in Southern Haiti
description: Hurricane Matthew left a tableau of devastation across southern Haiti, destroying houses, leaving villages under several feet of water and killing more than 800 people, according to a count by Reuters. Photographers captured disturbing images of the aftermath.

title: Popcast: Tyler Glenn at the Crossroads
description: His fiery solo album questions almost everything he used to believe in.

title: After the Kardashian Robbery, the No-Name Hotel Loses Its Anonymity
description: PARIS  Until last Monday morning, it was one of the ultimate insider addresses in Paris.

title: Popcast: Tyler Glenn, a Gay Mormon Pop Star at the Crossroads
description: Listen to this weeks podcast | Subscribe: iTunes | RSS | Stitcher| Audioboom

title: Thomson Reuters to Add Up to 1,500 Jobs in Toronto
description: OTTAWA  Thomson Reuters, the news and digital information company, said on Friday that it planned to add 400 jobs in downtown Toronto over the next two years as part of a northern expansion that could create up to 1,500 jobs.

title: Be Still Among the Redwoods
description: Sit between the trees in a Northern California redwood forest on a warm summer afternoon. Use this location to cultivate a sense of stillness and calm.

title: Awareness at Sunset
description: Perch yourself atop the rolling California hills at Spirit Rock Meditation Center in the San Geronimo Valley. Take a moment to rest as you take in the colors of the setting sun.

title: Awareness at Sunrise
description: Stand by a stream as the sun slowly rises. Behold its beauty and serenity and listen as life wakes up all around you.

title: Meditate by the Ocean
description: Stand on the cliffs of Northern California, take a moment to listen to the sound of ocean waves and see the rugged coastline.

title: Five Paintings Stolen in 2005 Return to Dutch Museum
description: HOORN, The Netherlands  On Thursday morning, officials at the Westfries Museum here used crowbars to pry open wooden crates containing five Dutch Golden Age paintings that had been stolen from the museum more than a decade ago. The crates had been delivered early that morning from Ukraine, where they were discovered in the hands of an ultranationalist militia group last year.

title: A Plea for Haiti
description: To the Editor:

title: A Mother-Daughter Night With Melissa Etheridge
description: How does a rock star begin an evening? She puts in her hearing aids.

title: Think Like a Doctor: A Terrible Stomachache Solved!
description: On Thursday we challenged Well readers to figure out why a 43-year-old woman had such terrible abdominal pain that she lost more than 10 percent of her original body weight over the course of just a few weeks. There were two important clues in her case. First, her pain came on after she ate. And second, the pain improved when she brought her knees up toward her chest. More than 250 of you responded, but only five of you got it right.

title: Showgirls, Pastrami and Candor: Gloria Steinems New York
description: Gloria Steinem started her career as a C.I.A. operative, got her break as a Playboy Bunny, married Christian Bales father and now produces a show for the cable television channel Viceland, the home of Balls Deep and Action Bronson Watches Ancient Aliens. Beyond that, there are some gaps in her rsum.

title: The Economy Is Strong But Slowing
description: The American economy added jobs at a steady pace and wages increased modestly in September. This is generally good news and serves as a counterpoint to the image of a broken-down and failing United States offered by Donald Trump.

title: Nighttime Windows
description: This week, our Voyeur ventured out after dark and found that, with their varied hues of light and glimpses of strangers lives, nighttime windows can be irresistible.

title: Voyeur: Nighttime Windows
description: With their varied hues of light and glimpses of strangers lives, nighttime windows can be irresistible

title: Kosovo: The Road Team
description: SHKODER, Albania  The gleaming Loro Borici Stadium was deserted. Children played on the empty turnstiles. Adults milled about a vegetable market on the edges of the stadium here. There was little to suggest that, later Thursday, it would be the stage for a soccer game of historical importance to the host nation, Kosovo: No posters, flags or other paraphernalia were in evidence. But then again, Shkoder is in Albania, not Kosovo.

title: Haiti Ravaged by Hurricane Matthew
description: Hurricane Matthew was the worst natural disaster to strike the Caribbean nation of Haiti since the earthquake of 2010.

title: Fleeing Threats in Venezuela, and Then a Florida Hurricane
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  The Capriles were seeking asylum again.

title: The Toilet Attendant ... Now Wash Your Hands
description: Julie Verhoeven has customized the public washrooms at this years Frieze London, and will serve as an attendant for the duration of the weekend.

title: Why One Artist Is Spending Frieze London Hiding in the Bathroom
description: Are these toilets unisex? asks a bemused Frieze London fairgoer who inadvertently wanders into the fairs ladies room, and his confusion is understandable: The artist Julie Verhoeven has turned the public bathrooms into the unlikely site for an art intervention. Disruption is very much the intention behind The Toilet Attendant Now Wash Your Hands, in which Verhoeven act as a washroom attendant alongside the art collector Valeria Napoleone. The carpet is confusing everyone, says Verhoeven, gesturing to the gender-disorienting hot pink floor covering in the mens washrooms, and the royal blue in the womens. Its quite telling about the way weve all been brought up. I thought we were all supposed to be art and visually astute. There is signage, she adds gleefully. I guess the pink and blue thing is deeply bred into the psyche.

title: Russia Seeks to Reopen Military Bases in Vietnam and Cuba
description: MOSCOW  Russia is working to re-establish its former military bases in Vietnam and Cuba, a senior official said on Friday, reflecting Moscows growing ambition to reassert itself on the world stage.

title: Ammon Bundy Case as Inkblot Test: What Will Jurors See in His Words?
description: PORTLAND, Ore.  The beard and cowboy hat that defined Ammon Bundys image to Americans on those cold mornings in January are gone. He is cleanshaven now and dressed in ill-fitting jailhouse blue. The federal wildlife refuge that he and other armed militia members occupied for six weeks in Oregons high eastern desert has returned to normal.

title: Why Stews Always Beat Steaks
description: I think that a stew is more interesting than a steak, whether its a beefsteak, a cauliflower steak or a fish steak. In terms of flavor complexity and satisfaction delivered to the diner, a stew always wins, at least for me. The steak is one-dimensional; the stew transcends the sum of its parts.

title: Founder of Overheard LA, Which Pokes Fun at the Citys Pretensions, Is Unmasked
description: After decades as the butt of jokes by Johnny Carson, by Steve Martin, by Larry David  basically, by everyone  Los Angeles may seem beyond satire. But over the last year, the West Coast capital of excess has been a target for parody from an unlikely source: random citizens, courtesy of an Instagram feed called @overheardLA.

title: Your Public Service Ad? Not Here
description: Last year, on a Turkish Airlines flight bound for Istanbul from Tel Aviv, Jo-Ann Mort encountered an agitated Hasidic man who had been assigned the seat next to hers. Ms. Mort overheard him ask another man, a Reform rabbi in the next seat of their row, if they could switch places. Adhering to the strictest interpretation of Jewish law, the Hasidic man did not want to sit beside a woman who was not his wife. The rabbi said no, so the man asked several other passengers to change seats with him until one young woman finally agreed. Writing about the episode later in Haaretz, the Israeli newspaper, Ms. Mort described a sense of profound irritation that left her scolding the young woman for her submission.

title: Confronting My Racist Object
description: (This essay first appeared in the Race/Related newsletter. Sign up here.)

title: 10 Things to Do Now in NYC
description: Its a big city, with plenty to do, see, hear and watch. This guide is a sampling of cultural highlights taking place in New York this weekend and over the week ahead. And theres much more where these came from.

title: At Harlem Cycle, Fitness Classes That Speak to the Soul
description: When Tammeca Rochester met with the fitness instructor Charles Tyler to discuss opening the first boutique cycling studio above 92nd Street, the two clicked immediately, she said.

title: Is the N.F.L.s Concussion Settlement Broken?
description: The neuroscientist Robert Stern gave a keynote address at a scientific conference in Boston recently. He is the director of clinical research at Boston Universitys Chronic Traumatic Encephalopathy Center, which has been at the forefront of the research linking C.T.E.  a disease characterized by mood swings, uncontrolled anger, depression, suicidal tendencies and eventually dementia  to repeated head trauma. A focus of the centers research has been on professional football players.

title: Park Slope, Illustrated
description: Evan Sklars images begin with a photograph. He then uses an iPad app to draw from the original photograph, creating an illustrated version of his neighborhood in Brooklyn.

title: Evan Sklar, a Photographer, Paints Brooklyn Without a Brush
description: Milton Glaser, the graphic artist, once said that drawing was for him a way of distinguishing what was real in the world from his preconceptions of it. If I look at you now and make a decision that Im going to draw you, I suddenly see you for the first time, he said. I havent seen the gradations of color between the bottom of your nose and the top of your lip, but when I decide to draw you, I have to. And so drawing becomes the means by which I understand what Im looking at. For the photographer Evan Sklar, drawing was a reaction to the images he saw on Instagram, which had all started to look the same to him.

title: Safety of Driverless Cars
description: To the Editor:

title: Donald Trumps Tax Records: Other Voices
description: To the Editor:

title: The Israeli-Palestinian Morass
description: To the Editor:

title: Another Celebrity Perk: Free Wedding Dresses
description: The next time you click through a wedding feature on a celebrity website, or flip through a weekly gossip magazine, you may consider that the glamorous, sinfully expensive gown being featured may have been given to, not purchased by, the star wearing it.

title: How Courtney Lavine, a Ballerina, Spends Her Sundays
description: Its going to be a busy fall for Courtney Lavine, a ballerina. Ms. Lavine, a corps de ballet member with American Ballet Theater, is scheduled to perform in Twyla Tharps Brahms-Haydn Variations and Benjamin Millepieds Daphnis and Chloe at Lincoln Center. She will also appear in an advertising campaign for Avons new fragrance, Prima. Ms. Lavine, 27, lives with her Maltese, Oopsie, on the Upper West Side.

title: Review: This Sublime New Dance Work Embraces Wonder
description: MONTCLAIR, N.J.  The choreographer Deborah Hay has been known to ask, of herself and her dancers, What if? A Hay classic: What if where I am is what I need? That spirit of wondering  and of letting a question dangle  infuses her latest work, Figure a Sea, which had its American premiere at Peak Performances here on Thursday. Performed by 20 dancers of the Cullberg Ballet, with an original score by Laurie Anderson, its one sublime hour of asking without needing to know.

title: A Dolls House, Part 2 to Open on Broadway
description: One of Henrik Ibsens most famous heroines, Nora Helmer, is returning to Broadway  but not in A Dolls House.

title: U.S. Says Russia Directed Hacks to Influence Elections
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration on Friday formally accused the Russian government of stealing and disclosing emails from the Democratic National Committee and a range of other institutions and prominent individuals, immediately raising the issue of whether President Obama would seek sanctions or other retaliation.

title: David Bowie as Muse? Why One Composer Says So
description: I always write pieces right up to the last minute, the composer Glenn Branca said in mid-September.

title: At Carnival Fresh Market in Brooklyn, a United Nations for the Palate
description: From the outside, Carnival Fresh Market looks like any other corner produce store. Crates filled with onions, peaches and four-for-$5 mangoes sit stacked, end to end, under a red-and-yellow striped awning.

title: Trump Campaign Shifts $1.8 Million in Ads to Larger Markets
description: Donald J. Trumps campaign is shifting more than $1.8 million in advertising planned in key battleground states for next week, taking money out of small markets and reinvesting in larger markets, according to several media buyers who track political advertisements.

title: Paying $15 Billion for Twitter Will Be Hard for Anyone to Justify
description: Twitters openness to being sold has set off a tweetstorm with a direct message: It will be hard for a new owner to make buying the $15 billion social network stack up.

title: Wells Fargo Isnt the Only Firm That Needs a Lesson
description: Under siege for setting up thousands of phony customer accounts to generate fees, Wells Fargo has taken a beating in Congress and the court of public opinion. Several states have piled on, announcing that they are temporarily cutting their business ties with the bank.

title: Favorite Thanksgiving Recipes From Across Canada
description: Its quieter. Its earlier. And its locally grown. (Sort of.)

title: Review: Fit for a Queen Sees Dynasty Centuries Before the TV Show
description: For those of you who cant wait for the promised reincarnation of the prime-time soap de luxe Dynasty on CW, theres plenty of glamorous backstabbing, diva dissing and sexual double-crossing in downtown New York these days, courtesy of an uptown establishment. And far more than any swanky 1980s television reboot, this production has every right to claim the name Dynasty for itself.

title: Four Things T Editors Are Really Into Right Now
description: I walked through a preview of the artist Pedro Reyess Creative Time project Doomocracy, an expansive, satirical haunted house where each room represents a different late-capitalist horror, last night with a couple of art-inclined pals. Among them was the Modern Painters editor Scott Indrisek, who tweeted this afterward:

title: Voices From a Worsening Afghan War
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  On this day 15 years ago, the United States began a costly war in Afghanistan that in several ways is more grim now than ever before. Now, even as the European Union is preparing to send tens of thousands of Afghan migrants back, war, intimidation and dislocation are a daily reality for many families in Afghanistan.

title: Homes for Sale in New York and New Jersey
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties in the New York region:

title: On the Market in the New York Region
description: This weeks homes include four-bedroom homes in Titusville, N.J., and Montrose, N.Y.

title: How Many Times Have Both Parties Nominated New Yorkers for President?
description: Q. Unless Gary Johnson, the Libertarian Party candidate, starts to catch fire, we seem certain to elect a president from New York this year. How many times have both major parties nominated New Yorkers as candidates, and do those elections share any themes with this years raucous campaign?

title: Richard Peck: Embraced by an Apartment
description: Richard Peck, a decorated author of childrens fiction  the Newbery Medal, the National Humanities Medal, the Edgar Award  lives in a co-op on the Upper East Side with the precise cityscape view he conjured when he was growing up in Decatur, Ill.

title: What I Love | Richard Peck
description: The author of childrens fiction, who has won a Newbery Medal and a National Humanities Medal, lives on the Upper East Side.

title: Blue Jays Take Control of Division Series With Four Home Runs
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.  Yu Darvish brought the Toronto Blue Jays to their knees on Friday at Globe Life Park. For a lineup of sluggers, that was part of the plan.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: Mylan to Settle EpiPen Overpricing Case for $465 Million
description: Mylan, the maker of the allergy treatment EpiPen, said Friday that it had reached a $465 million settlement with the Justice Department and other government agencies over questions on whether the company had overcharged Medicaid for the treatment by improperly classifying it as a generic drug.

title: Ts 50 Best Photos of Fashion Month
description: Highlights from the spring/summer 2017 season  on and off the runway.

title: A Ballerina Goes From Baby Bump to High Jumps
description: The hashtag #bouderbump was familiar to the many followers of the ballerina Ashley Bouders Instagram account. And on May 4, a baby girl followed it:  Violet Storm de Florio. Before that we had seen Ms. Bouder, a technical powerhouse and a principal at New York City Ballet, executing whipping fouett turns four days before her due date. Now, five months after giving birth, she is reclaiming her roles.

title: Fiddling While Venezuela Starves? Bolvar Symphony Opens Carnegie Season
description: Can music do anything when theres nothing to be done?

title: Donald Trump Apology Caps Day of Outrage Over Lewd Tape
description: Donald J. Trump issued an unusual videotaped apology early Saturday after a 2005 recording surfaced that showed him speaking in extraordinarily vulgar terms about women, setting off an uproar in the Republican Party.

title: Review: In Mahler, Philadelphia Orchestra Finds Beauty Amid the Grit
description: PHILADELPHIA  Despite its financial and administrative travails in recent years, including a bankruptcy filing in 2011, the Philadelphia Orchestra has maintained a remarkably high level of artistry. This was never more evident than on Thursday evening, when Simon Rattle led it in a stunning account of Mahlers Sixth Symphony here at Verizon Hall.

title: Sounds From a Gathering
description: When a family of whales from the Eastern Caribbean socializes they make up to 22 different types of codas, some of which can be heard in this recording of several whales.

title: A Whales Coda
description: A recording of the 1+1+3 coda that is made only by sperm whales in the Eastern Caribbean Clan.

title: Solange Knowless Stylist Will Do Anything to Hunt Down a Look
description: We just gravitated toward each other is how Shiona Turini, a freelance stylist and an editor for New York Magazine, described connecting with Solange Knowles in 2012 at Milan Fashion Week.

title: Fire at Sea Strikes a Nerve on the Migrant Crisis: What Can I Do?
description: PARIS  For a film that makes use of long silences, Gianfranco Rosis documentary Fire at Sea, about the tiny Italian island of Lampedusa  for years the European point of arrival for boatloads of North African migrants  has made some noise.

title: The Top 10 Moments From Paris Fashion Week
description: There were big debuts, 80s trends all over the runway  and a shocking crime.

title: Review: This Dance Is a Jolt at the Joyce Theater
description: There was a long moment during the recent premiere of RoseAnne Spradlins X at the Joyce Theater when I wondered if the entire audience would walk out. For the final third (or was it half?) of the 70-minute piece, Kayvon Pourazar, Connor Voss and Asli Bulbul carried metal ballet barres and one another back and forth across the space, over and over. At some point, an audience member yelled, Stop! But the dancers didnt, and it became a live question whether they ever would, as more and more people made a break for the exits.

title: What Happened to North Carolina?
description: In late September, the skies opened over North Carolina. The remnants of Tropical Storm Julia crashed into Bertie County, on the Albemarle Sound inside the barrier islands of the Outer Banks, sending cascades of muddy water into homes and stores and forcing officials to release a herd of bison kept at a local zoo. Gov. Pat McCrory diverted his increasingly struggling re-election campaign to tour the soggy town. He had barely had time to do so before another storm, 130 miles inland, sent several feet of water from the Cape Fear basin racing through Fayetteville.

title: Someone Mailed Feces to Four Philosophers: A Disquisition
description: Philosophy is generally concerned with higher truths. But this week, conversation in the profession turned to decidedly lower-order functions, after word emerged that four philosophers loosely connected through a long-running, multisided argument with one of the fields most vocal figures had been sent packages filled with excrement.

title: Hurricane Matthew, Donald Trump, Nobel Prize: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Canada Today: Giving Thanks, Canadian Style
description: Ottawa, Canada  Were trying something new: Canada Today, a weekly roundup for Canadian readers and anyone else interested in the True North. Tell us what you think and what youd like to see at CanadaToday@nytimes.com. And, using the link below, please subscribe to the email newsletter version.

title: Libya Starts Expanding Oil Exports  for Now, at Least
description: Little more than a week after the OPEC cartel moved to reduce oil supplies on the glutted global market, embattled Libya has reopened a major seaport terminal for oil exports and has announced that it intends to expand production through the rest of the year.

title: Obama Votes in Chicago While on a Fund-Raising Trip
description: CHICAGO  President Obama cast his ballot here Friday, joking with staff members of the Chicago Board of Elections about being 20 years younger than he is.

title: Finn Wittrock: The First Time I Started a Theater Company
description: Wolfe and I can hear the audience gathering on the hill, but we are busy in the Rose Garden, choreographing our sword fight with fresh sticks weve procured from the woods. Head, leg, leg, stab, spin move, Wolfe says.

title: Sweeping Limits on Police Use of Weapons Proposed in Chicago
description: CHICAGO  Police officials here proposed sweeping policy changes on Friday that would limit officers use of firearms and stun guns and emphasize the sanctity of life in an effort to address criticisms that officers have been too quick to fire their weapons and use force, especially against African-Americans.

title: C.E.O. of Male-Escort Site Pleads Guilty to Promoting Prostitution
description: The chief executive of Rentboy.com, who led what federal authorities said was once the nations largest online male-escort service, pleaded guilty on Friday to promoting prostitution.

title: Salesforce Shareholders Besiege Possible Twitter Deal
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The investor pressure began building on Marc Benioff, chief executive of Salesforce.com, two weeks ago.

title: Costa Rican Soccer Official Pleads Guilty in FIFA Corruption Case
description: Eduardo Li, the former president of Costa Ricas soccer association, pleaded guilty to racketeering and corruption charges on Friday, with his conviction the 18th announced by the United States in its criminal prosecutions involving FIFA, the international governing body of soccer.

title: De Blasio, Frustrated, Chooses to Take His Private Feuds Public, Again
description: It had the flavor of a City Hall confessional: For 15 minutes, Mayor Bill de Blasio took pains in a nighttime phone interview to explain why the leader of the nations largest city would embark on a seemingly hopeless war with The New York Post, one of the most recognizable tabloid newspapers in the world.

title: Jane Pauley Is Back  Again
description: Shortly after Jane Pauleys daytime talk show was canceled 11 years ago, she thought that might be it for her.

title: Those Who Dont Understand Trump Are Doomed to Repeat Him
description: Conservatives are deeply split over the rise of Donald J. Trump. Some see it as apocalyptic; others as refreshing. But two pieces of conventional wisdom are largely unchallenged by either side.

title: John Kerry Calls for War Crimes Investigation of Russia and Assad Government
description: WASHINGTON  Secretary of State John Kerry on Friday called for a war crimes investigation of the bombing campaign by Russia and the Assad government in the Syrian civil war, charging that they were continuing to attack hospitals as part of a deliberate strategy to terrorize civilians.

title: Amanda Kessel Is Making Up for Lost Time, in a Hurry
description: NEWARK  At a recent New York Riveters practice, Amanda Kessel spent the time allotted for water breaks circling the ice, looking as if she were itching to start the next drill.

title: In Lane-Closing Trial, Defense Questions a Key Witnesss Motivations
description: NEWARK  Three weeks of testimony in federal court here have focused mostly on the scheming behind the politically motivated lane closings at the George Washington Bridge in 2013.

title: Billy Bush Says Hes Ashamed by Lewd Talk With Donald Trump
description: For Billy Bush, the presidential cousin and genial Hollywood interviewer, 2016 was supposed to be a transformative year.

title: Transcript: Mayor Bill de Blasio on The New York Post
description: Mayor Bill de Blasios feud with The New York Post took an unusual turn on Thursday, as he blatantly ignored questions from the papers City Hall bureau chief during a news conference, while criticizing The Posts practices.

title: Channeling Their Inner Cavaliers, Indians Push the Red Sox to the Brink
description: CLEVELAND  The most popular man in all of northeast Ohio strode onto the grass at Progressive Field on Friday wearing a red Indians cap and a navy jersey. He had come to spread some of his talismanic powers.

title: Newly Released Hillary Clinton Emails Offer Glimpse at Husbands Advice
description: WASHINGTON  The State Department on Friday began releasing thousands of emails the F.B.I. collected as part of its investigation into Hillary Clintons use of a private email server while secretary of state, but many were duplicates or near duplicates of messages already made public.

title: Peace Prize Seen Not Necessarily for Achievements, but Hopes
description: LONDON  Just weeks after President Obama won the Nobel Peace Prize in 2009, he ordered 30,000 additional American troops to Afghanistan.

title: The Sleaziness of Donald Trump
description: And so we have now heard the Republican nominee for president of the United States bragging about repeated sexual assault.

title: Donald Trump, Groper in Chief
description: Jill Harths first concern with Donald Trumps hands wasnt that they were small. Its that they were everywhere.

title: Brock Yates, Writer and Rebel Who Created the Cannonball Run, Dies at 82
description: Brock Yates, an automotive journalist who founded an anarchic, cross-country road race in the 1970s, then fictionalized it in the script for the 1981 Burt Reynolds film The Cannonball Run, died on Wednesday in Batavia, N.Y. He was 82.

title: For Britains Brexit Bunch, the Party Just Ended
description: LONDON  For those blithely inclined toward the view that Britain would somehow find a way to sever its relationship with the European Union free of drama or financial consequences  like canceling a car rental reservation, with a tad more paperwork  Friday was a sobering day of reckoning.

title: In Rare Encounter, a Private U.S. Delegation Visits North Korea
description: A private American delegation visited North Korea last month  two weeks after the countrys most recent nuclear bomb test  in a low-key humanitarian mission carried out with the Obama administrations support, the organizer and the White House said Friday.

title: As Hurricane Matthew Blows Past, Florida Sighs With Relief
description: HUTCHINSON ISLAND, Fla.  As Hurricane Matthew doused the north Florida coast with floodwaters, high winds and rain, the mood across much of the state shifted from alarm to relief on Friday as the worst of the storm passed by without the catastrophic effects forecasters had predicted and some residents began to return to areas that had been evacuated.

title: Cubs Enjoy Coveted Time Slot for Story Line 108 Years in the Making
description: If this is the year the Chicago Cubs capture the World Series, a team known for its long tradition of day games will be a fixture of prime time.

title: Donald Trumps Lewd Comments About Women
description: In a 2005 recording obtained by The Washington Post before the presidential election, Donald J. Trump talks about women in vulgar terms to Billy Bush, then the host of Access Hollywood.

title: Detroit House Preserves Memories of a Little-Known Part of Rosa Parkss Life
description: When Rosa Parks stayed there in the late 1950s, the house on South Deacon Street in southwest Detroit was modest  two stories high, with white shutters and a chimney peeking from the top.

title: Toll Rises by Hour in Haiti Amid Ruin Left by Hurricane Matthew
description: LES CAYES, Haiti  A hospital now a shambles, its floors swamped with garbage and water, absent electricity. People living in the streets, camped in front of their broken homes. Buildings smashed into splinters. Farm fields flattened, portending a hard year ahead.

title: A Bill of Rights for Housecleaners
description: Chicago  For eight years, I worked as a housecleaner for a millionaire who lived in the Gold Coast neighborhood of Chicago. I took the bus across town three times a week, often to work in an empty house because my employer was frequently away, traveling for business.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: You know Im automatically attracted to beautiful  I just start kissing them. Its like a magnet. Just kiss. I dont even wait.

title: No Hockey or J.Lo, but Vladimir Putin Still Gets 450 Roses for His Birthday
description: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia celebrated his 64th birthday on Friday with an outsize gift from his countrys Parliament: a bouquet of 450 roses, one from each member of the State Duma, or lower house of Parliament.

title: Jim Kilroy, Real Estate Developer Renowned as a Yachtsman, Dies at 94
description: Jim Kilroy, a prominent California real estate developer who gained even wider renown for his exploits at sea, as a champion yachtsman sailing the largest class of racing boats, died on Sept. 29 in Los Angeles. He was 94.

title: Period of a Revolution
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Saturday crossword puzzles are tough, but the reward, after youve untangled the knotty clues, are long strips of lively entries that are fun to put into the grid. Add back in the satisfaction of actually untangling those knotty clues and you have one terrific puzzle.

title: Howard Dean: How to Move Beyond the Two-Party System
description: I stand with Hillary Clinton in the presidential race. Others will back Donald J. Trump. But polls suggest that almost one in 10 voters are making a different choice by supporting the Libertarian candidate, Gary Johnson, the Green Party candidate, Jill Stein, or another candidate.

title: President of City College Quits Abruptly Amid Scrutiny of Her Finances
description: Lisa S. Coico, the president of the City College of New York, the flagship of the largest urban public university in the country, abruptly resigned on Friday, a day after The New York Times contacted officials with questions about her administrations handling of more than $150,000 of her personal expenses.

title: Elaine Lustig Cohen, Designer Who Left Her Mark Everywhere, Dies at 89
description: Elaine Lustig Cohen, whose prolific graphic design career began  almost accidentally  with signage for the celebrated Seagram Building in Manhattan, died on Tuesday at her home in Manhattan. She was 89.

title: New Jerseys Gas Tax Wont Be the Second-Lowest in the U.S. For Long
description: TRENTON, N.J. (AP)  Gas in New Jersey is about to get more expensive after lawmakers voted on Friday to raise the state tax on it by 23 cents per gallon to replenish an expired transportation trust fund.

title: Dale Schenk, Who Saw Immune System as Weapon Against Alzheimers, Dies at 59
description: Dale B. Schenk, a scientist and industry leader whose discoveries opened new paths into research on Alzheimers disease, died on Sept. 30 at his home in Hillsborough, Calif. He was 59.

title: Walter Darby Bannard, Artist of the Color Field Movement, Dies at 82
description: Walter Darby Bannard, a Color Field painter whose elegant, severe abstract paintings of the late 1950s and early 60s were the springboard for a lifetimes exploration of color, form and the physicality of paint, died on Sunday in Miami. He was 82.

title: Austin Kalish, a Writer of Maude Abortion Episode, Dies at 95
description: Austin Kalish, a television writer who took on sensitive social issues in his scripts in the 1970s, including the fiercely debated abortion episode of the Norman Lear sitcom Maude, died on Wednesday in Woodland Hills, Calif. He was 95.

title: The Magic of That Wiffle Ball Sound
description: I grew up a St. Louis Cardinals fan in rural Mattoon, Ill., and played baseball in the backyard with friends. But there was a fence, and an angry dog behind it. If a baseball sailed into the neighbors yard, it was lost. And the cost of lost baseballs added up fast.

title: Dodgers Defeat Nationals in a Pitchers Duel That Wasnt
description: WASHINGTON  The natural inclination with every passing base runner against Clayton Kershaw in the fourth and fifth innings on Friday was to look at the visitors bullpen in left field at Nationals Park, which was an odd feeling with the best pitcher in the sport on the mound.

title: Broadcast Booth Blues
description: With the end of Major League Baseballs 2016 regular season came a special kind of silence: Dodgers fans who had been listening to the golden voice of Vin Scully since 1950 will no longer hear his poetic descriptions harmonizing with baseballs artistry. One of the great broadcasters in sports has retired (he wont be doing the Dodgers post-season, which begins this weekend).

title: Leaked Speech Excerpts Show a Hillary Clinton at Ease With Wall Street
description: In lucrative paid speeches that Hillary Clinton delivered to elite financial firms but refused to disclose to the public, she displayed an easy comfort with titans of business, embraced unfettered international trade and praised a budget-balancing plan that would have required cuts to Social Security, according to documents posted online Friday by WikiLeaks.

title: Donald Trump: King of the Old Boys Club, and Perhaps Its Destroyer
description: Lewd was apparently not a strong enough word for the editors of The Washington Post when they tried to describe the contents of a recording they had acquired, in which Donald J. Trump is heard in a 2005 conversation with Billy Bush, the Access Hollywood host; they went with extremely lewd in their headline.

title: Haitis New Catastrophe
description: Hurricane Matthew battered Florida and points north on Friday, having already wreaked deadly havoc in the Bahamas, Jamaica, Cuba and Haiti. All those along its path need aid and protection and, when the wind and rain end, swift help in rebuilding.

title: Mayor de Blasios Media Freeze-Out
description: If Mayor Bill de Blasio has decided that he is going to answer questions only from real media outlets, and not The New York Post, why doesnt he just go all the way? Revoke The Posts credentials, and bar its reporters from City Hall and make an example of them. Let the other reporters learn not to offend His Honor. And if they dont learn, he can stop taking all questions.

title: Queens Prosecutor Releases 71-Page Report on a Fatal Police Shooting
description: When a New York City police officer uses lethal force, prosecutors routinely examine the circumstances leading up to the death and whether the officer had operated lawfully. Often what they release to the public is limited to a brief statement saying whether they had decided to press charges. Or, if the matter is taken to a grand jury, the process is cloaked in secrecy.

title: Hurricane Matthew Blamed for 11 Deaths in U.S.; Carolinas and Georgia Hit With Severe Flooding
description: Hurricane Matthew made landfall Saturday morning near McClellanville, S.C., about 40 miles northeast of Charleston, as a Category 1 storm with sustained winds of 75 miles per hour. Georgia, South Carolina and North Carolina were lashed with torrential rains as the storm sideswiped those states on its path up the coast.

title: Corrections: October 8, 2016
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Cubs Jon Lester Shuts Door on Giants, Who Once Came Knocking for Him
description: CHICAGO  Within a month of winning their third World Series in five years in 2014, the San Francisco Giants sent eight people to Jon Lesters house in Atlanta to make a pitch for the prized pitcher on the free-agent market.

title: Joan Marie Johnson, of the Singing Trio the Dixie Cups, Dies at 72
description: Joan Marie Johnson, a founding member of the musical trio the Dixie Cups, whose hit Chapel of Love unseated the Beatles from the top of the Billboard 100 in 1964, died on Sunday at her home in New Orleans. She was 72.

title: Transcript: Donald Trumps Taped Comments About Women
description: Following is an unedited transcript of the tape in which Donald J. Trump repeatedly made vulgar comments about women. Mr. Trump was filmed talking to the television personality Billy Bush of Access Hollywood on the set of Days of Our Lives, where Mr. Trump was making a cameo appearance. They are later joined by the actress Arianne Zucker. The transcription is by Penn Bullock of The New York Times.

title: Trump Responds in 2016 to Outrage Over Comments
description: In a statement, Donald J. Trump said that vulgar remarks he made in an Access Hollywood tape in 2005 about women dont reflect who he is.

title: Whats on TV Saturday: 45 Years, Carol, and Lin-Manuel Miranda on S.N.L.
description: Showtime devotes the evening to women in love, with Oscar-nominated performances by Charlotte Rampling in 45 Years and Cate Blanchett and Rooney Mara in Carol. And Lin-Manuel Miranda makes his Saturday Night Live hosting debut.

title: Transcript of Donald Trumps Videotaped Apology
description: Following is an unedited transcript of Donald J. Trumps statement early Saturday apologizing for vulgar comments in a video made public on Friday. The transcription is by Michael Gold and Penn Bullock of The New York Times.

title: Donald Trumps Apology That Wasnt
description: For hours on Friday night, the political world waited for the rarest of expressions from Donald J. Trump  a heartfelt apology.

title: Paul Ryan and Mitch McConnell Reject Donald Trumps Words, Over and Over, but Not His Candidacy
description: How the two top Republicans in Congress have responded to Mr. Trumps comments.

title: Obviously, Marital Vows Mean Nothing to Him
description: Here are the top 10 comments of the week on our digital platforms, as selected by our readers and the journalists who moderate nearly every comment.

title: An Investors Plan to Transplant Private Health Care in Africa
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  The eyes of the private equity investor lit up as he strode across the empty floor of a recently built hospital here. There was not much to see: a stretch of unfinished concrete, and steel bars pushed into a corner.

title: Inside Swarovskis World
description: At the Alpine headquarters of the 121-year-old crystal maker, sparkle now competes with Silicon Valley as the company refashions itself as an incubator.

title: Swarovski, Maker of All Things Bejeweled, Tries On a Hoodie
description: WATTENS, Austria  A group of millennial programmers swapped jokes recently in their offices well-stocked kitchen while preparing salads for a weekly barbecue. Others mingled around a new foosball table, playfully arguing over the prospective teams.

title: Portraits of Pot Pets
description: The cats and dogs (and one turtle) take medical marijuana for various ailments. Our photographer captured them soon after they had gotten a dosage.

title: Pets on Pot: The Newest Customer Base for Medical Marijuana
description: When Lisa Mastramico needed relief for her ailing tabby, Little Kitty, she turned to an unlikely source: marijuana.

title: W.N.B.A. Stars Try to Move Up to Fashions Front Row
description: It should have been a breakthrough moment: Swin Cash, a former forward for the New York Liberty of the W.N.B.A., was on the cover of Sports Illustrated last spring, wearing not a uniform, but a red silk chiffon Michael Kors dress and a Hollywood smile for its 2016 Fashionable 50 roundup.

title: Awkward Sex, Onscreen and Off
description: Perhaps youve seen the new TV series whose pilot episode begins this way: A man and a woman are having sex, but something soon goes awry, and the whole production wraps up on an ungainly, awkward note.

title: Memories of a Secret C.I.A. Prison
description: Khaled al-Sharif spent two years in a secret C.I.A. prison, accused of having ties to Al Qaeda. He tells New York Times correspondent Sheri Fink what happened there, and how the experience continues to affect him.

title: How U.S. Torture Left a Legacy of Damaged Minds
description: Before the United States permitted a terrifying way of interrogating prisoners, government lawyers and intelligence officials assured themselves of one crucial outcome. They knew that the methods inflicted on terrorism suspects would be painful, shocking and far beyond what the country had ever accepted. But none of it, they concluded, would cause long lasting psychological harm.

title: A Little Variety
description: VARIETY PUZZLES  This weeks puzzles include:

title: Farhads and Mikes Week in Tech: Samsungs Exploding Products and Twitters Fizzling Deal
description: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry.

title: To Redefine Homestretch, Hillary Clinton Cues the Children
description: The negative tone and vicious political attacks that have cluttered commercial breaks disappear, replaced by soothing music and home videos of children marking their growth against wall rulers, in a new ad from Hillary Clintons campaign titled Measure.

title: Can Condo Boards Ensure Secret Ballots?
description: Q: I live in a small condominium in Baiting Hollow, N.Y., where everyone knows one another. When we vote at our annual meeting, two volunteer unit owners count the ballots, so our votes are not really secret. After last years election, I received a nasty anonymous letter in the mail about my vote. The lack of secrecy in our voting process hampers our ability to vote freely and affects our relationship with the board. Other condo communities have a secret double-envelope system similar to the one used for absentee ballots. Shouldnt that be a legal requirement?

title: Sign of Thaw With Iran: American Cellphones Ringing in Tehran
description: TEHRAN  Rushing for a plane to Tehran because of a family emergency, the Iranian-American businessman stuffed his mobile phone into his carry-on, forgetting to turn it off.

title: Review: Bob Dylan and the Rolling Stones, Electric, Not Just Nostalgic, at Desert Trip
description: INDIO, CA  Two names from the baby-boomer pantheon, the Rolling Stones and Bob Dylan, opened the Desert Trip festival on Friday night, starting a weekend of six bands led by songwriters who first forged their reputations in the 1960s. Saturday brings Paul McCartney and Neil Young; Sunday, the Who and Roger Waters (whose 1960s band was Pink Floyd), and the whole lineup repeats next weekend.

title: Conflict at Work? Empathy Can Smooth Ruffled Feathers
description: The workplace, like almost all places where people interact, can be a petri dish of conflict. Offensive remarks, unrealistic demands, people taking credit for others work, bullying  the transgressions that occur can take many forms. They also have the potential to escalate out of control and permanently damage relationships.

title: A Ship Inspector Who Brings a Bit of the Barre to the Bilge
description: Helen Gault, 34, is an apprentice weld inspector for Newport News Shipbuilding in Newport News, Va.

title: A Bean Bag Blowout, and Then a Deafening Silence
description: In this episode, a Haggler intervention and then a pair of updates about previous columns. There is a lot of ground to cover and consumer justice to dispense. So lets go.

title: What Went Awry at Wells Fargo? The Beaten Path of a Toxic Culture
description: A company discovers that its employees have been behaving badly, even unethically. Regulators swoop in to investigate. Public outrage grows. Company executives express shock at the revelations and assert that they never directed the staff to act in such a reprehensible way.

title: Variety Puzzle: Split Decisions
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  You dont need me for this, but I hope youll try Fred Piscops Split Decisions. These variety puzzles are so much fun. Print it out and take it outside to solve, so you can enjoy the beautiful fall weather were having. Or set yourself up in a comfy place at home with a warm beverage and make this your morning activity. You wont regret it.

title: Paul Ryan, Reluctant Supporter, Weighs Response to Donald Trumps Remarks
description: For months, Speaker Paul D. Ryan had chosen to remain largely silent, hoping that his partys nominee for president would simply get across the finish line, dragging congressional Republicans across with him.

title: Selling Shampoo, Eye Cream and a Chemical Crackdown
description: The last time Congress thoroughly overhauled the regulation of personal care products like cosmetics and shampoo, World War II had not yet begun.

title: Rangers Best-Laid Plans Go Awry When the Playoffs Begin
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.  This, it seemed, was the team the Texas Rangers had been trying for so long to build. They had two aces atop their rotation, a deep and versatile lineup, a healthy mix of youth and experience, and a stable bullpen, along with home-field advantage throughout the postseason.

title: Lewd Donald Trump Tape Is a Breaking Point for Many in the G.O.P.
description: WASHINGTON  Republican leaders began to abandon Donald J. Trump by the dozens on Saturday after the release of a video showing him speaking of women in vulgar sexual terms, delivering a punishing blow to his campaign and plunging the party into crisis a month before the election.

title: Elizabeth Michelis and Benjamin Litman: An 8th Grade Flame, Relit
description: Elizabeth Ann Michelis, a daughter of Dr. Mary Ann E. Michelis and Dr. Michael F. Michelis of Tenafly, N.J., was married Oct. 8 to Benjamin Stephan Litman, a son of Helena Litman of Manhattan and the late Jack T. Litman. Katherine Jeddah Vailakis, an interfaith officiant ordained by the New Seminary, officiated at Wave Hill, the public garden in the Bronx.

title: A Guarded Cultures Old and New Ways
description: In Bhutan, a small nation with centuries of Buddhist tradition in conflict resolution, a new law school will incorporate those values in its training.

title: Centuries of Buddhist Tradition Make Room for Bhutans First Law School
description: HAA, Bhutan  Under the gaze of the Buddhist god of wisdom, embodied in the form of a craggy hillside here, an American academic stood in front of 500 teenagers and posed a simple question: What does a lawyer do?

title: Jets Seeking a Sharpness Theyll Need Sunday
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Despite off-season sessions, training camp and now one-quarter of the regular season, the Jets (1-3) have been plagued by miscommunication and missed assignments that they will have to fix to have any chance in Sundays road game against the Pittsburgh Steelers (3-1).

title: Scenes From Hurricane Matthews Capricious Path
description: It was first noticed as a bit of meteorological arcana. An alert from the National Hurricane Center at 2 p.m. on Sept. 22 noted that a tropical wave had been detected moving off the west coast of Africa but gave it little likelihood of developing into a major storm.

title: Abbie Sorrendino and Andrew Brenner: A Train Crash and a New Outlook
description: Abbie Marie Sorrendino and Andrew Ryan Brenner were married Oct. 8 in Ithaca, N.Y. Liam Fitzsimmons, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated at Willard Straight Hall at Cornell University.

title: What Options Does the U.S. Have After Accusing Russia of Hacks?
description: WASHINGTON  Now that the White House has formally accused Russia of meddling in the presidential election with cutting-edge cyberattacks and age-old information warfare, devising a response might seem fairly easy: unleash the governments cyberwarriors to give the Kremlin a dose of its own malware.

title: Hurricane Matthew Loses Strength
description: Hurricane Matthew made landfall on Saturday morning about 30 miles northeast of Charleston, S.C., as a Category 1 storm with winds of 75 miles per hour. It was pushing toward North Carolina.

title: Healthy and Rested, Lynx Star Lindsay Whalen Is Primed for W.N.B.A. Finals
description: MINNEAPOLIS  The Minnesota Lynx never let birthdays pass quietly. Lindsay Whalen sees to that.

title: Why Republicans Are Probably Stuck With Donald Trump
description: The recording that emerged on Friday revealing Donald J. Trump speaking in vulgar and demeaning terms about women prompted extraordinary backlash from Democrats and Republicans, raising questions about whether the Republican Party could dump its nominee at the last minute and find someone more viable a month before Election Day.

title: I.O.C. Expands WADAs Authority to Lead Antidoping Efforts
description: With the Russian doping scandal still roiling international sports and dividing its leaders, Olympic officials met in Switzerland on Saturday to discuss overhauling the worlds antidoping system. They emerged with a plan to increase the power of the World Anti-Doping Agency, affirming that organizations central role in the fight against cheating.

title: Nationals Build a Contender, a Neighborhood and a Legacy
description: WASHINGTON  Kirk Cousins, the Washington Redskins quarterback, stood atop the Nationals dugout in full baseball gear on Friday to rouse the crowd for its playoff opener.

title: A Weakened Hurricane Matthew Still Delivers Flooding and Power Failures
description: ST. AUGUSTINE, Fla.  Sabine Juskowiak looked at the display case that, just a few days ago, showcased dozens of colorful French macarons. She surveyed the flooded shop floor, and she found it hard to believe that her store was only two months old.

title: Hurricane Matthews Trail of Damage
description: As the cleanup began in states where the storm came and left, the authorities urged people to remain cautious and to be patient.

title: A High Holy Call for Lox, and Old Hands to Slice It, at Zabars
description: To hear more audio stories from publishers like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Womens Table Tennis World Cup Debuts in the United States
description: PHILADELPHIA  When Lily Zhang visited the White House with other Summer Olympians late last month, she had a chance to speak with President Obama.

title: Among the Post-Liberals
description: THE Western system  liberal, democratic, capitalist  has been essentially unchallenged from the inside for decades, its ideological rivals discredited or tamed. Marxists retreated to academic fastnesses, fascists to online message boards, and Western Christianity accepted pluralism and abandoned throne-and-altar dreams.

title: Whats God Got to Do With It?
description: Chapel Hill, N.C.  The first debate between Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump featured plenty of magical thinking, but it was a nonreligious event. Neither candidate mentioned God. The second debate may be no different: Voters see Mr. Trump as either a prophet or an angel of death, but the only religion that interests him is his own faith in his winning temperament.

title: Is Idealism Missing From the Presidential Campaign?
description: Readers discuss David Brookss lament that there is no uplift in the presidential race.

title: The Nobel Give Peace a Chance Prize
description: The history of second-guessing the Nobel Peace Prize is a rich one. The awards to Yasir Arafat, Yitzhak Rabin, Shimon Peres, Le Duc Tho (who refused to accept it), Henry Kissinger, Jimmy Carter, Al Gore and Barack Obama, among others, all caused a stir in their day.

title: Racial Profiling in Preschool
description: That black adolescents receive harsher disciplinary punishments at school than their white peers for the same offenses is troubling enough. But federal data showing that even at the preschool level black students are nearly four times as likely to be suspended as their white peers is especially shocking. What it suggests is that racial biases are creeping into classrooms filled with 4-year-olds and that schools are effectively criminalizing black children, particularly boys, when they are barely out of diapers.

title: The Lost Cultures of Whales
description: Aboard the Balaena, Caribbean  I am alone on deck, my headphones filled with the sounds of the deep ocean. I have been tracking the sperm whales since 4 a.m. Now the island of Dominica imposes its dark shape in front of the rising sun.

title: Hillary Clintons Poisoned Prize
description: Perhaps something extraordinary will happen in the second debate, or in the third. Maybe theres some other surprise in the offing. Barring that, it really does look and feel as if Hillary Clinton is wrapping this thing up. I expect that on Nov. 9, the morning after the vote, well be talking about the election of the first female president of the worlds most powerful nation.

title: Surveillance in the Post-Obama Era
description: During his 2008 campaign, President Obama vowed to assert greater oversight of the massive surveillance apparatus built in the wake of the Sept. 11 attacks, arguing that the United States needed to strike a better balance between privacy and security and that all intelligence programs should be lawful.

title: From Voting Rights to Voting Wrongs
description: In August, when a divided Supreme Court let stand an appeals court decision striking down North Carolinas photo ID requirement for voters, the matter might have seemed settled. The provision, which requires voters to present government-issued photo identification, strikes directly at people who dont have drivers licenses  the states poor and disabled, young adults and the elderly, and particularly minorities.

title: Donald Goes to the Dogs
description: WHEN a man knows he is to be hanged, Samuel Johnson once said, it concentrates his mind wonderfully.

title: Tough Donald Trump Coverage, if a Little Late
description: Updated from the print version to include news of an audio tape of Donald Trump.

title: Shakespeare Explains the 2016 Election
description: In the early 1590s, Shakespeare sat down to write a play that addressed a problem: How could a great country wind up being governed by a sociopath?

title: Return to the Teenage Brain
description: Theres a reason adults dont pick up Japanese or learn how to kite surf. Its ridiculously hard. In stark contrast, young people can learn the most difficult things relatively easily. Polynomials, Chinese, skateboarding  no problem!

title: Laura Benanti
description: Laura Benanti is a Tony Award-winning actress and singer who most recently appeared in the Broadway revival of She Loves Me. She has also had many roles on television, including stints on Law and Order, Nashville and now Supergirl.

title: Tax Me. Please.
description: Tax opposition has been the organizing principle of Republican politics since the 1970s, from the property tax revolt to the Taxed Enough Already rhetoric of the Tea Party. But the visibility of these conservative mobilizations have disguised an important truth: Americans share a fundamental civic commitment to taxpaying.

title: Political Futures
description: Wall Street fears a Trump presidency was the main message of Whos Afraid of Trump? The Markets by Justin Wolfers of the University of Michigan (The Upshot, Economic View, Oct. 2). As evidence, Professor Wolfers cited a rally in overnight futures markets during the Sept. 26 presidential debate, a rally he attributed to a reduced chance of Donald J. Trumps election.

title: On the Trail: Week of Oct. 2
description: Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump met with church and community leaders across the country and held rallies this week.

title: Colombian Opposition to Peace Deal Feeds Off Gay Rights Backlash
description: For the presidents many opponents, it was never just about derailing the peace deal.

title: Carson Wentzs Fast Success Animates the Eagles and Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA  Eight blocks north of where Philadelphia Eagles fans peered through a fence and shrubbery to watch Carson Wentz practice on Thursday, an entrepreneur had set up a card table along South Broad Street and piled it high with green Wentz 11 T-shirts.

title: Donald and Billy on the Bus
description: Its Billy Bushs snickering that really gets to me. In the video from 2005, published Friday by The Washington Post, you can hear Mr. Bush (first cousin to George W.) wheezing ecstatically as Donald J. Trump brags, inadvertently into a hot mic, about sexually harassing and groping women. The pair, along with a passel of unidentified men, are on a bus en route to film an Access Hollywood segment with the actress Arianne Zucker.

title: After Water Fiasco, Trust of Officials Is in Short Supply in Flint
description: FLINT, Mich.  By the sunken standards of life in Flint, Kenneth Glover is lucky.

title: How Donald Trump Could Send Republicans Crashing Down
description: You do not need a statistical model to know that Donald J. Trump is in a lot of trouble.

title: John McCain Withdraws Support for Donald Trump After Disclosure of Recording
description: Senator John McCain, the 2008 Republican presidential nominee, withdrew his support on Saturday for Donald J. Trump as the Republican Party descended into chaos. On Friday, a recording was released showing Mr. Trump speaking about women in lewd and degrading terms.

title: Roslyn Litman, Antitrust Lawyer and Civil Liberties Advocate, Dies at 88
description: Roslyn Litman, a tenacious civil liberties advocate whose groundbreaking court victories included the removal of a holiday Nativity display from a public courthouse and an antitrust judgment against professional basketball for blackballing a player, died on Tuesday in Pittsburgh. She was 88.

title: Bangladesh Reports Killing 11 Militants in Raids
description: DHAKA, Bangladesh  Eleven militants were killed on Saturday in three separate raids on the outskirts of Dhaka, law enforcement officials said, in the deadliest day of a monthslong crackdown on Islamist groups.

title: Saudi-Led Airstrikes Blamed for Massacre at Funeral in Yemen
description: SANA, Yemen  Fighter jets from a Saudi-led military coalition repeatedly bombed a crowded reception hall in Sana where mourners were gathered after a funeral on Saturday, killing more than 100 people and wounding hundreds of others, according to Yemeni health officials and witnesses.

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: Cant Find a Plan on HealthCare.gov? One May Be Picked for You.
description: WASHINGTON  The federal government will choose health plans for hundreds of thousands of consumers whose insurers have left the Affordable Care Act marketplace unless those people opt out of the laws exchanges or select plans on their own, under a new policy to make sure consumers maintain coverage in 2017.

title: Kurdish Politician Who Vanished in Turkey Turns Up in Iraq
description: ISTANBUL  A Kurdish politician who had been missing from southeastern Turkey since May resurfaced in Iraq on Friday after months of speculation that the Turkish authorities had detained him.

title: The Desert Trippers: Old, Young, Nostalgic and Adventurous
description: Indio, Calif.  On Friday at Desert Trip, ahead of opening night sets by Bob Dylan and the Rolling Stones, good vibes wafted across the expansive Empire Polo Club here.

title: Syria Provokes an American Anxiety: Is U.S. Power Really So Special?
description: What to do about Syria?

title: Movie Doubles
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  A punny theme by Michael Ashley today, with some lively fill, like JOLTIN JOE, CRISIS MODE and GIANT SQUID balanced by quite a few short entries of less-than-desirable fill (AS IN, ALERO, SSR, ISR, ISO, OSS, SSA, SSGTS, EXE).

title: Showing How Art Critical of Malaysian Premier Thrived During His Rule
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia  Mahathir Mohamad, who transformed this country of paddy fields and rubber plantations into a modern economy of factories, highways and skyscrapers, is known as much for his bold economic vision as for his intolerance of anybody who got in his way.

title: Navys Upset of Houston Tightens the National Title Picture
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md.  Sixth-ranked Houston lost to Navy on a rain-soaked field Saturday, 46-40, all but certainly eliminating the chance for a team from outside the so-called Power Five conferences to qualify for the College Football Playoff this season.

title: 2 Police Officers Are Shot and Killed in Palm Springs, Calif.
description: The police in Palm Springs, Calif., are mourning two officers who were shot and killed on Saturday while responding to a call about a domestic disturbance. One of the victims was a young mother and the other a veteran months away from retirement.
