title: Seeing Nothing to Live For as Haiti Seeks a Body Count After Hurricane Matthew
description: PORT-SALUT, Haiti  The loss in this coastal town is all but entire. Dead animals float in tidal pools. Cinder-block heaps mark where homes once stood. Trees, stripped of leaves, branches and tops, impale the earth like ragged posts.

title: Dodgers Hill and Nationals Roark Conquer Struggles and Morph Into Starters
description: WASHINGTON  Part of what makes baseball unique is the winding career paths of the players. They hail from all over the world. Some signed with teams as 16-year-olds. Some went to college. Some toiled in the minor leagues for many years.

title: Donald Trumps Conduct Was Excused Again and Again. But Not This Time.
description: When Donald J. Trump promised to turn Muslims away from American shores, they wagged their fingers.

title: Women React With Fury to Donald Trumps Remarks, but Some Offer Support
description: WASHINGTON  Sandra Trafton, a financial consultant from Pittsburgh, suspects there are plenty of men who crassly discuss womens looks and their own sexual pursuits in private. But she prefers not to give them so much as a thought, and has largely succeeded  until now.

title: Donald Trumps Long Record of Degrading Women
description: Donald J. Trumps comments and behavior toward women have been the subject of criticism over the course of his presidential campaign. The revelation on Friday that Mr. Trump spoke about women in vulgar and degrading terms was the latest in a string of disclosures in which the Republican presidential nominee has been accused of unwelcome advances, unsettling workplace conduct and lewd comments. Below is a look at some of those episodes as reported by The New York Times:

title: Men Say Trumps Remarks on Sex and Women Are Beyond the Pale
description: That (some) men talk crudely (sometimes) about sex and womens anatomies comes as news to few people who have gone through puberty.

title: Wolfgang Suschitzky, Photographer and Cinematographer, Dies at 104
description: Wolfgang Suschitzky, an Austrian-born photographer and cinematographer who was a key figure in a British film movement of the 1930s and 40s that saw documentaries as a force for social good, died on Friday at his home in London. He was 104.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: I am living this kind of depression. Im not normal anymore.

title: Pitchers Swings, and Their Throws, Keep Cubs Rolling Past Giants
description: CHICAGO  Baseball is the sport where it is all supposed to even out, where those blistering liners and broken-bat bloopers balance out in the ledger of the long run.

title: Camille Balsan, Nicholas Rutherfurd
description: Camille Mathilde Rene Balsan, a daughter of Donna M. Balsan of Paris and the late Humbert J. Balsan, was married Oct. 8 to Nicholas Morton Rutherfurd, a son of the late Jody J. Rutherfurd, who lived in New York, and the late Morton A. Rutherfurd, who lived in Woodbridge, Conn. The Rev. Anita Gordon, a Unitarian Universalist minister, led a nondenominational ceremony at the home of Diane and Hank Louis, an aunt and uncle of the bride, in Park City, Utah.

title: Chlo Andrus, Martin Bringmann
description: Chlo Marie Andrus, a daughter of Sheila Moore Andrus and Bishop Marc H. Andrus of San Francisco, was married Oct. 8 to Martin Bringmann, a son of Martina P. Bringmann and Jrg M. O. Bringmann of Elstal, Germany. The Rev. Robert Brooks, an Episcopal priest and a friend of the brides family, performed the ceremony at the Chapel of Grace at Grace Cathedral in San Francisco.

title: Brett Barash, Dakota Sherman
description: Brett Morgan Barash, the daughter of Meri S. Barash and Eric J. Barash, both of Fort Lauderdale, Fla., was married Oct. 8 to Dakota Fisher Sherman, a son of Laura A. Sherman and David F. Sherman, both of Bloomfield Hills, Mich. Rabbi Howard Needleman officiated at the Four Seasons Hotel in Miami.

title: Sarah Armstrong, Matthew Porwoll
description: Sarah Elizabeth Armstrong, a daughter of Nancy J. Armstrong and Richard B. Armstrong of Atlanta, was married Oct. 7 to Matthew David Porwoll, a son of Lori S. Porwoll and Paul J. Porwoll of Johns Island, S.C. The Rev. Preston Davis, a Methodist minister, officiated at the Prospect Park Boathouse in Brooklyn.

title: Dennis Adler, David Gevurtz
description: Dennis Michael Adler, a son of Anita G. Adler and Russell D. Adler of New London, Conn., was married Oct. 8 to David Matthew Gevurtz, a son of Susan B. Gevurtz and Gary S. Gevurtz of Gladwyne, Pa. Andrew Cinnamon, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated at the Canoe Studios, a photography studio and event space in New York.

title: Hurricane Matthew Toll Climbs to at Least 17 as North Carolina Suffers Record-Breaking Flooding
description: Hurricane Matthew was downgraded to a post-tropical cyclone early Sunday morning as it hit North Carolina and Virginia with a weakened but still powerful punch.

title: Tory Brooks, Scott Caputo
description: Harriet Lyman Brooks and Scott Pieter Caputo were married Oct. 8 at the Parrish Art Museum in Water Mill, N.Y. Zachary Goldman, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated.

title: Annabeth Bondor-Stone, Connor White
description: Annabeth Robin Bondor-Stone and Connor Blake White were married Oct. 8 at the Riviera Mansion, an event space in Santa Barbara, Calif. Winnie Holzman, a cousin of the bride and a minister of the Open Ministry Church, officiated.

title: Catherine Barnao, Matthew Rowland
description: Catherine Janelli Barnao, the daughter of Camille Barnao and Frank J. Barnao of Brooklyn, was married Oct. 8 to Matthew Foster Rowland, a son of Susan B. Rowland and D. Richard Rowland of Rye, N.Y. Alphonse M. Naclerio, the acting village justice in Elmsford, N.Y., officiated at Shenorock Shore Club in Rye.

title: Cara Crowley, Seth Stammler
description: Cara Kristine Crowley, the daughter of Elaine M. Crowley of West Chester, Pa., and Michael J. Crowley of Sea Isle City, N.J., was married Oct. 8 to Seth Matthew Stammler, a son of Loretta A. Stammler of Columbus, Ohio, and Bradley W. Stammler of Blacklick, Ohio. Sharon Simon, a Universal Life minister, officiated at Tralee Farm, an event space in Stone Ridge, N.Y.

title: Corrections: October 9, 2016
description: METROPOLITAN

title: Erin Geismar, Michael Bolan
description: Erin Geismar and Michael Philip Bolan are to be married Oct. 9 in Long Island City, Queens. The Rev. Alastair Blaine, an Anglican priest, is to officiate at the Metropolitan Building, an event space.

title: Daniel DAddario, Jacob Schneider
description: Daniel Paul DAddario and Jacob Louis Schneider are to be married Oct. 9 at the Biddle Mansion in Tarrytown, N.Y. The Rev. Calvin Sanborn, an Episcopal priest and a cousin-in-law of Mr. Schneider, is to perform a ceremony that will include both Christian and Jewish traditions.

title: Lucia Finucane, Cyril Vergis
description: Lucia Myles Finucane, a daughter of Laurie A. Finucane and Mark R. Finucane of South Pasadena, Calif., is to be married Oct. 9 to Cyril Abel Vergis, the son of Abel Vergis of Lancaster, Pa., and the late Sara Vergis. Ron Petrella, a civil celebrant for Virginia, is to officiate in an outdoor ceremony at Oatlands Plantation in Leesburg, Va.

title: Eleanor Joseph, Andrew Johnston
description: Eleanor Clare Joseph, a daughter of Elizabeth H. Scheuer and Peter A. Joseph of the Bronx, is to be married Oct. 9 to Andrew Thomas Johnston, the son of Carole L. Forgan of Ashland, Ore., and Thomas J. Johnston of Jackson, Wyo. Rabbi David Ellenson is to officiate at the brides family home in Hopewell Junction, N.Y., and lead the ceremony with his wife, Rabbi Jacqueline Koch Ellenson.

title: Bethany Heitman, Antoine Samuda
description: Bethany Ann Heitman and Antoine Douglas Samuda were married Oct. 8 at 501 Union, an event space in Brooklyn. The ceremony was officiated by Storm Heitman, the brides brother, who was ordained by American Marriage Ministries for the occasion.

title: Ann Horwitz, Ariel Dubin
description: Ann Minna Horwitz, the daughter of Lisa E. Horwitz and Murray Horwitz of Chevy Chase, Md., was married Oct. 8 to Dr. Ariel Kate Hyman Dubin, a daughter of Sheila L. Dubin and Dr. Jack E. Dubin of Los Gatos, Calif. Helen Johnston Gant, a friend of the couple who was ordained by American Marriage Ministries for the event, officiated at the Hayes Mansion in San Jose, Calif.

title: Julia Hoyt, Minot Amory IV
description: Julia Estabrook Hoyt, a daughter of Blair Brown Hoyt and C. Alexander Hoyt of New York, was married Oct. 8 to Charles Minot Amory IV, a son of Jan Cushing Amory of Newport, R.I., and Mr. Amory III of Southampton, N.Y. The Rev. W. Patrick Edwards, an Episcopal priest, led the ceremony in Southampton at St. Andrews Dune Church, of which he is the vicar.

title: Eleanor May, Peter Hawkins
description: Eleanor Elizabeth May, a daughter of Thomas Kelly May of Birmingham, Ala., was married Oct. 8 to Peter Ratcliffe Hawkins, the son of Anne Ratcliffe Hawkins and John T. W. Hawkins of Ruxton, Md. The Rev. Gary Wingo, a Baptist minister, performed the ceremony at the Seaside Interfaith Chapel in Seaside, Fla., where he serves as pastor.

title: Christopher Pierce, Jonathan Pollock
description: Christopher Lawrence Pierce and Jonathan Richard Pollock were married Oct. 8 in Detroit. Dr. Robert Sweetman, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated at the Detroit Institute of Art.

title: Julia Merrill, Matthew Himler
description: Julia Christine Merrill, a daughter of Monica Risi Merrill and Charles C. Merrill of New York, was married Oct. 8 to Matthew Harris Himler, a son of Barbara A. Himler and Peter B. Himler, also of New York. The Rev. Paul S. Voisin, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at St. Theresas Cathedral Parish in Hamilton, Bermuda.

title: Stephanie Michael, Justin Barton
description: Stephanie Michelle Michael and Justin Vidal Barton were married Oct. 8 at Sole East Resort in Montauk, N.Y. The Rev. Dr. Jerome D. Taylor, a Lutheran minister, officiated.

title: Colie McClellan, Mark Kennedy
description: Jessica Colie McClellan and Mark William Kennedy were married Oct. 6 at a private home in McClellanville, S.C. The Rev. Dr. Jennie C. Olbrych, the vicar of St. James-Santee Episcopal Parish, officiated.

title: Alyssa Kelly, Granger Jewett
description: Alyssa Christine Kelly, a daughter of Cynthia M. Spano of Voorhees, N.J., and Michael P. Kelly of Princeton, N.J., was married Oct. 8 to Granger Robinson Jewett, the son of Mary Robinson Jewett and Kent C. Jewett of Summit, N.J. The Rev. Canon Matthew T. L. Corkern performed the ceremony at Calvary Episcopal Church in Summit.

title: Lily Salembier, James Sliger
description: Lily Lathrop Salembier, a daughter of Magee Hickey and Richolson Salembier of Brooklyn, was married Oct. 8 to James Knox Sliger, a son of Maggsie Griffith Sliger and Dan Sliger of Pittsburgh. Felicia Mennin, an acting justice of the New York State Supreme Court, officiated at the Southwood Estate in Germantown, N.Y.

title: Kathryn Sugar, Julia Cohen
description: Kathryn Ward Sugar, the daughter of Jill Moore Sugar and Dr. Jeffrey P. Sugar of San Diego, was married Oct. 8 to Julia Palmer Cohen, the daughter of Dr. Leslie A. Rodnan and Dr. John B. Cohen of Washington. Robbie Mantel, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated at Tribeca Rooftop, an event space in Manhattan.

title: Kathleen Whipple, Patrick Mitchell
description: Kathleen Ann Whipple, a daughter of Joan Shlora Whipple and George A. Whipple III of Rye, N.Y., was married Oct. 8 to Patrick John Mitchell, a son of Linda Spagnolo Mitchell and David F. Mitchell of Charlotte, N.C. The Rev. Daniel P. OReilly, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Church of the Resurrection in Rye.

title: Hai-Ching Yang, Tao Jin
description: Hai-Ching Yang and Tao Jin were married Oct. 8 in Santa Rosa, Calif. Yue Y. Xu, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated at DeLoach Vineyards.

title: Jonathan Siegel, Matthew Harris
description: Jonathan David Siegel and Matthew Scott Harris were married Oct. 8 in Central Park near the Bow Bridge. Rabbi David J. Gelfand officiated.

title: Rebecca Beland, John McNaught
description: Rebecca Elyse Carlos Beland and John Daniel McNaught were married Oct. 8 in Warrenton, Va. The Rev. Benjamin W. Maas, an Episcopal priest, officiated at the country home of the grooms parents.

title: Dyan Yu, Dong Joo Lee
description: Dyan Young Ju Yu, the daughter of Chong Aei Yu and Taek Yol Yu of Edison, N.J., was married Oct. 8 to Lt. Dong Joo Lee, a son of Kyung Lae Lee and Kwang Yong Lee of Harrington Park, N.J. The Rev. Kee Won Huh, a Presbyterian minister, officiated at the Crest Hardware & Urban Garden Center in Brooklyn.

title: Sharde Caesar, Shane Douglas
description: Sharde Sheryce Caesar and Shane Everett Douglas were married Oct. 8 at the Solage Calistoga Resort in Calistoga, Calif. Devon Fanfair, a Universal Life Church minister, officiated.

title: Anne-Marie Henderson, Alexander Cabot
description: Anne-Marie Elizabeth Henderson, the daughter of Helen K. Henderson and Ian E. Henderson of Tucson, is to be married Oct. 9 to Alexander Lee Cabot, a son of Susan K. Cabot and Lewis P. Cabot of Boston. Jerome J. Bellamy, a Universal Life minister, is to officiate at the Four Seasons Resort the Biltmore Santa Barbara in Montecito, Calif.

title: Dana Eisenberg, Jonathan Duber
description: Dana Sarah Eisenberg, a daughter of Deborah M. Eisenberg and Ronald P. Eisenberg of Woodcliff Lake, N.J., was married Oct. 8 to Jonathan Cutler Duber, a son of Nancy E. Duber and Marc N. Duber of Washington. Rabbi Stuart Weinblatt officiated at the Brooklyn Museum, with Larry Sanitsky, a Universal Life minister and a cousin of the bride, taking part in the ceremony.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: Divorce, Insecure and the Second Presidential Debate
description: Sarah Jessica Parker, an HBO legend, returns to that cable channel with Divorce  but this time shes no Carrie Bradshaw. Issa Rae boldly follows her with Insecure. And Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump meet at the second presidential debate.

title: Donald Trump the Showman, Now Caught in the Klieg Lights
description: Above all else, the success of Donald J. Trumps presidential campaign was made possible by the media environment in which it was spawned, and his canny ability to exploit it. Now that same environment could very well be the thing that destroys it.

title: Presidential Debate: Heres What You Missed
description: We analyzed in real time the second presidential debate between Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton. Plus, here are our fact checks and email exchanges with William Weld, the Libertarian vice-presidential nominee.

title: Homes That Sold for $450,000 and Under
description: 3 Orian Place, Glen Cove

title: Donald Trump, Florida, Nobel Prize: Your Weekend Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Rosberg Widens Lead With Victory in Japanese Grand Prix
description: SUZUKA, Japan  Something is not good in Lewis Hamiltons state of mind.

title: Bulgaris Chief: Make Your Targets Clear
description: Jean-Christophe Babin is chief executive of Bulgari, the Italian luxury jeweler.

title: Attack by Palestinian Kills 2 Israelis in Jerusalem
description: JERUSALEM  A Palestinian gunman made a brazen choice of location for a deadly rampage on Sunday: Driving a speeding car, he fired at civilians near a light rail stop opposite Israels national police headquarters, on the main road that runs between West Jerusalem and the predominantly Palestinian eastern part of the city.

title: What to Expect From the Second Debate
description: The stakes are high for both Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump as they prepare for the second presidential debate, a town-hall-style event in St. Louis on Sunday.

title: Inside Trump Tower, an Increasingly Upset and Alone Donald Trump
description: It has been his pride and his palace, a soaring black skyscraper overlooking Manhattan that seemed to match Donald J. Trumps ambition and ostentatiousness.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: How NBC Finished Second on the Trump Video Story
description: Days after a blockbuster video emerged capturing Donald J. Trump, then a reality television host, making vulgar remarks about aggressively kissing and groping women, a question was still reverberating around media and political circles:

title: N.F.L.: Cowboys Like Their New QB, Patriots Love Their Old One
description: On the Tom Brady Revenge Tour there will be no such thing as enough offense. The Patriots quarterback, fresh off of a four-game suspension, threw for 406 yards and three touchdowns in a blowout win over the Browns but spent his postgame interview talking about how rusty he felt.

title: Tallying the Toll of a Staten Island Drug Wave in Flowers for Funerals
description: They are not like other mourners. They are raw. Hysterical crying, said Jackie Berger, a florist.

title: Hurricane Matthew Blows Away Couples Wedding Plans
description: When Jessica Lewis, 32, and Jas Jeet Singh, 36, were tracking the early weather forecasts for Sunday, the day their wedding was to take place on Jekyll Island, Ga., they were disappointed to see that it was supposed to be 81 degrees and partly sunny.

title: 33 Injured in Collision of L.I.R.R. Trains
description: Thirty-three people were injured, four seriously, when two Long Island Rail Road trains, one carrying about 600 people, sideswiped each other on Saturday night, the authorities said.

title: 'This Storm Is Not Over For North Carolina'
description: Gov. Pat McCrory of North Carolina urged caution as Hurricane Matthew continued to hit the northeastern part of the state.

title: Revelation Surrounding Novelist Elena Ferrante Exposes Cultural Differences
description: PARIS  The apparent unmasking of an Italian translator as the pseudonymous best-selling novelist Elena Ferrante has sparked a trans-Atlantic backlash against the publication of the  findings earlier this month. But the responses to those findings also reveal a telling divide over what inspires that anger.

title: Taking Over a Hong Kong Street for Pleasure, Not Protest
description: HONG KONG  As Dennis Wu sat with hundreds of people in the middle of a busy Hong Kong street recently, the scene felt to him like the pro-democracy protests of 2014 all over again.

title: Lyn Wilde, 93, Half of a Twin Act in Movies, Is Dead
description: Lyn Wilde, half of a twin-sister act who charmed moviegoers in the 1940s, died on Sept. 11 in Michigan City, Ind. She was 93.

title: What Were Seeing in the Second Presidential Debate
description: Trump v. Clinton on women, national security and all else. Times Opinion writers weigh in before, during and after.

title: Utahs Top Mormons in All-Out Revolt Against Donald Trump
description: As Republicans across the country contend with the fallout from a newly released recording in which Donald J. Trump made vulgar and sexually degrading comments about women, perhaps nowhere was reaction more swift and decisive than in Utah, home to a sizable Mormon population already deeply unsettled by a sense of the candidates moral shortcomings.

title: Donald Trump Highlights Breitbart Interview With Clinton Accuser
description: Donald J. Trump posted a tweet on Sunday morning highlighting a new interview with a woman who claimed in 1999 that she was raped by Bill Clinton, signaling that he may bring up the accusation at Sundays debate in an effort to counter criticism after the release of a recording showing him speaking of women in vulgar sexual terms.

title: Donald Trumps Loyalists Arent Fleeing the Latest Storm
description: The tension that had burned for months like a fuse in Donald J. Trumps unorthodox campaign exploded over the weekend amid cascading revulsion over a videotape that exposed him as a boastful sexual predator. In a season of serial, seemingly candidacy-killing outrages, the overwhelming sense was that Mr. Trump had finally gone too far.

title: Lin-Manuel Miranda Brings Hamilton Flavor to S.N.L.
description: Lin-Manuel Miranda hosted the most recent Saturday Night Live, looking as giddy and grateful as he did on opening night of his musical Hamilton. Even with the mega-popularity of that show, Mr. Miranda, clean shaven and shorn of a ponytail since his days starring in Hamilton, acknowledged the rarity of having a musical-theater composer as host of S.N.L., saying at the top of his monologue: Most of you watching at home have no idea who I am.

title: Behind Dutertes Bluster, a Philippine Shift Away From the U.S.
description: MANILA  President Rodrigo Duterte has vowed to expel American troops from the Philippines, accused the C.I.A. of plotting to kill him and  insulted President Obama with an obscenity.

title: The Birth of a Nation Struggles at the Box Office
description: LOS ANGELES  Any lingering hope that The Birth of a Nation could push past a controversy surrounding its star, Nate Parker, to become a financial success and an awards contender appeared to end over the weekend, when it arrived to an estimated $7.1 million in ticket sales  flop territory, especially since the film was backed by an aggressive marketing campaign.

title: $1.6 Million Bill Tests Tiny Town and Bulletproof Public Pensions
description: Until the certified letters from Sacramento started coming last month, Loyalton, Calif., was just another hole in the wall  a fading town of just over 700 that had not made much news since the gold rush of 1849. Its lifeblood, a sawmill, closed in 2001, wiping out jobs, paychecks and just about any reason an outsider might have had for giving Loyalton a second glance.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Oct. 10
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: On Their Own, Afghan Forces Strain to Combat Taliban Offensives
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  As Afghan forces struggle to break a weeklong Taliban siege of central neighborhoods in the provincial capital of Kunduz, insurgents are also stepping up pressure on urban centers in western and southern Afghanistan, officials said Sunday.

title: Patriots Tom Brady, After Weeks of Simmering, Returns to Roast the Browns
description: CLEVELAND  Tom Brady looked at no one, spoke to no one, nodded at no one as he stalked toward the New England Patriots locker room early Sunday morning.

title: Trump and Clintons Second Debate: Analysis
description: Heres how we analyzed in real time the second presidential debate between Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump.

title: A Decade of Failure in the War on Drugs
description: MEXICO CITY  In 2006, Felipe Caldern, then the incoming president of Mexico, vowed that change was coming to fix the problem of drug trafficking and drug-related violence. To fulfill this promise he sent the army into the streets and embarked on a full-on war against drug trafficking.

title: Washington Should Stop Militarizing the Pacific
description: WASHINGTON  Americans often assume that Chinese military aggression is increasing the likelihood of a clash between China and the United States. But many policy makers in Washington ignore that Beijing has good reason to be troubled by the United States military footprint in its neighborhood. President Obamas pivot to Asia  which includes doubling down on Washingtons already-robust military presence in the region  further stokes the potential for conflict between China and the United States.

title: The Victims of War Are Sick of War
description: BOGOT, Colombia  I grew up on a beautiful island on Colombias Pacific Coast called Tumaco. My life was rooted in the land of my ancestors. We fished and traded. We were poor, and black, and neglected by the state, but lived in peace and with joy.

title: Ryan Fitzpatrick and Jets Avoid Turnovers but Cant Evade Steelers
description: PITTSBURGH  This time there were no turnovers, but another second-half fade left the Jets with their third straight loss, a 31-13 defeat by the Steelers at Heinz Field on Sunday.

title: Hold Onto Your Teeth: 2 New Shows Herald the Creepy Season
description: The scary season is upon us, and its giving us a couple of very watchable series in the next two days, one cerebral and ominous, the other snarling and screamy.

title: Life and Death on the New York Dance Floor Charts a Kinetic Scene in the Early 80s
description: If Tim Lawrence had wanted his third book, Life and Death on the New York Dance Floor, 1980-1983, to go pop, he would have titled it The World That Made Madonna, picked a different cover, and added a chapter or two focusing on her. He wouldnt need to do much more.

title: Famous for Its Past, a New Jersey Town Struggles to Define Its Future
description: This may be the biggest news about tiny Flemington, N.J., since the Lindbergh baby kidnapping-and-murder case in the 1930s, which Damon Runyon called the trial of the century.

title: Review: Paul McCartney and Neil Young Share a Bill, and Some Songs
description: INDIO, Calif.  All six headliners at Desert Trip, the festival of renowned 1960s rockers, have long faced the same question: How to choose a concert set from a catalog that has been growing for up to five decades? Paul McCartney and Neil Young, who shared the lineup  and the stage  on Saturday, had two disparate answers, though both juxtaposed some of their oldest and newest songs.

title: Jose Lobatons Unlikely Blast Helps Nationals Even Series With Dodgers
description: WASHINGTON  If not for the frailty of the human knee, Jose Lobaton would not have played for the Washington Nationals on Sunday. Lobaton spent most of the season as the backup to Wilson Ramos, the Nationals All-Star catcher, who was on the verge of a large payday in free agency.

title: The Mothers, a Debut Novel, Is Already Creating a Stir
description: When Brit Bennett started writing The Mothers, she was the same age as the novels young protagonist, Nadia Turner.

title: Trying to Disrupt the Auto Industry With The Onions Help
description: PAUL ELIO, the innovative engineer behind the commercial three-wheel car, had only a vague sense of what he wanted from his namesake companys latest major advertising campaign.

title: A Monstrous Name
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Its not Halloween yet, but Patrick Merrell offers us a spooky theme to start our solving week. We havent seen him since January, yet here he is, jumping out of the shadows and filling our Monday grid with monsters.

title: Fall for Dance Festival Is Short but Packed
description: Lets begin this account of Fall for Dances final two programs just by dropping names. Alessandra Ferri and Herman Cornejo, international ballet celebrities, danced a world premiere by Wayne McGregor on Friday and Saturday nights. On Wednesday and Thursday night, Alina Cojocaru, Friedemann Vogel and Johan Kobborg, names of equal ballet consequence, danced a one-act drama by Frederick Ashton not seen complete in New York since 2004. Fridays program began with an extended solo by Shantala Shivalingappa, one of the most renowned of all Indian classical dancers. The Wednesday-Thursday fare also included another remarkable one-woman vehicle, Alvin Aileys full-length solo Cry. The list is extraordinary.

title: Yes, Even Fresh-Faced Fans Cheered the Rock Stalwarts of Oldchella
description: INDIO, Calif.  Immediately after promising not to make any age jokes at the classic rock festival teasingly referred to as Oldchella, Mick Jagger welcomed the crowd to the Palm Springs retirement home for genteel English musicians. He was just warming up.

title: Hating Hillary Clinton: Female Comics Skewer the Sexism of the Likability Trap
description: The stand-up comic Jena Friedman has suggested a new campaign slogan for Hillary Clinton: Give uninspiring a chance: Settle for Hillary.

title: Review: Simn Bolvar Symphony Orchestras Evolution Raises Issues of Mission
description: In 2007, in a breakthrough appearance, the Simn Bolvar Youth Symphony Orchestra of Venezuela played two programs at Carnegie Hall. It felt as though an inspiring roster of dedicated, eager young artists, against great odds, had come from South America to jolt classical music with fresh purpose and energy. Under Gustavo Dudamel, their charismatic conductor, 26 at the time, they delivered electrifying performances of Beethovens Fifth Symphony and Bartoks Concerto for Orchestra, among other works.

title: A Guide to Enjoying the Final Stretch of the New York Film Festival
description: Every festival has its own agenda, pulse and profile. Cannes rolls out the biggest red carpet, Sundance turns newbies into indie stars and Toronto cranks up the new fall season with world premieres. The New York Film Festival has institutional heft  its presented by the Film Society of Lincoln Center  and an advantageous spot on the fall calendar, which allows it to present hotly anticipated new titles in North America before theyve become old media news. And of course the festival also has New York, where audiences still turn movies into kinetic social events.

title: Review: Miles for Mary, a Sendup of the Interminable Meeting From Hell
description: Though Dante cataloged many forms of diabolical torture in his Inferno, a guided tour of hell, he somehow missed out on what could well be the most excruciating eternal punishment of all. I mean (ominous organ chords, please) the staff meeting that never, ever ends.

title: Pope Francis Names 17 New Cardinals, Including 3 Americans
description: Pope Francis on Sunday named 17 new cardinals, including three Americans, adding prelates from developing countries to give them a greater voice in selecting the next pope. Francis American appointments elevate moderates in the church hierarchy, bypassing doctrinal conservatives from large archdioceses.

title: North Carolina Resident Surveys Damage
description: A gallery owner in Nags Head, N.C., a beach community, surveys the damage to his shop after Hurricane Matthew.

title: Apple and Samsung Clash in the Supreme Court, and Sony Goes Virtual
description: Heres what to expect in the week ahead:

title: Donald Trump Vows Retaliation as Republicans Abandon Him
description: The Republican Party was at the brink of civil war on Sunday as Donald J. Trump signaled he would retaliate against lawmakers who withdraw their support from his campaign, and senior party leaders privately acknowledged that they now feared losing control of both houses of Congress.

title: Billy Bush, Host on Today, Is Suspended by NBC
description: Billy Bush, a host on the Today show who has received stinging criticism for his role in a video with Donald J. Trump, has been suspended by NBC.

title: Palm Springs Police Awake in a Nightmare After Fatal Shootings
description: The police in Palm Springs, Calif., are mourning two officers who were shot and killed on Saturday while responding to a call about a domestic disturbance. One of the victims was a young mother and the other a veteran months away from retirement.

title: Hollywoods Queen of Reinvention Takes on Rocky Horror
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif.  In the late 1990s, still the dark ages for female executives in Hollywood, Dolly Parton invited a young woman to lunch.

title: Indians Manager Terry Francona Has a Knack for Stories as Well as Titles
description: BOSTON  As a baseball lifer, Terry Francona is superb at telling baseball stories. Once, while managing the Boston Red Sox, he stood in a hallway of the visiting clubhouse in Port St. Lucie, Fla., before a spring training game and regaled his coaching staff and a visitor with a hilarious, self-deprecating tale about how he had just been stuck inside the bathroom of the team bus as it motored across the state.

title: Report Criticizes Mexican Officials for Ignoring 2011 Massacre
description: MEXICO CITY  The killers went to the town of Allende one weekend in March 2011 with orders to exact revenge. They massacred 26 people in two days, including women and children, because of a feud among leaders of the feared Zetas drug gang.

title: A Neighborhood Changes, and People Keep Parking
description: Dear Diary:

title: North Carolina, Saturated and Surprised, Reels from Hurricane Matthew
description: LUMBERTON, N.C.  Brittany Graham had been confident that Hurricane Matthew would bring no more than a few inches of rain to this inland city. But by Sunday afternoon, her grandfathers small farm was underwater.

title: Looking for a Choice of Voices in A.I. Technology
description: Jason Mars is an African-American professor of computer science who also runs a tech start-up. When his companys artificially intelligent smartphone app talks, he said, it sounds like a helpful, young Caucasian female.

title: Ron Wyden Discusses Encryption, Data Privacy and Security
description: WASHINGTON  After Apple and the F.B.I. made their battle over encryption public in February, members of Congress quickly jumped into the debate. Some lawmakers promised new rules that would give authorities more access to smartphones, while others promised to fight off those laws.

title: Brooklyn Lawsuit Could Affect the Fate of Millions of Immigrants Nationwide
description: In his 26 years, Martin Batalla Vidal has been many things: a Mexican citizen, a New York City resident, a high school graduate, a nursing student, a caterer, a health club janitor and an undocumented immigrant.

title: Obamas Weekend in Chicago: Thanks for the Memories
description: CHICAGO  A sense of nostalgia has begun to creep into the last months of Barack Obamas presidency, lending the feeling of a valedictory tour to a rare trip he made this weekend to his adopted hometown, Chicago.

title: Level of Outrage Over Donald Trump Tape Is Linked to Another Issue: Race
description: As the backlash increases over a recording of Donald J. Trump speaking of women in vulgar sexual terms, some have said the fury may be particularly intense because Mr. Trump, who has previously offended a number of minorities, is now being perceived as demeaning a target historically more valued in American society: white women.

title: A Roar at a Funeral, and Yemens War Is Altered
description: SANA, Yemen  Large speakers played verses from the Quran as hundreds of mourners filed through the fanciest reception hall in Sana, the capital, to pay their respects to a prominent family after the death of its patriarch.

title: Derrick Rose and Joakim Noah Distract Knicks, Right on Schedule
description: The Knicks have spent recent days going about the unvarnished business of preseason basketball without two starters. Center Joakim Noah continues to work his way back from a hamstring injury, and point guard Derrick Rose will spend his foreseeable future in Los Angeles, dealing with his well-chronicled legal troubles. As Noah put it last week, Nothings perfect.

title: Full Video: Second Presidential Debate
description: Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump square off for the second time during a debate held at Washington University in St. Louis.

title: Trump Opponents and Media Seek Apprentice Tapes via Twitter
description: Does damning footage of Donald J. Trump exist from his days as host of The Apprentice? And if so, where is it?

title: Watch the Debate With Our Columnists
description: Follow along, and discuss, the second presidential debate with our columnists Frank Bruni, Roger Cohen, Gail Collins, and Ross Douthat.

title: Ken Thompson, Brooklyn District Attorney, Dies After Disclosing Cancer
description: Kenneth P. Thompson, the first black district attorney of Brooklyn and a voice for racial justice at a moment of tension between law enforcement and minority communities, died on Sunday from cancer, his family said. He was 50.

title: What Does Weld Say? Real-Time Reaction From a Libertarian
description: Joining us live during tonights debate was William Weld, the Libertarian Partys vice-presidential nominee and a former two-term Republican governor of Massachusetts.

title: Fact Checks of the Second Presidential Debate
description: Reporters for The New York Times fact-checked the statements made by Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump during Sundays presidential debate.

title: An Open Letter to the Woman Who Told My Family to Go Back to China
description: Dear Madam:

title: Quotation of the Day
description: The Republican Party is caught in a theater fire; people are just running to different exits as fast as they can.

title: Theodore Anderson, Mathematician Who Advanced Data Analysis, Dies at 98
description: Theodore W. Anderson, a statistician whose work brought a new mathematical rigor to economics and social science in the postwar years and helped pave the way for modern econometrics and data analysis, died on Sept. 17 in Stanford, Calif. He was 98.

title: Peter Allen, a Voice on the Radio for the Met Opera, Dies at 96
description: Peter Allen, whose nonoperatically light tenor and precise but not pedantic style introduced more than 500 performances for the Metropolitan Operas Saturday afternoon radio broadcasts, died on Saturday at his home in Manhattan. He was 96.

title: Superheroes, Villains and More at New York Comic Con
description: An annual celebration of comics in New York City.

title: The Second Presidential Debate
description: Whew: Like watching a duel with axes at three paces! Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump battled tonight in their second presidential debate, and heres my play-by-play commentary in the form of selected tweets. This isnt a column or even a formal blog post; just journalism on the fly. Here goes!

title: Donald Trump Featured Paula Jones and 2 Other Women Who Accused Bill Clinton of Sexual Assault
description: Donald J. Trump held a surprise news conference shortly before the second presidential debate on Sunday with three women who have accused Bill Clinton of sexual assault or sexual harassment in the past.

title: Trump Deflects Questions on Lewd Comments
description: The Republican presidential nominee, Donald J. Trump, dismissed his lewd comments from 2005 as "locker room talk," directing attention toward national security and Bill Clinton's sexual behavior.

title: In Race of Bike Messengers, Potholes and Bad Manners Can Be Costly
description: The messengers showed up in Bushwick, Brooklyn, on Sunday, laying their bicycles flat in the middle of Waterbury Street, then stepping back as someone distributed photocopied manifests, the term used for a list of pickups and deliveries.

title: In Second Debate, Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton Spar in Bitter, Personal Terms
description: Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton collided in an almost unremittingly hostile debate on Sunday night, a 90-minute spectacle of character attacks, tawdry allegations, and Mr. Trumps startling accusation that Mrs. Clinton had tremendous hate in her heart.

title: Blue Jays Secret Weapon: A Very Busy Rebuilt Rotation
description: TORONTO  If you want to guess which teams make the playoffs without looking at win-loss records, the workload of their starters often tells the tale. If a rotation is good enough to pitch a lot of innings, chances are, the team will thrive.

title: Andrzej Wajda, Towering Auteur of Polish Cinema, Dies at 90
Insecure Series Premiere: Single Black Woman
description: Early in the premiere of Insecure, Issa Dee (Issa Rae) finds herself in front of a classroom of apathetic minority teenagers in Los Angeles. Shes there on behalf of a nonprofit that focuses on reaching out to the citys struggling youth, and shes failing terribly at connecting with them. Theyre more interested in dissecting her hairstyle, dating status, and why she talks white. Its the sort of razor-sharp cruelty that teenagers are exceedingly good at.

title: For Cubs Fans, Enemy Home Runs Come With a Duty: Throw. It. Back.
description: CHICAGO  When the Chicago Cubs pitcher Travis Wood unexpectedly hit a home run Saturday night in Game 2 of his teams National League division series against San Francisco, the baseball found a happy nesting spot in the left-field bleachers at Wrigley Field. The Cubs fan who snared it even returned it to Wood after the game rather than keep it as a memento.

title: Donald Trump Goes Low
description: Donald Trump boiled his decadent campaign down to one theme during the presidential debate on Sunday night: hatred of Hillary and Bill Clinton.

title: Martha Raddatz and Anderson Cooper Steered Debate With Sharp Questions
description: They dug for revelations, extracting news nuggets  a rarity on a debate night  like Donald J. Trumps admission that he had used a nearly billion-dollar loss to avoid paying federal income taxes for years.

title: Donald Trump Talks at Debate, but Many Women Hear Only a 2005 Tape
description: It was Donald J. Trumps chance to sound contrite and mature, to explain away the sexually predatory boasts he was caught making on tape and to persuade Americans that  for all his no-apologies braggadocio  he was, in fact, capable of feeling shame.

title: Unexceptional Packers Offense Is Good Enough to Beat Giants
description: GREEN BAY, Wis.  The ball popped loose from Green Bay running back James Starkss grasp Sunday night after he made a catch with less than three minutes to play and the Packers leading by a touchdown. For the briefest of moments, Giants wide receiver Odell Beckham Jr. and Coach Ben McAdoo thought another frustrating night for the offense might be salvaged.

title: Donald Trump Acknowledges Not Paying Federal Income Taxes for Years
description: Donald J. Trump explicitly acknowledged for the first time during Sundays debate that he used a $916 million loss that he reported on his 1995 income tax returns to avoid paying personal federal income taxes for years.

title: Transcript of the Second Debate
description: Following is a transcript of the second presidential debate, on Sunday, as transcribed by CQ Transcriptswire.

title: My Lesson From White America
description: EUGENE, Ore.  Its a clich about the classroom that your students teach you as much, if not more, than you teach them.

title: With Help From an Error, the Blue Jays Sweep the Rangers and Advance
description: TORONTO  It was not an obvious moment of infamy  no ground ball through the legs, no fastball down the middle just begging to be a hit. But the record will show that the play that sent the Toronto Blue Jays to the American League Championship Series on Sunday was scored as an error against the most notorious member of the Texas Rangers.

title: Whats on TV Monday: Vice News Tonight and Freakish
description: With Vice News Tonight, Vice Media and HBO imagine a news show for modern times. Supergirl begins a new season on a new network. And Hulu gets in on the zombie game, or something like it, with Freakish.

title: Predators in Arms
description: As many people are pointing out, Republicans now trying to distance themselves from Donald Trump need to explain why The Tape was a breaking point, when so many previous incidents werent. On Saturday, explaining why he was withdrawing his endorsement, Senator John McCain cited comments on prisoners of war, the Khan Gold Star family, Judge Curiel and earlier inappropriate comments about women  and that leaves out Mexicans as rapists, calls for a Muslim ban, and much more. So, Senator McCain, what took you so long?

title: Samsung Halts Galaxy Note 7 Production as Battery Problems Linger
description: In 1995, furious over quality problems with one of his companys mobile phones, Lee Kun-hee, the chairman of Samsung and arguably the most famous businessman in South Korea, set a pile of 150,000 defective phones on fire outside a factory.

title: Corrections: October 10, 2016
description: OPINION

title: Who Won the Debate? Donald Trump Avoids Annihilation
description: Donald J. Trumps campaign appeared to be crumbling as he entered the second presidential debate against Hillary Clinton, with Republicans withdrawing support for his candidacy after the disclosure of a vulgar recording that showed him bragging about sexual assault. Facing a barrage of tough questions, the Republican nominee managed to scrape through, evading questions, fabricating answers and attacking his opponent in deeply personal terms.

title: Debate Takeaways: Clinton Is Still Standing, and Trump Isnt Going Away
description: With Donald J. Trumps campaign engulfed in crisis, the second presidential debate promised a clash of grand proportions: a decisive, even cataclysmic showdown between one candidate on his heels and the other, Hillary Clinton, emerging as a strong front-runner.

title: Moments From the Second Presidential Debate
description: Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump traded barbs in a debate at Washington University in St. Louis.

title: U.N. Chief Condemns Airstrike on Yemeni Funeral and Dismisses Saudi Denials
description: GENEVA  The United Nations secretary general, Ban Ki-moon, on Monday condemned a weekend airstrike on a funeral ceremony in the Yemeni capital, Sana, as well as the Saudi-led bombing campaign believed to be responsible for it.

title: Donald Trump Probably Stanched His Losses, but Didnt Seem to Gain
description: The bar was low for Donald J. Trump after the worst two weeks for a presidential campaign in recent memory, and he seemed to clear it at Sundays debate.

title: Fact Check: The Town Hall Debate
description: Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton squared off in the second presidential debate. We checked the facts.

title: 1891: Serious Train Crash in France
description: A serious collision occurred yesterday morning at Brunoy Station, on the P.-L.-M. Railway. There is a daily service of trains running between Brunoy and Paris, and the early morning train had just been made up on a siding. It was shunted on to the main line to take up passengers, and the latter had taken their places, when a goods train from Melun came up at full speed, and ran into the rear of the train. The shock was tremendous. Two third-class carriages were literally smashed to pieces, and a first-class carriage was wrecked. The force of the collision was such that the passenger train was driven up the line a distance of more than one hundred yards.

title: San Francisco Noir: Photos From the 40s and 50s
description: Fred Lyonss longtime muse is his hometown, San Francisco, whose streets and people have always beckoned him to dive in with camera in hand, day or night.

title: Syrian, Feared to Be Planning Bombing, Is Arrested in Germany
description: BERLIN  The German police arrested a Syrian man early Monday who was suspected of plotting a bombing, bringing an end to a weekend manhunt that renewed fears about a threat posed by extremists among the nearly one million refugees and migrants who arrived in Germany last year.

title: Aid in Dying Movement Advances
description: New York, Colorado and the District of Columbia may soon join the handful of states where doctors are allowed to help terminally ill patients die by prescribing a lethal dose of painkillers.

title: No Way to Treat Refugees
description: Hungarys anti-immigrant referendum last week was declared invalid because less than half of the electorate turned out. But it is distressing that 3.3 million voters, or more than 98 percent of those who cast ballots, favored the proposal by Prime Minister Viktor Orban to reject European Union requirements that the country accept its share of refugees.

title: Trump, the Next Big Short
description: A Republican billionaire entrepreneur runs for president on a platform of huge tax cuts for the rich and for business and yet, when his candidacy appears ascendant, the markets swoon.

title: When the People Choose Gun Control
description: The vast majority of Americans  about nine in 10  support reasonable, common-sense gun regulations. The numbers are only slightly lower among gun owners and members of the National Rifle Association. And yet, year after year, lawmakers in Congress and in statehouses across the country, all beholden to the gun lobby, act as if the opposite were true.

title: At Last, a Plan to Reinvent Penn Station
description: To the Editor:

title: How Trade Deals Have Hurt American Workers
description: To the Editor:

title: Free Speech in High School
description: To the Editor:

title: A Divisive President at City College, and a Long List of Personal Expenses
description: After Lisa S. Coico took the helm in 2010 as the president of the City College of New York, the flagship of the City University of New York system, she proved to be a divisive figure on the schools Harlem campus.

title: A Short Fall Break, but What Should We Call It?
description: Many schools in the United States are off for Columbus Day, so were taking a short break ourselves  but, as The Times reports, we may not be calling this early fall holiday Columbus Day for much longer:

title: San Francisco Noir: Photos From the 40s and 50s
description: Fred Lyon is 92 years old and has photographed his hometown, San Francisco, for more than 70 years. His rich black-and-white scenes conjure a bygone era, when flash powder still existed, being alone with your thoughts was common, and the famed cable cars were public transportation for locals, rather than rolling tourist traps headed to Fishermans Wharf.

title: 1966: Older Officers Are Kept on the Job
description: WASHINGTON  The navy, battling a serious shortage of experienced officers, now is permitting older officers twice passed over for promotion to stay on the job, sources revealed today [Oct. 9]. Such men normally are forced to leave active service. This was learned in the wake of the Navys announcement Friday that it will continue to extend the duties of an estimated 1,000 pilots and other highly skilled officers for another year to meet Vietnam needs. And, in Saigon, the U.S. military command announced that some selected officers in advisory and staff positions in the various services will serve up to two years, double the normal tour.

title: Questioning Gender Amid a Chaotic East Village Childhood
description: DARLING DAYSBy iO Tillett WrightIllustrated. 385 pp. Ecco/HarperCollins Publishers. $26.99.

title: New Memoirs Show How the Other Half Lives
description: It might be said that the presidential candidacy of Donald Trump has something in common with Hurricane Katrina. In exposing how a major American city can share traits with the developing world, the storm broke apart one of Americas prevailing ideas about itself: the myth that for all our inequities and intractable social blights, this is still fundamentally a land of equal opportunity. Trump, through sheer dint of his own bluster, has conducted his own version of this expos. By forcing blue-state liberal types to reckon with a demographic they had long dismissed as a punch line  low-income, uneducated whites in economically depleted regions  he awakened them to the fact that the groovy progressive social values they had assumed were a national fait accompli were actually only half the story.

title: Im a Doctor. If I Drop Food on the Kitchen Floor, I Still Eat It.
description: You may have read or heard about the study debunking the five-second rule. It said that no matter how fast you pick up food that falls on the floor, you will pick up bacteria with it.

title: When You Have to Go, Japanese Rest Stops Wont Keep You Waiting
description: The kids are hungry, the driver has a headache and everyone has to go to the bathroom. If youre traveling by car on a holiday weekend, the last thing you want to find at a roadside rest stop is a long line for a toilet.

title: In Bridgeport, Property Values Plummet, but Taxes Soar for Some
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn.  When Alison Boteler opened the property tax bill last summer on the home that she shares with her mother here, she was stunned. The mayor had campaigned on a pledge of no new taxes. Instead, her taxes had shot up $5,000, to $24,000 a year.

title: Hillary Clinton, Donald Trump, Samsung: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Nine Famous Women. No Makeup. Selfies.
description: Barefaced revelations, from Laverne Cox, Mindy Kaling, Christie Brinkley and more.

title: To Wear Makeup or Not to Wear Makeup?
description: The question is surprisingly fraught, but the answer is simple.

title: Morning Agenda: Peso Predictor, Salesforce Investors Speak, Calpers Standoff
description: The focus is again on the currency markets, but this time it is not just about the pound.

title: New York Today: Mourning a Brooklyn Prosecutor
description: Updated, 11:04 a.m.

title: Oliver Hart and Bengt Holmstrom Win Nobel in Economics for Work on Contracts
description: Oliver Hart and Bengt Holmstrom were awarded the Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Science on Monday for their work on improving the design of contracts, the deals that bind together employers and their workers, or companies and their customers.

title: Some I.V.F. Experts Discourage Multiple Births
description: This summer Louise Brown, the worlds first test tube baby, celebrated her 38th birthday as a mother of two naturally conceived children. In the decades since Ms. Browns celebrated birth, the techniques of in vitro fertilization, or I.V.F., have improved tremendously, resulting in an estimated five million babies worldwide born to couples unable to conceive on their own.

title: When Do You Worry About a Picky Eater?
description: I saw one of the white-food kids a couple of weeks ago  a 9-year-old boy who lives on French fries, chicken fingers, white rice and white bread. Some white-food kids are so strict that their parents have to warn the restaurant that if theres a little ceremonial dusting of parsley on the French fries, the child wont eat them.

title: A Frog Dies in Atlanta, and a World Vanishes With It
description: Atlanta  Two weeks ago, the last known Rabbs fringe-limbed tree frog died in a biosecure safehouse at the Atlanta Botanical Garden. Its distinctive, barklike call was last heard in the wild, as far as we know, in a Panamanian forest in 2007.

title: Tourists Behaving Badly: Name-and-Shame Effort Fails to Fix Chinas Image
description: BEIJING  Two young Chinese tourists carve their names on the Great Wall. Hundreds of picnickers leave their garbage moldering on the banks of the Yellow River.

title: Trumps Second Debate, in Brief
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive more briefings and a guide to the section daily in your inbox.

title: California Today: San Francisco Fields a Mental-Health SWAT Team
description: Good morning.

title: Taiwans President Calls for New Talks With Beijing
description: HONG KONG  Taiwans president delivered a resounding affirmation of its freely elected government on Monday, noting that its deepening foothold on the island stands in stark contrast to the authoritarian government of mainland China.

title: Britains Economy Was Resilient After Brexit. Its Leaders Learned the Wrong Lesson.
description: This article must begin with a mea culpa. When British voters decided in June that they wanted to depart the European Union, I agreed with the conventional wisdom that the British economy would probably slow and that uncertainty put it at risk of recession.

title: What I Learned About a Vanished New York From Gloria Steinem
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times. In this piece, the Times Metro reporter John Leland reveals some of the many delightful nuggets of lesser-known New York City history recently shared with him by Gloria Steinem.

title: Britains Nuclear Cover-Up
description: OXFORD, England  Last month, the British government signed off on what might be the most controversial and least promising plan for a nuclear power station in a generation.

title: Was That a Debate? Or Were the Candidates Just Trying to Go Viral?
description: At the end of a rough night in the first presidential debate, Donald J. Trump congratulated himself for his restraint in not attacking his opponent with her husbands sexual history.

title: Women, Children and Razor Wire: Inside a Compound for Boko Haram Families
description: MAIDUGURI, Nigeria  Beyond the tall, concrete walls of a fortified compound, the authorities are holding a special group of detainees: the wives and children of Boko Haram commanders.

title: 1966: Two U.S. Satellites Collide
description: MADRID  Two unmanned U.S. satellites collided in outer space last year [1965] but survived the five-mile-per-second crash, a U.S. space official told the 17th Astronautical Congress here today [Oct. 10]. The announcement was the most sensational statement on the opening day of the congress, in which 1,200 scientists from 30 countries are taking part.

title: At a Christian College, Student Journalism Gets Religious
description: If you choose to enroll at my small evangelical liberal arts college in Illinois, youll learn quickly that the Wheaton community is very much into prayer.

title: The Best Team in the N.F.L.? Right Now, Its the Vikings
description: Five weeks have been played in the N.F.L. season. The Denver Broncos, the reigning Super Bowl champions, have lost. So have the Green Bay Packers and the Pittsburgh Steelers. Playing without Tom Brady, the New England Patriots also lost.

title: Paul Ryan Turns Focus From Donald Trump to House Races, Roiling G.O.P.
description: The House speaker, Paul D. Ryan, dealt a hammer blow to Donald J. Trumps presidential candidacy on Monday, dashing any remaining semblance of Republican unity and inviting fierce backlash from his own caucus by announcing that he would no longer defend Mr. Trump.

title: 1891: Steel Mills Clogged
description: Steel mills are reported to be more concerned about inability to make appreciable headway against the mass of orders already upon the books than in obtaining new contracts. Domestic consumers needs for the first half of next year are far from being satisfied, and the foreign demand for commercial forms would take up a large, additional tonnage if mills could promise shipments before July, 1917. Russia continues negotiating for 60,000 tons of barbed wire, and the closing of contracts for 7,500 more railroad carriages, requiring 75,000 tons of steel, is imminent. The great activity was in the Pittsburg and Chicago districts.  The New York Herald, European Edition, Oct. 11, 1891

title: With Colombias Peace Deal in Doubt, a Battered Town Fears a Return to War
description: BOJAY, Colombia  Of all the acts of violence that have scarred Colombia during five decades of armed conflict, few have cut so deep for so many as the slaughter that occurred in this municipality 14 years ago.

title: What 50 Years of Earthquakes and Volcanic Eruptions Look Like
description: Earth has a violent heartbeat.

title: Holiday Cooking
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Dozens Believed Killed as Violence Erupts in Myanmar
description: YANGON, Myanmar  At least 24 people were believed on Monday to have died in western Myanmar after unknown assailants attacked police outposts on Sunday near the border with Bangladesh.

title: Spending More Just to Save Money Is a Self-Defeating Strategy
description: Just over a week ago, we learned that in 1995 Donald Trump claimed almost a billion dollars in operating losses that could be used to avoid future federal income taxation. On Sunday night during the presidential debate, he bragged about his tax expertise.

title: Is Ralph Lauren Going to Be Hillary Clintons Dresser in Chief?
description: Has Hillary Clinton found her dresser in chief? It would appear that way.

title: Hurricane Matthews Toll Rises; Flooding Strands 1,500 in North Carolina
description: Gov. Pat McCrory of North Carolina said Monday that an urgent rescue effort was underway in Lumberton, where a levee breach in the wake of Hurricane Matthew forced people to their rooftops.

title: Daily Report: Your Choice of Computer Voice is Predictable
description: Lets face it: Youre probably not thinking about technology right now. Youre watching highlights of Sunday nights presidential debate. Youre tweeting about it. Reading about it. Captivated by the latest outrage that makes Nixons flop sweat in the Kennedy debate seem, well, not exactly a big deal.

title: In Haiti, a Citys Race Into the 21st Century Is Ruined by a Hurricane
description: JRMIE, Haiti  Things had been looking up in Jrmie, a coastal city marooned on the tip of Haitis southern peninsula. It had recently gotten its first decent road link to the rest of the country, a new highway through the rugged mountains that brought development. Cellphone service had finally begun, enabling farmers and businesses to flourish. The city was racing into the 21st century, dreaming of advanced agriculture and tourism in one of Haitis few nature preserves.

title: Trump Campaign Tried to Seat Bill Clintons Accusers in V.I.P. Box
description: An extraordinary backstage confrontation between Donald J. Trumps campaign and the staff of the Presidential Commission on Debates unfolded just minutes before the debate on Sunday night after Mr. Trump tried to give seats in his V.I.P. box to a group of women who have accused former President Bill Clinton of making unwanted sexual advances.

title: Solange Edges Out Bon Iver to Secure Her First No. 1 Album
description: In an unusual face-off on the Billboard chart, Solange and Bon Iver competed for this weeks top spot with highly acclaimed, left-of-center new albums, and Solange won by a nose.

title: Horse Racing
description: This weeks challenge was inspired by Todd Unger, chief digital officer and chief marketing officer of the Daily Racing Form, horse racings dominant multiplatform media and e-commerce company. Lets experience a bit of that equestrian energy with

title: Ken Bone's Debate Moment
description: Ken Bone, an audience member who asked a question about energy policy at the second presidential debate on Sunday, has become an internet sensation.

title: Donald Trump, Barbarian at the Debate
description: What the hell did I just watch in that presidential debate last night?

title: Freeing the Gmail New Message Window
description: Q. When using Gmail on the web, is there a way to occasionally make a new message a free-floating window that I can move around the screen, instead of having it anchored down at the bottom of the inbox?

title: Coke and Pepsi Give Millions to Public Health, Then Lobby Against It
description: The beverage giants Coca-Cola and PepsiCo have given millions of dollars to nearly 100 prominent health groups in recent years, while simultaneously spending millions to defeat public health legislation that would reduce Americans soda intake, according to public health researchers.

title: From Locker Room Talk to Muslims Report Stuff, the Internet Strikes Back
description: As the presidential election comes down to the wire, it seems as if Americans are grasping at anything to cope with the deluge of vitriol emerging from an increasingly bitter campaign.

title: What You Should Watch: Atlanta and Supergirl
description: Welcome to Watching, The New York Timess what-to-watch guide. We comb through releases big and small to email readers twice a week with our timely recommendations. You can browse previous guides here, and to receive recommendations straight to your inbox, sign up here. Stay tuned for our coming website.

title: At River Caf, Breakfast as a Celebratory Event
description: At the River Caf, on the East River, a goal is to provide a classic high-level breakfast in the style of the grand hotels of Europe, said the owner, Michael OKeeffe. Though he is still tweaking the menu, his weekday eye-opener features choices like smoked salmon Benedict or avocado toast with poached eggs, and wines, Champagne and gentle pastel-hued cocktails. Everyone stays for a long time, an hour and a half or two, relaxing away from the hustle of the city in a celebratory setting, ordering cocktails, Champagne and a surprising amount of caviar, he said: Breakfast 8:30 to 11:30 a.m. Monday to Friday, the River Caf, 1 Water Street (Old Fulton Street), Fulton Ferry, Brooklyn, 718-522-5200, rivercafe.com.

title: West Side School Rezoning
description: To the Editor:

title: A Dizzying, Beautiful Stack of Pearls
description: The multifaceted Parisian designer Pierre Hardy says the bold jewelry he creates for the house of Herms is inspired by shape and feeling rather than particular gemstones. This dizzyingly sinuous cuff, nearly three inches high, is a diamond-rimmed roller coaster of 150 pearls in varying sizes, as well as a meditation on the passage of time. Within the curvilinear rose-gold armature, the pearls seem to flow from day into night, shifting in shade from the luminous white of a snowy morning to the bottomless gray-black of midnight.

title: A Private Solution to Deutsche Banks Public Woes
description: Deutsche Banks sliding share price and capital shortfall call for some creative solutions. And they do not get much more out of the ordinary than an idea that Germanys corporate titans might take stakes in the lender to help it manage the impact of a potential $14 billion fine from American regulators, as Handelsblatt reported on Oct. 6. It is a less nutty concept than it sounds.

title: Cheese Made in Switzerland but Aged in Queens
description: Murrays Cheese often buys young cheeses from artisanal producers and ages them in its caves in Queens. The latest is an Appenzeller-style mountain cheese from Walter Rass in Switzerland, whose mild, immature wheels are usually sold only in his village. At Murrays, Mr. Rasss cheeses are stored for nine months, acquiring a nutty, robust grassiness. Theyre tart, with hints of caramel, and beg for a glass of sauvignon blanc: Annelies, $34.99 a pound, Murrays Cheese shops, murrayscheese.com.

title: Premier League Stars Score the Goals. He Scores Everything Else.
description: RICHMOND, England  Charles Porter and his staff of eight work from his office in a converted riding school on the grounds of Aske Hall, an old manor house set in the gentle, rolling hills of North Yorkshire. His Australian Labradoodles, Bertie and Cybil, spend their days lounging on a leather sofa by a roaring fire.

title: Ken Bone Is Closer to Deciding, After Debate
description: A desperate America seeking distraction from an ugly political climate may have found a new sweetheart. He is Kenneth Bone, an undecided voter in a bright red sweater.

title: Why Doesnt the United States (Finally) Get Rid of the Penny?
description: Ask The Times, a Times Insider feature, draws on New York Times expertise to answer questions about current events, science, sports, culture and whatever else is making headlines.

title: Stomping Grapes in Brooklyn
description: Stomping on grapes for wine has gone the way of the horse and buggy, but on occasion it is brought back for a touch of the past and some freewheeling fun. Thats what Mark Schwartz will try in front of his Brooklyn wine shop this weekend. Tubs of grapes will be hauled out for willing participants to try their hand  er, foot  at crushing, either barefoot or wrapped in plastic: Grape stomp, noon to 5 p.m. on Saturday, Little Mo Wine & Spirits, 1125 Nostrand Avenue (Midwood Street), Prospect-Lefferts Gardens, Brooklyn, 718-363-2101, littlemowine.com.

title: Katharine Hayhoe, a Climate Explainer Who Stays Above the Storm
description: LUBBOCK, Tex.  A member of Katharine Hayhoes church asked her a question after services a couple of weeks ago: Do you feel our weather is getting more extreme?

title: In Experiment, Apes Have Humans Figured Out
description: Apes know what youre thinking. Or at least an experiment suggests they do.

title: Warming Relations in Person, Putin and Erdogan Revive Pipeline Deal
description: MOSCOW  Amid increasingly tense relations with the United States over Syria, President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia took advantage of a routine meeting in Istanbul on Monday to advance the Kremlins reconciliation with Turkey, including an agreement to revive a suspended natural-gas pipeline project.

title: Cancer in Retreat on One Front: Fewer Children Are Dying
description: Children are dying less often from cancer, with substantial declines in all races and age groups, according to a new report from the National Center for Health Statistics.

title: Whyd You Do That? Printing Donald Trumps Vulgarities
description: Coverage of the leaked 2005 audio tape of  Donald Trump speaking in lewd language about women has produced an onslaught of reader mail, mostly because of the vile words contained in the coverage. The majority of those writing in are asking how the decision was made rather than complaining about the choice to include such words. I went to the Times political editor Carolyn Ryan to ask some of the readers most frequent questions.

title: Hatch Chiles in Mild, Medium or Hot
description: New Mexico is known for its chiles from the Hatch Valley in the southern part of the state; chiles with varying heat levels are grown there and labeled Hatch. Zia Green Chile Company of Brooklyn sells jars of medium-hot or hot green chiles from Hatch, along with mild red; all are simply cooked, diced and preserved with lime, garlic and salt. The medium-hot green is vegetal and smoky, the hot is powerful, and the red has more fire than you would expect. Theyre worth keeping in the refrigerator as a go-to condiment or spicy addition to recipes. The company also sells fresh roasted chiles from New Mexico; the 2016 harvest is ready for pre-order for shipping in coming weeks: Zia Green Chiles, 16-ounce jars, $10; roasted chiles, $35 for five pounds, www.ziagreenchileco.com.

title: After Nearly 44 Years, and 3 Major Terrorism Trials, a Judge Leaves the Bench
description: From his seat on the bench, Judge Kevin Thomas Duffy listened patiently to the man he would soon put in prison for the rest of his life.

title: First a Room, and Now a Book of Chocolate
description: Grab that offset spatula, some parchment paper, many slabs of chocolate (60 to 100 percent cacao) and extra-large eggs, and youre ready to tackle this new collection of recipes from the Chocolate Room, a cafe in Park Slope, Brooklyn, with a branch in Cobble Hill. Consider making a three-layer blackout-style cake (with the thoughtful option of a single layer), a classic chocolate cream pie, a flourless cake baked in a water bath, insanely rich chocolate ice cream or simple dark chocolate and walnut cookies. For each, the equipment needed is thoroughly detailed, as is the shelf life for the results, which can be surprising, like three to four days in the refrigerator for the chocolate cream pie: Theres Always Room for Chocolate: Recipes From Brooklyns the Chocolate Room, by Naomi Josepher, Jon Payson and Georgia Freedman (Rizzoli $32.50).

title: Highlights From the Clinton Campaign Emails: How to Deal With Sanders and Biden
Jamaican Rock Iguanas Get a Shot at a New Home in the Wild
description: Meet the Jamaican rock iguana. Its scaly body stretches around two feet long, tail not included. Slate blue spikes stick up along its spine, and a saggy sac of loose skin wraps around its head like a hoodless cowl. When cornered, it strikes with its front claws  one reportedly ripped an eye from a dog.

title: Letters: Vast Majority of N.F.L. Retirees Favor Concussion Settlement
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: Learning From Dogs as They Sniff Out Their World
description: Our daily tug of leash war goes like this. I tell Chico were taking a left. He yanks right, wet black nostrils burrowing in loamy leaf piles. Me versus a 15-pound Havanese, incensed by scent.

title: What Story Did Debate Night Body Language Tell?
description: From the opening handshake that did not happen to the stone-faced stares and surly scowls, it was evident from watching Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton share a debate stage on Sunday night that their political differences have become personal and that the mutual distaste that they feel is very real.

title: Review: The Philharmonic Revisits an Early Triumph of Its Director
description: Alan Gilbert, approaching the end of his tenure as music director of the New York Philharmonic, briefly revisited an early triumph last week in the orchestras subscription concerts at David Geffen Hall. In 2010, Mr. Gilbert collaborated with the director Doug Fitch on an innovative staging of Gyorgy Ligetis satirical opera Le Grand Macabre (1978), an absurdist take on nothing less than the end of the world.

title: Climate Change Blamed for Half of Increased Forest Fire Danger
description: Forest fires are burning longer and stronger across the western United States, lighting up the landscape with alarming frequency. Residents are forced to flee, homes are incinerated, wildlife habitats are destroyed, lives are lost. Last year, the Forest Service spent more than half its annual budget fighting fires.

title: For G.O.P. Candidates, Renouncing Donald Trump Carries Dire Risks
description: Paula Barche Rupnik, a Republican from Scottsdale, Ariz., was planning to vote for Senator John McCain in his re-election campaign this year. But she changed her mind this weekend, after he rescinded his support for Donald J. Trump.

title: Deutsche Bank and Walmart Face Same Gambit With Justice Dept.
description: When companies are caught up in an investigation, the question is almost always about how much they will have to pay the government to resolve the case. The negotiations can seem like a poker game, with one side throwing out a number while the other claims it would rather fight than agree to such a sum.

title: Home and Work: Nata Janberidze and Keti Toloraia
description: Inside the homes and studio of a pair of emerging Georgian designers, who playfully spin the future out of their uneasy Soviet past.

title: Georgias Emerging, Avant-Garde Designers to Know
description: Strictly speaking, Nata Janberidze and Keti Toloraia began their creative collaboration in a vacuum. When they started designing objects and interiors a decade ago, fresh out of art school, their hometown Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia, a small country on the Black Sea that spent much of the 20th century as part of the Soviet Union, had no creative community for two young designers to gain inspiration from, or any local market for the one-of-a-kind groundbreaking pieces they designed under the distinctly Western, purposefully plain name Rooms.

title: Donald Trump, Locker-Room Talk and Sexual Assault
description: To the Editor:

title: Tiger Woods Postpones Return, Saying Hes Not Ready to Compete
description: Three days after Tiger Woods committed to his first PGA Tour event in 14 months, he abruptly withdrew, leaving this weeks Safeway Open with twice as many tickets sold as a year ago but a fraction of the star power.

title: #MyRunLooksLike: Show Us Your Marathon Training
description: We want a glimpse of your road to the marathon start line. Share your photos on Instagram using #MyRunLooksLike.

title: Review: In American Housewife, a Plus-Size Mom in the Land of Fitbits
description: American Housewife, an awful attempt to transplant Roseanne into the age of economic inequality, mistakes sophomoric for subversive. The show, which begins Tuesday on ABC, seems to be angling for what it views as an underserved demographic, all those malcontented Americans we keep reading about in connection with the presidential election, the ones who are stuck in a cant-get-ahead life because the privileged class has mucked things up and taken all the money. In this shows interpretation, the down-and-outs spend their days telling potty jokes, thinking the whole world hates them because of their weight, and in general emitting contempt for everyone and everything, including their own children.

title: Tyson Foods, a Meat Leader, Invests in Protein Alternatives
description: Tyson Foods appears to be the first big meat company to invest in a business that, among other things, aims to reduce consumption of chicken, beef and pork by replacing it with plant proteins.

title: Review: Godzilla Returns, Again, With a Wink
description: You either like your Godzilla movies slick and high-budget, like the 1998 American version that starred Matthew Broderick, or you like them with a rickety, 1950s feel that evokes the original.

title: Yale Rep Celebrates Its 50th Amid Nostalgia (and a Few Worries)
description: NEW HAVEN  Leave it to Robert Brustein, the outspoken founding director of Yale Repertory Theater, to raise tough questions at a celebration of the theaters 50th anniversary this weekend.

title: The Trees of New York City
description: Q. Why do I see only deciduous trees, not evergreens, planted along New York City streets?

title: 5 One-Liners That Sum Up a Fiery Trump-Clinton Debate
description: The second presidential debate was one of the nastiest ever. There was no shortage of eye-rolls, sighs and gestures of faux politeness that dripped with sarcasm. After weeks of throwing flames from afar, Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton let the zingers fly on Sunday night.

title: Members of Congress Ask N.H.L. for More Concussion Information
description: Four members of Congress want more answers from Gary Bettman, the commissioner of the N.H.L., about what the league is doing, or not doing, about concussions in hockey.

title: Species, Interrupted  Why it Matters When Extinction Silences a Tree Frog
description: When someone notable attains a certain age, newspapers assign reporters to draft advance obituaries, with just the top two or three paragraphs to add when the inevitable happens. As news spread late last monthof the death of Toughie, the last known Rabbs fringe-limbed tree frog, I used Twitter to muse on whethermedia willhave to start doing the same thing for species of living things that are on the brink of extinction:

title: Musicians to Know: An R&B Duo With Indie-Film Cred
description: The reason we dont have a band name is just because we never expected it to pop like it did! explains the musician and actor Brian Sene Marc. So when he makes R&B with the vocalist Denitia Odigie, they simply go by their names: Denitia and Sene.

title: Donald Trump vs. Hillary Clinton: More a Brawl Than a Debate
description: To the Editor:

title: Soothing Ruffled Guests: Hotels Meet Threat of Bad Reviews
description: Pam and Larry Willis had recently purchased the Gables Wine Country Inn in Californias Sonoma wine region four years ago when they received it: their first TripAdvisor threat.

title: Snooping in the Bathroom to Assess Credit Risk in China
description: KUNSHAN, China  Banks and other lenders typically look at borrowers credit histories, tax forms and other financial information to determine whether they will get paid back. In China, lenders also look at their bathrooms.

title: Review: At Desert Trip, Rocking Beyond the Hits With a Vengeance
