title: A Minneapolis Restaurant That Goes Medieval
description: If molecular gastronomy evokes science fiction (foams! liquid nitrogen!), Upton 43 in Minneapolis feels more like alternate history. To eat there is to imagine a world where the spice trade never really developed, a chef-driven culture built on the flavors of medieval Europe. By focusing on old-fashioned techniques like fermenting and roasting, Erick Harcey, the chef, is expanding the citys eating scene and redefining the Swedish-American foods he grew up with.

title: Syllabus for Bob Dylan Seminar
description: Prof. Richard F. Thomas teaches a Harvard freshman seminar about Bob Dylan, who was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature. Take a look at the syllabus for the course, which Mr. Thomas has taught four times.

title: Jeff Goodby: Work for Bosses Who Can Take a Joke
description: This interview with Jeff Goodby, co-chairman and partner of the advertising agency Goodby Silverstein & Partners, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: In Paris, 8 New Tours, From Art to Shopping
description: Peak tourist season in Paris may be winding down, but several new and innovative tours in the city are keeping it a vibrant destination in the fall and winter, too. Many of the sites these excursions cover arent new; the way to see them, on the other hand, is.

title: Bob Dylan 101: A Harvard Professor Has the Coolest Class on Campus
description: For the Harvard classics professor Richard F. Thomas, who has been gently teased by colleagues for teaching a freshman seminar about Bob Dylan  as well as for the students who sometimes get double takes for choosing the course  the announcement of the newest Nobel laureate in literature was hailed as vindication. And cause to break out celebratory cupcakes at the fortuitously timed Thursday afternoon session.

title: I Crossed the World
description: When imagining a journey around planet Earth, I never pictured the part where I crossed the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge in a Toyota Camry with a pink Lyft mustache on the dashboard. Yet that was how I embarked on an accidental circumnavigation of the globe one recent sunny morning, Annie Lennox singing I travel the world and the seven seas on the car stereo as the Camry hurtled through the E-ZPass lane.

title: How to Circle the Globe  on Purpose
description: Weve come a long way from the era of the fictitious circumnavigator Phileas Fogg. Traveling around the world today can take far fewer than 80 days, especially by plane, as the following multimodal trips indicate. Here are some options for tourists who have enough of the spirit of exploration to try to circle the globe.

title: 5 Underrated Pioneers in Circumnavigation
description: Nicholas Kulish may have traveled the world unintentionally but others made a mission of circling the globe. Five trailblazers are below.

title: Grieving Thais Line Streets of Bangkok to Pay Tribute to King
description: BANGKOK  Tens of thousands of grieving Thais lined the streets of the capital on Friday to view the coffin of King Bhumibol Adulyadej, a day after the beloved monarchs 70-year reign ended with his death.

title: Never Trump. But Then What?
description: At the annual RedState gathering, prominent conservatives reflect on how Donald Trump has divided their party.

title: The Fear of Having a Son
description: When my son, Macallah, was born five years ago, my college students asked how it felt to be a new father.

title: Photographs of Desperate Shadows Cast by the California Sun
description: Concealed by bedraggled vegetation alongside a freeway, the path would beckon to Anthony Hernandez; and like an urban archaeologist, hed venture forth to find, in a clearing beneath a sheltering overpass, the traces of an unknown civilization: hundreds of cigarette butts, food in a plastic bag suspended from a tree, a chair constructed from two slabs of plasterboard.

title: Can a Mayor Succeed Where Presidents Fail?
description: PARIS  If you want a lively dinner party conversation in Paris these days, just mention les voies sur berges  the express car lanes that run along the Seine  and your guests will soon be at one anothers throats.

title: The Wall Is a Fantasy
description: NOGALES, Mexico  A few hundred feet from the American border, Jos Manuel Talavera contemplated his challenge with the focus, if not quite the physique, of an Olympic high jumper. A stocky coffee farmer from Honduras, he was fresh off La Bestia, or the Beast  the freight train network used by migrants to cross Mexico. Now he was preparing to vault into the United States, for the third time.

title: Insiders Dish on the Art Market
description: During Frieze Week, a 1982 abstract by Gerhard Richter became the object of a 10-minute duelbetween two telephone bidders at Sothebys Friday evening auction of contemporary art. Garten, estimated at 3 million pounds to 4 million pounds, was finally knocked down for 10.2 million with fees, prompting whoops and applause from the packed salesroom. The painting had last been seen at auction in 1987, when it sold at Christies for 49,500.

title: A Balloon Warrior Subverts North Korea, Thousands of Leaflets at a Time

Plainclothes detectives check his mailbox and tag along wherever he goes to protect him from possible assassins sent by North Korea, which openly threatens to kill him.

title: Whats Behind a Rise in Ethnic Nationalism? Maybe the Economy
description: Global economic weakness and a rise in inequality appear to be causing a disturbing growth in ethnic nationalism.

description: BRUSSELS  Just behind the Common Markets headquarters here, a huge concrete office complex is going up. It will house several thousand more Eurocrats, boast a train siding, but do nothing to improve Brusselss dull townscape.

title: Anna Kendrick: Movie Star. Twitter Star. Ready for More.
description: Anna Kendrick is the kind of actor who likes to cut to the chase. If Im working with a director who wants to be touchy-feely or whatever, thats fine, said Ms. Kendrick, who since March has promoted six films while amusing her nearly 5.8 million Twitter followers. But I am happy as a clam when were just focused and prepared and ready to shoot.

title: A Museums Seal of Approval Can Add to Arts Value
description: FOR most art lovers, museums are a place to indulge a passion or seek solace from the world outside. But for art collectors like Jorge Garcia, they offer a level of objectivity about an artists work that galleries lack.

title: Prince Tribute Puts the Hometown Hero Ahead of the Superstar

title: Waiting for the Mail
description: Barney Rosset, the publisher of Grove Press who died in 2012 at 89, defied convention when he brought the work of Samuel Beckett, D.H. Lawrence and Henry Miller to American readers. Ben Yagoda reviews Rossets posthumous memoir this week.

title: The Story Behind This Weeks Best Sellers
description: Notorious: Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg has been making the rounds lately to promote a new anthology of her writing, My Own Words, which hits the hardcover nonfiction list at No.12. As you might expect, the interviews have centered largely on Ginsburgs love of the law, her long, impressive career and the inner workings of the court. But Ginsburg has also become something of a pop culture superstar in recent years, ever since an admiring law student nicknamed her Notorious R.B.G. (a riff on the rapper Notorious B.I.G.). The meme went viral, and now Ginsburgs stern face and big glasses show up on tote bags, baby onesies and coffee mugs bearing slogans like The Ruth Will Set You Free. So when Gwen Ifill talked with her for PBSs NewsHour Bookshelf this month, the first question involved Ginsburgs newfound status as a folk hero. It is utterly amazing, Ginsburg said. Of course I didnt see it coming. ... But I certainly was given a tremendous boost into the public arena by the Notorious R.B.G. When I was asked about it, I said, well, its exactly right, because Notorious B.I.G. and I had something in common. ... We were both born and bred in Brooklyn.

title: The Latest and Best in Crime Fiction
description: Its only a story  or is it? Graeme Macrae Burnet makes such masterly use of the narrative form that the horrifying tale he tells in HIS BLOODY PROJECT (Skyhorse, $24.99), a finalist for this years Man Booker Prize, seems plucked straight out of Scotlands sanguinary historical archives. Presented as a collection of Documents Relating to the Case of Roderick Macrae, which took place in 1869, the novel includes the jailhouse memoir of a 17-year-old Scottish Highlander being held in Inverness Castle, awaiting trial for three appalling murders.

title: Why, and When, Your Child Should Have a Debit Card
description: MANY children learn to save by stashing cash in a piggy bank or jar, then graduate to a basic savings deposit account. But as teenagers, they start to spend more  lunch while on a field trip, a movie with a friend  and may need an account that lets them make purchases with a debit card.

description: Ezekiel Elliott of the Dallas Cowboys takes on the mighty Green Bay Packers run defense in a game of strength versus strength; Colin Kaepernick will finally take the field for the San Francisco 49ers; and the Tom Brady Revenge Tour continues. But Week 6 will not include the Minnesota Vikings, the leagues last unbeaten team. Here is a look at Sundays matchups and who we think will win them.

title: Misogyny Is Back. Did It Ever Go Away?
description: On the night of Saturday, Sept. 10, between the hours of about 8 and 11, six women, each of them walking in Midtown Manhattan, were approached by a group of young men who sought to light them on fire. Although the attacks were mercifully unsuccessful  no one was injured  one woman, standing at the intersection of Fifth Avenue and East 54th Street had her skirt set aflame, while another, walking past a Valentino store, the police reported, felt something warm on her left arm, only to realize that her blouse was on fire. Six days later, a 14-year old boy was taken into custody, and charged with attempted assault and harassment. Given that everyone targeted for conflagration was female, the police have considered these hate crimes.

title: Anatomy of a Media Conspiracy
description: Look, Mom, there I am in WikiLeaks. Right there among the rest of the media sellouts, Clinton shills and biased tools of the MSM who are apparently bent on destroying Donald J. Trump. Sarah Palin tweeted about me, Trump himself derided my actions in a stump speech and Im pretty sure Bill OReilly just called on me to resign, if Im reading the barrage of Twitter mentions correctly  and it is a barrage (or was before I stopped reading Twitter).

title: Exclusive | 213 West 23rd Street
description: A loft in a Beaux-Arts building that once housed the Y.M.C.A.s celebrated McBurney branch is about to enter the market at $14.5 million.

title: $14.5 Million Loft in a Celebrated Y.M.C.A.
description: For almost a century, the Beaux-Arts building at 213 West 23rd Street housed the Y.M.C.A.s celebrated McBurney branch. It was there that Charles Merrill met the stockbroker Edmund Lynch, and the playwright William Saroyan first took up residence after arriving in New York.

title: Uncertain Future for Wests Wild Horses
description: To reduce the devastation to grasslands and to cut down on storage costs, the Bureau of Land Management's Wild Horse and Burro Advisory Board voted to euthanize some of the 77,000 wild horses in 10 Western states. The vote inspired outrage from animal rights activists.

title: Success Spoils a U.S. Program to Round Up Wild Horses
description: OSAGE COUNTY, Okla.  As the sun set on the honey-colored prairie here, a herd of wild horses grazed belly deep in Indiangrass and big bluestem. On the next ridge, a dozen more horses nibbled in the pasture, and beyond them even more, dotting the hills almost as far as the eye could see.

title: Review: Danish Dance Theater, Pulse-Checking and a Rave for the Undead
description: As the curtain rises on Black Diamond by Danish Dance Theater, a man lies on the stage, menaced by two figures wearing mesh bags over their heads. As a sad little flurry of confetti falls, more figures slink in wearing long black coats, the men bare chested. Sometimes, they jerk like poorly programmed robots or their fingers scurry over their arms like spiders. Its enough to make you wonder, Exactly which bad movie is this trying to be?

title: Obama, Cementing New Ties With Cuba, Lifts Limits on Cigars and Rum
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Friday moved to cement his administrations historic opening with Cuba by issuing a sweeping directive that will last beyond his presidency, setting forth a new United States policy to lift the Cold War trade embargo and end a half-century of clandestine plotting against Cubas government.

title: Billie Joe Armstrong: A Punk Seeks Serenity Inside the Chaos

description: Last November, Shaun Reed, 32, drove up a winding road in Ione, Calif. In the back of the vehicle, unperturbed by the journey to the old gold-rush town, rode a flop-eared, cocoa-colored goat. Mr. Reed was sure it was the perfect gift for Heidi and Randy Ilich, who he hoped would soon be his in-laws.

title: In a Queens Food Court, No More Dumplings, No More Ramen

title: Can This Caterpillar Predict Winter Weather? Probably Not Very Well
description: This weekend, 25 vertical racing lanes will hang along a sun-drenched stage in Banner Elk, N.C., awaiting their athletes  thousands of fuzzy, brown and black banded caterpillars. Throughout the day, people will sign up their worms for the big race. An M.C. known as Mr. Woolly Worm will kick off the race wearing a pink and yellow suit infested with fake caterpillars. The first to reach the top takes home the grand prize: $1,000 and the honor of forecasting this years winter weather.

description: SAN FRANCISCO  Twitter may have to fix its problems on its own, at least for now.

title: FIFA Decision Boosts U.S.s Chance to Host 2026 World Cup
description: FIFAs governing council voted on Friday to bar countries in Europe and Asia, which will host the next two World Cups, from bidding to host the tournament in 2026. The decision significantly increases the chances that the event will take place in the United States, either as the sole bidder or in partnership with a neighbor such as Mexico or Canada.

title: Gender Issues in Sharp Focus at The Times
description: Susan Chira, senior correspondent for gender issues, and Susan Dominus, a Times Magazine writer, talk about men, women and coverage of their changing roles.

title: We May Be Leaving the Ken Bone Zone
description: This is an obituary for a fictional persona: Ken Bone, Americas Red-Breasted Hero.

title: Hal Holbrook, on The Birth of a Nation
description: To the Editor:

title: Expanding the Nobel Pantheon to Include Bob Dylan
description: To the Editor:

title: Evan McMullins Moonshot White House Bid Has Utahs Attention
description: LOGAN, Utah  On a night when Donald J. Trumps campaign was staggering under new accusations that he had groped and sexually assaulted women, 900 voters streamed into a middle school auditorium in this reliably Republican and mostly Mormon city, desperate to hear something different.

title: Wells Fargo Needs to Make a Clean Break With the Past
description: Even after two big shuffles at the top, Wells Fargo is still working from the same playbook. And for the banks stockholders, that could mean more frustration lies ahead.

title: Gender Issues in Sharp Focus at The Times
description: Susan Chira, formerly The New York Timess deputy executive editor, has a new role, as senior correspondent for gender issues.

title: 2010 | Trump Calls The Times His Forever Enduring Partner
description: Times Insider shares historic insights from The New York Times.

title: In Sagaponack, Betting the Farm on Boutique Vodka
description: The earth is gold to farm, said Dean Foster, who learned before he was in kindergarten how to drive a tractor on his familys potato farm in Sagaponack, N.Y. As a child, he never questioned going into the family business, which has been growing potatoes on the East End of Long Island for generations. But now we have an influx of people who realize this earth is gold to build on.

title: Celebrating 35 Years of Carolina Herrera
description: On Thursday evening, Omars, a members-only dining club on West Ninth Street, was filled to its wood-paneled, mirrored brim with a cross section of New York City actors, models, financiers, socialites, activists, editors and artists.

title: Presidential Policy Directive on Cuba
description: President Obama on Friday signed a new directive regarding United States policy toward Cuba, enshrining his push to normalize relations in a legally binding document.

title: Striped Bass of the Hudson
description: With the jutting jaw of a mob kingpin and the pinstripes of a Wall Street executive, striped bass swim through the brackish waters of New York Harbor like old-school New Yorkers  as if they own the place.

title: Morsos Modern Family: Five Years Old, but Decades in the Making
description: It seemed as though the entire Sutton Place neighborhood had gathered at Morso on a recent Tuesday evening. The contemporary 95-seat restaurant, lined with vintage 1950s-style graphics, was packed with couples, groups of friends, families and a handful of solo diners.

title: How Wall St. Regulation Pushed Up Libor, and Borrowing Costs
description: Is there any significance to the fact that a short-term interest rate has nearly tripled in the last year, to 0.86 percent from 0.32 percent? The short answer, of course, is yes. But the more interesting answer involves what the change in the so-called three-month London Interbank Offered Rate, or Libor, says about the Federal Reserves new regulatory framework for Wall Street, which it has slowly but surely been rolling out since the worst days of the financial crisis eight years ago.

title: Donald Trump Assails His Accusers as Liars, and Unattractive
description: Donald J. Trump wielded his presidential candidacy on Friday as a weapon for savaging detractors and venting personal grievances, attacking the women who have accused him of sexual assault and unwelcome advances and railing against what he described as a vast conspiracy against him by the news media and Hillary Clintons campaign.

title: Soccer Player Ched Evans Is Acquitted of Rape Charges in Retrial
description: Ched Evans, the Welsh soccer player whose career was derailed by his conviction on charges of raping a 19-year-old waitress in a hotel, and whose consistent protestations of innocence brought him both support and scorn, was found not guilty Friday after a retrial of the case.

title: How Julia Wolfe and Michael Gordon, Workaholic Composers, Spend Their Sundays
description: Julia Wolfe and Michael Gordon are two of the three founders and artistic directors of Bang on a Can, the genre-bending musical collective that will turn 30 next year. Theyre also a married couple who raised two children in their TriBeCa loft, a former Romanoff Caviar factory. The two compose loud music at either ends of the loft, which they share with their daughter, Yael, 20, and a cockapoo named River. Ms. Wolfe, 57, who goes by Julie, just won a MacArthur fellowship to go with her 2015 Pulitzer Prize for her oratorio Anthracite Fields, about coal mining in Pennsylvania. Amplified, a guitar quartet by Mr. Gordon, 60, is scheduled to be performed at the Brooklyn Academy of Musics Next Wave festival in December. They are workaholics who observe the Jewish Sabbath.

title: Trump as Champion of Working Class? Come On, Obama Says
description: CLEVELAND  President Obama on Friday implored voters here to reject a dark and pessimistic vision offered by Donald J. Trump and urged a robust turnout on behalf of Hillary Clinton in a state where the presidential candidates are locked in a razor-thin contest.

title: New York Bridal Fashion Week Recap
description: Designers like Monique Lhuillier, Reem Acra and Inbal Dror showcased their fall 2017 bridal collections.

title: A Peek at Bridal Fashion Week
description: This year at New York Bridal Fashion Week, designers like Monique Lhuillier, Reem Acra and Inbal Dror showcased their fall 2017 bridal collections. New looks that emerged on the runways included dramatic capes, intricate floral details, flamboyant ruffles and metallic gowns. Heres a peek at some of the fashions that will be available for next years brides.

title: Celebrating Three and a Half Decades
description: Actors, models and socialites gather to honor Carolina Herreras 35 years in fashion and a new book commemorating her time in the industry.

title: Artist Asks Cubans to Imagine They Are Running for President
description: MEXICO CITY  Tania Bruguera, the Cuban artist whose high-profile performances challenging the limits of freedom on the island have drawn support from the art world, threw down another gauntlet to Cubas closed political system on Friday when she said that she would run for office  even for president.

title: Cholera Deepens Haitis Misery After Hurricane
description: RENDEL, Haiti  There is a plague on this town.

title: Readers Go Electric Over Dylans Nobel
description: Mr. Dylan, I have just one question, Archy Techt from New York wrote. How does it feel?

title: Review: Eyewitness Tells of Whodunit, but Also Who Saw It
description: Not every role is a good fit for Julianne Nicholson, but Helen Torrance, the upstate New York sheriff she plays in the USA series Eyewitness, is well tailored. Duty bound, methodical and possessing only a nodding acquaintance with humor, Helen is someone you would probably like to know but wouldnt necessarily want to hang out with. Shes perfect for Ms. Nicholson, an actress who seems to keep everything inside.

title: The Nationals Cant Escape Their Sad Endings
description: WASHINGTON  You know what the Nationals clubhouse sounded like Thursday night, past midnight, after Washington lost the deciding Game 5 of its National League division series?

title: Trumps Comments Prompt Women to Speak Out
description: Since a 2005 recording of comments by Donald J. Trump about women went public, survivors of sexual assault are speaking out in unprecedented numbers.

title: Black Doctor Says Delta Flight Attendant Rejected Her; Sought Actual Physician
description: Dr. Tamika Cross, a black physician at the Lyndon B. Johnson Hospital in Houston, could not immediately come to the phone on Friday. She was busy delivering a baby boy by C-section.

title: In Race for Millennials, Its Time to Speed Up
description: Vice entered the nightly news business this week, delivering a rebel-style newscast on HBO with no anchor, no ads and none of the predictable tics and tricks of the broadcast old guard. The show is aimed at the very market segment that The New York Times is feverishly trying to reach  millennials.

title: In Nigeria, Joy for Girls Freed by Boko Haram. What of the Rest?
description: LAGOS, Nigeria  People fanned out on bicycles and on foot across a remote region of northeastern Nigeria on Friday to notify the families of 21 girls that they had been liberated by Boko Haram, the Islamist extremist group, after two and a half years of captivity.

title: Jordan Tones Down Textbooks Islamic Content, and Tempers Rise
description: MAAN, Jordan  When Jordans school year began last month, educators began noticing tweaks in the curriculum.

title: The Playlist: Pusha T Spurns the Doubters and Kendrick Lamar Tempts the Critics
description: Every Friday, pop critics for The New York Times weigh in on the weeks most notable new songs and videos  and anything else that strikes them as intriguing  in the Playlist. You can listen to this playlist on Spotify here. Like this format? Let us know at theplaylist@nytimes.com, and sign up for our Louder newsletter (coming soon!) here.

title: Janet Yellen Says Labor and Inflation Complicate Feds Plans to Raise Rates
description: BOSTON  Janet L. Yellen, the Federal Reserve chairwoman, did not talk on Friday about the Feds plans for its benchmark interest rate. Instead, she talked about why those plans have been so hard to make.

title: Wells Fargo Says Customers Shied Away After Scandal
description: Wells Fargo disclosed on Friday that new account openings had taken a nose-dive since the scandal over illegal activity at the bank erupted: Bank executives said customers opened 25 percent fewer checking accounts and applied for 20 percent fewer credit cards in September compared with a year ago.

title: Signs of Strain in the Stock and Bond Love Affair
description: It has been easy for stock investors to love bonds as they have generated handsome returns while providing protection when the stock market falls.

title: Palantir Faults Labor Dept.s Data in Discrimination Suit
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Palantir, a large and secretive Silicon Valley start-up recently sued by the United States Department of Labor for discrimination, contends that the government misread the way it hires employees.

title: Review: The Content Trap Rethinks Digital Media Strategy
description: For 15 years, the business school cases written by Bharat N. Anand, a popular Harvard Business School strategy professor, have played a central role in framing students understanding of the media industry. Like all great business school cases, they tell an interesting story and provide the critical facts but leave it to the interactive classroom experience to draw out the relevant lessons.

title: Stocks Climb Under Heavy Clouds
description: The Federal Reserve still hasnt raised interest rates, though it insists that an increase is just around the corner. An even bigger decision that cannot be put off  it will be made by American voters on Nov. 8  is stirring concern all over the world.

title: How Regular Investing Smooths the Markets Ups and Downs
description: You may not realize you are doing it, but if you are salting away money every month in a workplace retirement plan, there is a good chance that you are practicing one of the most time-honored methods for long-term investors: dollar-cost averaging.

title: Sticking With Stocks, Especially in Market Downturns
description: Call it confidence, or an unwillingness to try to time the market, or even complacency. But whatever the reason, some mutual fund managers with the best performances over the last five to 10 years say they are disinclined to sell their stock holdings  even if the overall market turns down.

title: Picking a Portfolio With Pokballs
description: Oops! Didnt mean to bump into you there. Its just that I cant stop playing Pokmon Go, the smartphone game.

title: Canada Today: Economic Bright Spots, and Some Disquieting Mail
description: Were trying something new: Canada Today, a weekly roundup for Canadian readers and anyone else interested in the True North. Tell us what you think and what youd like to see, at CanadaToday@nytimes.com. And, using the link below, please subscribe to the email newsletter version.

title: Brexit Blurs the European Investment Outlook
description: When the British voted in a referendum to leave the European Union, it clouded the political outlook across the region, and that made the economic and investment outlook far murkier, too.

title: Three Excellent Books on Long-Term Investing
description: It is easy to forget personal investing fundamentals when stock prices hit new highs one week, fall sharply the next and then rise again in no reliable pattern, as they have been doing this year. So now is an ideal time to reread  or perhaps pick up for the first time  three excellent books by people who are particularly good at explaining the building blocks of a solid portfolio.

title: Autumn in New York, So Inviting
description: Top social events in the city recently included Carnegie Halls opening night gala, the N.A.A.C.P. New York State Conferences 80th anniversary benefit and the Olana Partnership gala.

title: Autumn in New York, So Inviting
description: The fall social season is in full swing, with notable New Yorkers out on the town almost every night. On Oct. 6, many gathered at the Waldorf Astoria for Carnegie Halls opening night gala, the first to feature its new chairman, Robert F. Smith. That same evening, the N.A.A.C.P.s 80th anniversary benefit was held at the Sheraton Times Square, where Richard D. Parsons and Reginald Van Lee were the events chairmen, and Cicely Tyson was among the honorees. On Thursday, the Olana Partnership honored Washburn and Susan Oberwager.

title: Louis Stettner, Who Photographed the Everyday New York and Paris, Dies at 93
description: Louis Stettner, a photographer who explored the streets of the two cities he called his spiritual mothers, New York and Paris, recording the daily lives of ordinary people, died on Thursday at his home in Saint-Ouen, France. He was 93.

title: Review: In Graves, a Politician Goes From Red to Blue to Gruff and Gray
description: You probably need to be left-leaning or at least politically neutral to enjoy the new Epix comedy Graves, which begins Sunday, though really everybody should savor Nick Noltes performance in it. The guy was born to be a growly old man.

title: Why You Should Bet Against Your Candidate
description: When your favorite sports team is defeated, youre disappointed, even dismayed. The same is true when your preferred political candidate doesnt win. It hurts when your side loses.

title: The Assault Allegations Against Donald Trump
description: To the Editor:

title: Helping Homeless Students
description: To the Editor:

title: Desus & Mero: No Suits. And No Canned Sketches.
description: This past Tuesday afternoon, in a conference room on the third floor of Vices sprawling Williamsburg offices, the comic team of Desus & Mero was going through its daily calisthenics.

title: U.S. Athletes Reassured After New Russian Hack
description: The United States Anti-Doping Agency is seeking to reassure American athletes that their private medical information is safe after Russian hackers gained access to the email account of one of the agencys officials.

title: Review: A Choreographers Head-Spinning Turns as Self-Revelation
description: If I had to categorize the French-Algerian choreographer Rachid Ouramdane, Id label him an expressionist minimalist. I cant think of anyone else to whom that tag applies in dance, and Mr. Ouramdane reminds me of nobody else. His vocabulary is small, but it suggests that he has urgent points to make that go beyond dance. Hes original, peculiar, limited, irksome, haunting.

title: Thailand Looks to Likely Future King With Apprehension
description: TUTZING, Germany  For more than two years, the king of Thailand lay ill in a Bangkok hospital. During much of that time, his son, the heir to Thailands throne, was far from the kingdom, flying around Europe in his Boeing 737 and ensconced in luxury villas and hotels amid the misty lakes and mountains of southern Germany and Austria.

title: Falls Muted (and Ruffled) Pastels
description: Fall usually brings to mind dark, cozy colors  but this seasons party dresses conjure a distinctly different mood.

title: Diver Recounts His Encounter With a Cage-Breaking Great White Shark
description: A scuba diver who was on a diving tour of great white shark habitats narrowly escaped an encounter with one this month when it broke through the bars of a diving cage and thrashed for nearly a minute until it freed itself.

title: Is It a Risk for the 49ers to Start Colin Kaepernick? Not for Them.
description: When the San Francisco 49ers play the Buffalo Bills on Sunday, Colin Kaepernick will make his first start of the season as the 49ers quarterback. Although Kaepernick is currently best known for refusing to stand for the national anthem  a protest against racial injustice that has spread across the sports landscape  it wasnt all that long ago that he was the dynamic young quarterback who led his team to a Super Bowl appearance and a conference championship game in back-to-back seasons.

title: Is G.O.P. Dodging a Landslide? Trumps Polling Hasnt Collapsed (Yet)
description: The past three weeks could not have gone much worse for Donald J. Trump, or really the entire Republican Party for that matter.

title: Wells Fargos Problems Go Beyond Sham Accounts Scandal
description: JPMorgan Chase and Citigroup are hinting at broader woes for Wells Fargo. Wall Street helped the two diversified giant banks trounce third-quarter earnings expectations, while Wells Fargo just squeaked by. As Timothy J. Sloan, the new chief executive at Wells, contends with the sham accounts fiasco, he also will be tested by falling returns.

title: Review: A Composers Mystical Music Gets the Space It Demands
description: Many of Kaija Saariahos orchestral pieces unfold with minute and seemingly constant shifts of subtle sounds and colorings. Dense chords murmur restlessly, as wavering melodic lines escape from sustained, quivering sonorities and spin off, sometimes disappearing into an ether. The instrumental writing is continually varied and wondrously strange.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: To Lead or Disrupt?
description: No third-party candidate has made it to the White House. What makes politicians like Gary Johnson of the Libertarian Party or the independent Evan McMullin run for the presidency?

title: Fall Bridal Trends
description: The fall 2017 bridal collections included off-the-shoulder creations and even thigh-high satin boots.

title: The Maverick Bride
description: Brides will be brides, or so convention has it, cherishing gauzy fantasies of alabaster princess gowns trailing regal yards of tulle.

title: Review: Berlin Station, the Hunt for a C.I.A. Whistle-Blower
description: Olen Steinhauer is a successful espionage novelist (his latest is All the Old Knives) whos now created a television series, Berlin Station, for the premium-cable channel Epix. It appears to be his first dramatic work, and as rookie efforts go, its more than solid.

title: Clinton, Trump, Cuba: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Review: Stuffed Details Fights Women Wage With Their Weight
description: The strange thing about Stuffed, the new ensemble piece by Lisa Lampanelli, is that shes the only one in its cast of four who is portraying a real person. Long established as an insult comic with a tough-broad stage persona, she plays herself in this WP Theater production, unveiling her issues with food and fat for public consumption.

title: Ruth Bader Ginsburg Regrets Speaking Out on Colin Kaepernick
description: WASHINGTON  Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg issued a statement on Friday expressing regret for her critical comments on protests by San Francisco 49ers quarterback Colin Kaepernick and other National Football League players seeking to draw attention to police brutality and racial injustice.

title: Higher Prices Dim the Appeal of Dividend-Paying Stocks
description: Dividend-paying stocks have had a terrific run for the last five years and already have double-digit gains in the first three quarters of 2016.

title: De Blasios Police Reform Pledges May Burden His Re-election Bid
description: As Mayor Bill de Blasio of New York turns toward his re-election fight next year, an issue that galvanized his first run  achieving significant police reform  is suddenly becoming a liability.

title: Louis Stettner, Photographer of Everyday Poetry
description: Mr. Stettner, who died on Thursday at 93, had an unerring eye for life in New York and Paris, the two cities he called his spiritual mothers.

title: How Three Strong-Performing Funds Pick Stocks
description: Many stock-picking styles have sizzled lately, with growth and value and domestic and international investing all toting up gains. Three of the better-performing mutual funds of recent months found their winners among small- and large-cap growth stocks and Chinese shares.

title: FM Stations That Dont Reach Far, but Reach Deep
description: They would seem to make odd broadcasting bedfellows: the Roman Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn and the Global Service Center for Quitting Chinese Communist Party. Yet the two organizations are partnering on the airwaves, with two radio stations starting next month at 105.5 FM in Queens.

title: Trumps Comments and Your Relationship
description: Wed like to hear how the allegations of sexual misconduct against Donald J. Trump are playing out in peoples relationships. Please share your story with us.

title: Behind Putins Combativeness, Some See Motives Other Than Syria
description: MOSCOW  Somewhat obscured by the volatile American presidential election this week was the implosion of relations between the Kremlin and the West.

title: Death Sentences Require Unanimous Jury, Florida Supreme Court Rules
description: The Florida Supreme Court ruled Friday that the death penalty cannot be imposed without the unanimous support of a jury, deepening the recent turmoil around capital punishment in a state with a long history of executions.

title: Theres Such a Thing as Too Much Neuroscience
description: The United States government recently announced its new director of the National Institute of Mental Health, Dr. Joshua Gordon. If you think thats just bureaucracy as usual, think again. Mental health research, under the leadership of the previous director, Dr. Thomas Insel, underwent a quiet crisis, one with worrisome implications for the treatment of mental health. I hope Dr. Gordon will resolve it.

title: Flush and Dominant, Australias Banks Come Under Pressure
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Dr. Benjamin Koh felt it was obvious what his employer wanted: to avoid paying the claim of a terminally ill customer.

title: Politics Trumps Gender in the Selection of a U.N. Leader
description: UNITED NATIONS  In the end, politics trumped gender.

title: The King Who Personified Thailand
description: He was a curious amalgam of modern and feudal: an American-born, Swiss-educated king who could not be criticized under Thailands stern lse-majest laws; an accomplished sailor, painter and saxophonist who once jammed with Benny Goodman, but before whom his subjects had to prostrate themselves; a constitutional monarch with limited powers who commanded a vast fortune and was accorded almost divine status; a head of state whose reign was punctuated by a progression of bad governments and coups, yet was loved by his countrymen.

title: Team Sky Tried to Rise Above Doping and Landed in an Ethics Quagmire
description: When Britains Team Sky made its debut in 2010, two things dominated its agenda. It planned to develop a British Tour de France winner within five years and to do so with a zero-tolerance approach to doping.

title: 3 Held in Bomb Plot Against Somalis in Kansas
description: Three militia members plotted to detonate a bomb at a housing complex in western Kansas where Somali immigrants lived and worshiped, federal investigators said Friday.

title: In New York City, Hundreds Become U.S. Citizens Just in Time to Vote
description: In a packed federal courtroom in Brooklyn on Friday, it was one-stop shopping for 262 New Yorkers: They became American citizens and registered to vote  all from their seats and just before the deadline.

title: Pierre taix, Director and Slapstick Actor, Dies at 87
description: Pierre taix, a French director of seamlessly choreographed slapstick films, including Happy Anniversary, which won an Oscar for best live-action short subject in 1963, died on Friday in Paris. He was 87.

title: Puerto Ricos Governor Warns of Fiscal Death Spiral
description: Reach for your wallets. It is going to be expensive to pull Americas largest territory out of its death spiral, Puerto Ricos outgoing governor warned the islands new federal oversight board on Friday.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: I just want to send him to heaven. He did so much for us.

title: 2 Face Hate Crime Charges in Attack on Sikh Man in California
description: Two men in California were charged with hate crimes on Friday in connection with an attack on a Sikh man, punching him in the face and using a knife to cut up to 10 inches of his hair, which was unshorn by religious mandate, a prosecutor said.

title: De Blasio Calls for Change in Law That Blocks Release of Police Disciplinary Actions
description: In the face of mounting criticism of his record on transparency, Mayor Bill de Blasio called for changing a state law that the city has said blocks the release of details about disciplinary actions taken against New York City police officers.

title: How Turned Off Are Voters? Check Out Tommys Diner
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio  So here we are, nearing the end of 2016s he-said, she-said race to the bottom. Through it all, through his ugly caricatures of Mexicans and Muslims, through her pretzel contortions to explain her emails, through the Russian hacking and the 3 a.m. Twitter rants and the rest, this was always going to be a hold your nose and vote election.

title: Donald Trumps Barrage of Heated Rhetoric Has Little Precedent
description: WASHINGTON  There is a long tradition of presidential candidates ratcheting up their language when they are trailing in the closing weeks of an election.

title: Tim Tebow Is a Hit With the Fans and Hitless on the Field
description: SCOTTSDALE, Ariz.  The player came to home plate, bat in hand, and was greeted by the opposing catcher, Nick Ciuffo, who is acquainted with most of his opponents in the Arizona Fall League from a youth spent on baseball diamonds.

title: For New Yorks Foulest Waterways, a Seat of Dubious Honor
description: The hardware is here, Rob Buchanan said, wheeling in the trophies on Thursday night for an unusual award ceremony.

title: U.S. Deficit Increases to $587 Billion, Ending Downward Trend
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration confirmed on Friday that a six-year run of declining annual budget deficits had halted: The shortfall for the fiscal year that ended Sept. 30 was $587 billion, an increase over last year in dollars and as a percentage of the economy.

title: Relieve, and Achieve, in the Postseason
description: CLEVELAND  The American League Championship Series opened here Friday with news that Trevor Bauer, who was scheduled to start Saturday for the Cleveland Indians, had sliced the pinkie of his pitching hand  while performing routine maintenance on a drone.

title: Left Behind by a Fallen Soldier, and Fighting Flashbacks 10 Years Later
description: I have been fighting sleep every night this week to keep the flashbacks from flooding in. They are flashes of the day when two military officers showed up at my door. The day I screamed so loud I scared my baby and then collapsed onto the hardwood floor. The day my soldier, First Sgt. Charles Monroe King, was killed in combat in Iraq.

title: Friday Night Music: Im With Her Does Dylan
description: Ive posted other performances of this song by this band, but this is a good one  and topical this week!

title: Dodgers Dave Roberts Isnt Managing Like a Rookie
description: CHICAGO  Watching the thrilling theater of Game 5 of the National League division series against the Washington Nationals unfold on Thursday night, Los Angeles Dodgers General Manager Farhan Zaidi was filled with pride. His rookie manager, Dave Roberts, was pulling the right strings  some of them unconventional  to propel his team to the National League Championship Series.

title: Nicols Maduro Flexes New Budgetary Muscles in Venezuela
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  Venezuelas new annual budget resembled those of past years. Millions of dollars were promised for social programs like housing and education. Money would be earmarked for local governments to police the streets and repair potholes.

title: El Salvador Wins Dispute Over Denying a Mining Permit
description: MEXICO CITY  The government of El Salvador won a long-running legal battle on Friday when an international arbitration panel ruled that it did not have to pay compensation to a mining company that was denied a concession to drill for gold.

title: The Coming Battle for Mosul
description: The coming battle to retake Mosul in northern Iraq could be a turning point in the American-led fight against the Islamic State. The city is the terrorist groups stronghold in that country and critical to its claim to having established a caliphate.

title: Help Teachers Before They Get to Class
description: The countries that have eclipsed the United States in educational achievement have far more effective systems for training teachers. Consider, for example, Finlands system, which has consistently ranked among the best in the world. Decades ago, Finland moved teacher education out of teachers colleges and into universities, where students are given rigorous preparation and recruited from the top quarter of their graduating high school classes.

title: N.J. Transit Getting Scrutiny and Pledges of Aid for Its Problems
description: State lawmakers in New Jersey moved on Friday to hold hearings focused on investigating the problems plaguing New Jersey Transit, and a top federal official announced that a key project meant to improve the railroads service was moving forward.

title: Hen Tracks
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Once you take on the challenge of conquering  or at least trying  a Saturday New York Times crossword puzzle, its important to let go of the notion that your wheelhouse is always, reliably your wheelhouse. Youll discover that you have a lot to learn, and thats not a bad mind-set. Zen Buddhists call that shoshin, or Beginners Mind.

title: Judge Dismisses Suit Against Gun Maker by Newtown Victims Families
description: A Connecticut judge has dismissed a lawsuit filed by relatives of victims of the Sandy Hook Elementary School attack, delivering a blow to an ambitious effort to hold accountable the makers of the assault rifle used in the 2012 massacre before the case ever went to trial.

title: How to Get Away With Doping
description: Manchester, England  In 2004, I was in a French prison cell, arrested by a Paris drug squad on the order of an examining magistrate, a powerful official in the French criminal justice system. It was right that I should have been there: I had broken the law  as it turned out, not French law, but sporting law. I had taken performance-enhancing drugs and I had won some of the biggest races in the sport of cycling, including a World Championship title. I had cheated.

title: On the Trail: Week of Oct. 9
description: The week began with the second presidential debate and ended with Hillary Clinton scaling back her schedule while Donald J. Trump accused her campaign and the news media of conspiring against him.

title: F.B.I. Memos on the Black Panther Party
description: These documents, made public during a civil suit brought by a former Black Panther, Dhoruba al-Mujahid bin Wahad, in the 1980s, show that the F.B.I. exploited press coverage in its efforts to undermine the group.

title: Accusers Acquaintances Testify as Derrick Rose Trial Nears End
description: LOS ANGELES  Derrick Roses civil rape trial concluded its second week Friday, with his fate undecided but nearing a resolution.

title: By Limiting Damage, Indians Get off to a Fast Start Against the Blue Jays
description: CLEVELAND  The Toronto Blue Jays muscled their way to the American League Championship Series, blasting 10 home runs in four games before meeting the Cleveland Indians in Game 1 on Friday. The teams had played seven games in the regular season, and Toronto had homered in all of them.

title: Christina Wang and Brian Lam: Smitten With Seafood, Beset by Bees
description: Christina Jessica Wang, a daughter of Daisy Wang and Peter Kin-Chung Wang of Hong Kong, was married Oct. 15 to Brian Sze-Tsung Lam, the son of Marie W. Lam and Shau Wai Lam of Summit, N.J. Bernard Lang, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated at the Wauwinet Hotel in Nantucket, Mass.

title: Corrections: October 15, 2016
description: NATIONAL

title: Louisville Sews Up Win After a Mistake by Duke
description: Lamar Jackson provided a cushion with a 2-yard touchdown run with 1 minute 32 seconds remaining, and No. 7 Louisville held off visiting Duke, 24-14, on Friday night.

title: Whats on TV Saturday: Captain Fantastic and Emily Blunt on S.N.L.
description: Viggo Mortensen goes off the grid  and then comes back again  in Captain Fantastic. Sarah Paulson and Mark Duplass play former teenage lovers who unexpectedly reconnect in Blue Jay. And Emily Blunt takes the Saturday Night Live stage.

title: Nations, Fighting Powerful Refrigerant That Warms Planet, Reach Landmark Deal
description: KIGALI, Rwanda  Negotiators from more than 170 countries on Saturday reached a legally binding accord to counter climate change by cutting the worldwide use of a powerful planet-warming chemical used in air-conditioners and refrigerators.

title: Everybody Hates a Winner: A Brooklyn High School Football Coach Inspires and Exasperates
description: Last December, on a cold, sunny morning at Yankee Stadium, Bruce Eugene, the head football coach of the Grand Street Campus Wolves, took his players on a slow walk through the grounds to calm their nerves. Though they would soon be playing for the Public Schools Athletic League championship, this field, he assured them, was no different than their turf back in Brooklyn.

title: I Regret Not Standing Up to Him for That
description: Here are the top 10 comments of the week on our digital platforms, as selected by our readers and the journalists who moderate nearly every comment.

title: How Did Walmart Get Cleaner Stores and Higher Sales? It Paid Its People More
description: BENTONVILLE, Ark.  A couple of years ago, Walmart, which once built its entire branding around a big yellow smiley face, was creating more than its share of frowns.

title: Magnates Twin Goals: Fighting Climate Change and Electing Donald Trump
description: MONTAUK, N.Y.  On a sunny morning late this summer, Andrew E. Sabin was aboard his 60-foot yacht, Above the Ground. He had begun the day in Amagansett, a well-heeled enclave near East Hampton where he maintains a lush seven-acre compound replete with a menagerie featuring peacocks and an enormous pig. Now, on the eastern tip of Long Island, Mr. Sabin pierced a clam with a hook and dropped his fishing line 120 feet to the ocean floor, hoping to land some cod.

title: The art of making (and not making) plans
description: Adult life is full of commitments: bills to pay, family to see and a job you probably have to show up for. But in a world where many of us complain of being overscheduled, theres something uniquely depressing about having no control over the time once quaintly called personal and free.

title: A Onetime BuzzFeed Wunderkind, Now at CNN
description: Andrew Kaczynski, the 26-year-old reporter who dug up evidence showing that Donald J. Trump had supported the invasion of Iraq before the war, was Google-chatting with Tim Miller, a Republican operative who was the communications director for the Jeb Bush presidential campaign.

title: Houstons Coach Pecks Away at Footballs Macho Culture, a Kiss at a Time
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md.  When the University of Houstons football players arrive for a game, they know what to expect as a prelude to the coming hours of brutality as they file into the stadium: a kiss on the cheek from their head coach, Tom Herman.

title: Scenes of New York
description: One photographers view of city residents in their element.

title: As Seen on the Streets
description: The photographer of this series, Daniel Weiss, 29, was born in New York City and grew up on the Upper West Side. He had two big interests, which fed each other: skateboarding and photography.

title: The Power Pastor: How A.R. Bernard Built a New York Megachurch
description: One Saturday in mid-September, the Rev. A. R. Bernard took to the blue carpeted stage of the Christian Cultural Center, the 96,000-square-foot megachurch he built 16 years ago at the edge of Starrett City, in Brooklyn, with his usual accouterments: a smartphone, a bottle of water and a large glass marker board that he would soon cover in bullet points drawn from the playbooks of marketing specialists. Mr. Bernard, 63, is tall and slender, and on this day he wore a distressed black leather jacket, a white polo shirt, bluejeans and white tennis shoes  casual Saturday attire. On Sunday, you would find him impeccably tailored in a light wool suit and tortoiseshell glasses, looking more like the banker he once was than the pastor of a congregation of nearly 40,000.

title: Discounts on Ranch Vacations (Riding Included)
description: Horseback riding has long been considered a costly pursuit, especially when payment for individual rides is required. Choosing an all-inclusive ranch is one way to keep costs down, and there is an additional value when those properties offer specials.

title: A Little Variety
description: VARIETY PUZZLES  This weeks puzzles include:

title: How the U.S. Became More Involved in the War in Yemen
description: The United States has become more directly involved in Yemens civil war.

title: Jims and Nicks Week in Tech: Smoldering Phones, the Yahoo Markdown and Amazon Music
description: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry. Jim Kerstetter, the deputy technology editor in San Francisco, and Nick Wingfield, technology reporter in Seattle, are filling in for Farhad and Mike this week.

title: Is the Market for New York Apartments Softening?
description: Q. Last spring, we put our Upper West Side apartment on the market. It is a two-bedroom in mint condition with wraparound views, and we listed it for a little over $2 million. Ten days later, our agent suggested lowering the price because she said the market was suddenly soft. After about four weeks, we took the apartment off the market. I have noticed that many comparable apartments are now off the market, too. Is the overall market soft? Are two-bedrooms the problem? Is it my neighborhood?

title: Saudi-Led Coalition Says It Bombed Yemen Funeral Based on False Information
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  A Saudi-led military coalition involved in Yemens war acknowledged on Saturday that one of its jets carried out an attack on a funeral this month in the Yemeni capital, Sana, that killed more than 100 people and wounded hundreds of others.

title: India Police Pressed to Act in Girls Death After Fast
description: NEW DELHI  The police in south India are under increasing pressure to take action in the case of a 13-year-old girl who went into cardiac arrest after completing a 68-day religious fast.

title: Rise of Saudi Prince Shatters Decades of Royal Tradition
description: He has slashed the state budget, frozen government contracts and reduced the pay of civil employees, all part of drastic austerity measures as the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia is buffeted by low oil prices.

title: A Meeting Place Filled With Noted Designers
description: Mad Men and MoMA

title: Your Phones on Lockdown. Enjoy the Show.
description: The comedian Dave Chappelle used to hate when fans would pull out smartphones during his act, record the performance and then post it on YouTube and social media before the show had even ended. To him, the fans seemed more interested in getting the perfect shot than in appreciating his stand-up routine.

title: A Linguist Who Cracks the Code in Names to Predict Ethnicity
description: Lisa Spira, 30, is director of research and product development at Ethnic Technologies in South Hackensack, N.J.

title: Variety: Acrostic
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Vitamins and nutrition happen to be an area of interest of mine, so I was happy to learn what I did from todays quote in our acrostic. VITAMIN A really can be a MIRACLE CURE if it is made accessible to populations who are deficient in it.

title: Let the Boss Leave the Book Club
description: For over five years, Ive been a member of a book discussion group that includes two co-workers from the midsize company I work for. The group is purely a social gathering and is not work related in any way. None of our other colleagues are members.

title: The ExoMars Spacecraft Arrives at the Red Planet
description: The ExoMars spacecraft is now orbiting Mars.

title: For Paul Ryan, a Long, Labored Path Leading Away From Donald Trump
description: WASHINGTON  He didnt see it coming.

title: With a Little Luck for a Change, the Cubs Amassed a Fortune
description: CHICAGO  When Theo Epstein wanted to trade Ryan Dempster, one of the few coveted assets he had inherited when he signed on as the Chicago Cubs president of baseball operations, it did not appear as if Dempster was doing him any favors.

title: Donald Trump and Other Animals
description: I once interviewed Donald Trump for a magazine story. The topic was rivalries, which seemed like a natural for him. But he was so bombastically short on specifics, so braggadociously vague, that in the end there was nothing to quote. I left him out of the story.

title: As a Black Republican Senator, Tim Scott Faces a Unique Donald Trump Issue
description: CLEMSON, S.C.  The event, technically, was the screening of a documentary about conservative solutions to poverty. But the big draw for the nearly all-white audience of Clemson University students was Tim Scott, the only black Republican in the United States Senate  and the walking proof, to Republicans here, that they have moved beyond the old white tribalism that once defined them.

title: Ang Lees Plea: Give Billy Lynn a Chance
description: Please give this a chance. Have an open mind. Enjoy the show.

title: Minnows of the Sports World Nip the Titles From the Whales
description: The Cleveland Indians must be stopped, for the sake of equality, justice and proportional representation.

title: Urging Blacks to Vote for Clinton for Obamas Sake, and Their Own
description: With the Trump campaign seemingly taking on more water every day, Hillary Clinton is shifting into voter-turnout mode. This ad  aptly titled Show Up  seeks to persuade African-Americans to cast their ballots as if their lives, or at least their civil rights, depend on it.

title: With Idols in Ranks, South Korean Army Steps to a K-Pop Beat
description: GYERYONG, South Korea  The audience applauded politely as the honor guard twirled its rifles, and oohed and aahed at the acrobatic taekwondo demonstration. But the real excitement began when the army band appeared.

title: Listen to Bob Dylans Many Influences
description: As Bob Dylan has said, his songs didnt get here by themselves. Heres a sampler of his influences, from Woody Guthrie to the Kinks, alongside the tracks he made famous.

title: Nostalgia for the Grace of George H.W. Bush
description: The suggestion, the vice president told his 1988 campaign diary, was strange and unbelievable. Twenty-eight years ago, George H. W. Bush, fresh from securing the Republican presidential nomination to succeed Ronald Reagan, was about to choose a running mate of his own. His campaign manager, Lee Atwater, always on the lookout for the unconventional and the unexpected, had apparently had informal talks with Donald J. Trump, the New York developer.

title: If Hillary Clinton Groped Men
description: Is there a double standard for women in politics?

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: The E.U. Should Stick to Its Guns on Brexit
description: Britain and the European Union may be getting over the initial shock of the British demand for a divorce. Now comes the bitter fight. Already, both sides have staked out very different positions on immigration, an issue that promises to be the most contentious in the separation proceedings.

title: Head Trauma Haunts the Gridiron
description: The National Football League began its season last month with a pledge of another $100 million for more research and safer equipment to deal with the traumatic head injuries that have caused premature deaths among retired players and raised threats to the long-term viability of one of Americas favorite, and riskiest, sports.

title: The Authentic Power of Michelle Obama
description: Isnt it delicious that after trafficking in racism, promoting sexism and using a lie about Barack Obamas birthplace as a pivot into political relevance, Donald Trump could receive his final death blow from a black woman: the presidents wife?

title: How Cats Evolved to Win the Internet
description: Like many people, I needed a cat photo for my personal website. Lulu did the trick. She was puffy, orange and belonged to the ex-roommate of my sisters boyfriend. Lulu  whose nickname is Luyonc  vamped obligingly, and Lulus owner soon decided that her budding cat model required an Instagram account.

title: In Defense of the Religious Right
description: I RISE to offer a defense  not a full-throated defense, more of a limited one  of the beleaguered, battered, all-but-broken religious right.

title: Is It Time to Desegregate the Sexes?
description: You could be forgiven for thinking that the most fiercely contested territory in America right now is the bathroom. On Monday, the Supreme Court is expected to announce whether it will hear G.G. v. Gloucester School Board, which turns on the question of whether Gavin Grimm, a 16-year-old transgender boy, may use the mens room.

title: Food Banks and Free Markets
description: How Food Banks Can Stop Sending Potatoes to Idaho, by Sendhil Mullainathan of Harvard (The Upshot, Economic View, Oct. 9), told how Feeding America used free market principles to aid distribution among the food banks it serves. The organization put in place a bidding system employing a virtual currency.

title: Where the Trump Name Is Emblazoned Now: The Front Yard
description: HUDSON, Ohio  Some stood alongside heavily trafficked highways, big enough to read a quarter-mile away.

title: Outpourings of Grief at Monarchs Death
description: Three days after the death of King Bhumibol Adulyadej of Thailand, health officials offered special grief counseling, and mourners dressed in black gathered in Bangkok.

title: Thailand Says Bhumibols Cremation Is a Year Away, With Heirs Coronation to Follow
description: BANGKOK  The cremation of Bhumibol Adulyadej, the revered Thai king who died Thursday, will not take place for at least a year, a top official said Saturday, with the crown princes coronation expected to occur some time after that.

title: In a Pioneering Moment for the W.N.B.A., Players Unite in Protests Over Injustices
description: After the Libertys game against the San Antonio Stars on July 10, five players stood together in the media room at Madison Square Garden, explaining why they had shed their league-mandated warm-ups to wear T-shirts that addressed recent fatal shootings by and of police officers.

title: Fascination and Fear: Covering the Black Panthers
description: The Black Panther Party was founded 50 years ago in Oakland, Calif., on Oct. 15, 1966. Within two years, it had chapters across the country. The Times is marking the occasion by exploring the Black Panthers legacy through their iconography and how they were covered in our own pages.

title: Fifty Years Later, Black Panthers Art Still Resonates
description: The Black Panther Party was founded 50 years ago in Oakland, on Oct. 15, 1966, and within two years it had chapters across the country. The New York Times is taking this opportunity to explore the Black Panthers legacy, through their iconic use of imagery and how they were covered in our own pages.

title: We Should Take a Drug Test Before Debate, Donald Trump Says
description: PORTSMOUTH, N.H.  Escalating his criticism of Hillary Clintons debate performances, Donald J. Trump came to a state battling a drug epidemic and suggested without any evidence on Saturday that his opponent had been on drugs during their second debate.

title: How to Be a Man in the Age of Trump
description: ONE afternoon, while reporting for a book on girls sexual experience, I sat in on a health class at a progressive Bay Area high school. Toward the end of the session, a blond boy wearing a school athletic jersey raised his hand. You know that baseball metaphor for sex? he asked. Well, in baseball theres a winner and a loser. So who is supposed to be the loser in sex?

title: Issues in Hillary Clintons Past Leave Her Muted in Furor Over Donald Trump
description: In the past week, as a swirl of sexual assault accusations against Donald J. Trump has prompted a loud national discussion about male power and womens rights, the first woman to be a major partys presidential nominee was barely heard from.

title: Michelle Schools Donald Trump
description: ANITA HILL lost her fight.

title: Biden Hints at U.S. Response to Russia for Cyberattacks
description: WASHINGTON  Since the Obama administration formally accused Russia about a week ago of trying to interfere in the election, there has been intense speculation about whether President Obama has ordered the National Security Agency to conduct a retaliatory cyberstrike.

title: Indians Future May Rest in the Hands of Their Young Shortstop Francisco Lindor
description: CLEVELAND  The engine of the Cleveland Indians knelt on the grass in front of the shortstop hole Saturday, bathed in the sparkling midday sunshine before batting practice. Francisco Lindor, whose home run had won the opener of the American League Championship Series the night before, was practicing the fundamentals of the position that defines him.

title: The Other Campaign Madness: Mega-Donors
description: Whatever voters disappointment with the fractious and bitter election campaign, the moneyed forces underpinning the candidates are quietly doing very well. Its estimated that the $6.3 billion record set for election spending by presidential and congressional candidates in 2012 will be surpassed by at least a billion dollars this year, driven by affluent mega-donors whose insider heft with politicians grows with each seven-figure check they write.

title: What Do the Scary Clowns Want?
description: The Great Clown Scare of 2016 started in the dog days of August, when a young man began wandering the streets of Green Bay, Wis., in gruesome black-and-white clown makeup, carrying black balloons. (It was later revealed that he was doing guerrilla marketing for a horror short.) A few weeks later, children in a Greenville, S.C., apartment complex told the police about clowns flashing green laser lights in nearby woods and trying to lure them with cash. The complex issued a warning to residents, but the police found nothing  not one frizzy strand of clown-wig hair.

title: Premier League Pioneer Reaches a Somewhat Hostile Destination
description: LONDON  Just before the next act of his saga began, Bob Bradley took a few moments for himself.

title: Time (It Takes to Complete a Game) Isnt on M.L.B.s Side
description: The Washington Nationals could be excused if they did not want to go home. Facing elimination on Thursday in Game 5 of their division series with the Los Angeles Dodgers, they did everything they could to stay alive, and ended up stretching a nine-inning game out to 4 hours 32 minutes.

title: Foreign Spouse, Happy Life
description: Paris  A few years ago, my husband and I went to a restaurant on a Friday night. The Aperol spritzes had just arrived  we lived in Geneva, where the language is French and the cocktails are Italian  when a man I didnt know approached our table. He started talking. My husband chatted back. On the sidelines, I limbered up my bonsoirs and enchantes. But I never got the call-up. The man walked off, and I remained an unidentified sitting object  mute, anonymous, peeved.

title: A Better Way to Vote?
description: Readers discuss the risks and benefits of ranked voting, as proposed by Howard Dean.

title: James Turner
description: James Turner is the founder of Glimpse, an English nonprofit that advocates valuing friends and experiences more than the stuff advertisers pressure us to buy. The groups first project was Citizens Advertising Takeover Service, in which members replaced the ads in a London tube station with pictures of adorable cats.

title: Emotion
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Todays crossword by Tom McCoy is the type of puzzle that makes me rock out. I dont know about you, but as soon as I got the theme and realized why the title was Emotion, the first song that came to mind was this one:

title: New Syria Talks End Quickly, Giving Little Hope to a Beleaguered Aleppo
description: LAUSANNE, Switzerland  Talks among the United States, Russia and critical Middle East states aimed at brokering a new pause in Syrias war broke up after a few hours on Saturday without signs of progress, or a break in the Syrian governments ferocious assault on rebel-held parts of the city of Aleppo.

title: Ladies First: Saudi Arabias Female Candidates
description: In this documentary, The Times takes us into the largely inaccessible world of Saudi women by profiling three women running for public office, including Loujain al-Hathloul, in the first Saudi election open to female candidates.

title: Pedals the Walking Bear Said to Be Killed by a Hunter in New Jersey
description: Pedals, a beloved American black bear who walked upright and strolled around the suburbs of New Jersey like a Hanna-Barbera cartoon come to life, was believed to have been killed by a hunter last week, animal welfare activists said. His age was not known.

title: Cleveland Indians, With a Surprise Starter, Silence the Toronto Blue Jays Again
description: CLEVELAND  For the first two games in the American League Championship Series, a clear pattern has been established: The Cleveland Indians pitch well, take a slim lead and then hand the ball to their impenetrable bullpen to secure the win.

title: Hacked Transcripts Reveal a Genial Hillary Clinton at Goldman Sachs Events
description: In a 2013 paid speech hosted by Goldman Sachs, Hillary Clinton said she had not yet decided whether she would run for president again.

title: Hillary Clinton Builds $150 Million War Chest, Doubling Donald Trump
description: Donald J. Trump entered the homestretch of the campaign at a pronounced financial disadvantage to Hillary Clinton, according to figures Mr. Trumps team released on Saturday, and far below the self-funding goal he set for himself earlier in the race.

title: Killing of Migrant Forces France to Confront Treatment of Chinese
description: AUBERVILLIERS, France  A Chinese tailor, Zhang Chaolin, emigrated to France with his wife and two sons in 2006 in search of a better life. They settled in Aubervilliers, a working-class suburb of Paris, where a decade of striving finally put that life within reach.

title: Peter Thiel to Donate $1.25 Million in Support of Donald Trump
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Peter Thiel, true to his reputation as the most contrarian soul in Silicon Valley, is doubling down on Donald J. Trump.

title: Dennis Byrd, Former Jets Player, Is Killed in Car Crash in Oklahoma
description: Dennis Byrd, a former Jets defensive lineman who made an inspiring recovery from paralysis after a career-ending neck injury in 1992, died on Saturday in a two-vehicle crash near Claremore, Okla., officials said. Byrd was 50.

title: 4 Are Killed After Pickup Truck Plunges Off San Diego Bridge
description: Four people were killed on Saturday after a pickup truck plunged 60 feet off the San Diego-Coronado Bridge into a crowd gathered at a park below, a spokesman for the California Highway Patrol said.

title: Clayton Kershaw, Fresh Off His First Save, Prepares for Another Start
description: CHICAGO  Clayton Kershaw powered the Los Angeles Dodgers to the National League Championship Series with two starts and the final two outs of the division series. Now he will start Game 2 of the N.L.C.S. on Sunday against the Chicago Cubs.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: It is the biggest thing we can do in one giant swoop.

title: Donald Trump and the G.O.P.: The Party of Lincoln, Reagan and, Perhaps, Extinction
description: Staunch in its opposition to the Democrats but rived by fierce internal schisms, the American political party stumbled toward defeat, its members cursing their fate. We are slain, cried Lewis D. Campbell, a representative from Ohio. The party is dead, dead, dead!

title: New Test of North Korean Missile Fails, South Says
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea launched an intermediate-range ballistic missile, but the test failed as the projectile exploded shortly after liftoff, the South Korean military said on Sunday.

title: Email About Qatari Offer Shows Thorny Ethical Issues Clinton Foundation Faced
description: In April 2012, representatives from Qatar were apparently hoping to get five minutes with former President Bill Clinton while in New York to present him with a $1 million check for his foundation as a birthday gift from the previous year.

title: Brittany Watts, Eric Swalwell
description: Brittany Ann Watts and Representative Eric Michael Swalwell were married Oct. 14 at the Rene C. Davidson Courthouse in Oakland, Calif. Nancy E. O'Malley, the Alameda County district attorney, who is also a deputy marriage commissioner, officiated.

title: Jennifer Yong, Michael Kim
description: Dr. Jennifer Ji Hye Yong, a daughter of Young Hee Yong and the Rev. Jang Young Yong of Fullerton, Calif., was married Oct. 15 to Dr. Michael Gulchu Kim, the son of Ellen Y. Kim and David Kim of San Jose, Calif.

title: Jessica Tom, David Brown
description: Jessica Tang Tom and David Brown were married Oct. 15 at Paxson Hill Farm in New Hope, Pa. Claire M. Nasuti, a friend of the couple who was ordained by American Marriage Ministries for the event, officiated.

title: Christina Abruzzo, Anthony Finizio
description: Christina Louise Abruzzo, a daughter of Carol Bradford Abruzzo and Joseph F. Abruzzo Jr. of Summit, N.J., was married Oct. 15 to Anthony Vincent Finizio, the son of Eugenia C. Finizio and Ralph A. Finizio of Pittsburgh. The Rev. Thomas Rekiel, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at St. Teresa of Avila Church in Summit.

title: Anne Weiss, Jack Delaporte
description: Anne Jackson Weiss, the daughter of Ann Robinson Weiss and Jack M. Weiss of New Orleans, was married Oct. 15 to Jack Patrick Delaporte, a son of Susan L. Delaporte of Bernardsville, N.J., and Lee A. Delaporte III of Mendham, N.J. The Rev. Winston E. Rice performed the ceremony at Trinity Episcopal Church in New Orleans.

title: Linda Vongkhamchanh, Alexander Gittleson
description: Linda Vongkhamchanh, the daughter of Toy Vongkhamchanh of Brentwood, Tenn., and Somnuk Vongkhamchanh of Spring Hill, Tenn., was married Oct. 13 in Nashville to Alexander Henry Gittleson, a son of Mary J. Gittleson and Norman E. Gittleson of Colts Neck, N.J. Fabian Bedne, a member of the Nashville and Davidson County Metropolitan Council, officiated in the councils offices.

title: Corrections: October 16, 2016
description: SPORTS

title: Billy Clark Taylor, Jeremy Smith
description: Billy Clark Taylor and Jeremy Benton Smith are to be married Oct. 16 at the 3 West Club in New York. Young Lee, a friend of the couple who became a minister of the First Nation Church for the occasion, is to officiate.

title: Christina Shearman, Kenneth Schuhmacher
description: Christina Cameron Hamilton Shearman and Kenneth Andrew Schuhmacher were married Oct. 15 at Bernards, a restaurant in Ridgefield, Conn. Barbara Manners, a selectwoman and a justice of the peace for the Town of Ridgefield, officiated.

title: Anna Thompson, Bradley Pearson
description: Anna Strom Thompson, the daughter of Peter G. Thompson of Washington and the late Barbara Strom Thompson, was married Oct. 15 to Bradley James Pearson, a son of Helen W. Pearson and Glenn W. Pearson of Chevy Chase, Md. Porter G. Dawson, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated at the Columbus Club in Union Station in Washington.

title: Nicole Sheldon, Rebecca Maisel
description: Dr. Nicole Natoli Sheldon, a daughter of Grace N. Sheldon and Paul C. Sheldon of Mequon, Wis., was married Oct. 15 to Rebecca Lindley Maisel, the daughter of Nell W. Maisel and Elliot B. Maisel of Mobile, Ala. Ivan Maisel, an uncle of Ms. Maisel, who became a minister of American Marriage Ministries for the occasion, officiated at the Roosevelt Hotel in New Orleans.

title: Elizabeth Reisman, Adam Byrnes
description: Elizabeth Adele Reisman and Adam Robert Byrnes were married Oct. 15 at 440 Seaton, an events space in Los Angeles. Raelyn P. Jacobson, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated, with Miguel A. Sossa-Mardomingo, another friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, leading the groom through his vows and introducing the seven blessings, a Jewish wedding tradition.

title: Lisa Sessa, Paco Correa
description: Lisa Carmela Sessa and Francisco Correa were married Oct. 15 on the fishing pier in Ocean Grove, N.J. Dr. Vincent Mastronardi, who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Emily Reid, Clement McNally
description: Emily Erin Reid, the daughter of Mary E. Currie Reid and Gerald F. Reid of Wallingford, Conn., was married Oct. 15 to Clement Corbin Hutchinson McNally, the son of Margaret C. Holland of Woodstock, Vt., and Brian J. McNally of West Palm Beach, Fla. The Rev. Frank Desiderio, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at Our Lady of Mercy Chapel in Newport, R.I.

title: David Norse, R. Eric Thomas
description: The Rev. David Johnston Norse and R. Eric Thomas were married Oct. 15 in Philadelphia. The Rev. Dr. Ken Evers-Hood, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony at the Broad Street Ministry.

title: Angela Rasmussen, Alexei Krasnoselsky
description: Angela Lynn Rasmussen and Alexei Leonidovich Krasnoselsky are to be married Oct. 16 in an outdoor ceremony on Utah Avenue in Seattle, which is known as Hawk Alley, a tailgating area for football fans. Gary Buchanan, a Universal Life minister, is to officiate, after which the couple plan to watch the Seahawks-Atlanta Falcons game.

title: Mika Morse, Cole Berrier
description: Mika Cori Morse married Cole Jerrad Berrier Oct. 15 at the River Bend Country Club in Great Falls, Va. The Rev. Jamie D. Schiffer, a minister ordained by the Unity Institute and Seminary, officiated in a ceremony that was led by Stephen C. Robinson, a former federal district judge for the Southern District of New York.

title: Anna Porges, Conlin Sheridan
description: Anna Girard Porges, a daughter of Leigh Simon Porges and J. Randolph Porges of Short Hills, N.J., was married Oct. 15 to Conlin Thomas Sheridan, a son of Roberta M. Sheridan and Kevin T. Sheridan of Boonton, N.J. The Rev. Nancy Howarth, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony at the First Presbyterian Church in East Hampton, N.Y.

title: Donald Trump Says Hes a Big Fan of Hindus
