description: Updated, 9:06 a.m.

title: 5 Tips for Saving on Holiday Air Travel
description: When it comes to holiday travel, it is generally true that the earlier you book, the better  though there are several factors at play.

title: In Rome, Using Roman Holiday as a Guide
description: The silver-haired gentleman in the perfectly tailored dark suit made a sweeping gesture and gave me a wistful smile.

title: Morning Agenda: Two-Faced About Wall Street, Tornado Joins Bhararas Team, a Carrot for Hollywood
description: Does Hillary Clinton really mean it when she says, No bank is too big to fail, and no executive is too powerful to jail? It is easy to dismiss comments like these as being just a sop to progressives, especially because transcripts of her speeches to big banks show her striking a much more conciliatory note.

title: Samsungs Uneven Handling of Galaxy Note 7 Fires Angers Chinese
description: TIANJIN, China  Zhang Sitong was saving a friends phone number on his Samsung Galaxy Note 7 smartphone when it started to vibrate and smoke. He threw it on the ground and told his friend to start filming.

title: Anti-Semitic Anti-Zionism
description: LONDON  The hard left meeting the hard right is an old political story, as Hitler understood in calling his party the National Socialists. So in these days of turbulence its no surprise that the leftist supporters of Britains Labour Party leader Jeremy Corbyn should find common cause with the rightist backers of Donald Trump.

title: After Losses in Syria and Iraq, ISIS Moves the Goal Posts
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Islamic State leaders had long promised their followers an apocalyptic battle  foretold, some believe, by the Prophet Muhammad  in an otherwise nondescript village they controlled in northern Syria.

title: News Quiz | Oct. 11-17, 2016
description: Have you been following the news? Take our quiz to see what you know and to learn more.

title: Teaching Seventh Graders in a Total Mess of an Election Season
description: EAU CLAIRE, Wis.  Maybe its the talk of fat shaming, or adultery, or sexual assault, or bans on Muslims and walls to keep out Mexicans. But Brent Wathke is having a rough time teaching this presidential campaign to his seventh graders.

title: Pearl Jam and Tupac Shakur Lead Nominees for Rock Hall of Fame
description: Pearl Jam, Tupac Shakur, Janes Addiction and Depeche Mode lead the latest crop of nominees for the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame, raising the possibility of a sweep of 1980s and 90s nostalgia for an institution that has been criticized for its devotion to the baby boomer generation.

title: We Can Fix Corporate Taxes
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive more briefings and a guide to the section daily in your inbox.

title: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie: Nigerias Failed Promises
description: LAGOS, Nigeria  I was 7 years old the first time I recognized political fear. My parents and their friends were talking about the government, in our living room, in our relatively big house, set on relatively wide grounds at a southeastern Nigerian university, with doors shut and no strangers present. Yet they spoke in whispers. So ingrained was their apprehension that they whispered even when they did not need to. It was 1984 and Maj. Gen. Muhammadu Buhari was the military head of state.

title: Is This Election Over?
description: The math is grim for Donald J. Trump: His rival, Hillary Clinton, has a 90 percent chance of winning the election, as of Monday afternoon.

title: Roll Over Beyonc: Chuck Berry Announces a Surprise Album
description: When you hear about surprise album releases these days, you probably think of Beyonc, Frank Ocean, Kanye West.

title: The Terrifying Impunity of Brazils Riot Police
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  When I cover a street protest in Brazil, I make sure to bring a helmet, a gas mask and a pair of goggles as protection from tear gas. I wear running shoes so I can escape from the police, and long pants as protection from shrapnel and rubber bullets. I carry a digital camera and a lawyers phone number. My press card always hangs around my neck.

title: From Russia (but Nowhere Else) With Love
description: Sofia, Bulgaria  Americans may be divided between Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton, but the rest of the world isnt. A recent WIN/Gallup International global poll conducted in 45 countries shows Mrs. Clinton decimating her opponent. She wins by a landslide almost everywhere  including Melania Trumps native Slovenia  with two telling exceptions: Russia and the Palestinian Authority.

title: Austria Seeks to Seize, and Possibly Tear Down, Hitlers House
description: BERLIN  The Austrian government moved on Tuesday to seize the house where  Hitler was born, and it may tear it down, in an effort to demystify a site that has become a magnet for neo-Nazis as well as tourists.

title: Michael Bloomberg Gives $50 Million to Museum of Science, Boston
description: Michael R. Bloomberg, the three-term mayor of New York and billionaire philanthropist, has said that throughout his life he has been most influenced by his parents. In second place: the Museum of Science, Boston.

title: Chappatte on the Mosul Offensive
description: Worldly powers devise a plan to take the Iraqi city back from the Islamic State.

title: Google Pixel Review: Assessing the New Smartphone

title: Tom Colicchio Opens Fowler & Wells at the Beekman Hotel
description: FOWLER & WELLS The Beekman, a new hotel in a stunning landmark building steps from City Hall, has dining options that are bound to become downtown destinations. The atrium, a sprawling, comfortably upholstered bar and lounge, is flanked by this restaurant from Tom Colicchio, and another one, Augustine, from Keith McNally, that will open in a few weeks. Mr. Colicchio named his restaurant for two phrenologists who practiced their pseudoscience in the building. With his executive chef, Bryan Hunt, he has devised a seasonal menu with dishes like chicory salad with pears, candied walnuts and Roquefort cheese; sauted foie gras with persimmons, pink peppercorns and bitter greens; and rabbit schnitzel with pistachios and lemon. Favorites from an earlier era, like lobster thermidor and beef Wellington, will be offered as specials. I think of this as old New York modernized, Mr. Colicchio said. The handsome brick-walled room with stained-glass windows combines polished vintage details with industrial elements. (Opens Thursday): 5 Beekman Street (Nassau Street), 212-658-1848, fowlerandwells.com.

title: In Bridge Scandal Trial, Prosecutors Liken Ex-Christie Allies to Film Villains
description: NEWARK  The prosecutor cross-examining a former aide to Gov. Chris Christie standing trial in the George Washington Bridge lane-closing scandal confronted him with an image he had texted to a colleague. It was of Randolph and Mortimer, the two villainous traders from the movie Trading Places.

title: Mosul, Assange, Trump: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: N.B.A. Executives Predict a Finals Rematch
After Lean Years, Big Oil May Emerge Stronger Than Ever
description: Big Oil is clawing its way back.

title: How Eni Bet Big and Won Big on Natural Gas off Egypt
description: SAN DONATO MILANESE, Italy  A drilling ship working about 120 miles off the Egyptian coast for Eni, the Italian oil company based here, bored into a giant trove of natural gas in July 2015 that turned out to be the largest discovery ever in the Mediterranean Sea and by far the largest by the global petroleum industry that year.

title: North Sea Fields Flag, Denting Prospects for Scottish Independence
description: The Transocean Winner, a rig filled with more than 300 tons of diesel and weighing 18,740 tons, broke away in an August storm to drift onto the rocks on the Isle of Lewis, in far western Scotland.

title: Anti-Semitic Posts, Many From Trump Supporters, Surge on Twitter
description: She had seen her face superimposed on the body of a concentration camp inmate. She had been called a slimy Jewess. She had been told she deserved the oven. One anonymous individual had electronically harassed her for 19 hours straight.

title: Dodgers Shut Out Cubs Again and Take 2-1 N.L.C.S. Lead
description: LOS ANGELES  It is almost as if the Chicago Cubs arrived back in the National League Championship Series by acclamation.

title: The Five Months in Mexico That Shaped Pep Guardiolas Philosophy
description: BARCELONA, Spain  It was as they were whiling away one of those long, sultry evenings cooped up in the comfortable surroundings of the Hotel Lucerna in Culiacn, Mexico, that Pep Guardiola outlined to ngel Morales his vision of the perfect goal.

title: Corrections: October 19, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Whats on TV Wednesday: Hugh Laurie in Chance and the Third Presidential Debate
description: Hugh Laurie returns as a doctor  this one even darker than before  in Chance. Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump take on the issues, and each other, in their final presidential debate. And catch a glimpse of People of Earth, about a support group for alien abductees, before it runs this month.

title: Food Insecurity Among University of California Employees
description: A study out of Occidental College found that 45 percent of the university systems full-time clerical, administrative and support workers sometimes go hungry.

title: Life, Love and Honor in Newarks Housing Projects
description: Akintola Hanifs photographs of public housing around Newark are his testament to residents he knows as honorable, loving and hardworking.

title: I Fight for Your Right to Vote. But I Wont Do It Myself.
description: Tonight, like millions of Americans, I will be glued to my television, watching the third and last presidential debate. But unlike them, and millions of others, whatever I hear tonight, I wont be taking it with me into the ballot booth. I am a major in the United States Army, and I believe it is my professional duty  and that of my fellow officers, in all branches  not to vote.

title: The Religious Rights Trump Schism
description: Donald J. Trump had already roiled the religious right, casting the Republican Partys most reliable voting bloc into an abyss of despair, recriminations and uncertainty about the future. Then the 2005 video surfaced of him boasting about his sexual predations and women began coming forward to accuse him of sexual assault.

title: The Trump Afterlife
description: We are in the last days of Donald Trump, presidential candidate. But as his defeat becomes more assured, the anxiety about his political afterlife is mounting. Liberals fear a world where he refuses to concede and his supporters turn to violence. Conservatives fear a world where the Republican Party remains imprisoned in his short-fingered grasp. Fox News executives fear a world where Trump starts a cable channel and steals their audience out from under them. And his supporters imagine that like a populist Obi-Wan Kenobi, he will rise more powerful than before.

title: Trump in a Bikini
description: Is it too late for Hillary Clinton to surrender to Donald Trumps demand that she take a drug test before this last presidential debate?

title: Social Security at Stake on Nov. 8
description: There is no overstating the extent to which Americans rely on Social Security. The program provides monthly benefits to some 60 million people, mostly retirees for whom the modest payments  about $1,300 a month on average  represent half to all of their income. As the population ages in coming decades, Social Security will only become more important  and, unfortunately, less reliable. According to the latest projections, the system will come up short in 2034, unless reforms are undertaken before then to strengthen its finances.

title: WikiHillary for President
description: Thank God for WikiLeaks.

title: Taking On the Boys Club at the Art Museum
description: LONDON  The directors of two of the worlds most popular art museums recently announced their resignations. Martin Roth, the director of the Victoria and Albert Museum, will step down this year, and Nicholas Serota, the director of the Tate museums, both in Britain, will depart next year. These job vacancies, which search committees are now working to fill, offer an opportunity to correct the gender imbalance in art museum leadership in Britain, America and beyond.

title: The Plant That Heals, or Kills?
Federal Inquiry Into Mayor de Blasio Is Said to Focus on Whether Donors Got Favors
description: A federal investigation into Mayor Bill de Blasios campaign fund-raising has zeroed in on whether donations were exchanged for beneficial city action in about a half-dozen cases, according to people with knowledge of the inquiry.

title: Presidential Debate: What You Missed
description: How we analyzed in real time and fact checked the last presidential debate between Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump.

title: Review: Michael Moore in TrumpLand Isnt About Donald Trump
description: If the news that the documentarian Michael Moore was releasing a surprise film called Michael Moore in TrumpLand had you expecting a rollicking, full-force attack on Donald J. Trump, prepare to be disappointed. Mr. Moore, one of filmmakings best-known provocateurs, seems to be decidedly uninterested in provoking anyone with this new offering, which had its hastily arranged premiere Tuesday night at the IFC Center in Greenwich Village. The film is not an attack on Mr. Trump, but instead a paean to his opponent in the presidential contest, Hillary Clinton.

title: ExoMars Spacecraft Enters Orbit Around Mars as Word From Lander Is Awaited
description: Mars has a new visitor  at least, in orbit.

title: Life, Love and Honor in Newarks Housing Projects
description: For some, the thought of Newarks housing projects conjure up images of crowded brick high-rises with tight hallways and dangerous, dimly lighted corners. But Akintola Hanif sees a very different scene when he photographs there  a place where children play and people love and live their lives as a large community.

title: Questions for: Teaching Seventh Graders in a Total Mess of an Election Season
description: Article: Teaching Seventh Graders in a Total Mess of an Election Season

title: Terrifying Encounters
description: How scared are you of sharks?

title: A Snack Tray to Gather the Family Around
description: Last year I was on an evening flight from New York to West Palm Beach, delighted to find myself in first class. Across the aisle sat an older dame  70s, maybe  in slacks, legs crossed, reading The Financial Times, which shed folded in vertical fourths, exactly the way all the charcoal gray suits used to do back when bankers still rode the subway to Wall Street in the mornings. The steward came through with the cart, and each one of the Louis Vuitton bucket bags and the full-length foxes and the razor-thin silver laptops spilling out of the rows in front of us ordered their water, tomato juice, white wine, organic purple potato chips with Hawaiian sea salt  and in so doing, confirmed their classy virtues. The lady in seat 4F, though, the one in the light cashmere pullover reading the newspaper, she clicked the latch on her seat-back tray and said: Double Smirnoff, on the rocks. And Doritos.

title: Living in Freeport, N.Y.
description: This incorporated village in the town of Hempstead took a beating from Hurricane Sandy four years ago, but its making a comeback and rebuilding.

title: Ulysses S. Grant: New Biography of A Nobody From Nowhere
description: AMERICAN ULYSSESA Life of Ulysses S. GrantBy Ronald C. WhiteIllustrated. 826 pp. Random House. $35.

title: Abbi Jacobson Didnt Expect Hillary Clinton to Come on Her Show
description: You and your best friend, Ilana Glazer, are the creators and stars of Comedy Centrals Broad City, in which you play best friends. Does it feel weird whenever youre not working with her? Weve managed to create this really cool working relationship where our other projects inspire each other. But this is the longest weve gone where we havent seen each other. Its been, like, a month and a half.

title: The Third 2016 Presidential Debate: A Place for Student Predictions and Reactions
description: Did you watch any of the previous two presidential debates between Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton? Do you plan on watching the third and final debate?

title: Writer, Writer, Pants on Fire
description: Theres a Yiddish expression, bubbe meise, which my husband and I use when our children tell us a story we know to be untrue. The brilliance of this term is its utter lack of judgment. When we call something a bubbe meise, were not chastising them. Were agreeing to go along with whatever tale theyve spun, while acknowledging that it didnt actually happen.

title: How Donald Trump Hacked the Politics of Foreign Policy
description: Donald J. Trumps foreign policy proposals, like forcing Mexico to pay for a border wall or withdrawing from NATO, have drawn unprecedented condemnations as incoherent, contradictory and unrealistic.

title: Should You Tell a Mans Fiance That He Faked His Degrees?
description: A few years ago, I realized that a close friend was misrepresenting himself professionally as having multiple graduate degrees that he did not actually earn. When I confronted him in a compassionate way, he denied it, but could offer no evidence to the contrary. We have fallen out of touch, but he is now engaged to a woman I know. We have several mutual friends. I want nothing to do with this guy and have done my best to forget about his deception, but if I were his fiance, I would certainly want to know. Thoughts? Name Withheld

title: Whoever Wins the White House, This Years Big Loser Is Email
description: Every four years, pundits race to anoint this or that newfangled tech trend as the next disruptive force to forever alter the mechanics of American democracy. The 2016 campaign has already been called the Snapchat election, the Periscope election, the Meerkat election, the Twitter election, the Facebook election and the meme election. (If there were a vomit emoji, Id insert one here. And then wed have the emoji election.)

title: The Anti-Helicopter Parents Plea: Let Kids Play!
description: It was a Friday afternoon at Mike Lanzas house in Menlo Park, Calif., and the boys were going crazy. There were boys playing ball in the street, while in the backyard, boys were skittering along the top of the fence while others were wrestling on the trampoline. The house itself is nothing special  a boxy contemporary, haphazardly furnished  but even by the elevated standards of Silicon Valley, the Lanzas play space is extraordinary. It boasts a map of the neighborhood painted on the driveway, a fabulous 24-foot-long play river  an installation art piece, designed for childrens museums  and a two-story log-cabin playhouse with a sleeping loft, whiteboard walls inside for coloring and really good speakers, blasting Talking Heads.

title: Rosemary and Time: Does This Italian Hamlet Have a Recipe for Long Life?
description: In and around Acciaroli, Italy, a particularly pungent variety of locally grown rosemary  said to smell 10 times as strong as the norm  is a daily part of the diet. Residents raise and consume their own rabbits. Anchovies hauled in by the towns fishermen feature prominently on dinner plates.

title: Freeport, N.Y.: A Waterfront Community Rebuilds
description: When Al Grover, 89, moved to Freeport 80 years ago, commercial fisherman and baymen  people who made a living off the water  lived near the canals that slice into the southern edge of this incorporated village on the south shore of Nassau County on Long Island.

title: 12 Questions Wed Like to Hear at the Presidential Debate
description: Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump will meet on Wednesday night at the University of Nevada, Las Vegas, for their final debate of the presidential election. The moderator, Chris Wallace of Fox News Sunday, has divided the hour-and-a-half event into six 15-minute segments, to cover immigration, the Supreme Court, entitlements and debt, the economy, foreign policy and fitness for office.

title: Think its cathartic to run angry? Think again
description: This article is part of a series aimed at helping you navigate lifes opportunities and challenges. What else should we write about? Contact us: smarterliving@nytimes.com.

title: How to Be Mindful of Fall
description: Fall is a feast for the physical senses, the perfect opportunity to step out of our thoughts and into the body, connecting with the world around us.  Andy Puddicombe, co-founder of the meditation app Headspace.

title: The Decline of the West, and How to Stop It
description: WASHINGTON  For most of the last 70 years, the United States, Canada and much of Europe have constituted a vast zone of peace, prosperity and democracy. The trans-Atlantic community has grown to over 900 million inhabitants of more than 30 countries. It has set an example for regional cooperation in Africa, Latin America and Southeast Asia, and served as a mainstay of the liberal world order.

title: Presidential Debate, ISIS, Arctic Surfing: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Morning Agenda: Yahoo Traffic Increased, Veterans Get Disruptive, China Slows
description: Fear not, Verizon, for the Yahoo user is loyal.

title: What Chesley Sullenberger Never Travels Without
description: Capt. Chesley B. Sullenberger III is best known for his successful landing of a US Airways plane on the Hudson River in 2009, an event depicted in the Clint Eastwood-directed film Sully, now in theaters. Captain Sullenberger is currently the aviation and safety expert for CBS News, and he travels around the world speaking on topics related to airline safety and standards.

title: The Dish on the Washington Power Dining Scene
description: On a recent September evening in Washington, D.C., there wasnt a seat to be had at Fiola Mare (fiolamaredc.com), a seafood-centric Italian restaurant in Georgetown. Smartly dressed visitors in the spacious dining room and at the patio tables savored the piercing sunset while tucking into towers of cold seafood and sipping Champagne and white wine.

title: Atlanta Walks a Line Between Magic Realism and Keeping It Real
description: In the presidential debates and at campaign rallies, Donald J. Trump has indulged a fondness for the equation of black life and hell: Happiness is scarce, and misery, poverty and violence afflict all. Thats a certain white mans view of black life, as seen on his TV set  in 1989, when the Huxtables were the only prominent African-Americans visible amid proliferating news images of dangerous black people. Television in 2016, with its bounty of black shows, both rebukes and complicates that dehumanizing assessment. And the show doing that with the most farcical tang, at the moment, is Atlanta, now in its first season on FX.

title: New York Today: Cooking for One
description: Updated, 9:47 a.m.

title: Family Behind Korean Conglomerate Lotte Is Indicted in Corruption Case
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The head of the South Korean retail giant Lotte, one of the countrys largest family-controlled conglomerates, was indicted on Wednesday on tax evasion, embezzlement and other criminal charges, the latest high-profile corruption scandal to hit big businesses here.

title: Hong Kong Legislators Stop Pro-Independence Lawmakers From Taking Oath
description: HONG KONG  Dozens of Hong Kong politicians loyal to the Chinese government prevented three newly elected lawmakers who support greater autonomy from Beijing from being sworn in to the local legislature on Wednesday.

title: The Federal Governments Latest Project: Squirrel GIFs
description: The National Archives and Records Administration is the guardian of some of the nations most precious documents, like the parchment Declaration of Independence displayed under glass in its main building in Washington.

title: Do Campaign Ads Matter? Donald Trump Offers a Rare Chance to Find Out
description: Donald J. Trump hasnt done much TV advertising. He prefers a different style of campaigning, with rallies and the free media coverage of them, along with his frequent Twitter posts. Fund-raising has taken a back seat because, as Mr. Trump said: I dont even know why I need so much money. Why do I even need these commercials?

title: New York Times Names A.G. Sulzberger Deputy Publisher
description: Since 1896, when Adolph S. Ochs bought The New York Times, the Ochs-Sulzberger family has controlled the newspaper. It led the company through two world wars, the publication of the Pentagon Papers, labor strife and severe financial challenges, striving to maintain the papers importance even as new forms of media threatened to overtake it.

title: In Versace, Michelle Obama Sends a Powerful Message at Her Final State Dinner
description: On Tuesday night, at her final state dinner as first lady, Michelle Obama solidified her legacy as perhaps the most adept and successful practitioner of the art of political dressing that any administration has seen.

title: Maddon and His Team Have Their Patience Rewarded
description: LOS ANGELES  From the moment last fall when the Mets celebrated a pennant under the Wrigley Field lights, the Chicago Cubs had made it seem so easy. They bolstered their lineup and rotation. They charged to a 25-6 start. Their entire infield started the All-Star Game. They spent all but one day of the regular season in first place and then won their division series handily.

title: In Colorado, Deals Before Ski Season Begins
description: There is a period between summer high season (when hikers and families flood the state) and winter high season (when skiing is the main attraction) where locals in Colorado take a deep breath. Through approximately mid-November, crowds are notably absent and savings are abundant.

title: Will the Fox News Debate Be a Partisan Affair?
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive more briefings and a guide to the section daily in your inbox.

title: California Today: For Some U.C. Workers, Skipping Meals to Make Ends Meet
description: Good morning.

title: Russian Hacker, Wanted by F.B.I., Is Arrested in Prague, Czechs Say
description: PRAGUE  A man identified as a Russian hacker suspected of pursuing targets in the United States has been arrested in the Czech Republic, the police announced Tuesday evening.

title: In Western Myanmar, a Lockdown and Fears of More Violence
description: HONG KONG  More than a week after attacks on police officers began a wave of bloodshed in western Myanmar, a lockdown by security forces has prevented aid workers from operating in the area, and new videos of what appear to be local Muslims calling for resistance have raised fears of more violence.

title: Dont Blame Wahhabism for Terrorism
description: LONDON  The word Wahhabism has become a boogeyman in the West, deemed responsible for the radicalization of Muslims around the world. And since Wahhabism is a strain of Islam that has its origins in the Arabian Peninsula and is the dominant religious doctrine of Saudi Arabia, that country is often viewed as the prime culprit in the propagation of violent extremism.

title: As California Water Use Rises, Some Ask: Were Limits Eased Too Soon?
description: EAST PORTERVILLE, Calif.  This state slashed urban water use over 25 percent in the face of a punishing drought last year, exceeding a mandatory order issued by Gov. Jerry Brown and turning California into a model of water conservation. Californians tore out lawns, cut back landscape watering and took shorter showers as they embraced Mr. Browns call to accommodate what he warned were permanently drier times.

title: What You Get for  $1,500,000
description: A condo in New Orleans, a contemporary in Colorado and a shingle-style house in Maine

title: $1.5 Million Homes in Louisiana, Maine and Colorado
description: NEW ORLEANS

title: Symphonic Variations: A Frederick Ashton Classic Returns
description: In the great plotless classical ballets, the prime subject is dancing itself. Thats true of the British choreographer Frederick Ashtons Symphonic Variations, one of the purest pure-dance classics ever made. Created by Ashton in 1946 as his first work for the Covent Garden opera house, today Symphonic Variations is danced all around the world. After a 10-year gap, it returns to repertory at American Ballet Theater on Wednesday.

title: Russia Is Moving Ahead With Missile Program That Violates Treaty, U.S. Officials Say
description: Russia appears to be moving ahead with a program to produce a ground-launched cruise missile despite the Obama administrations protests that the weapon violates a landmark arms control agreement, according to American officials and lawmakers.

title: Word + Quiz: obliterate
Classes for Jedis Run Afoul of the Lucasfilm Empire
description: Obsessed fans of Star Wars have long enjoyed a tolerant relationship with owners of the pop culture empires copyrights and trademarks.

title: Siberian Town Stakes a Claim as Humanitys Cradle
description: SOLONESHNOYE, Russia  Wood smoke hangs like a mist over this town, nestled in a valley deep in Siberia. The log houses lean at jaunty angles, dogs bark in the yards and cows, their neck bells clanging, walk the dusty streets.

title: A Contemporary Home on a Hillside
description: A four-bedroom five-bathroom home outside of Medellin, Colombia, is on the market for $889,800.

title: House Hunting ... in Colombia
description: A MODERN FOUR-BEDROOM HOUSE OUTSIDE MEDELLIN

title: The Trump Side of Canadian Immigration
description: The term Canadian values is normally a harmless clich  a reminder that the planets second largest country by land mass is a Boy Scout-like bastion of tolerance and fairness. This trope regained some of its luster with last falls election of Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, who might as well be the countrys Boy Scout in chief.

title: Durable Designs for Women Who Wrangle and Weld
description: Physically demanding jobs may not be restricted to men anymore, but the women entering such careers are still finding it challenging to break into one aspect: work clothes.

title: As New Ukraine Talks Begin, What Is the State of Europes Only Active War?
description: KIEV, Ukraine  With soldiers dying daily in Ukraine, the site of the only active war in Europe, Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany hosted a meeting on Wednesday to see whether President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia was willing to cut a deal to end the conflict while he also faces pressure from the West over Moscows role in Syria.

title: 1966: 500-Foot Skyscraper For Montparnasse
description: PARIS  American and French businessmen are teaming up to build a skyscraper in Paris that they claim will be the worlds biggest  and most expensive  commercial building. At slightly more than 500 feet high, it would also be the highest building in central Paris. It would cost $100 million and stand on the site of the old Maine-Montparnasse railroad station. Plans for the new Paris landmark include a 250-room hotel, several restaurants and boutiques, a theater, an ice-skating rink, a heliport on the roof and underground parking and, inside the building, 30 high-speed elevators.

title: How Taking a Gap Year Can Shape Your Life
description: If your teenager is talking about taking a year away from the classroom between high school and college, you may have Malia Obama to thank for that. But if theyre not yet talking about whether to follow her lead, they should be.

title: Jean-Pierre Bemba, Congolese Politician Imprisoned for War Crimes, Is Convicted of Witness Tampering
description: PARIS  Jean-Pierre Bemba, a Congolese politician who is serving an 18-year prison sentence for crimes against humanity and war crimes, was convicted on Wednesday of coaching and bribing witnesses to give false testimony.

title: Big, Bigger and Biggest in Museum Shows
description: Its a great week to be in New York, especially if big, freshly-minted museum shows appeal. Things get rolling Sunday, Oct. 23, with the unveiling at MoMA PS1 of Mark Leckey: Containers and Their Drivers, the largest survey yet of this astute, often amusing perpetuator of video, installation, lecture-performance and photography. On Tuesday, the Met Breuer will debut Kerry James Marshall: Mastry, a survey of an artist whose ravishing, nuanced paintings confront the realities and history of black life in America. Wednesday brings Pipilotti Rist: Pixel Forest, a survey of a pioneering artist known for combining music and images of nature and the female body into some of contemporary arts most lyrical videos and video installations. And Friday is the Whitney Museums turn with Dreamlands: Immersive Cinema and Art, 1905-2016, an expansive survey of a century-long relationship that will further explore the potential of the museums grand fifth-floor gallery.

title: 1891: Pollution of the Seine
description: Dwellers in Paris, who, during the dry months of the year, are forced to drink Seine water or none at all, will be gratified to hear that a scheme for purifying the river, proposed six years ago, but abandoned on account of the cost, has been taken up again. The Council-General now proposes to divert all the sewer water that flows into the Seine and the Marne above Paris, convey it as far as Asnires, and there pump it up into a reservoir, whence it can be conducted on to the irrigation grounds at Achres.

title: Tracey Ullman Returns to HBO
description: HBO returns another dependable veteran to its fold with Tracey Ullmans Show, a six-episode sketch series starring this British comedian, whose Emmy-winning Tracey Takes On  left the channel in 1999.

title: Troy Schumachers BalletCollective Comes to N.Y.U.
description: New York City Ballets fall season just ended, but the corps de ballet dancer Troy Schumacher isnt taking any breaks. Mr. Schumacher has been directing his own, much smaller company, BalletCollective, since 2010, and this spirited troupe returns to New York Universitys Skirball Center for the Performing Arts on Thursday, Oct. 27, and Friday with two new works.

title: Sia Furler, a Shy Woman Hiding Under a Big Wig
description: Sia Furler, singer-songwriter turned megahit collaborator turned victim-to-victory pop belter, is shy onstage. She sings her hits, like Chandelier, in a torn, slurred voice while keeping still and hiding under a giant wig. But theres action onstage: choreographic vignettes featuring the dynamo Maddie Ziegler, whose frenetic moves and flickering expressions ramp up the songs emotional stakes. Sharing a bill with her in Brooklyn is a decidedly more carnal performer: Miguel, who knocks himself out onstage like an old-school soul showman with a decidedly modern repertory, personalizing rock, R&B and hip-hop as he merges seduction with the pride of a cross-cultural outsider. Also on the bill is AlunaGeorge, which slips a streak of female empowerment into its dance tunes. (Tuesday, Oct. 25, Barclays Center; barclayscenter.com.)

title: In Classical Music, a Double Serving of Youth
description: Last October, when the compelling British tenor Mark Padmore riveted audiences at Alice Tully Hall by performing Schuberts three major song cycles over three nights, his crucial partner on every step of this momentous marathon was the superb young South African fortepianist Kristian Bezuidenhout. New Yorkers can catch Mr. Bezuidenhout on his own recital at Zankel Hall when he performs Beethoven (including the brilliant Sonata No. 7 and the beloved Sonata Pathtique) and Haydn. (7:30 p.m., Monday, Oct. 24.)

title: Two A. R. Gurney One-Acts at the Flea Theater
description: The playwright A. R. Gurney and the Flea Theater have had a long, fruitful relationship, with many of Mr. Gurneys plays starting at the TriBeCa space. So it seems fitting that hes once again presenting new work at the Flea: His current pair of one-acts  Ajax and Squash (billed together as Two Class Acts)  will be the final shows at the Fleas White Street home.

title: At Film Forum, the Fastest Noodle Slurpers in the West
description: Tampopo, Juzo Itamis Japanese noodle western (1987), is an uproarious, tasty series of satirical sketches that celebrate an erotic connection between food and sex.

title: A Walk Through The Pacific Crest Trail
description: Ive written extensively about the joys of backpacking on the Pacific Crest Trail, so I thought Id pass along these photographs and this text from the co-author of a new coffee table book about the trail.  Nicholas Kristof

title: Attack in Afghanistan by Afghan Soldier Kills 2 Americans
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  An Afghan soldier opened fire on a group of Americans at a military depot near Kabul on Wednesday, killing two and wounding another three in the latest outbreak of green on blue insider violence, American and Afghan officials said.

title: Jeopardy! Quiz: What Is ... The New York Times?
description: Test your knowledge of The New York Times with 10 questions from the archive of Jeopardy!

title: Black Man Is Arrested While Walking, and Minnesota City Starts a Conversation
description: The mayor of Edina, Minn., said officials were taking steps to improve relations between the police and minority residents after a white officers arrest of a black man who was walking in the street to avoid construction work on a sidewalk last week prompted an outcry.

title: Ill Take the Gray Lady for $2,000
description: Times Insider shares historic insights from The New York Times. In this article, Flora Lee Peir  an assistant news editor and one of a handful of Times staffers who has competed respectably on Jeopardy!  takes us behind the scenes of the symbiotic, decades-old relationship between a news organization and an iconic television game show. Pay attention! There will be a quiz.

title: In Quick Response, de Blasio Calls Fatal Shooting of Mentally Ill Woman Unacceptable
description: Deborah Danners essay recounted her long, aching struggle with schizophrenia, a battle that had begun some 30 years earlier.

title: Where to See Celebrities Onstage This Fall
description: The star power on New York stages this season may not be as diverse as it was last year. But the wattage is still darn strong. Heres our guide to some of the celebrities who will be taking bows this fall.

title: Bake-Off!
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Keeping the Political Wool From Being Pulled Over Your Eyes
description: DO you know a logical fallacy from a statistical improbability? Do you know correlations from causations?

title: Faculty Members at 14 State Universities in Pennsylvania Go on Strike
description: Thousands of faculty members went on strike Wednesday at 14 Pennsylvania state colleges and universities  a rare escalation in higher education, but one that reflects increasingly widespread tensions between administrators and their faculties.

title: Philippines on Edge as Typhoon Haima Roars Ashore
description: A potentially devastating typhoon made landfall in the Philippines late Wednesday with slightly less force than had been feared.

title: Picassos life, portrait by portrait
description: Sylvette David was a 19-year-old blonde with bangs and a ponytail when she became Pablo Picassos studio model. The artist, 72 at the time and living in the southern French town of Vallauris, spotted the young woman on her visits to the ceramics atelier next door. One spring day in 1954, he dangled a sketch of her over the garden wall, invited her in, and asked if she would pose for him.

title: The New Blue and Red: An Educational Split Is Replacing the Culture War
description: Hillary Clinton has built a commanding lead over Donald J. Trump in national polls, but she still has one big weakness: white working-class voters, especially men.

title: Dressing for Bill
description: Fashion personalities came dressed to for Bill Cunninghams tribute at Carnegie Hall.

title: Lawsuit Seeks to Halt New York Subsidies for Upstate Nuclear Plants
description: ALBANY  A collection of energy companies and trade associations have filed a lawsuit seeking to reverse a decision by the administration of Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo to subsidize several struggling upstate nuclear plants, arguing that the state overstepped federal authority to regulate energy prices.

title: They Dressed for Bill
description: Among the luminaries assembled at Carnegie Hall on Monday to memorialize Bill Cunningham, who died on June 25 at age 87, was former Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg. Stepping briskly to the stage, Mr. Bloomberg reminded the gathering of more than 1,000 that few people knew better than Mr. Cunningham himself that the best runways are the streets of New York.

title: He Cant Drink, but Julio Urias Is Starting in the Postseason
description: At 20 years 68 days old, the Los Angeles Dodgers Julio Urias became the youngest postseason starter ever by taking the mound against 37-year-old John Lackey and the Chicago Cubs on Wednesday night in Game 4 of the National League Championship Series.

title: All the Victims of Boko Haram
description: The liberation of 21 of the more than 270 girls abducted from a Nigerian school in April 2014 is certainly to be celebrated. Yet, those heartwarming scenes of parents and girls joyously dancing and hugging are not the end of this terrible saga  not for the children still in the clutches of Boko Haram, the extremist Islamist group that has been spreading death and destruction across northeastern Nigeria for seven years, and perhaps not even for the girls who have been set free.

title: Review: A New Rocky Horror, Stripped of Subversive Magic
description: Some things cant be replicated or recaptured, and thanks to Fox we now know that one of them is the subversive magic of The Rocky Horror Picture Show.

title: Daily Report: Explaining Yahoos Unexpected Jump in Traffic
description: In its glory days, Yahoo had a garish mock hotel sign in San Francisco that billed the service as a nice place to stay on the internet. It may be again  but only after a fashion.

title: Falling in Love With Italys Blissful, Rustic Aeolian Islands
description: Where simplicity is luxury, time slows to the roll of the Mediterranean and meals are rivaled only by the crisp white wine.

title: Donate Your Computers Spare Time to Science
description: Q. I have heard about volunteer computing, but I am wondering how exactly it works and how secure it is. Would my computer be at risk?

title: Ex-Fox Chairman Roger Ailes to be Subject of TV Mini-Series
description: LOS ANGELES  The former Fox News chairman Roger Ailes is coming back to television, but perhaps not in a way he will like.

title: Monkeys Can Make Stone Tools, but They Dont Use Them
description: The capuchin monkeys of Serra da Capivara National Park in Brazil are well known for using rocks. They use them as hammers to crack open nuts. They use them for digging. They even use them to show off to potential mates. Now scientists report that they also spend time banging stones together, for no clear reason, producing sharp-edged stone flakes that are just like some of the first tools of early humans.

title: Steven Cohen May Return to Hedge Fund Industry When Ban Expires
description: Steven A. Cohen, a billionaire investor barred from managing money for others, is one step closer to making his return to the hedge fund industry.

title: During a Social Media Break, Kim Kardashian West Offers More Me
description: The publication of the new, expanded edition of Kim Kardashian Wests 2015 book of self-portraits, Selfish, comes at an unusual moment for the reality star.

title: Morgan Stanley Could Benefit From Some Fed Decisions
description: Morgan Stanley is positioned for a liftoff, but the timing is in the hands of the Federal Reserve.

title: Airbnb Proposes Cracking Down on New York City Hosts
description: Airbnb said on Wednesday that it was willing to crack down on individuals in New York City who rent out multiple homes, bowing to pressure from politicians and tenants rights groups who say the company has worsened affordable housing issues in the city.

title: Dear A.G., Here Are Three More Problems for You
description: The New York Times took a critical step toward crowning a new publisher on Wednesday, naming Arthur Gregg Sulzberger as deputy publisher and heir to the throne. He most likely will succeed his father, Arthur Sulzberger Jr., as publisher of The Times after an undefined apprenticeship.

title: Right-Wing Video Suggests D.N.C. Contractors Schemed to Incite Chaos at Donald Trump Rallies
description: Two operatives who were working with the Democratic National Committee to help elect Hillary Clinton are no longer working in that role after an undercover video appeared to show them plotting to incite violence at Donald J. Trumps rallies.

title: Trade Sports Cards? He Paints Them
description: It is not often that David Hockney and Dwayne Schintzius come up in the same conversation.

title: The A.C.L.U., on Transgender Students
description: To the Editor:

title: As Health Markets Struggle, 9% Average Rise in Enrollment Is Predicted
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration said Wednesday that it expected monthly enrollment in the Affordable Care Act marketplace to average 11.4 million next year, up 9 percent from the monthly average this year, despite rising premiums and the departure of major insurers from the marketplace in many places.

title: Taxes and Campaign Money
description: To the Editor:

title: To the Principals Office: A Childs View of Donald Trump
description: To the Editor:

title: The Best Cookbooks for Beginning Cooks
description: This article is part of a series aimed at helping you navigate lifes opportunities and challenges. What else should we write about? Contact us: smarterliving@nytimes.com.

title: Sites of Conscience
description: To the Editor:

title: Charter Schools and Civil Rights
description: To the Editor:

title: A beginners guide to decorating your home
description: This article is part of a series aimed at helping you navigate lifes opportunities and challenges. What else should we write about? Contact us: smarterliving@nytimes.com.

title: Former Lincoln Center Presidents New Post: At National Sawdust
description: Jed Bernstein, whose tenure as the president of Lincoln Center was cut short last spring after he failed to disclose a relationship with an employee, is crossing the river for his next post: He is now an adviser at National Sawdust, the new-music space in Williamsburg, Brooklyn.

title: Peels NYCs New Collection
description: The line of shirts and jackets, popular with skaters and fashion editors, was created last year by Jerome Peel.

title: A Brand Inspired by a Hardworking Father
description: Growing up in the suburbs of West Palm Beach, Jerome Peel spent hours watching his father fix old Hondas and dirt bikes. Hed be wearing this work shirt, Peel recalls. Just that blue shirt, unbuttoned, with a tank top tucked into his jeans. That was the coolest look to me. Last year, Peel was inspired to launch Peels NYC, a unisex line comprised of work shirts and utilitarian garments that pays homage to hard workers.

title: Melania Trump Mimics Hillary Clinton to Defend Donald Trump
description: Melania Trump borrowed from Michelle Obama for her speech at the Republican convention where her husband was nominated for president. To defend him against charges of sexual harassment and groping, she had a different source: Hillary Clinton.

title: Introducing The New York Timess Next Big (Food) Thing
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times.

title: What Were Seeing in the Final Presidential Debate
description: How Donald Trump vs. Hillary Clinton looks to Times Opinion writers  before, during and after.

title: Fight for Mosul Endangers Civilians
description: The Iraqi Army and coalition forces launched an offensive this week to retake Mosul from the Islamic State, and humanitarian workers worry that civilians will be caught in the crossfire.

title: Fashions New It Kids
description: Meet the next generation of Kendall Jenners and Gigi Hadids: children of celebrities parlaying their parents fame and good genes into careers.

title: A Haitian Warlord Meets His Match: Hurricane Matthew
description: PESTEL, Haiti  Guy Philippe is among the most feared men in Haiti, a nation with a rich history of men worthy of fear.

title: Review: A Musical Tour of Mendelssohns Europe
description: Haydns Surprise Symphony gets its nickname from a fortissimo chord placed where it has no business being, at the end of the second go-round of a quiet little ditty that sounds like a nursery game played on tiptoes. Performed with conviction and a dose of mischief, it should make listeners jump.

title: Just Being Himself, in a Professional Womens Hockey League
description: BUFFALO  He changed his voice mail recording and created a new email address. He updated his LinkedIn profile, too, to reflect his new name.

title: Geno Smith Replaces Ryan Fitzpatrick as Jets Quarterback
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  On Monday night in Arizona, after the Jets lost their fourth straight game, Coach Todd Bowles quickly sought to stifle any suggestion that a change would be made at quarterback.

title: The Modern Love Podcast: Rebecca Hall Reads Take Me as I Am, Whoever I Am
description: In this episode of Modern Love: The Podcast, the actress Rebecca Hall (Christine) reads the essay Take Me as I Am, Whoever I Am, Terri Cheneys explanation of what its like to date while having bipolar disorder.

title: On Debate Night, Celebrating a Book About Immigrants
description: Just before the final debate between Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump kicks off in Las Vegas on Wednesday night with immigration as a focus, a group will gather in New York to celebrate Nuevo New York, a book about creative professionals of Latin American descent. Included in it are well-known figures like Carolina Herrera, Maria Cornejo, Carlos Campos, Francisco Costa and Nina Garcia.

title: Dancers Get Much Needed Recognition  and a Little Cash, Too
description: The hard work of dancing is too often undernoticed and underpaid. Enter the New York Dance and Performance Awards, better known as the Bessies, which bestow some much needed recognition and a touch of glamour on the profession once a year, if not a whole lot of money  though this years ceremony, at the Brooklyn Academy of Music on Tuesday, began with an announcement that all nominees would receive a $500 honorarium. (Its a start?)

title: Prayer
description: Selected by Matthew Zapruder.

title: Understanding the Terms of Your Student Loans
description: As student debt for new graduates continues to climb, borrowers need to pay close attention to the type and the terms of the loans they seek, even if the loans come from state programs, a new report finds.

title: Education Company to Pay $4.3 Million in Settlement With New York State
description: A for-profit network of schools and the family behind it have agreed to pay New York State more than $4.3 million in a settlement after having spent state funds, intended to pay for special education preschool, on credit card bills, maintenance of a boat and a sons law school tuition, as well as claiming false tax deductions, the office of the state attorney general, Eric T. Schneiderman, said on Wednesday.

title: The Centuries-Old Ceramics Techniques of Faenza
description: The artist Emma Harts Max Mara Prize residency has taken her to the Italian city, renowned for its ceramics since the 15th century.

title: Visiting Italys Ceramics Workshops With a Buzzy Multimedia Artist
description: The artist Emma Hart is not a fan of the glossy, filtered visions of life offered by Instagram, at least as most people use it. Though she has a background in photography, Hart has issues with the mediums tendency to make subjects look good and smooth, and favors instead a pursuit of the grubby and real. Her artworks draw on the vexations of modern life with mischievous humor, referencing ill-paid jobs in call centers, faceless bureaucracy, the travails of young motherhood and her own South London roots.

title: They Write Plays for a Living. But Hows Their Handwriting?
description: The brochure for the Playwrights Horizons season features the word Playwrights written eight times, by each of the featured theatermakers (seven writers and a collaborating director). The concept was to create a look that would never be the same twice, said Michael Bierut, a partner in the design firm Pentagram, which created a new brand identity for the Off Broadway company.

title: Review: In The Arab of the Future 2, Back to Syria in 1984
description: It is certainly possible to enjoy the second volume of Riad Sattoufs graphic memoir, The Arab of the Future 2: A Childhood in the Middle East, 1984-1985, without having read its predecessor. Even without a shard of context, Mr. Sattoufs story and storytelling would be irresistible.

title: Jury Clears Knicks Derrick Rose of Liability in Rape Suit
description: LOS ANGELES  Knicks guard Derrick Rose was cleared on Wednesday in a lawsuit accusing him and two friends of raping a woman who had had a relationship with him. The verdict, from an eight-member jury in a federal civil trial, absolved Rose of wrongdoing, although the damage to his reputation remains to be seen.

title: Review: A New, Abstract Guillaume Tell at the Met Opera
description: It sounded like a good idea.

title: Trump and Clintons Last Debate: Analysis
description: Heres how we analyzed in real time the last presidential debate between Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump.

title: Ex-N.B.A. Star Amare Stoudemire Rises as an Art Connoisseur
description: Amare Stoudemire was inspecting art at Christies in Rockefeller Center on a sweltering afternoon in June. He was drawn to a tall piece by David Hammons, an influential artist whose work is in the permanent collection at the Whitney Museum of American Art. It was a smoky cloud scape created by bouncing a basketball covered in graphite and dirt on paper.

title: Fresh Off Employing Evan Bayh, U.S. Chamber of Commerce Attacks Him
description: WASHINGTON  Until just a few months ago, Evan Bayh was working for the U.S. Chamber of Commerce. Now the chamber is working as hard as it can against him.

title: Mosul, Philippines, U.S. Presidential Election: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Lady Gagas Stripped-Down New Album Fishes for Inspiration
description: For almost a decade, Lady Gaga has been assiduously arguing the case that the external is the internal, that performance is authentic, that flamboyance is ideology. Her career has been predicated on demolishing conventional ideas about what it might mean to play a character  with Gaga, it was never play, always work, and always true.

title: SoFi, an Online Lender, Is Looking for a Relationship
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Alyson Casey recently received an invitation to a singles event in Manhattan from a start-up. But it didnt come from a dating service. It came from the company that had recently refinanced her student loan: SoFi.

title: Russia Sports Minister Promoted to Deputy Prime Minister
description: Vitaly Mutko, the Russian sports minister who was denied admittance to the 2016 Olympic Games after damning revelations of state-sponsored doping, has been elevated to deputy prime minister of Russia.

title: Youll Want Some Velvet for Fall
description: Where has all the leather gone? This season is all about velvet.

title: Vermont Governor Proposes Limits on Painkiller Prescriptions
description: Gov. Peter Shumlin of Vermont on Wednesday announced proposed limits on the number of painkillers that could be prescribed, the latest measure his administration has taken to combat the opioid crisis that has ravaged the state in the last five years.

title: No Justice in Iran
description: Iranian hardliners have intensified their anti-Western crackdown by sentencing two Iranian-Americans to 10 years in prison on charges of cooperating with the United States. The unjust judgments, reported by Iranian media on Tuesday, mark the latest effort by the judiciary, controlled by the countrys hardline faction, to thwart improved ties with the United States and the West after the 2015 nuclear deal.

title: Three Words Lead to a Battle Over Great Comet on Broadway
description: Five years ago, the small nonprofit theater company Ars Nova commissioned an up-and-coming composer to write his wacky dream project, a musical adaptation of one dramatic section of War and Peace.

title: Smithsonian Seeks $300,000 to Save Dorothys Ruby Slippers
description: They are just a pair of shoes, but what a pair of shoes.

title: In Push for G.M.O.s, China Battles Fears of 8-Legged Chickens
description: HONG KONG  For many in China, the term genetically modified food evokes nightmares: poisoned seeds, contaminated fields, apocryphal images of eight-legged chickens.

title: Review: New York Cabaret Convention Slips In Modern Flourishes
description: Maureen McGovern was presented with the Mabel Mercer Award, the highest honor presented to a performer at Tuesdays opening-night gala of the 27th New York Cabaret Convention at the Rose Theater. Ms. McGovern, who sang a pristine, unamplified rendition of Over the Rainbow, is a supreme exemplar of the American songbook tradition celebrated this year over four consecutive evenings through Friday.

title: When Hillary Clinton Tested New Slogans  85 of Them
description: Crafting the perfect political slogan is hard. Writing scores of unmemorable ones? Less so.

title: Presidential Debate, Mosul, Putin: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Celebrate 75 Years With Coach, 20 Years With Jay Z
description: Brush up on your fashion and music history. On Thursday, Coach will celebrate its 75th anniversary by putting 48 vintage bags up for auction, including a duffel (the brands most iconic style, introduced in 1971) that has been reworked with metallic patches and pins. The first $50,000 in sales will benefit the Costume Institute at the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

title: Marijuana Lights Up State Ballots
description: People in nine states, including California, Florida and Massachusetts, will vote Nov. 8 on ballot proposals permitting recreational or medical use of marijuana. These initiatives could give a big push to legalization, prompting the next president and Congress to overhaul the countrys failed drug laws.

title: Indians Defeat Blue Jays and Reach First World Series Since 1997
description: TORONTO  For all the passion that Clevelanders pour into their sports teams, they have suffered a disproportionate amount of bitter misfortune. For decades, the citys premier stadium was known as the Mistake by the Lake, and teams like the Browns, the Cavaliers and the Indians endured agonizing defeats  or were simply abject failures for generations at a time.

title: German Police Officer Dies After Raid on Supporter of Far-Right Fringe Group
description: BERLIN  A policeman has died of injuries suffered when a 49-year-old supporter of a fringe group that rejects modern Germany opened fire on officers sent to his home to confiscate his weapons, the authorities said on Thursday.

title: Reported Cases of Sexually Transmitted Diseases Are on Rise
description: WASHINGTON  There were more cases of sexually transmitted diseases reported in the United States last year than ever before, according to new federal data. Rates of chlamydia, gonorrhea and syphilis  three of the most common S.T.D.s  grew for the second consecutive year, with sharper increases in the West than other regions. And while all three diseases are treatable with antibiotics, most cases continue to go undiagnosed, potentially causing infertility and other problems.

title: Bobby Shmurda, a Brooklyn Rapper, Is Sentenced to 7 Years in Prison
description: Just before a judge sentenced the Brooklyn rapper Bobby Shmurda to seven years in prison on Wednesday, he tried to take back his guilty plea, accusing his lawyer of forcing him to accept the deal.

title: Bollywood Becomes India and Pakistans Latest Battleground
description: MUMBAI, India  India and Pakistan, longtime enemies with nuclear arsenals, have battled over borders, killed each others soldiers and fought three wars since the countries creation seven decades ago.

title: Juno Hobbled but Healthy After Glitch, NASA Says
description: Hours before a close flyby of Jupiter on Wednesday, NASAs Juno spacecraft experienced a malfunction that scrambled plans for peering deep into the planet.

title: How Silicon Valley Treats a Trump Backer: Peter Thiel
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Peter Thiel made a relatively modest investment in the presidential candidacy of Donald J. Trump, but it is generating a major uproar in Silicon Valley.

title: Taken for a Ride
description: Dear Diary:

title: Raiders Owner Says He Is Firm on Moving Team to Las Vegas
description: HOUSTON  With the recent approval of $750 million in public money for a new football stadium in Las Vegas, Mark Davis, the owner of the Oakland Raiders, said Wednesday that he was more determined than ever to move the team there.

title: Trove of Stolen Data Is Said to Include Top-Secret U.S. Hacking Tools
description: WASHINGTON  Investigators pursuing what they believe to be the largest case of mishandling classified documents in United States history have found that the huge trove of stolen documents in the possession of a National Security Agency contractor included top-secret N.S.A. hacking tools that two months ago were offered for sale on the internet.

title: Another English Club Cracks Under Barcelonas Pressure
description: BARCELONA, Spain  Claudio Bravo is not alone. He would have felt that way, of course, as he trudged off the field at Camp Nou, disconsolate and deaf to the warm ovation afforded him by Barcelonas fans. He certainly felt that way in the locker room as the dust cleared on Manchester Citys humbling 4-0 defeat and even his manager, Pep Guardiola, acknowledged that Bravo, Citys goalkeeper, was sad.

title: Brazilian Lawmaker Who Led Impeachment of President Is Arrested
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Eduardo Cunha, the former speaker of Brazils lower house of Congress who engineered the impeachment of President Dilma Rousseff this year, was arrested Wednesday on corruption charges, federal prosecutors said.

title: Lawyer for Ex-Christie Aide Says She Was Made Scapegoat in Bridge Plot
description: NEWARK  The George Washington Bridge lane-closing scandal crept closer to Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey, as lawyers for one of his former aides began her defense in federal court here on Wednesday.

title: A Rape and Murder Prompts Thousands of Argentine Women to Protest
description: BUENOS AIRES  Women across Argentina stopped work for an hour on Wednesday and took part in mass demonstrations to demand more protection after an escalation in attacks against women and girls this month.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Not many people have 80-year-old shoes and want to preserve them forever.

title: Trump Debate Guests: Who Are Malik Obama and Patricia Smith?
description: Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump have both tried to rattle each other during the debates by inviting guests who might unsettle their opponent, but Mr. Trump, a talented showman running a scorched-earth presidential campaign, has excelled at inviting attention-grabbing guests.

title: Children 14 or Under Need Fewer HPV Vaccine Doses
description: Children 11 to 14 years old need only two doses of the HPV vaccine, not the previously recommended three doses, to protect against cervical cancer and other cancers caused by the human papillomavirus, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said on Wednesday.

title: Fact Checks of the Third Presidential Debate
description: Reporters for The New York Times fact-checked the statements made by Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump during Wednesdays presidential debate.

title: Sparks Candace Parker Ignores Slights, Heeding Pat Summitts Lessons
description: Los Angeles Sparks forward Candace Parker has attained almost every accolade possible during her career.

title: How We Watched the Third Debate
description: Follow along, and discuss, with Frank Bruni, Roger Cohen, Ross Douthat and Elizabeth Williamson.

title: Philippine Police Van Rams Protesters at U.S. Embassy, Hurting Dozens
description: MANILA  Dozens of protesters were hurt on Wednesday after a Philippine police officer used a van to ram into them during a demonstration against the United States in the capital.

title: Fatal Police Shooting in Bronx Echoes One from 32 Years Ago
description: In a city as thick with history as New York, it is inevitable that some public events will echo the past. In the case of Deborah Danner, a mentally ill woman fatally shot by the police on Tuesday night in the Bronx, that echo was Eleanor Bumpurs.

title: Eddie Applegate, a Sweetheart on The Patty Duke Show, Dies at 81
description: Eddie Applegate, an actor best known for playing Patty Lanes steadfast high school sweetheart on the 1960s sitcom The Patty Duke Show, died on Monday in Los Angeles. He was 81.

title: A Taco Wall to Protest Trump
description: Supporters of the Democratic nominee for president, Hillary Clinton, surrounded a Trump Hotel in Las Vegas with about 150 taco trucks on Wednesday and staged protests ahead of the final presidential debate.

title: A.G. Sulzberger: Leading Change at The New York Times as Journalism Evolves
description: [Update: A.G. Sulzberger will take over as publisher of The New York Times on Jan. 1, The Times announced on Dec. 14, 2017.]

title: Clinton and Trump Do Battle in the Final Presidential Debate
description: Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump faced off tonight in their final presidential debate. To me the big headline was Trumps refusal to commit to honoring the result. That is unprecedented, more in keeping with a warlord than with a major party nominee, and it leaves me saddened. Heres my play-by-play, a first draft of history, in the form of selected tweets.

title: Phil Chess, Whose Record Label Elevated Unknown Blues Musicians, Dies at 95
description: Phil Chess, who with his brother founded Chess Records, a storied Chicago label that captured great blues musicians like Muddy Waters in their prime and helped power the musical fusillade of rock n roll with vibrant recordings by the likes of Chuck Berry, died on Tuesday at his home in Tucson, Ariz. He was 95.

title: Yvette Chauvir, Ballerina and Symbol of French Culture, Dies at 99
description: Yvette Chauvir, one of the 20th centurys outstanding ballerinas and the most lustrous star of French ballet from the 1940s through the 1960s, died on Wednesday at her home in Paris. She was 99.

title: Persistence of Memory
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  If you have never come across the term palindrome, it means something that is spelled the same reading from left to right as it is reading right to left. One of the most well known palindromes is Madam, Im Adam, and people who love to play with words have contests called the Symmys (yes, thats a palindrome too; what did you expect?) to see who can come up with the best one. There is even an online magazine edited by the Symmys champion Mark Saltveit devoted solely to this pastime.

title: Review: In Love, Love, Love, All You Need Is Selfishness.
description: Now heres a couple who know how to grow old in style. Portraying a pair of soul mates in selfishness in Mike Bartletts Love, Love, Love, which opened on Wednesday night at the Laura Pels Theater, Amy Ryan and Richard Armitage advance from the ages of 19 to 64 with a galloping satirical wit that pulls you along, happy and appalled, through the decades.

title: Want an Old Piece of the Statue of Liberty? This Is the Man to See.
description: For more than three decades, Rick Stocks has been hoarding a mountain of construction debris  so much of it that he had to squirrel it all away in three different warehouses in Tennessee and Florida.

title: Donald Trump Wont Say if Hell Accept Result of Election
description: In a remarkable statement that seemed to cast doubt on American democracy, Donald J. Trump said Wednesday that he might not accept the results of next months election if he felt it was rigged against him  a stand that Hillary Clinton blasted as horrifying at their final and caustic debate on Wednesday.

title: Tesla Will Make Its Cars Fully Self-Driving, but Not Turn the System On Yet
description: DETROIT  Tesla Motors said on Wednesday that it would equip all of its new vehicles with technology that enables fully autonomous driving, but would not activate the system until it undergoes further testing.

title: Retrial in Etan Patz Murder Case Revives 2 Views of Suspect
description: Pedro Hernandez was a man weighed down by what he had done, prosecutors said, and he felt compelled to unburden himself, confessing to a prayer group, a friend, his wife and eventually, years later, to detectives who suspected he was a child killer.

title: Donald Trumps Contempt for Democracy
description: Donald Trump turned, in the third and final presidential debate, from insulting the intelligence of the American voter to insulting American democracy itself. He falsely insisted there were millions of people registered to participate in the election who did not have the right to vote and declared he would not commit to honoring the outcome.

title: The Debate in One Scary Answer
description: O.K., Donald Trump wont promise to accept the results of the election. Thats truly  good grief.

title: Living With Schizophrenia
description: In an essay, Deborah Danner, who was killed in a police shooting, once described the challenges of living with mental illness, including interacting with law enforcement.

title: Chris Wallace, Mixing Humor With Scolding, Guides Final Debate
description: LAS VEGAS  The smart money on Wednesdays matchup between Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump was for a 12-round, no-holds-barred bout worthy of this citys prizefights.

title: 5 Days After Failed Missile Test by North Korea, Another Failure
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea launched an intermediate-range ballistic missile on Thursday, but the test ended in failure, the United States military said. It was the Norths second failed attempt to flight-test that type of missile in five days.

title: U.S. Presidential Debate, Syria, Mars: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Fantasy, Fights and Love: 500 Years of Orlando Furioso
description: FERRARA, Italy  This city, once presided over by the Este dynasty, became one of the most brilliant of all the European courts and artistic centers of the Renaissance. It was an environment that spurred a richness in the visual arts and inspired such epic poems as Orlando Furioso (The Madness of Orlando), a fantastical mingling of medieval chivalric romance, classical literary elements and contemporary events.

title: Exploring Daubigny, Through His Influence on van Gogh
description: In July 1890, about 10 days before Vincent van Gogh shot himself in the chest, he presented his just-completed Daubignys Garden to the widow of a French landscape painter he had long admired, Charles-Franois Daubigny.

title: Buffet: A Life of Success, Rejection and Now a Celebration
description: Few artists have known the roller coaster of fame and shame that the French painter Bernard Buffet experienced during his life. Buffet, who was once hailed as the artistic successor to Picasso only to be reviled later as vulgar and the epitome of poor taste, was an immensely popular artist before falling into near oblivion. He committed suicide in 1999 at the age of 71.

title: Hillary Clinton, Mocking and Taunting in Debate, Turns the Tormentor
description: She mansplained him. Let me translate that if I can, Hillary Clinton said dryly after Donald J. Trump talked up his tax plan.

title: Europes Leaders Make Their Point Without Saying a Word
description: BRUSSELS  How do you like your leaders? Dashing? Fired up? Sober and controlled? At European Union summit meetings, 28 leaders project competing versions of what it means to be in charge as the bloc falters. Some examples of the stagecraft that will be on display at the next summit talks, beginning Thursday:

title: Paris Fair Crosses the Road, Giving Art Room to Breathe
description: The Grand Palais and the Petit Palais, both built for the 1900 Universal Exposition in Paris, have long been separated by a wide and busy street that links this citys Right and Left Banks.

title: Speed Is In for the Rangers, Especially Chris Kreider
description: Speed is a constant theme for the new-look Rangers this season. It is not as if such an essential hockey element was not part of Coach Alain Vigneaults approach the first three years of his Rangers tenure, but their dynamic burst from the gate this season has been noteworthy, with speed throughout the lineup pressuring opponents and creating scoring chances.

title: Baylor Under Federal Investigation Over Possible Title IX Violations
description: The federal government announced Wednesday that it was formally investigating whether Baylor University had violated Title IX in its handling of sexual assault on campus, the latest development in a scandal that included several accusations and convictions of sex crimes levied against Baylor football players and a damning university-commissioned report.

title: Transcript of the Third Debate
description: Following is a transcript of the third presidential debate, on Wednesday, as transcribed by CQ Transcriptswire.

title: Corrections: October 20, 2016
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Kurds, Heading Into the Teeth of ISIS, Open a New Front
description: Mr. Gordon, a New York Times military correspondent, is with Kurdish pesh merga forces on the northern approach to Mosul.

title: Rodrigo Duterte and Xi Jinping Agree to Reopen South China Sea Talks
description: BEIJING  President Rodrigo Duterte of the Philippines and Chinas leader, Xi Jinping, agreed on Thursday to resume direct talks on disputes in the South China Sea after years of escalating tension, a sign of warming relations with Beijing.

title: Cubs Thrash Dodgers to Even N.L.C.S. at Two Games Each
description: LOS ANGELES  Faced with a moment of truth after being shut out in back-to-back games by the Los Angeles Dodgers, the Chicago Cubs had all eyes upon them, studying how they would react.

title: The Debates Were a Failure of Journalism
description: Tonight wrapped up three weeks of presidential campaign debates. It was also a three-week period in which cities in at least 34 states reported record-high temperatures. New York reached 80 degrees today, and Nashville nearly hit 90.

title: Giants Kicker Josh Brown Admitted Abusing Wife, Police Evidence Shows
description: Josh Brown, the Giants kicker, admitted to domestic violence against his wife in a journal and emails, according to police documents released in Washington State on Wednesday.

title: Whats on TV Thursday: Rocky Horror and Jago: A Life Underwater
description: Laverne Cox tries to fill Tim Currys fishnets and platform Mary Janes in Foxs reboot of The Rocky Horror Picture Show. Project Runway: Fashion Startup circles the sharks. And Jago: A Life Underwater follows an 80-year-old Indonesian spear fisherman to the depths of the sea.

title: The Third Presidential Debate
description: Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump faced off in the final debate before the election.

description: There were no handshakes or pleasantries between Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump in their final debate, which moved quickly from a discussion of policy to a flurry of personal attacks.

title: Where Can You Escape the Harshest Effects of Climate Change?
description: Its hard to imagine that any city in North America will escape the effects of climate change within the next 25 years.
