title: Are You There? Its Me, Reality: Grit Returns to Young-Adult Novels
description: Growing up on Long Island in the 1970s, I kept a copy of Judy Blumes Are You There, God? Its Me, Margaret, in its classic lavender-tinted paperback edition, tucked away in a closet in my playroom with the vague intention of returning it to the local library, someday. As months went by and I read and reread the novel upward of a half-dozen times, it became clear that I would never give it up. I imagined thousands of dollars of fines accruing and ultimately an arrest followed by some period of detention. Wasnt the involvement of law enforcement the only proper response to an abject refusal to relinquish something so precious?

Among the latest is the House speaker, Paul Ryan, who told House Republicans last week that he was done defending Trump (though not rescinding his endorsement of him).

description: Tyler Perrys Boo! A Madea Halloween is Mr. Perrys 16th feature film as a director, and it shows him just barely more adept in this respect as he was for his first outing, Madeas Family Reunion (2006). His shot composition is rudimentary at best, his blocking of action is practically indifferent, and his editing rhythms run the gamut from hobbled to stumbling.

description: One of the greatest seafood mysteries is why an assertively flavored fish like salmon is vastly more popular than a milder one like Spanish mackerel.

title: 35 Arrests in Long Island Gang Case as Another Body Is Found

description: The press serves as a check on people in power, says David McCraw, The Timess vice president and assistant general counsel. Susan Lehman is host.

description: Last weeks top charity galas included the Frick Collection, Keep a Child Alive, the National Committee on American Foreign Policy, and the New York Womens Foundation.

title: Warm Nights of Fall
description: Despite summerlike temperatures, the fall social calendar was in full swing. The Frick Collection held its autumn dinner on Oct. 17 at its Upper East Side house. Keep a Child Alive, co-founded by Alicia Keys, hosted its annual ball on Oct. 19 at the Hammerstein Ballroom, raising $2 million for H.I.V. care in sub-Saharan Africa. The National Committee on American Foreign Policy held a dinner on Oct. 19 at the Metropolitan Club. And the New York Womens Foundation, which bills itself as the nations largest womens grant-making fund, presented its fall gala at the Plaza Hotel on Oct. 13.

title: Times Lawyer on Donald Trump, Libel and Free Speech
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times.

title: Where to Find One-Bedrooms in New York
description: Of the nearly 23,356 New York City rentals recently listed on The New York Times Find a Home site, 8,390 were one-bedroom apartments. So where should you look if youre hoping to rent one of them? Here are the five neighborhoods in the city with the most one-bedrooms.

title: At Trial, Etan Patzs Mother Recalls Final Moments With Her Son
description: It was a hectic morning 37 years ago, but Julie Patz vividly recalled pieces of it: The two toddlers who needed her attention; her older daughter not wanting to wake up; and her 6-year-old son, Etan, springing out of bed. She remembered trying to talk him out of taking his favorite toy cars to school, and his jamming the cars into his tote bag anyway.

title: How Kids Learn Prejudice
description: Recently, my 2-year-old daughter asked me about the Trump video everyone seemed to be talking about. Like many parents, I had made the mistake of assuming we were still in the soft and squishy baby days when she wasnt listening. But now she is listening.

title: Flee or Stay? For Mosul Residents, Both Choices Are Risky
description: Mr. Arango, the Times Baghdad bureau chief, is reporting from villages and humanitarian aid camps near Mosul.

title: Think Your Retirement Plan Is Bad? Talk to a Teacher
description: Margaret Jusinski first got to know her investment broker through the breakfasts he provided when he visited her public school in the leafy suburbs of New Jersey, where she teaches middle-school children computer coding and how to build robots made of Legos.

title: Review: The Plough and the Stars, War and Folly in a Dublin Tenement
description: MONTCLAIR, N.J.  Pale and shaky, the girl races down the aisle of the theater, up the steps and onto the stage, where she stands in front of a microphone like a nervous soloist drafted into a school show. Clutching a sheet of lyrics, she begins to sing the Irish national anthem, Amhran Na bhFiann (The Soldiers Song), in a voice thats sweet and clear. Then she coughs and chokes, her blood spattering the white paper.

title: Debate-Watching With Hillary Clintons BFFs
description: CHICAGO  Donald J. Trump had just called Hillary Clinton a nasty woman, and Mrs. Clintons childhood girlfriends started laughing. Im so glad he said that, one friend said. He just couldnt stop himself, another said.

title: Cheap Fun in Central Park: Scaling Rat Rock
description: On a recent Saturday in the southwest corner of Central Park, scores of children swarmed an immense 40-by-15-foot rock. As they climbed, leapt and navigated a crevasse, one boy offered his appraisal.

title: Answers to Questions About 403(b) Plans
description: The so-called 403(b) plans are tax-deferred workplace retirement investment accounts, which are similar in many ways to their more widely used counterparts, 401(k) plans.

title: Studying the Building Blocks of Life in Stereo Sound
description: This is your Friday cryptography problem: There are about 100,000 different kinds of proteins in the human body, each made out of different combinations of amino acids. They are the building blocks of life. When something goes wrong in our bodys mini-machinery and botches the shape of some proteins, they cant do their job.

title: How Has Your Life as a Saudi Woman Changed?
description: Women in Saudi Arabia were recently granted the right to vote, but they still cant drive. They can now run for office, but they cant make any major decisions without the approval of a male guardian.

title: London City Airport Is Declared Safe After 500 Are Evacuated
description: LONDON  London City Airport was declared safe on Friday, several hours after 500 people were evacuated in what the authorities had described as a possible chemical incident.

title: Review: Baryshnikov Explores the Troubled Mind of a Dance Genius
description: Mikhail Baryshnikov, one of the great ballet dancers of the late 20th century, tries to evoke the violently disordered mind of Vaslav Nijinsky, one of the great ballet dancers of the early 20th century, in Letter to a Man, an opaque and frustrating work of dance theater being presented at the Brooklyn Academy of Music.

title: Letter to a Man
description: Scenes from the production based on the diaries of Vaslav Nijinsky, in which Mikhail Baryshnikov plays the early-20th-century ballet great who became schizophrenic.

title: Remember the Past, Cubs, but Avoid Repeating It
description: Every mistrustful, jittery Cubs fan requires reassurance right about now that this moment in time is not merely another cruel tease. The Cubs have dropped six match points in a row in my lifetime, whenever they needed just one more victory to reach the World Series. I wear the scars on my knuckles, from the time I slammed my hand into a low ceiling in despair.

title: Airbnb Sues Over New Law Regulating New York Rentals
description: Hours after Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York signed a bill that would impose steep fines on Airbnb hosts who break local housing regulations, Airbnb filed a federal lawsuit contending the new law would cause it irreparable harm.

title: How Charges of Voter Fraud Became a Political Strategy
description: In asserting that the presidential election has been rigged against him and casting accusations of widespread voter fraud, Donald J. Trump has tapped deep into an increasingly prevalent theme of Republican Party politics: that Democrats try to steal elections, not win them.

title: Hillary Clinton Makes Pitch for Mandate and a Swing-State Sweep
description: CLEVELAND  Hillary Clinton entered the final phase of her campaign on Friday, working to ensure a victory that is decisive enough to earn a mandate for her presidency and a surge of voters to help Democrats win congressional races.

title: When Anas Met Circe, and Other Operatic Adventures
description: For 34 seasons, the Center for Contemporary Opera has been grappling with what opera can be today. This genre has evolved over centuries, along with musical and theatrical styles. Yet shouldnt certain basic elements of the art form remain?

title: An Exquisite Ratmansky and More From American Ballet Theater
description: You know that ballet is an art famous for beauty, musicality, virtuosity and expressiveness. Yet even those of us who revisit it, like a shrine, were astounded to recognize just how these things were exemplified on Wednesday night in the opening work of American Ballet Theaters two-week season at the David H. Koch Theater.

title: After Hurricane, Haiti Confronts Scars From 2010 Earthquake Recovery
description: PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti  The ghosts of 2010 haunt Haiti.

title: Were You Swept Up Under Britains Anti-Gay Laws? Wed Like to Hear From You
description: Decades after homosexuality was decriminalized in Britain, the government recently announced that it would posthumously pardon thousands of gay and bisexual men who were convicted of having or seeking gay sex.

title: Tobacco Giant Reynolds American Unlikely to Get a Sweeter Offer
description: John Boehner, the former speaker of the House of Representatives, may find that his month-old gig as a board member at Reynolds American does not last as long as he expected. British American Tobacco is offering $47 billion for the 58 percent of the Camel cigarette maker that it does not already own.

title: Pipilotti Rist, Provoking With Delight
description: The Swiss artist Pipilotti Rist may have been raised in the birthplace of Calvinism, with its reputation for austerity and penitence. But you wouldnt know it by her work, or almost anything she has touched in an influential career spanning three decades. She titled one of her books Congratulations! and another, bound in pink velvet, The Tender Room. Her hallucinatory 2009 feature film, Pepperminta, told the tale, as she once described it, of a young woman and her friends on a quest to find the right color combinations and with these colors they can free other people from fear.

title: What Were Reading
Election, Internet, N.S.A.: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: 3 U.S. States Turn Down Russian Requests to Monitor Elections
description: At least three American states have turned down Russian requests to monitor polling locations during the election on Nov. 8, as United States officials portrayed the overture as little more than a Russian public relations stunt.

title: Russian Carrier Is Bound for Syria, Flexing Muscle but Risking Malfunction
description: MOSCOW  The Admiral Kuznetsov, Russias lone, rather geriatric aircraft carrier, steamed through the English Channel toward the Mediterranean Sea on Friday in the Kremlins latest attempt to reassert its lost superpower status.

title: Mexico Arrests Ex-Chief of Police in City Where 43 Students Disappeared
description: MEXICO CITY  Mexicos federal police on Friday arrested a fugitive former municipal police chief who is a major figure in the investigation into the disappearance of 43  college students in September 2014.

title: Faculty Members at State Universities in Pennsylvania End 3-Day Strike
description: Thousands of unionized faculty members at state-run universities in Pennsylvania ended a three-day strike on Friday after a tentative agreement was reached with the state, officials said.

title: The Battle for Mosul, in One Image
description: Raging fires and smoke revealed the front lines of the battle to retake the Islamic State stronghold of Mosul, Iraq.

title: David Bunnell, Whose Magazines Were Tech World Must-Reads, Dies at 69
description: David Bunnell, a journalist and publisher who helped create PC Magazine, Macworld and other consumer publications that chronicled and contributed to the explosive growth of the personal computer industry, died on Tuesday at his home in Berkeley, Calif. He was 69.

title: Nicole Haran, 47, Who Helped Create a Theater Troupe and Web Series, Dies
description: Nicole Haran, a writer, director and the co-creator of a four-episode web series about life in a Brooklyn apartment house, died on Oct. 16 in Manhattan. She was 47.

title: Philippines Separation From U.S. Jilts Hillary Clinton, Too
description: WASHINGTON  When the Philippines appeared to jilt its old ally the United States in favor of China this week, it repudiated not only President Obama and his pivot to Asia, but also Hillary Clinton, who made reaching out to the region her signature project as his secretary of state.

title: After Unsteady Steps to Punish Domestic Violence, N.F.L. Faces Scrutiny Again
description: After one of the most egregious cases of domestic violence among National Football League players two years ago, in which a star on the Baltimore Ravens was caught on video knocking out his fiance, the league vowed a not-again, get-tough approach.

title: Donald Trumps Warning on Election Result Sounds Familiar to Some Immigrants
description: Many voters saw it as a historic breach of tradition when Donald J. Trump refused to say this week that he would accept the result of the election if he lost.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Im not for labeling someone as mentally ill for the rest of their lives, but there are warning signs that should prevent the purchase of a gun, and we are just not doing it.

title: Man Who Took Trove of N.S.A. Data Has Court Date
description: BALTIMORE  The intelligence contractor accused in the largest-ever breach of classified information was portrayed by his lawyer in court on Friday as a patriot and a dedicated worker who became compulsive about taking work home.

title: Canada Today: Getting Away From It All on Cape Breton Island
description: Along with its scenery and coastline, the scarcity of population on Cape Breton Island in Nova Scotia can be an attraction for tourists. For locals, however, the population decline on the island is a headache. In an effort to find employees for their store and bakery in one town there, Whycocomagh, members of the Austin family offered two acres of free land to anyone who would work for them for at least five years. Although the land was well off the grid, more than 50,000 people applied.

title: Yasiel Puig Has Cooled Down, but Dodgers Fans Dont Seem to Care
description: LOS ANGELES  The night before what was possibly his final game at Dodger Stadium in a home uniform, Yasiel Puig restlessly paced around his double locker, his eyes on his smartphone as he tapped and talked out text messages. He engaged in a brief conversation in Spanish about the English Premier League.

title: Thank You, Donald Trump
description: Donald J. Trump could well go down in history as a feminist hero.

title: Nassau County Executives Arrest Raises Democratic Hopes of State Senate Gains
description: ALBANY  The corruption scandal enveloping the Nassau County executive has given Democrats a new and potent line of attack, as they try to gain control of the narrowly divided New York Senate.

title: Kigeli V, the Last King of Rwanda, Dies at 80
description: Kigeli V, the last king of a dynasty that ruled Rwanda for a millennium, died last Sunday in Washington, where he had been living on public assistance. He was 80.

title: Russian Suspected of Hacking U.S. Tech Companies Is Indicted
description: SAN FRANCISCO  A Russian man accused of breaking into computer systems at three internet companies in 2012 has been indicted by a federal grand jury in Oakland, Calif.

title: Atlantic Coast Conference Chips Away at SECs Dominance
description: BLACKSBURG, Va.  The persistent smears of Atlantic Coast Conference football have subsided. Florida State won a national championship in 2013, and Clemson had a near miss in the title game last season. The emergence of Louisville and its Heisman Trophy-contending quarterback, Lamar Jackson, has given the league another reputable team, one of six from the conference that have spent time in the Top 25 this season, and one of the four to make the Top 10.

title: N.J. Transit Chief a No-Show at a Legislative Hearing on Safety
description: TRENTON  New Jersey Transits new executive director was a no-show on Friday when it came time to face state lawmakers here and explain the agencys worsening safety record.

title: Hurricane Recovery Program in New York City Will Fall Short of Target
description: The program created to help homeowners in New York recover from Hurricane Sandy will not meet its year-end deadline, officials said this week, the latest setback for the yearslong effort to rebuild thousands of homes in the city that were damaged in the storm.

title: Uses Without Sharing
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Making crossword puzzles gives constructors a good opportunity to slip in small tributes here and there in the entries and we have such a puzzle today. Its your basic themeless Saturday grid, but today James Mulhern has touchingly included an entry at 7A that is a tribute to his dog Mickey, who passed away.

title: A WikiLeaks Lesson for Mrs. Clinton
description: The consensus by United States intelligence agencies is that the WikiLeaks dump of emails from the account of John Podesta, Hillary Clintons campaign chairman, was the result of a hack by Russia in an effort to influence the presidential election. The leaks are continuing, so its impossible to say whether anything truly damaging to Mrs. Clinton will emerge. Some of the purloined exchanges consist of routine and often boring campaign planning, while others seem embarrassing or cynical, as when Clinton aides debate accepting campaign cash from foreign government lobbyists, and one writes: Take the money!!

title: After Sandy, Overpromising and Underdelivering
description: The fourth anniversary of Hurricane Sandy will come and go next week, but thousands of storm-struck New York City homeowners will still be waiting for their houses to be rebuilt under the citys misbegotten Build It Back program.

title: Only in Utah
Mr. Gingrichs Big Trump
description: Its no big surprise that Newt Gingrich is still a gung-ho adviser to the Trump campaign. Mr. Gingrich has long espoused political views similar to Donald Trumps.

title: More Coveted Than a Sack? A Jersey With a Single Digit
description: In their spring and summer practices before this season, the players on Virginias football team wore uniforms without numbers. The Cavaliers new coach, Bronco Mendenhall, instituted the policy as a way to make players compete for and earn the jersey numbers they wanted.

title: Dont Take Donald Trump to Dinner
description: The evidence continues to mount: There is nothing in the world that Donald Trump cant make worse.

title: What Nixon Could Teach Trump About Losing
description: Austin, Tex.  Richard M. Nixon, the first president to resign from office, was hardly a beacon of moral integrity. Nor was Nixon above demagogy on the campaign trail, infamously fanning the flames of Communist paranoia during the McCarthy era by unjustly painting his opponent in his 1950 Senate race, the California congresswoman Helen Gahagan Douglas, as the Pink Lady.

title: Ignoring the Debt Problem
description: Together, the two of us have 179 years of life experience and 13 grandchildren. We have served presidents of both parties. We have seen more campaign seasons than we care to count  but none as strange as this one.

title: Venezuelan Electoral Panel Halts Effort to Recall President Nicols Maduro
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  Leaders of Venezuelas opposition on Friday angrily called on citizens to take to the streets after the countrys electoral commission suspended a drive for a referendum to remove President Nicols Maduro.

title: Fly Fishing and the Art of Criminal Defense
description: When I landed a job as a public defender in my hometown, Reno, Nev., fresh out of law school in 2004, I had no practical experience with the criminal justice system. I hadnt volunteered with a legal aid organization, hadnt even been on the mock trial team in school. I had never sat at a counsel table.

title: Corrections: October 22, 2016
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Tracy Hamilton and John Bustamante: The Voters Said No. She Said Yes.
description: Tracy Idell Hamilton and John Marcus Bustamante were married Oct. 22 at the Little Church of La Villita in San Antonio. The Rev. Arthur Flores, a Baptist minister, performed a nondenominational ceremony.

title: Whats on TV Saturday: Bad Moms and Weiner
description: Tough week with the kids? Unwind with some mothers rebelling against doing it all in Bad Moms. Meanwhile, Weiner looks at the unraveling of Anthony D. Weiners political career. And Rats will haunt your dreams.

title: The Clinton and Trump Foundations Are Vastly Different. Heres How.
description: A comparison of the Clinton and Trump Foundations and the controversies that surround them.

title: Heal the Painful Divide in Our Country
description: Here are the top 10 comments of the week on our digital platforms, as selected by our readers and the journalists who moderate nearly every comment.

title: Drop and Give Me 22!
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights from The New York Times. In this post, Jodi Rudoren, a deputy international editor, reflects on the 22 Push-Ups Challenge  and on camaraderie it inspired among her colleagues.

title: How to Get a Deal at Local Markets
description: Buying goods at local markets on your vacation is a tangible way of capturing a memory of your destination, according to Hannah Roth, a travel adviser with McCabe World Travel in McLean, Va., who specializes in creating shopping-focused itineraries.

title: Want to Explore Iceland? An Airline Has a Buddy Who Can Help
description: As an aviation writer I frequently ask flight crews for tips on what to see and do when I go somewhere new because they are among the most experienced travelers. And while some airlines capitalize on the knowledge  with guidebooks or crews who point out the landmarks they fly over  no airline seems more committed to having its employees act as travel ambassadors than Icelandair.

title: The Malibu Juice Magnate
description: MALIBU, Calif.  I wasnt eating right. Was I even eating? In that miserable winter in 2011, I couldnt always be sure. Unlike my impossibly slender, toned new neighbors here, where Id rented a small apartment on the beach to escape my cold Montana hometown, I didnt count calories, carbs or protein grams. I only counted pounds, the bottom line. Lately, Id lost track even of those. A combination of workaholic strain and grief over my mothers recent death had plunged me into a spiral of self-neglect as I veered between pigging out and going hungry. I was failing as a Southern Californian, and my eyes, as yellow as Post-it notes, were proof.

title: A Constellation of Influencers: Behind the Curtain at Teneo
description: Whether participating in glittery dinners with heads of state, or tte--ttes in the Oval Office, Andrew Liveris, the chief executive of Dow Chemical, has regularly visited the White House.

title: They Took In One Refugee Family. But Families Dont Have Borders.
description: When ordinary Canadians signed up to help Syrian refugees, neither group expected to face agonizing questions from half a world away.

title: A Little Variety
description: A LITTLE VARIETY  This weeks puzzles include:

title: Farhads and Mikes Week in Tech: The Political Evolution of Silicon Valley
description: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry.

title: Jake Gyllenhaal on His Return to Broadway: Not So Fast
description: Jake Gyllenhaal is delaying his return to Broadway.

title: Debt, Diversion, Distraction
description: There was a time, not long ago, when deficit scolds were actively dangerous  when their huffing and puffing came quite close to stampeding Washington into really bad policies like raising the Medicare age (which wouldnt even have saved money) and short-term fiscal austerity. At this point their influence doesnt reach nearly that far. But they continue to play a malign role in our national discourse  because they divert and distract attention from much more deserving problems, depriving crucial issues of political oxygen.

title: Variety: Diagramless Crossword Puzzle
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Time to build another Diagramless crossword, and this time Mary Lou Guizzo and David Steinberg have us building our very own JACK OLANTERN, because Halloween is next week.

title: Scotland Embraces Gay Politicians in a Profound Cultural Shift
description: GLASGOW  A popular tabloid called Patrick Harvie, the leader of the Scottish Green Party, a Green threat to the family when he ran for Parliament in 2003  not because of his politics but because he is bisexual. When Ruth Davidson became the first openly gay leader of the Scottish Conservative Party in 2011, she was labeled the kickboxing lesbian.

title: New Climate-Friendlier Coolant Has a Catch: Its Flammable
description: LONDON  Rajiv Singh started thinking about how to do his part to fight global warming 15 years ago.

title: Call It What It Is: Rape
description: The state of Montana doesnt often make the national news. But it did recently when a judge there sentenced a man to just 60 days in jail after he repeatedly raped his 12-year-old daughter. In the three weeks since the sentence was issued, over 80,000 people have signed an initiative seeking to have the judge impeached.

title: John McCains Choice on Trump
description: On Oct. 26, 1967, John McCains A-4 Skyhawk was shot down over North Vietnam. Over the next five and a half years, Lieutenant Commander McCain was tortured by North Vietnamese guards seeking to force him to confess his air piracy; twice, he tried to commit suicide rather than give in. As a stunt intended to embarrass his father  Adm. John McCain, commander of American forces in the Pacific  his captors at the Hanoi Hilton offered to free the younger McCain. Rather than desert his mates, he refused.

title: Outside Money Favors Hillary Clinton at a 2-to-1 Rate Over Donald Trump
description: Six years after a Supreme Court decision opened vast new channels for money to flow into national elections, Democrats have built the largest and best-coordinated apparatus of outside groups operating in the 2016 presidential campaign, defying expectations that conservative and corporate wealth would dominate the race.

title: The Rich Vote Republican? Maybe Not This Election
description: For the first time in decades, the wealthy are set to deliver a landslide victory for a Democratic presidential candidate.

title: Do Not Anger the Travel Gods. Sweat the Details.
description: To the extent that the Haggler has ever considered travel insurance, it has taken place during the two seconds required to decline it when buying a ticket on Amtrak.

title: The Bat Whisperers
description: LOS ANGELES  A baseball players relationship with his bat is  well, its complicated.

title: A Film Technician Who Discovers Gems in the Outtakes
description: Willem Barneveld, 58, is a film technician and curator at Pro-Tek Vaults in Burbank, Calif.

title: High School Pushover No More: The Power of the Polo Shirt
description: A smirk flashed across my former classmates face as she walked in and saw me behind the cash register wearing my maroon cap and name tag. She whispered something to her equally tall and slender friend  a summer kid I recognized but didnt know  then strode over and greeted me in a way she hadnt since we were little: as if we were friends. Then she asked for a pack of cigarettes.

title: Chinas Antigraft Enforcers Take On a New Role: Policing Loyalty
description: BEIJING  The investigators descend on government agencies and corporate boardrooms. They interrogate powerful officials and frequently rebuke them for lacking zeal. Most of all, they demand unflinching loyalty to President Xi Jinping and the Communist Party.

title: The Calculus in Six Crucial Senate Races
description: A look at the political math in six states where tight races could determine control of the Senate:

title: Jets Quarterback Bryce Petty Understands All Too Well How to Wait
description: When the Jets made a change at quarterback last week, Bryce Petty knew the job would not come his way. He understands the waiting game. His career stalled for 1,700 days before he finally became the starting quarterback at Baylor.

title: From Shared Dartmouth Floor, an Ascension for Alexi Pappas and Kyle Hendricks
description: In 2008, my freshman year at Dartmouth, I lived on the third floor of Fahey Hall with 15 randomly selected classmates. Two of us would go on to become professional athletes: me, an Olympic runner, and Kyle Hendricks, who was the winning pitcher Saturday night as the Chicago Cubs beat the Los Angeles Dodgers to advance to their first World Series since 1945.

title: Trump and Clinton Turn Each Others Words to Their Advantage
description: For months, Hillary Clintons campaign has run attack ads whose sole voice is that of Donald J. Trump. Now, the Trump campaign is flipping the script, highlighting past statements by Mrs. Clinton in a new ad titled Predators. The Clinton campaign has parried with Captain Khan, an emotional ad featuring the Muslim military father who spoke against Mr. Trump at the Democratic National Convention, then was criticized by him in the days afterward.

title: AT&T Agrees to Buy Time Warner for $85.4 Billion
description: In the world of media, bigger remains better.

title: Can Trump Help Us Bridge the God Gulf?
description: GOD should sue some of her supposed champions for defamation.

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: The Witching Season
description: The witching hour is upon us.

title: Pardon the American Taliban
description: In the mid-1960s a young American teacher in a small central African country became involved with a group of political rebels  former government ministers mostly  who had been active in the struggle for independence. They had fallen out with the authoritarian prime minister, objecting to his dictatorial style. The country was newly independent, hardly a year old. The men advocated democratic elections and feared that the prime minister would declare himself leader for life in a one-party state.

title: If They Google You, Do You Win?
description: Are voters misleading pollsters? Are there hidden Donald Trump supporters who could throw the election his way?

title: The Dangers of Hillary Clinton
description: A VOTE for Hillary Clinton over Donald Trump, the Clinton campaign has suggested in broad ways and subtle ones, isnt just a vote for a Democrat over a Republican: Its a vote for safety over risk, steady competence over boastful recklessness, psychological stability in the White House over ungovernable passions.

title: Go Midwest, Young Hipster
description: Even as Hillary Clinton appears poised to win easily against a highly erratic candidate with a campaign in meltdown, a sobering reality awaits Democrats on Nov. 9. It seems likely that they will eke out at most a narrow majority in the Senate, but fail to pick up the 30 seats they need to reclaim the House. If they do manage to win a Senate majority, it will be exceedingly difficult to hold it past 2018, when 25 of the partys seats must be defended, compared with eight Republican ones.

title: A Chance to Unseat Marco Rubio
description: Just months ago, Senator Marco Rubio was seen by the Republican establishment as one of its best hopes for taking back the White House. Now, Representative Patrick Murphy, a second-term congressman, is within striking distance of defeating Mr. Rubio in the senators race to keep his seat.

title: Why Hillary Clinton Needs to Be Two-Faced
description: Although this years presidential race has not been a season of gentle ironies, theres one to be found in the revelation of what are alleged to be Hillary Clintons closed-door speeches. After all the fuss about the bombshells they might contain, they show a warmer and more relaxed figure than the guarded, elusive and sometimes evasive persona she presents to the public.

title: The Books My Dad Wont Read? Mine
description: Last November, a week after I had last seen him, my father passed out while sweeping the driveway (hes the kind of man who sweeps the driveway, the kind of man who thinks something like passing out is caused by either having had too much coffee or not enough coffee), and within 24 hours of being admitted to the emergency room, he was told he had leukemia. The doctors said that, without treatment, he had about six weeks to live. He was 58.

title: Britains Step Toward Justice for Gay Men
description: Britains decision to posthumously pardon the tens of thousands of gay men convicted of seeking or having sex is just and long overdue. But it is unjust that 15,000 men who were convicted before those laws were repealed and who are still alive will have to go through an onerous process of applying for a pardon.

title: The Medias Moment of Truth
description: The medias responsibility for Donald Trumps political success will be debated for a good long while, with the network honcho Les Moonvess words about Trumps candidacy (It may not be good for America, but its damn good for CBS) front and center. But almost from the moment that Trump entered the 2016 presidential race, he has been a justifiably huge story. A lead in the polls became a lead in the delegate count and then, surreally, the nomination of the Republican Party.

title: Children Dont Always Live
description: My daughter, Greta, was 2 years old when she died  or rather, when she was killed. A piece of masonry fell eight stories from an improperly maintained building and struck her in the head while she sat on a bench on the Upper West Side of Manhattan with her grandmother. No single agent set it on its path: It wasnt knocked off scaffolding by the poorly placed heel of a construction worker, or fumbled from careless hands. Negligence, coupled with a series of bureaucratic failures, led it to simply sigh loose, a piece of impersonal calamity sent to rearrange the structure and meaning of our universe.

title: A Democrat Deft With a Firearm Tightens the Race for the Senate
description: OFALLON, Mo.  For much of the year, Democrats viewed Jason Kander as a perfect Senate candidate running in the wrong state.

title: Where Are Women in F.B.I.s Top Ranks?
description: WASHINGTON  When the call came in that a bomb had exploded in Manhattan, Amy Hess quickly got to work.

title: On the Trail of Interdependence
description: Among Appalachian Trail thru-hikers  that special class of backpackers dedicated (or obsessed) enough to walk the trails full 2,200 miles  the question of whether to carry a tent is hotly debated.

title: Taking the Plunge Into the Podcast Pool
description: THE NEW YORK TIMES is used to a change of costume. When the website launched 20 years ago, Times editors reimagined what the Gray Lady would look like draped in digital sheen. When video arrived several years later, they imagined their journalism in motion. A decade after that, they squeezed it into a cellphone, making it fast, sleek and slim, but, as with the rest, still recognizable as The Times.

title: Training for Teachers
description: Are new federal rules on teacher education the right approach to improving schools?

title: Good Neighbors, No Politics
description: NASHVILLE  A few years ago an app surfaced on Facebook that could identify how many of your friends were liberal and how many were conservative. One of my real-life friends clicked the button to see how her Facebook list stacked up and was shocked by the result. I had no idea I liked so many Republicans, she said.

title: Philip Le Roux
description: Philip Le Roux is curator of Kirstenbosch National Botanical Garden in Cape Town.

title: Pentagon Expects Mosul Push to Unlock Trove of ISIS Intelligence
description: WASHINGTON  The Pentagon is sending dozens of additional intelligence analysts to Iraq to pore over a trove of information that is expected to be recovered in the offensive to recapture Mosul from the Islamic State, data that could offer new clues about possible terrorist attacks in Europe.

title: Battle Over Indians Name and Logo Moves to the World Series
description: The Cleveland Indians are returning to the World Series for the first time in 19 years on Tuesday, and with that will come renewed protests over the teams name and Chief Wahoo logo, a depiction some consider a highly offensive caricature.

title: Trump Recording Narrows Divide on Sexual Assault
description: Of all the silver linings one might have expected from this whiplash-crazy election, a new national understanding of sexual assault would have been quite hard to imagine.

title: Donald Trump Pledges to Heal Divisions (and Sue His Accusers)
description: GETTYSBURG, Pa.  Donald J. Trump came to this historic battlefield town Saturday to offer his vision for Americas future, saying he hoped to heal the divisions of the country as President Lincoln tried to do here seven score and 13 years ago.

title: Galaxy Note 7 Recall Dismays South Korea, the Republic of Samsung
description: SEOUL, South Korea  A former South Korean teacher, Kim Jeong-min was at Narita Airport in Japan this month when he watched a television news report that Samsung Electronicss Galaxy Note 7 smartphone was banned on airplanes because it was prone to catching fire.

title: For New Islanders Announcer, a Place to Call Home
description: Brendan and Mary Burke and their 2-year-old daughter, Quinn, moved into a third-floor apartment in the Park Slope neighborhood of Brooklyn last month.

title: N.B.A. Preview: Crystal Balls Show Cavaliers and Warriors Back in the Finals
description: The Golden State Warriors dream season, in which the team won 73 games and point guard Stephen Curry became the N.B.A.s first unanimous most valuable player, crashed and burned at the hands of LeBron James, Kyrie Irving and the Cleveland Cavaliers. The loss was so unexpected that it started a meme online, with the Warriors blew a 3-1 lead used as a rallying cry in any bleak situation.

title: A New Era of Internet Attacks Powered by Everyday Devices
description: WASHINGTON  When surveillance cameras began popping up in the 1970s and 80s, they were welcomed as a crime-fighting tool, then as a way to monitor traffic congestion, factory floors and even baby cribs. Later, they were adopted for darker purposes, as authoritarian governments like Chinas used them to prevent challenges to power by keeping tabs on protesters and dissidents.

title: Annemarie Huste, a Kennedy Chef Who Said Too Much, Dies at 73
description: Annemarie Huste, whose career as private chef to Jacqueline Kennedy came to an abrupt and much-publicized end in April 1968 when she was fired for talking to the press, died on Wednesday at her home in East Islip, N.Y. She was 73.

title: Over/Under
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  I have gone on record as being the kind of crossword solver who does not like too many cross-referenced clues in my puzzles, but today we have a puzzle that I really enjoyed. If a constructor commits the act of cross-referencing for a good purpose, as Ellen Leuschner and Jeff Chen do in their Sunday puzzle, then by all means, cross-reference away. Because this is an amazingly well-constructed puzzle.

title: Gay Republican Group Declines to Endorse Donald Trump
description: The Log Cabin Republicans, a conservative gay and lesbian political organization, declined on Saturday to endorse Donald J. Trump for president, revealing split feelings within the group over whether the Republican nominee is really the advocate of gay rights he claims to be.

title: Kevin Meaney, Veteran Stand-Up Comedian, Dies at 60
description: Kevin Meaney, a headliner on the stand-up comedy circuit for more than 30 years, was found dead on Friday at his home in Forestburgh, N.Y. He was 60.

title: Egyptian Army Officer Killed Outside Home; Militant Group Is Suspected
description: CAIRO  Gunmen suspected of being Islamist militants killed a senior Egyptian Army officer on Saturday in a brazen daylight shooting outside the mans home in a Cairo suburb.

title: Regulatory Microscope Lies Ahead for AT&T and Time Warner
description: A cable and internet provider decides to buy an entertainment conglomerate.

title: Theo Epsteins Shrewd Moves Fortify Cubs With Impact Players
description: CHICAGO  The win total has risen steadily, from 61 to 66 to 73 to 97 to 103, more and more doses of sunlight for fans used to gloom. Theo Epstein, the architect of the Chicago Cubs, has come to the end of his fifth season here with baseball alive in the crisp autumn air.

title: Bob Dylans Silence on Nobel Prize Is Called Impolite and Arrogant by Academy Member
description: The saga of Bob Dylan and the Nobel Prize continues.

title: Alabamas Defense Offers Offensive Lift in Teams Big Test
description: TUSCALOOSA, Ala.  During Alabamas stretch of dominance  going back to the 2009 season, when the Crimson Tide won their first of four national championships under Coach Nick Saban  the teams typical midautumn foil has been Louisiana State. But with the Tigers flailing, at least by their standards, Saturday afternoons showdown against No. 6 Texas A&M figured to be the top-ranked Tides biggest test before the postseason.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: It seems to be going backwards. They need to do something to turn that around.

title: Whos Behind the Deal Between AT&T and Time Warner
description: AT&Ts blockbuster $84.5 billion takeover of Time Warner means many things  including rich fees for the bankers and lawyers who helped craft the deal.

title: Cubs Defeat Dodgers to Clinch First Pennant Since 1945
description: CHICAGO  David Ross, the grandfatherly catcher, admits to never having paid much attention in history class. Kris Bryant, the precocious young slugger, isnt much for math, struggling to count back the years since the Chicago Cubs last won a World Series.

title: On the Trail: Week of Oct. 16
description: Hillary Clinton stayed off the campaign trail for most of the week, meeting Donald J. Trump for the final presidential debate on Wednesday, and again on Thursday, at the Al Smith dinner.

title: Kathryn Banakis, Matthew White
description: The Rev. Kathryn Loretta Banakis and Matthew Joseph White were married Oct. 22. The Rev. Dr. Jeannette DeFriest performed the ceremony at St. Lukes Episcopal Church in Evanston, Ill., where she is the rector. The Rev. Meghan D. Young, a minister of the United Church of Christ, took part in the ceremony.

title: Elizabeth Gill, Daniel Brillman
description: Elizabeth Pratt Gill, a daughter of Ann Lanahan Gill of Wayne, Pa., and the late Douglas P. Gill, was married Oct. 22 to Daniel Matthew Brillman, a son of Cindy Brillman of Bryn Mawr, Pa., and Dr. Robert Brillman of West Chester, Pa. The Rev. Dennis Reid, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at St. Davids Episcopal Church in Wayne.

title: Samantha Tritsch, Ryan Fuld
description: Samantha Alexis Tritsch, a daughter of Lori S. Kanter-Tritsch of New York and the late Steven A. Tritsch, was married Oct. 22 to Ryan James Fuld, the son of Lisa Kaye Fuld and James J. Fuld Jr. of New York. Rabbi Angela Warnick Buchdahl performed the ceremony at Central Synagogue in New York.

title: Duffield Ashmead IV, Eric Ort
description: Dr. Duffield Ashmead IV and Eric Douglas Ort were married Oct. 22 at their home in Farmington, Conn. Gary J. Fountain, a friend of the couple and a Universal Life minister, officiated.

title: Jacqueline Smith, Ryan McCarthy
description: Jacqueline Claire Smith, the daughter of Ellen T. Fahey-Smith and Christopher M. Smith of Rye, N.Y., was married Oct. 22 to Ryan Joseph McCarthy, a son of Elena Nazario McCarthy and Dennis G. McCarthy of Rockville, Md. The Rev. Christopher J. Devron performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of the Resurrection in Rye.

title: Christine Farrell, Kevin Cote
description: Christine Emily Farrell, a daughter of Arlene G. Farrell and Dr. Robert M. Farrell of Brookville, N.Y., was married Oct. 22 to Kevin Joseph Cote, a son of Kathleen M. Cote and Michael R. Cote of Atlanta. The Most Rev. Wilton D. Gregory, the archbishop of Atlanta, performed the ceremony at the Church of St. Ignatius Loyola in Manhattan, with the Rev. Joel Konzen, a Roman Catholic priest, taking part.

title: Jacqueline Nicholls, Andrew Warshawer
description: Jacqueline Sueanne Nicholls and Andrew Morton Warshawer were married Oct. 22 at the Brookmill Farm in Lambertville, N.J. Sam L. Warshawer Jr., the grooms father, who became a minister with American Marriage Ministries for the occasion, officiated.

title: Pippa Lord, Martin Hale Jr.
description: Philippa Gwendoline Lord and Martin de Mora Hale Jr. were married Oct. 22 at the Plymouth Church in Brooklyn. The Rev. Dr. Brett Younger, a Congregational minister, performed the ceremony.

title: Sarah Brindle, Thomas Buchanan
description: Sarah Katherine Brindle, the daughter of Patricia A. Brindle and Kevin Brindle of Savannah, Ga., was married there Oct. 22 to Thomas Boyd Buchanan, the son of Leslie Wakefield Buchanan and Joseph R. Buchanan of Miami. The Rev. James W. Giddens performed the ceremony at Trinity United Methodist Church.

title: Elizabeth Bennett, Stephen Parker
description: Elizabeth Barclay Bennett and Stephen Eric Parker were married Oct. 22 at Washington National Cathedral. The Rev. Canon Jan Naylor Cope, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony, with the Rev. Canon Ralph Godsall taking part.

title: Meaghan Carrigan, Nicholas Barnicle
description: Meaghan McNabb Carrigan, the daughter of Sherry A. Carrigan and Daniel J. Carrigan of Oakton, Va., was married Oct. 21 to Nicholas Michael Barnicle, a son of Anne M. Finucane and Mike Barnicle of Lincoln, Mass. The Rev. Samus Finn, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Copley Crypt Chapel on the campus of Georgetown University.

title: Meghan Snyder, Grant Wentworth
description: Meghan Elizabeth Snyder, a daughter of Karen Blanchette Snyder and George L. Snyder of Bethesda, Md., was married Oct. 22 to Grant Blaise Wentworth, a son of Kim Turner Wentworth and Finn X. Wentworth of Morristown, N.J. The Rev. George Fitzgerald, a Roman Catholic priest and a great-cousin of the bride, performed the ceremony at Our Lady of the Cape in Brewster, Mass.

title: Brittany Peterson, Leif Dautch
description: Brittany Elese Peterson, the daughter of Ann E. Peterson and David L. Peterson of Ross, Calif., was married Oct. 22 to Leif Marcus Dautch, a son of Elizabeth J. Pretzinger and Robert M. Dautch of Carpinteria, Calif. Judge Carlos T. Bea of the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals in San Francisco officiated at the grooms family farm in Ojai, Calif.

title: Bronwyn Roantree, Larry Bull
description: Bronwyn Conwell Roantree and Larry Bull were married Oct. 22 at the Orient Congregational Church, United Church of Christ, in Orient, N.Y. The Rev. Dr. Ann M. Van Cleef, the churchs pastor, performed the ceremony.

title: Jessica Cox, Oliver Davis-Urman
description: Jessica Caroline Cox, a daughter of Linda Long Cox of Charleston, S.C., and Cary L. Cox of Findlay, Ohio, was married Oct. 22 to Oliver Davis-Urman, the son of Deborah Davis and Mark Urman of Montclair, N.J. Mac Hammett, a justice of the peace, officiated at the Gibbes Museum of Art in Charleston.

title: Andrs Iniestas Injury Mars Barcelonas Thrilling Win
description: Lionel Messis penalty kick in stoppage time of a pulsating 3-2 win at Valencia on Saturday moved Barcelona atop the Spanish league, but the victory came at a cost: Andrs Iniesta sustained ligament damage in his right knee that could keep him out for several months.

title: Helen Howe, Alexander Persson
description: Helen Elizabeth Howe, the daughter of Kathryn Welch Howe and Con E. Howe of Los Angeles, was married Oct. 22 to Alexander Carl Persson, a son of Bengt G. Persson of Boston and the late Birgitta H. Persson-Wiss. The Rev. Stephen Huber, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at All Saints Episcopal Church in Beverly Hills, Calif., with the Rev. Charles L. Orr, a Presbyterian minister, taking part.

title: Andrea Snavely, Lewis Liu
description: Andrea Elizabeth Snavely and Lewis Ziruo Liu were married Oct. 18 at Islington Town Hall in London. Heather Dsenisi, a deputy registrar, officiated. On Oct. 21, the Rev. Dushan Croos, a Roman Catholic priest who is the senior Catholic chaplain at Oxford University, led a religious ceremony at Merton Chapel at Merton College in Oxford, England.

title: Kathleen Brennan, David Derr
description: Kathleen Sundius Brennan and David William Derr Jr. were married Oct. 22 at Great Oak Manor, a bed-and-breakfast in Chestertown, Md. Scott G. Wilkinson, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated.

title: Samantha Wolf, Benjamin Ryan
description: Samantha Josephine Wolf and Benjamin Joseph Ryan were married Oct. 22 in New York. Eric M. Morgenstern, a friend of the couple who became a minister of the American Fellowship Church for the occasion, officiated at the W Hotel in Union Square.

title: Jessica Seiden, Michael Schuman
description: Jessica Diane Seiden and Michael Lev Schuman were married Oct. 22 at the Red Maple Vineyard in West Park, N.Y. Rabbi Dan S. Wiko officiated.

title: Alexandra Thom, Alexander Graybeal
description: Alexandra Mary Thom, a daughter of Lisa M. Kayata and Jeremy N. Thom of Scarsdale, N.Y., was married Oct. 22 to Alexander Kung Graybeal, a son of Alice S. Kung and David P. Graybeal of Scarsdale, N.Y., at the Church of St. Ignatius Loyola in Manhattan. The Rev. Dennis Yesalonia, the pastor of the church, performed the ceremony.

title: Margaret Siller, Richard England
description: Margaret Marie Siller and Richard Nathaniel England were married Oct. 22 at Dahlgren Chapel on the campus of Georgetown University in Washington. The Rev. Alexei Michalenko, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Cate Marvin, Joseph DuPont
description: Cate Marvin, the daughter of Mary Jo VanKirk Marvin and Charles B. Marvin of Peterborough, N.H., was married Oct. 22 to Joseph Charles DuPont, a son of Barbara A. DuPont and Charles J. DuPont of Hampton, N.H. Geraldine Pittman de Batlle, a friend of the couple and an English professor at Marlboro College, who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated in the dining hall at the college in Marlboro, Vt.

title: Megan Linares, Guillermo Artiles
description: Megan Nicole Linares, the daughter of Gail Blaha Linares and Jose L. Linares of Brick, N.J., was married Oct. 21 to Guillermo Carlo Artiles, the son of Maria R. Artiles and Emilio Artiles of North Bergen, N.J. The Most Rev. Manuel A. Cruz, an auxiliary bishop of the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Newark, performed the ceremony at the Cathedral Basilica of the Sacred Heart in Newark.

title: Robert Joachim, Daniel Hewitt
description: Robert Alan Joachim and Daniel Thomas Hewitt were married Oct. 22 in Washington. The Rev. Canon Jan Naylor Cope, an Episcopal priest and the provost of the Washington National Cathedral, performed the ceremony there.

title: Corrections: October 23, 2016
description: T MAGAZINE: THE GREATS

title: Parron Edwards, George Stimola
description: Parron Allen Edwards and George Michael Stimola were married Oct. 22 at St. Johns of Lattingtown Episcopal Church in Locust Valley, N.Y. The Rev. Mark L. Fitzhugh, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony, with the Rev. Adriene Thorne, a Presbyterian minister, taking part.

title: After 70 Barren Seasons, Cubs Reach an Oasis
description: CHICAGO  Joe Maddon chose No. 70 for his uniform long before he agreed to manage the team that never wins. He picked it because he wanted a number nobody would ever care to take from him. It carried no significance.

title: Donald Trumps Threat to Reject Election Results Alarms Scholars
description: Donald J. Trumps suggestions that he might reject the results of the American election as illegitimate have unnerved scholars on democratic decline, who say his language echoes that of dictators who seize power by force and firebrand populists who weaken democracy for personal gain.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: The Walking Dead and Keeping Up With the Kardashians
description: The Walking Dead begins its seventh season with a long-awaited revelation. Keeping Up With the Kardashians pits Kim Kardashian West against her mother. And in King Cobra, Christian Slater and James Franco play rival gay pornographers.

title: No Easy Mold to Fill to Become a Latino Texas Politician
description: HOUSTON  It was a brief but telling glimpse of the new Texas.

title: Homes That Sold for $1 Million and Above
description: 631 Long Ridge Road, #39, Stamford

title: AT&T, Chicago Cubs and Mosul: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: Police Investigating Deadly Explosions North of Tokyo
description: TOKYO  A series of explosions rocked a parking lot and nearby park on Sunday morning in Utsunomiya, a city about 80 miles north of Tokyo, killing one man and injuring three other people, the local police said.

title: Cubs Banish Decades of Anguish From Wrigley
description: CHICAGO  He stood on the grass in shallow left field, bathed in the glow of the lights above Waveland Avenue. Half a century ago, on sunny afternoons at Wrigley Field  only afternoons back then  he would have swooped in for catches on that very spot. He might have met a smiling Ernie Banks and Ron Santo on his way back to the dugout.

title: Not a Regular Day: What a Trump Rally Clash Reveals About a Divided Nation
description: In June in San Jose, Calif., a tug of war over a sign supporting Donald J. Trump sent one man to jail for six days and another man to soul-searching. This is their story.

title: Tenor Will Sing Anthem at N.F.L. Game but Supports Athletes Kneeling Protests
description: The movement to protest racial oppression by not standing during the national anthem is now reverberating from the sports world to the world of opera.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Obama Assists 150 State Candidates, Targeting G.O.P.s Grip on Legislatures
description: FARIBAULT, Minn.  For half a dozen years, Republicans have swept into statehouses across the nation, winning more legislative chambers than at any time in history and pushing states to the right on issues such as abortion, voting rights, labor unions and gender identity.

title: With Tom Hanks Aboard, S.N.L. Parodies Final Presidential Debate
description: After Donald J. Trump deemed Saturday Night Live a hit job last week, the show wasted no time in skewering his latest debate performance against Hillary Clinton. The opening sketch again featured Alec Baldwin as Mr. Trump and Kate McKinnon as Mrs. Clinton, this time with Tom Hanks as the moderator Chris Wallace, and covered Mr. Trumps inconsistent foreign policy and inflammatory catchphrases.

title: N.F.L. Scores: Nobodys Perfect, but the Patriots Are Close
description: The Miami Dolphins got a big upset, the San Diego Chargers managed to get through a game without collapsing, and the Cleveland Browns trotted out a sixth quarterback. Those were just a few of the big stories in a week where the most anticipated matchups were not all that competitive but some of the lesser games provided plenty of entertainment.

title: Brazils Merchants of Death
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  As Brazil weathers the worst political and economic crises in living memory, Brazilians can hardly be blamed for being distracted. But there is a subject that the countrys politicians  and citizens  are not discussing, even though it risks tarnishing Brazils international reputation as an advocate of peacebuilding and diplomacy: an unchecked arms industry and its involvement in foreign conflicts around the globe.

title: A Modest Proposal to End Death in the Mediterranean
description: Bloomington, Ind.  The sea is vast, but the horizon is near. If you are in the water, you see hardly any distance. With every foot of elevation, the horizon recedes: Five feet above sea level  standing on a raft  its three miles away. So, from the deck of your foundering vessel, you might still see Libya, as your rescuers arrive.

title: Donald Trump Gets First Major Endorsement in Las Vegas
description: With polls showing him sliding nationally, Donald J. Trump received a bit of welcome news on Sunday in one battleground state as the editorial page of Nevadas largest newspaper, The Las Vegas Review-Journal, endorsed him for president.

title: Hillary Clinton Presses Her Advantage Over a Struggling Donald Trump
description: Hillary Clinton moved aggressively on Sunday to press her advantage in the presidential race, urging black voters in North Carolina to vote early and punish Republican officeholders for supporting Donald J. Trump, even as Mr. Trumps party increasingly concedes he is unlikely to recover in the polls.

title: Mariano Rajoy Set to Lead Spain as 10 Months of Deadlock Come to an End
description: BARCELONA, Spain  Mariano Rajoy, Spains caretaker prime minister, is set to form a new government, after the main opposition party, the Socialists, voted on Sunday not to block his re-election.

title: At Least 13 Killed in Bus Crash on California Highway
description: NORTH PALM SPRINGS, Calif.  A bus traveling along a California highway here slammed into a tractor-trailer on Sunday morning, killing at least 13 people and injuring dozens more, according to the California Highway Patrol.

title: Heng on the Philippines Relationship With China
description: President Rodrigo Duterte of the Philippines repeatedly sought to distance the Philippines from the United States during his state visit to China.

title: Cavaliers Reward for the Title Is to Share a Prized Trophy
description: CLEVELAND  LeBron James invited Larry out for oysters. Richard Jefferson made a gold pendant for his wife in the shape of Larry. And Tristan Thompson took Larry to his old high school.

title: Humiliation Is in the Air as Chelsea Routs Manchester United
description: LONDON  With about 15 minutes of a dismal, deflating game still to endure, Manchester Uniteds fans started to sing. Packed into a corner of Stamford Bridge and spread over two tiers, they split into a percussion section and a chorus line. Those in the front rows beat out a rhythm on advertisements; those in back provided the vocals.

title: The Corporate Confidence of the AT&T-Time Warner Deal
description: By many measures, this should be a moment of great economic uncertainty for the corporate world.

title: Mosul, AT&T and U.S. Presidential Election: Your Monday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Review: In Do Not Say We Have Nothing, a Portrait of Souls Snuffed Out
description: If you are walking straight into a headwind, it is a triumph simply to keep yourself upright. Wittgenstein wrote about this with what looks like staggering foresight in 1930: that in a time of cultural impoverishment, the strength of the individual is wasted through the overcoming of opposing forces & frictional resistances.

title: Review: Man With a Plan Dusts Off a Dated Premise
description: In the first episode of Man With a Plan, Adam Burns (Matt LeBlanc) faces a change when his wife, Andi (Liza Snyder), goes back to work. He has to transition from being a dad who occasionally plays with his three kids to being a dad who has a hands-on, lunch-making, rule-enforcing role in raising his children.

title: Review: Berlin Radio Choir Honors Bach and Those He Influenced
description: In recent years New Yorkers have gotten to know the members of the Berlin Radio Choir for their acting skills as much as for their extraordinary singing. In 2014 the ensemble performed in the director Peter Sellarss theatrical staging of Bachs St. Matthew Passion with the Berlin Philharmonic at the Park Avenue Armory. Recently the choir opened Lincoln Centers White Light Festival with Human Requiem, a dramatized performance of Brahmss German Requiem in which the choristers acted out the texts as they sang, while moving about and mingling with the audience.

title: Jets, With Fitzpatrick Back at Quarterback, Top Ravens to Halt Skid
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The Jets had promised rebirth. Change was afoot: a new quarterback, a more aggressive defense, a lighter schedule. They were done repeating mistakes.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Oct. 24
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Review: At Ballet Theater, a Tribute to an Overlooked Female Composer
description: The list of female choreographers working in ballet, though it goes back almost 300 years, remains too short. The list of ballets made to scores by women, however, remains far shorter; Im disappointed that the shortage hasnt been taken up as a feminist cause.

title: How Marguerite LeHand Shaped the Franklin D. Roosevelt White House
description: America is poised for the possibility of its first female president. But once upon a time, another woman in the White House wielded nearly as much power as any man aside from the chief executive.

title: Mark Leckey, No Longer Arts Wunderkind, Is Now Its Wizard
description: LONDON  Arrange to visit the British artist Mark Leckey at his home on gritty Caledonian Road here and he confirms in an email: Ill put the kettle on.

title: Lawsuit Filed Over Golden Girls Puppet Parody
description: The court documents dont exactly scream out, Thank you for being a friend.

title: Chase Courts Instagram Set, Whetting Appetites for Travel and Dining
description: James Corden, host of The Late Late Show on CBS, sits at a table in the woods, enjoying a meal prepared by the world-renowned chef Mads Refslund and discussing Mr. Refslunds planned restaurant in Williamsburg, Brooklyn.

title: Tyler Perrys Madea Scares Off Jack Reacher at Domestic Box Office
description: LOS ANGELES  The drag queen Madea and her posse of goofy grannies unexpectedly mopped the floor with Tom Cruise at the weekend box office.

title: True or False? Hillary Clinton, a Native Chicagoan, Is a Cubs Fan
description: It started with a photograph  the shot retweeted round the world, if you will.

title: Aleshea Harris Wins a Playwriting Prize for Is God Is
description: The Relentless Award, which is awarded annually to a playwright in honor of Philip Seymour Hoffman, has been given to Aleshea Harris for her play Is God Is. The prize includes $45,000, a weeklong stay at a retreat and the opportunity to put on staged readings at regional theaters across the country.

title: Breakfast-Time Fare
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  It is rare that I solve a puzzle and am surprised by the themes revealer. But thats exactly what happened to me with John Guzzettas Monday theme.

title: As Artificial Intelligence Evolves, So Does Its Criminal Potential
description: Imagine receiving a phone call from your aging mother seeking your help because she has forgotten her banking password.

title: Turkeys Push to Join Battle for Mosul Inflames Tension With Iraq
description: ERBIL, Iraq  A dispute between Iraq and Turkey has emerged as a dramatic geopolitical sideshow to the complicated military campaign to retake Mosul, Iraqs second-largest city, from the Islamic State.

title: Apple and Tesla to Report Earnings
description: Heres a look at whats expected this week.

title: Now at GQ, Keith Olbermann Takes His Outrage Online
description: Keith Olbermann knows the question before it is asked: How, after a career spent anchoring news and sports shows on ESPN, MSNBC, NBC and Fox, has he come to be delivering anti-Donald J. Trump commentaries on GQ magazines website?

title: Mondays N.F.L. Matchup: Texans (4-2) at Broncos (4-2)
description: 8:30 p.m. Eastern, ESPN Line: Broncos by 8

title: In Russias Frozen Zone, a Creeping Border With Georgia
description: JARIASHENI, Georgia  Marked in places with barbed wire laid at night, in others by the sudden appearance of green signs declaring the start of a state border and elsewhere by the arrival of bulldozers, the reach of Russia keeps inching forward into Georgia with ever more ingenious markings of a frontier that only Russia and three other states recognize as real.

title: Tough Stand by Indias Modi on Militants Raises Risks With Pakistan
description: NEW DELHI  As an opposition leader, Narendra Modi was a vocal critic of Indias government for not responding more forcefully to cross-border attacks from militants based in Pakistan. As prime minister, Mr. Modi has not shied away from openly retaliating in Pakistani-controlled Kashmir against the militants  and stirring up nationalist passions.

title: G.O.P. Hopefuls in New York Races Walk Tightrope on Donald Trump
description: In a normal year, down-ballot candidates in the home state of their partys presidential nominee count on Election Day to provide a big boost from voters energized to send their candidate to the White House.

title: To Secure a Mega-Merger, AT&T Plans to Shoulder Mega-Debt
description: If AT&T completes its colossal acquisition of Time Warner, the combined company will in some ways look more like a bank than a media conglomerate.

title: Fantasy Sports Companies Near Settlement With New York State
description: The daily fantasy sports companies DraftKings and FanDuel are nearing a settlement agreement with New Yorks attorney general over claims that they engaged in false advertising when they spent nearly a half-billion dollars blitzing the national airwaves with commercials last year, according to two people familiar with the discussions who spoke on the condition of anonymity because negotiations were continuing.

title: Germany Confronts, in Unique Exhibit, Its Holocaust of the Bullets
description: BERLIN  In this city laden with history, they were just two events recalling a heinous past: one, the opening of a public exhibition calling for a reckoning with a particularly brutal period of the Nazis rule; and the other, a modest remembrance of one Holocaust victim. Both channeled questions ever present here: Why did Germans under Hitler abandon their humanity  and who and what survived?

title: Haggling in the Rain
description: Dear Diary:

title: WikiLeaks Gift to American Democracy
description: You sure have to hand it to the Russians.

title: Turn Onto Old Dixie. After a Long, Rocky Stretch, It Becomes Obama Highway.
description: RIVIERA BEACH, Fla.  The rechristened road runs beside a railroad freight line, slicing across a modest corner of Palm Beach County and a considerable section of the Southern psyche. It used to be called Old Dixie Highway.

title: New Yorks M.L.S. Teams Finish Strong
description: New York teams claimed two playoff byes and the league scoring title on Sunday in a furious finish to the M.L.S. regular season.

title: After 108 Years of Unfulfilled Yearning, Cubs Fans Are Taking Nothing for Granted
description: CHICAGO  The sun once again rose over Lake Michigan early Sunday, but even on a crisp, clear October day, the wind in the Windy City ceased  the W flag atop the Tribune Tower along the river was limp  as if it, too, needed a moment.

title: A Brownstone and the Bitter Fight to Inherit It
description: Bill Cornwell and Tom Doyle lived in a brownstone in the West Village for over five decades. They were artists, neighborhood fixtures and committed partners. Their enduring love never seemed to them to need codification  not to mention that for most of their relationship, gay marriage was illegal.

title: Time Warners Non-Mogul Mogul Who Foretold Its Worth
description: Jeffrey L. Bewkes, the chief executive of Time Warner, made a big bet in the summer of 2014 when he rejected an $80 billion takeover bid by 21st Century Fox, controlled by Rupert Murdoch.

title: Cleveland Indians in 1948: A Story of Integration
description: Satchel Paige, the greatest pitcher ever excluded from Major League Baseball, arrived at Clevelands Municipal Stadium for a tryout with the Indians in July 1948. A Negro leagues legend believed to be in his early 40s, Paige faced one batter, Lou Boudreau, who was both the Indians manager and shortstop.

title: Steve Dillon, Comic Artist Who Helped Create Preacher, Dies at 54
description: Steve Dillon, a comic-book artist best known for Preacher, a long-running series, recently adapted for television, about three companions who literally search for God, died over the weekend in Manhattan. He was 54.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: We are ready for them. This is not a threat or a warning. This is about Iraqi dignity.

title: Making Sense of AT&Ts Bid for Time Warner
description: You had a lot of people saying you shouldve combined a donkey with a rabbit and gotten a flying unicorn.

title: Crows and Ravens Make New York Comebacks to Caw (and Cr-r-ruck) About
description: Crows and ravens would seem to be the perfect New Yorkers. Both bird species are whip-smart, sociable, energetic, talkative and loud. And they dress entirely in black.

title: Swift Opposition to Resurrection of AT&T Giant
description: Over three decades ago, such was AT&Ts monopoly over the nations communications networks that the government forcefully shattered its empire.

title: Westworld Season 1, Episode 4: Truth and Consequences
description: For visitors to the park, the chief allure of Westworld is freedom: freedom from the strictures of legality and social norms; freedom to indulge in whatever violent and sexual fantasies they can imagine; freedom of the kind settlers might have experienced in the wide-open terrain of the Old West, before civilization came along and posted the guardrails. The paradox of Westworld is that freedom isnt possible, because the park is monitored more closely than Disneyland and the hosts are synthetic constructs, acting on their loops. Comparisons to sandbox video games like Grand Theft Auto are apt: Players may enjoy wandering around between missions, shooting at random passers-by and looking for Easter eggs, but theyre penned in by the limits of this heavily monitored world.

title: Victorian Cocktails and Medical Curiosities in (Where Else?) Brooklyn
description: The new City Point retail center in Downtown Brooklyn has the usual big-box staples like Target and Trader Joes, but just past the fourth-floor entrance to a Century 21 department store is a bar called House of Wax that is far from conventional.

title: The Walking Dead Season 7 Premiere: Negans Victim Is Revealed
description: So now we know: Jeffrey Dean Morgan should make a terrific Negan.

title: Insecure Season 1, Episode 3: Code Switching
description: Given all that black women are forced to deal with  from police brutality to being told that our natural hair is unprofessional  it isnt surprising that we learn to create armor between ourselves and the rest of the world. This armor takes a variety of forms. But one particular to the black community is code switching. We learn early and often that the way we are in spaces with other black people is not the way we should be in professional circles. So the clipped words, slang and biting humor we use with friends becomes smoothed out. We take on a style that our white peers find safe and nonthreatening. It isnt lying, its a means of survival. But what happens when a black co-worker finds code switching to be dishonest and the language we use to define ourselves fails?

title: For Republicans Abandoning Donald Trump, Obama Has a Message: Too Late
description: NORTH LAS VEGAS, Nev.  President Obama on Sunday savaged Representative Joe Heck, Republican of Nevada, for failing to reject Donald J. Trump earlier in the presidential race, seeking to tarnish Mr. Heck and other Republican candidates across the country by association with a standard-bearer he called indecent and unfit for the presidency.

title: Sandra Lee Bartky, at the Vanguard of Feminist Philosophy, Dies at 81
description: Sandra Lee Bartky, an influential feminist philosopher who argued that women were subconsciously submitting to men by accepting an unnatural cultural standard for the ideal female body  what she called the tyranny of slenderness  died on Oct. 17 at her home in Saugatuck, Mich. She was 81.

title: Food Industry Goes Beyond Looks to Fight Waste
description: Duck-shaped potatoes. Curvy cucumbers. Broken carrots.

description: Think of it as farm-to-table 2.0.

description: People on the edges of the countrys vast seas of sand are being displaced by climate change.

description: WASHINGTON, D.C.  Wanting an award, Bill Murray once said, is like a virus. Its an illness.

description: BUSINESS DAY

title: Whats on TV Monday: Matt LeBlanc in Man With a Plan and Beyond Borders
description: CBS adds another stay-at-home dad to its lineup, this one played by Matt LeBlanc. A Hotel Impossible spinoff looks at the finer points of luxury establishments. And Beyond Borders explores the American policies that gave rise to an influx of undocumented immigrants.

title: Word + Quiz: genuflect
A Difficult Harvest for Americas Black Farmers
description: In Stolen Land, Stolen Futures, Michael Santiago looks at the challenges facing a third-generation black farmer as he struggles to stave off foreclosure and hold on to his land.

title: The Religious Right and the Election
description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:
